comment: Tough but fair. He responds almost instantly on Piazza and through email, though, so make use of that.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Greggo isn't a bad lecturer, but he tends to make things more complicated than it is. I took Calc 2 in high school, but the calc 2 taught by Greggo was still tough for me even though I learned most of the concepts before. Some of the newer concepts taught that I didn't know before were just confusing. Quizzes are also unnecessarily difficult.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: I worked hard for this class and got nothing at all. He's condescending and bad at explaining tricky concepts. He also seems to think he's still 16 with those clothes and that piercing. Are you not a math professor at a top-ranking university?

One of the best professors I've had here. He is extremely clear in everything. If you go to him, he gives great feedback, but you usually won't need to because there's opportunity for that in recitation and HW is returned with detailed comments of what to improve on. Also, he is genuinely good at communicating concepts, unlike some professors.

Great professor! I took Calc1 and Calc2 in highschool, so I thought it would be easy to transition to Calc3 at CMU. I was wrong and Greggo really made me work hard. I bombed my first test but got a lot better at calculus as the course progressed. He is a very clear professor, and he challenges you on the tests. I ended up loving the class though.
Great professor. Gives clear lectures. Attend them and you'll be on track. Tests are slightly tough but most definitely fair.

Greggo is an excellent professor who thoroughly explains everything. Calculus in 3D is a fast-paced course so the material might feel rushed, but Greggo really takes the time to write extensive exam reviews to prepare his students. Exams can be tough, but definitely doable if you prepare. Go to office hours and he'll like you even more.
Greggo is a hard teacher and he teaches his class tougher than most 21259 teachers do.  You will learn if you put your head to it, but he is not easy.

Lectures are clear, and recitation worksheets are a great supplement to lectures. Homework assignments are most of the time long, but not very hard. Listens to feedback. Three midterms and a final. Gives extra credit on every midterm. The first two were easy, but the third was unexpectedly hard(class avg was 45, and 60+ was an A). Final was easy.

Took calc-3d with Greggo in Fall 2014. Very clear lectures. Listens to student feedback. After the first midterm some students said the homework was a little too much, and he reduced the amount by around  40%. Gives extra-credit problems on every midterm. Exams are not hard and reflects the materials taught. Definitely take his 259. Awesome prof.
lol read the textbook or something cuz lectures are just a bunch of paragraphs

Greggo is one of the few human beings I've seen who can write as fast as he speaks. Multivariable calculus with him made for painful note taking, so don't even try to copy what he writes in time, listen to him instead. He's very theory based, and often leaves you teaching yourself how to actually solve problems, but the concepts will be understood.

Listens to feedback. Very fair. Lots of work, written and online. Works through theorems and basic examples in class and more detailed examples are done in worksheets during recitation or through homework. Definitely need to go to class for this. Has extra credit problems on tests for applying material to past knowledgetheoremscreating proofs.

I won't say that he's a nice teacher; in all honesty, I think he's a bit (read: VERY) arrogant and not fun to e-mail or talk to at all. Regardless, he knows his stuff fairly well, and is one of the clearer teachers I have. I don't know whether or not his grading policies are fair--class is easy, his grading is not--but, education-wise, not too bad.

He's nice but a little intimidating. His lectures are very fast-paced and he is very wordy in his proofs and explanations which can make things confusing. He picked pretty bad TAs but overall you will learn a lot. Exams are hard, but if you take time to understand on your own you will be fine.

Lectures are fast paced and can be difficult to keep up with or understand at times, depending on your familiarity with the subject. Greggo is very knowledgeable, and the tests are not too difficult if you really pay attention and make an effort to understand everything he teaches.

Greggo was not a very good lecturer. His lecture style was very bland, rushed and disinterested. He also did not seem to have much interest in the subject and as a result did not put much effort into communicating to the class. He seems like a nice guy though.
He is a very good teacher and it is very easy to learn with him and his quizzes are relatively fair but his exams are impossible!

Greggo is a great professor. His lectures are very interesting and will give you insights you can't get just by reading the book. His tests can be difficult, but he provides lots of solved practice problems so you can prepare for them. Highly recommend.
Greggo is the man. Very clear and straightforward teaching style, also very helpful if you go to office hours and ask him questions.
Awesome teacher. His tests are kind of long, but if you understand what you are doing, you will be fine.

3D calculus is a HARD class, but Greggo teaches it very well. I really love the class, and did fairly well. Greggo's lectures complement the book fantastically. He explains the material precisely and concisely. Good experience :)
Greggo is one of the better math professors at CMU. I will miss him next year!
Very straightforward, covers material clearly and concisely.  You learn a lot in a short period of time and are never bored.

He's awesome and helpful. He doesn't waste too much time providing proofs and pretty much lays out for you what you need to know for the tests (which aren't easy, but feasible) and how the material he's teaching you is useful. What I liked the most was he was just really straightforward in his instruction style. Could've done better in the class :/

Also 127 Concepts of Mathematics. Has excellent review material available before tests. Friendly guy, and spells out everything about course&material in no uncertain terms. He moves pretty fast, but not too fast that you might have trouble keeping up. Overall, if you can take a class with him, go for it.
He's ok. Not very helpful.

Awesome guy. Great lecturer, gives a few good examples after proofs, and he sky dives. Quiz each week in recitation is easy. Tests are only within one lecture period, very doable if you do homework. Doesn't mind if you show up for a later lecture.  Schedule him!
Greggo is awesome. He's a total badass with a lip ring, pictures of him smoking cigars and skydiving. His class is easy as long as you pay attention and take notes.

Never question Greggo in class, because you are wrong. In addition, he is a total badass, with pierced nipples, tongue, and lip. The material is decently hard, but not impossible. Greggo's explanations are very concise and he's always willing to help you out in office hours.
Cool guy. He basically hand-feeds you the knowledge in class and throws homrwork at you to make sure you get it. As long as you go to class and do the homework, tests and exams are giveaways.

Greggo is AWESOME. He is by far the best out of my past 3 calculus teachers. The way he teaches is very clear and he is NEVER wrong in any way. If you do the homework and study for quizzes, tests are easy. SCHEDULE HIM IN; HE IS SO COOL.
Very helpful. As long as you are doing your work, doing the quizzes, you will be fine.
Not recommended, heavy homework and tough grading policy.
Easy class if you go to lectures. Most people don't go to class though so ...
She is the best
Pretty annoying, not hard class though.
Quiz grading was diabolical
Don't take her courses unless you are good as hell. Tons of homework, awful teaching, irresponsible.

She is great - cares for her students as long as they are serious about the course stuff. Is somewhat strict on the  grading scale (no curve given even if you got like a 89.9%), but that's fair. There are a lot of homework in the second half of the course, but the problems are doable if you pay attention in the lectures.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Extremely nitpicky in grading, will take off lots of points for smaller errors and is inflexible with regrade requests. Tests and quizzes are pretty fair in that they are only based on material covered in class, but like I mentioned above are graded extremely harshly. I would not recommend taking Irina whatsoever. Nice person, not a great prof

Class has a serious problem in the way it is structured. A large majority of the grade comes from tests which are ridiculously difficult and graded with no leniency. Averages on tests are low Cs, and she does not curve at all. HW and quizzes are fair, except they barely add anything to final grade. Highly advise students to take with someone else.
Professor Irina is a nice lady who is passionate about teaching. The class is hard, but she does a good job of explaining concepts.

Thinks her class is the most important when in reality, it is not. Home works are much longer than they need to be and lectures are depressing. Better off taking 21-240 or 21-241 with another professor tbh.
Awful.

Very enthusiastic about the material that she teaches. You definitely need to know the material well to do well on quizzes and tests. Don't try to use methods other than the ones taught in class on quizzes or tests. Her office hours are always helpful though so you have ample opportunity to understand the material.
awful
OK Irina is not an easy prof and is not chill at all, but if you take concepts with her you will LEARN and she will help you if you ask

Irina may seem strict, but she cares a lot about all her students. She's also one of the best math teachers I've ever had; her lectures are concise and useful. Her homework are usually challenging, but you learn a lot more from trying to figure out problems yourself instead of having someone hold your hand. Thanks Irina :)

Concepts is a difficult course but Irina's lectures are very clear and she goes over important content multiple times. She also provides numerous resources for students and genuinely cares about their learning.

This professor is not being nice to students, rather being heartless.The worst instructor I have ever had. Although her notes are clear, she frightens students who ask questions. Never reply email. Punish students who unintentionally make nonacademic mistakes. Value rules and order more than intelligence and creativity. Kills all interest of math.
Extremely unclear grading criteria and so disrespectful to students! If you can take concepts with any other professor, do that.

She is genuinely one of the worst instructors I have ever had the misfortune of haven taken. Do not take a course with her if another professor is available. She seems to enjoy in lectures putting down students that ask questions and is inconsistent when grading. Much of the difficulty comes from her more so than the material.

90% of lectures are example problems and 10% usable content and techniques (and no fun corollaries). She ends up teaching specific proofs/answers rather than the techniques and methods to create new proofs. The problems on the exams are practically the same as the hw which are the same as the ones she goes over in class. Study a lot and do all HW.

Was decent in 256 but terrible for 241. Clearly doesn't care about her students and has an extremely harsh grading system. Lecture is impossible to keep up with while taking notes because she goes through her prewritten notes too quickly.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Tough class, but she explains the content well. If you show up to class and put in the effort with homework, you should be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: She is very strict and non empathetic. Unwilling to be accommodating for students. Doesnt even teach very well. You are better off watching professors on YouTube teach the same subject than attend her classes. She just reads hand written notes.

While the material in this class is difficult, it's definitely doable. However, you can't rely on lectures to do well. Her lectures just consist of her reading off prewritten pieces of paper that are copied almost verbatim from the textbook and often times, her notes include a lot of errors. Because of this, the lectures aren't really that helpful.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Lectures get confusing at times but she's really accessible. Class is hard af but is doable. She's tough but a great person overall.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: bruh she freaked out during the covid 19 pandemic. No teacher was as anal as her throughout this time. Mustve sent out like 50 emails, ppl stop reading them b/c they realized it was her just going off on some trivial tangent. Made academic integreity declarations ridiculously complicated. plus her class is just her throwing up her notes on the bord

I really love Irina. She can be a little harsh compared to your average professors but she is actually a very caring and adorable professor once you get to know her a little better. I am taking 241 with her as well and it's been a great time. Her class is definitely hard but doable. I just messed up on the final don't make the same mistake
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Concepts get tough pretty fast but Irina has a few patterns in the way she does things. Her homeworks are pretty long but it is much needed practice, and there are always 1 or 2 questions in there that's a trivial application of whatever she covered in class. For exams, you wouldn't be too surprised provided you master the homework, so do your hw!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I honestly still dont know how to feel about Irina's class. I am someone who had no background in discrete math whatsoever so this class was hard for me from the start. I think shes a great teacher for people who already somewhat know the material, but for me, someone who had never seen this material before, this was hard. Think bf taking this lol
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Class was much more difficult than it needed to be, super unsympathetic to student struggles, especially considering so many students dropped. Her lectures were decent, but the grading was so awful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: - Toughest grading I have ever seen. Small mistake on page long proof? 3 /10 points - No curve despite appalling test averages - Over half of the class dropped - No useful resources are ever uploaded online - Overly complicates the simplest proofs or explanations - Youtube videos are more helpful than her lectures - Disrespectful and unsympathetic

Very easily irritated and often jokes about how hard her tests will be, which isn't very helpful in a course as intense as Concepts. She needs to show more respect to her students in general. I had a much better experience taking this course with John Mackey and would recommend his class over Irina's any day.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Great professor, problem sets are not challenging and exams are a lot similar to hws

She's a great professor, and the class was easy as long as you showed up to class and did the homeworks. Super easy quizzes and exams that didn't have too many problems to do but lots of time to do them.
She surely developed a good way to make students learn after teaching this course so many times. Some people think she is mean but she definitely try her best to help after being mean.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: class starts off easy, gets really hard and then becomes a meme.

I've heard great things about her teaching Concepts (21-127), but she was a terrible matrices teacher. She got too much into the proofs for matrices, which made the class way too hard. She also got angry when people asked questions in lectures. Just wanted to put her notes on the board and didn't seem to care about student learning at all.

A very interesting person. She has the kind of chill that you won't normally find on a female professor. Explain everything thoroughly and straightforwardly. She doesn't normally give pep talk but when she does you do feel the sincerity she has. In terms of respecting, come on we're adults here. A disgusting proof is disgusting but she will help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I don't enjoy her teaching style. Disrespectful even at time.
Irina is so engaging and thorough. Best math prof I've had yet. Concepts with her was hard but very fair on exams
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Hard class, but Irina was an interesting teacher to have.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: She is a good professor. Good at explaining things, and very caring and hilarious. Definitely would recommend her class.

I took Concepts with Irina (21-127). I had a hard time in this class, but she was always encouraging and gave good lectures. I personally enjoyed her style because she wrote out every step of her proofs. Definitely listened if you asked for help, so if you feel unsure on something don't be afraid to ask her and go to office hours!
It is a hard course and you can expect to work. Irina is okay with explaining things but not great.
Lectures are very clear. Very good at balancing lecture time with questions from students, and is flexible with the course schedule.

Advice to students: attend class and recitation, work to understand the problems in hw. I took Prof. Irina's 21-127 course in my freshman year and if you could do the hw you could crack the tests pretty easily. Write all possible steps for problems in tests, I always lost points on whatever steps I did not mention :-)
Good lecturer. Classes are slow and boring. ATTEND OH! Homeworks are tricky and ATTEND OH to be clear on concepts. Easy exams.
I took 21-122 with her in the past, it was terrible. But now I'm in 21-127, and it's amazing. It is by far the most interesting class I'm taking this semester.
Nice Professor

Lectures sometimes confusing, and sometimes repeated herself a few times as writing, going pretty slowly. At the end of the year, didn't have enough time to finish wave equation, and didn't go through examples so we were left for the test not knowing the material completely. My TA (not a reflection on professor but FYI) was really bad, and wrong.
Not the best, but still a good professor! Straightforward, chill, smart. Lectures helped with assignments, which helped with exams.

Great professor! I like her style of teaching a lot and I find her lecture very easy to follow and understand. HW's are challenging but TAs and Office Hours are extremely helpful. You need quite a bit effort to get a good grade though.
Interesting course. Mostly computational, but there are concepts too. You will need to come to class and take notes. Nice person and good teacher.
Irina is awesome! She's extremely funny and willing to help her students.
Everything is clearly explained and questions are answered willingly

Has a thick Russian accent. Doesn't explain concepts and instead wastes class time on difficult problems that are not relevant to homework at all. Has handwriting that is hard to read if you sit further than the 5th row. Has trouble understanding students' questions and thus her answers are not at all helpful

A pretty difficult teacher.  She likes to dive right into the difficult problems without going over the basics.  If you're not a natural at math, getting outside help is a must.  TA's and other students are usually very helpful.  She likes to grade on a curve so don't be surprised if tests are hard and averages are in the 60's.

Very nice lady, but not the best teacher. If you have her for 121 she is really pretty easy. Just learn from the book and you never have to go to class. Class average on the first test was a 65 so she gave a 10pt bonus quiz and made the rest of the tests easier. Class averages on the next two tests were 88.
Excellent professor. Everything she goes over in class is extremely helpful and she is also very polite.

Irina is the worst professor I have ever encountered. She does not explain anything and is not helpful at all. If you have to take a class that she is teaching, do everything you can to not take it with her. If you have to take it with her, then do everything you can to get outside help as you will need it.

Very enthusiastic, but makes fairly common computation errors and sometimes has difficulty understanding students' questions. Her accent is fairly strong but she's still understandable, and explains concepts competently. A very fun person, even if not the most amazing teacher.
Nice professor. Supposedly much easier than previous semester's prof(Mackey). Mild accent and awful at spelling, but that is not terribly important in math. Overall, not a bad professor.

Shes a nice person, but a terrible teacher. Her handwriting is hard to read, as her g's, 9's, y's and phi's all look the same. She also fails to clearly explain topics, and presents example problems she doesn't solve all the way. Worst of all, she puts questions on homeworks on topics not covered in class, then sends an email to explain the topic.
Not going to class will sink you. She does love all her students though, and if you meet her outside class, you get to see a far more relaxed person (who's a bit evil in a fun way at times).
Two things... She fails to explain important concepts and theorems clearly. She has a thick Russian accent. Not as bad as Adamchik though.

He is a really nice guy and a caring person who wants his students to succeed. However they usually don't succeed because he is not very good at teaching. The lectures he gives are so unorganized and he goes all over the place- you get confused within a minute because he goes on a random tangent to something unrelated every 2 seconds.
One of the worst lecturers I have ever experienced in my life. Goes all over the place
Extremely boring and useless lectures.
Boring and doesnt know how to teach
Worst!
He doesn't know how to teach. He keeps jumping in class in name of a joke but isn't funny in anyways!!

Greg is a terrible lecturer, one of the worst. That being said, he cares a lot about his students and is always available for extra help. Although I'm not too sure if that's helpful due to his inability to explain anything. The exam was curved quite heavily when I took the course, so that's nice I guess

Lectures are engaging, but sometimes not very relevant to what you actually need to know to pass the class. However, he really cares about his students and offers plenty of support with office hours, TA office hours, and small group meetings with TAs.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He is an okay lecturer but not so great prof overall. May have been the class structure + covid, but I really do NOT recommend taking 18100 with him. (or at all, really)
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Caring professor, always (and really, always) available to help. Reasonable grading schemes, very focused on students learning. Great lectures but fast, you'll get lost very quickly if you don't pay attention.

Kesden is extremely energetic. Some people like that, some people don't. But no matter your opinion on his teaching style, there's no denying that he cares about his students. Kesden has kept his office hours open throughout the night (I've seen him on at 5am) helping students. He insists that you can call him any time, any day. He cares a ton.

Very hard to pay attention teaching style.  Lecture style not very good for learning.  Can't really expect students to learn if you ramble on and on with examples that don't necessarily explain the concept you're trying to teach.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Puts effort into using metaphors, analogies and storytelling in his lectures. Good teacher. The labs were very fair; I loved that he gave us so much freedom to do whatever. The frivolous complaints are from people who needed excessive handholding or had little hands-on programming experience. He was so lenient and easy on his first class at UCSD.
Avoid this professor like the plague. New to UCSD, but is unorganized and has no idea how to manage large scale classes.

I'll give him slack because it was his first quarter teaching at UCSD (Fall '15). He was very energetic and knew the material. Tests were actually the practice exams that were provided, and the group projects were graded extremely leniently.  Passing the class with a good grade was not an issue because I didn't need to learn or retain anything.
Shows up late to class. Admits that his lecture slides are incorrect but doesn't correct them before he posts them online. Unclear instructions for group project. Doesn't prepare you for the final
Okay, I was thinking he's a good professor until I saw his final. Every single instruction is very vague. Would not recommend.
If you want to raise your stress level for some reason, I highly recommend taking his class. Of course, you wont be learning anything except the fact that he's the worst professor at UCSD.

He's late to class and doesn't seem to teach. Rather, he shares stories and tries to engage the class by hitting other students and jumping on their desks. I would not recommend this professor. He also seems to have temperamental issues (ie hitting students). Worst and most annoying professor I've ever had at UCSD .

I agree with what the 3.9 GPA student is saying. I definitely don't think he is a good instructor, because he is always late and unprepared. I have never taken a class in which students wait for the professor for 20 - 30 min each class. The project starts from week 5 with almost no preparation. I don't really learn anything from this class.

This guy is by far the most annoying professor I've ever taken. He has no sense and I think he's he snorts cocaine before coming to class. He is useless, very unclear about the grading scheme, extremely disorganized and a massive waste of your time. Believe me when I say this, I'm a straight A student with a 3.9 GPA. I know what I'm talking about.
Great class.

Energetic and tells fairly engaging stories, but I can remember one time when a student-worker came in to try to fix a faulty projector and when the student couldn't fix it he started ripping on the kid. Not a class act

Class lectures are superb.  He keeps the class interesting and really knows the subject matter. Sometimes assumes you know too much and isn't thorough enough during office hours.  Seems confused when you don't get it.  Class is the hardest one i've taken in my life.

Moves fast, spends more time telling funny stories, climbing on desks, and throwing things at his students than covering lecture material, but is helpful outside of class. Keep on top of your work and lecture is hilarious.

He's such a little boy. Annoying. Too busy taking care of tons of workload. Assumes students already know most of the materials probably because there are many graduate students in the lecture. If you are advanced and want to know much more, he is great.
Awesome class and professor :)
Great teacher.  Thoroughly enjoyed his class.  If you have him, ask him about the Chinese textbook that used some of his code.  He makes some good exceptions.

I came into the class not knowing C but by the end of the semester I knew what was going on. Most of the stuff you know are learned from his extremely hard labs and exams. Don't take him if you want an easy A

Very hard class. Tells students they're "drinking from a fire hose" and it's apt because he expects a lot of learning, quickly. The class is sink or swim, but if you manage you'll learn a ton. I didn't realize how much work was required initially, but once I put in the hours I started getting As on tests.
Doesn't teach anything, expects you to know C already. Does not introduce you to C.
HAWT<3!
Kesden is awesome! I <3 him!!!

Took 15-111 (called 15-121 nowadays) with him. Very energetic lecturer. Hates it if you sleep/goof off in class. Can be frustrating if you're not in CS or not taking courses past what he's teaching because he will sometimes stretch the material and teach beyond the scope of the class.
Awesome. Flat out.
Excellent. Entertaining and informative.

Be warned that 15-100 is not adequate preparation for Kesden's 15-111.  Lectures primarily consist of "humorous" stories and Java esoterica.  Learn the programming yourself the summer/winter before the class and you should be fine.  Exams are straightforward, yet tend to cover the lecture notes more than the class itself.

Very, very tough teacher compared to colleagues teaching the same course.  However, he knows very well what he's talking about, and every student who has gone through him gets the last laugh when the final comes.
He's really nice as well as helpful! Kesden time is always a little later than real time, but if you really want to learn programming, it's Kesden all the way.

I loved Kesden! He is an excellent lecturer, but not very organized. His TAs keep him in line. He is a lot of fun in class and does not tolerate laziness so if you want an easy A, take another class. If you want to work hard and learn C, take Kesden. TAs very knowledgeable and helpful and Kesden always available for help.

Professor believe in the power of the TA. Course taught through example. Examples usually good, but jump around a lot. In love with floodfill. Lives 2.0 miles from campus, but can't get here on time because "neighbors are moving and blocking driveway".

Perpetually late, Arrived 45 minutes late only to be told by student that class started at 9:00 not 9:45. Terrible excuses for absences (ie: bus wedged into intersection, A tree fell on my friend's garage and oh sorry I don't have an excuse today)  Teaches class well if and ONLY if you know what he's talking about. Prior knowledge REQUIRED!!!!!!!!
He gives out really hard tests.

great professor. really tough class, really high demanding but if you wanna learn he is your man;) really no downsides, I loved his class and the way he teached and learned a ton the hard way (ie sleepless nights..). Highly recommended for passionate students not for the rest.
He was an amazing professor, period.  Not for the feint of heart

Not a great 15-100 teacher.  Horrible at explaining simple concepts make you more confused.  Swears, insults, throws things, and jumps up onto desks.  However, he REALLY knows his stuff.  He is available 24-7 for help on labs (mostly easy), I don't think he sleeps, since he replies to emails at 4:00AM within 90 seconds.

He's HARD and he fails 1/2 the class. If U R looking for an easy A, U R in the wrong class. But if U R looking for a gd learning exp., then pay attention. He's v. gd at explaining CS concepts and data structures. Assg. are fairly hard but the exams are the killers. U can't simply BS on the exams and expect him to give U partial credits.

A great professor. Even though the course load was heavy, he always was reasonable. He cared a lot on students doing their best. Always available for help with projects, and course material. (even at night). He is funny and has a great way of making the course more enjoyable.

Kesden is my favorite professor by far, for the reasons that most of the 100 kids hate him.  He swears a lot, and throws stuff at people who are sleeping.  He takes a more ADULT approach to a class of adults.  Also, despite what those say below, he is exceptionally proficient in Java.  Yall need to grow up.
Boooooooooooo
He doesn't know how to properly explain java.
he's a funny guy who keeps class amusing.  oftentimes i'd find stuff on the homework that he didn't go over / went over very quickly in class, but he's very helpful if u go talk to him.
Perpetually late, profane, unprofessional.  Throws things at students and walks on desks.  My diagnosis: Napoleon complex.  Not very good at teaching Java, either.

Doesn't let you take notes on the computer to follow along but he talks to fast to handwrite them. It's close the the end of the semester and I still haven't received grades for the first several projects. How am I supposed to learn from my mistakes if I don't get any feedback?
The professor has a nice attitude but he loses the class.  I have no idea whats going on.
available, but not very helpful, watch out for that truckload of work!  confusing and unclear and very disorganized-ask the TA's for help, not him!
disorganized, unreliable, always late. but, *relatively* easy on the eyes for a cs professor
No Comments
this mofo throws pens at his students =P  he is short and he talks a lot
Phenomenal lecturer and very approachable outside of class.

Really nice professor, cares about his students. His homeworks are rather hard and the midterms are quite hard. He is generally hilarious. His lectures are good for a general overview but they are slightly fast-paced.
I didn't find his lectures to be helpful while the homework was extremely difficult.
Best professor I've ever had.
Overall a very good professor. Class was very challenging and homeworks were even harder, but I learned the most out of any class.

Amazing Professor. Inspires freshman to be excited about pure mathematics and holds the class to a high standard while providing excellent support for everyone to succeed given that they are willing to put in the work.
Such a charismatic, personable lecturer--wish I could take 151 again despite the heavy courseload. Gave such a wonderful intro to various important math concepts. A great guy.
Mackey is an amazing prof. he's an excellent teacher and is very kind and respectful towards his students. would highly recommend him
Best professor everr

One of the best lecturers I've ever had. Very helpful faculty member in general; he's good to meet with several times to talk about future plans, particularly ones relating to future CS or math courses. Cares about his students and shows genuine love for mathematics. Tests are fairly hard but you will learn a lot.

One of the top 3 teachers I've had in my entire schooling career. I feel privileged to have been able to take courses with such an inspired individual. If you get this man for any of your classes, consider yourself lucky and don't waste a second in lecture on your phone. You miss out on so much knowledge.

Absolutely outstanding professor - probably the best professor I've had my entire life. He makes a difficult class extremely enjoyable, and inspires me to pursue higher level maths classes. Attend his office hours! They're fun and you get a lot out of it

Amazing professor! I took his class over half a summer semester along with another class so the schedule was pretty rough - but he made the journey fun! Literally one of the best professors/teachers I've ever had! Take his class if you ever get the chance!

Prof MacKey is by far my favorite teacher at CMU. He is amazing at explaining theories, keeps lectures interactive and interesting, and is an inspirational gift to the CMU faculty. In the simplest word, I love MacKey. He truly cares about his students. Some professors prioritize research over teaching at CMU. MacKey prioritizes his students.

He's a great professor, 21-128 is a great class designed to give students a very strong foundation in proof-based mathematics. He's absolutely hilarious, yet also respected and one of the best teachers in the Carnegie Mellon math department.
good good

John Mackey is hands down an amazing professor. Classes and course content are very well planned. Great lecturer, the kind of person you just want to keep listening to. His homeworks and tests are pretty hard, but he gives you enough of a leeway on the curve to make getting a decent grade not too easy, but within reach if you work for it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: There was a day that I was laying in bed sick, but still got up to go to Concepts just because I couldn't imagine missing it. Really inspirational guy and always has some diet Pepsi by his side. Good guy and real patient with students. You will really need to try. He expects and believes that his students can grasp difficult material.
Very very inspirational. He is passionate about teaching and he has the magical power to make you love math. I became a math major after taking math128 with him.
He is a very passionate teacher. You can expect to actually learn stuff from him. In general, he will give you not only good knowledge but also good advice for other classes.
Great professor, really hard homework, reasonable grading
Best professor I've ever had. The man really kills it in every aspect of teaching. Propelled me beyond what I thought I could achieve. Thank you for everything

Mackey is hilarious and really high energy. It's pretty amazing that he is the head of the math department at a school like CMU and still chooses to teach Calc 1 to give freshmen a solid foundation. It's all downhill with math professors afterwards.
great

He was the best professor I've ever had. He brings tons of energy and gets you excited about the material. If I had him for every class my life would be amazing. If you have the opportunity to take his class, do it. Also loved all the riddles.
I honestly can say that Professor Mackey is the best professor I have ever had.
He's awesome. Interesting and he's really interested in letting the student LEARN.
Take concepts with Mackey, there really no other way, and hes a brilliant proffessor.
Brilliant Professor. My favorite class by far since coming to CMU
seriously the reason i became a math major. made me want to go to class in the morning. his classes are hard, but he's amazing at explaining things. and he's attractive.
Simply awesome teacher! Fantastic class! No complaints!!!!!
If you can, take Mackey
Mackey rocks! He's very helpful and always willing to answer questions.
Funny, enthusiastic, helpful. The course material can be a bit challenging, but if you're willing to put in the work, you'll get a lot out of it.

Hilarious, engaging, and effective. A genuinely great guy who takes pleasure in his job. Teaches with the intent to be difficult, but enjoys his students' struggles in an understandable way. Memorable, a great professor, and a very interesting class.
An *excellent*, hilarious lecturer. His classes are notoriously hard but not impossible by any means. Has a great staff of TAs and provides lots of help and generous curves.
Dr. Mackey is AMAZING! I feel like he has prepared us all very well for the next level of hard proofs: 251!

Very good teacher. Very clear, very far. Very nice and caring. Mackey is well known on campus, and one of the favorite math professors. The class is hard if you've never seen the material before, but he is very balanced, and if you conceptually understand the material, you will be fine.

Graph Theory is an amazing course if taught by the right teacher, aka Mackey. Lectures are mostly proofs of theorems in the book, Midterms are challenging but Mackey curvres a lot, and Final was harder than midterms.
Hard tests, but they're on material covered in class.

Professor Mackey is very cool, and very smart.  He's great at teaching, very friendly and helpful.  Also, he's the coolest professor here by far, because he went to the University of Hawaii! How cool is that?
Amazingly good teacher.
Wonderful teacher.  I highly recommend him to anyone wanting a great class.  A little hard, but worth it.

he's too hyper even for someone who drinks 2-liter bottle of coke each morning. Got us interested in Euclidean alg bc every mathmetician apparently jumps up and down when hearing it, but he didn't tell us what the alg is:(
Very difficult class but very funny and interesting prof.
Great Professor.  The exams were really hard, but he curved them so it was okay.
No Comments
tests are HARD... he gives concept questions, but overall he is very helpful

Tests are ridiculously hard, but only involves material he explicitly covers. Often tests technicalities and problems requiring creative thinking. Curves grades fairly at end. Really passionate about math and how "beautiful" it is; energetic lec
homework a lot. But a fun and important class. I would recommend it!
Get ready to learn. You need to know the material inside and out for this class but that's a good thing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Tough class

Business majors get their panties in a bunch about this class, but its the only real class they actually take. Any math, cs, engineering person will find this is one of the easiest classes in their freshman schedule.

Klepper is one of the best professors at cmu. If you are a smart and dedicated student you will get an amazing amount out of the class, as he not only will teach you econ but how to apply it in a variety of current issues. I highly recommend having lunch with him (something he offers. He's the reason I wanna minor in econ.

I'm not gonna lie, I sometimes lost focus staring at how hot he is. Definitely a teacher for looks and knowledge too. But seriously if you're stupid. Leave before you fail with a W. But then again his hotness is worth it. #cheetah. Also the t.a's really make the class so get a good one
Klepper is one of the hottest professors you will ever have. #cheetah. also if you are dumb, dont take this class, you will fail

Klepper is one of the best teachers at CMU, and he's taught for 30 years so he already knows how you're going to mess up.  I've found that smarter students love the class, and less bright ones hate it.  I feel no pity, this class is one of the few which isn't dulled down.

I came to CMU with AP credit in economics but I decided to take this class anyway. Biggest mistake of my life. I dropped it after the second week and took the credit. True or false. Black or white. This or that. How can you teach economics like that? AP Macro - 5. AP Micro - 5. 2 weeks of Klepper - C.
He's an economist so he knows what he's doing you just got to listen and study everything he says....its definitely not an easy A.
I was TA for Klepper for two years back in 2003 and 2004. I think he is one of the best professors at CMU. It is not easy class but you learn a lot

My hardest class and also the most interesting. He measures your understanding by taking what we learn and applying them to new situations and sometimes adds extra variables to questions we've had on minitests. You LEARN.
Class is actually interesting

He always teaches materials not related to his textbook. So it is sucks. On monday and Wednesday he does his lecture and on Friday (only for one day!!) we and TA go through textbook homework and quiz never related to his lecture. Beside, his final test is really funny. 100 hundred questions without explanation only T/F !!! it just measures luck
He is really an interesting guy. Hard class but I've learned a lot.
From what I have heard, it seems like you do better in this class without knowing anything about econ before having klepper

I didn't know that Economics could be this enjoyable, interesting, and HARD. Klepper is by far the BEST lecturer and teacher I've ever had in my life. He is on top of his game in EVERYTHING, including schedules, homeworks, exams, and grading.  btw, FINAL SUCKED. it was the hardest exam ive ever taken in my life.

His "win every argument" attitude makes him sound dictatorial and makes some students feel defeated during class discussions. Other than that, he's pretty knowledgeable and very effective in his teaching.

Klepper's tough and demanding, and he gives a good amount of homework each week.  His exams are definitely no walk in the park.  That said, he's an excellent teacher and you will truly understand microeconomics after having him.
No Comments
HARDEST CLASS I'VE EVER TAKEN!!! Wait until the spring to take this class...Klepper does not mess.
hard class but klepper is an excellent brilliant teacher. Not your intro to econ class but worth taking
intro to econ was harder than any other econ class

He is awesome, stimulating students to think for themselves and understand concepts on their own, but in this doesn't lose sight of actually needing to teach and does an amazing job at it, conveying concepts with great clarity and fun.

Very good lecturer. His tests are difficult at first, then get easier. I had a mid A until the final. The final is worth 40% (maybe more if you do well) and is VERY, VERY HARD. It's T/F but the hardest T/F test you'll take EVER.

his lectures are fun...esp. the experiments, but alllll the hw and quizzes(which weighted tooooo much) are not related from the lectures...i leanred more from my TA.. tests are damn hard but TAs are always nice when they grade those ;)

Very hard class but doable without too much effort. He curves a lot because he has to. Take the class in the spring with the easier prof if your looking for an easy A but you will learn a lot w/ Klepper.
Pay attention lectures or you're screwed.
harddddd classsssssssssssssss
Klepper is the man.

Very aggresive lecturer, demands attention and participation by arguing with the class over sensitive political issues.  In-lecture experiments are fun and profitable, and are the back bone of his exams, so attendance is basically mandatory.  Good TAs too
Clear, concise, and fun.
Klepper was the best teacher I've ever had!
kleppernomics is the best class i took my freshman year... it's tought and the final sucks but its a great class
No Comments
No Comments
klepper's final sucks hard
not such a good intro course
Teaches econ in a radical and probablt the best way. I learned alot and loved it
very difficult class but he is willing to help you understand econ
No Comments
No Comments
Kleppernomics
No Comments
Klepper Rocks
No Comments
Klepper's econ classes're stella.His classes are well structured and  refreshing
Absolutely awful at lecturing, cannot pay attention to him for my life. Frankly a bizarre experience. Overcomplicates a frankly easy subject to comical levels. Just terrible.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: He's the singular worst lecturer I've had at CMU. Every single lecture consists of 18 pages of handwritten notes, of which only 2 at most contain useful material, if at all. People who are taking diffeqs already know how to do elementary algebra, but he focuses all his attention on that instead of actually teaching the core concepts of the course.

Uses slides from previous years, and goes relatively fast through them. It's more important to follow them rather than writing everything down. Very clear and a lot of good outside help is available. HWs can be challenging but are very reasonable. Plenty of review problems for tests and no surprises on them. Highly recommend.
Third class I've taken with Handron. Very reasonable guy. Funny and interesting lectures.
Kind of unstable guy, doesn't know what he's talking about and babbles on about stuff that is unrelated to course content. Also not funny at all.
not reasonable

He's very funny (put a brick in the freezer to demonstrate Newton's Law of Cooling), and I liked his lectures quite a bit. It was clear he went out of his way to adapt to online class (and did so well). It's diffeq, so don't expect a cakewalk, but show up to lectures and study a bit and you'll be fine. HW is sometimes a bit long.
Amazing and interesting teaching. Easy quizzes and exams. Very friendly professor.
Honestly probably my favorite math professor, he always makes an effort to explain things within the context you're likely to see them, which is very helpful
Good at explanation materials. His office hours is very helpful!

Imagine getting all perfect scoreS on everything but the final and one quiz and still get a bad grade, this is how this guy treat his student. He intentionally give you very bad grade if you are way too ahead of the average score to drag you down. I dont know why someone will be such mentally ill to do this. Shouldnt even be a professor at first.

Professor Handron gives clear, descriptive lectures and often pauses to ensure that the students are keeping up. Take advantage of his office hours! It's obvious that it really does matter to him that his students learn, and I've never gone to his office hours and left with unanswered questions

Great person but has no logic AT ALL. His logic goes the opposite of all my other math professor. Go to lecture and you'll be scratching you hair off. Read the online notes written by another professor and you'll be fine. VERY boring lecturer too. Worst course I've taken.

Good person, but this man just does not know how to explain. I am honestly considering stop going to lecture and read textbook. I took Calc BC in High School and I cannot understand what Handron explains. This man needs to change the way he teaches.

Pretty good overall. Goes through material at a reasonable pace, but sometimes hard to understand his definitions until he does an example. Very good at answering questions and really cares about his students.

Lectures are fine and prepares you for the homework. The homework is not difficult, but it can get a bit time consuming. He's somewhat funny and occasionally he tells stories before the start of class. Tests are on the easier side but each question is worth a lot of points. Do your work, review your materials, and you should get an A.

taking his calc 3D and diff eq at the same tine. His lecture is really not helpful, and he didn't give practice exam before midterms. The exam material is also a bit different from his lecture, which makes me so confused from time to time.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: One of the worst professors I've had. He's a nice guy but his lectures are useless more often than not you just end up teaching yourself the material. He is very unclear during class and spends most of the time writing things on the board without giving any context or explanation
He is a really nice person but not a good professor. He makes way too many mistakes during lecture and is terrible at responding to emails. His 7:30 AM exams aren't something to be desired either.
Horrible lecturer. Irresponsible.
Unclear lectures, harsh grading. Exams contain too many problems to finish in such limited time

Wasn't the best teacher you can get. His lecture gets comfusing from time to time, so you really need to look at the notes multiple times to get the point. Jumps around in the Textbook, which is there mostly for the homework questions. He is a really nice person, but just not such a great teacher.
He has the worst teaching methods. He jumps around all over the textbook and does not explain key concepts well.

TAs are pretty different in terms of grading. My TA was really strict albeit his recitations were pretty useless. Homework and class don't seem to match up, and you'll probably need to read the textbook to understand more clearly the material taught in class.
He is a nice guy BUT his teaching is highly deficient. His notes are very disorganized, his classes are unclear and his HWs are way harder than what you learn in class.
not good
Nerd sense of humor but hes a real nice cute guy. Solid teacher but his homeworks and tests are very challenging
He really likes to do proofs!

For matrix algebra, his lectures are hard to follow and he does way too many unnecessary proofs in class, and not enough examples. His notes aren't organized at all and he goes extremely fast, so lecture was pretty useless for me. That said, he's actually not that bad at explaining if you go to his office hours.

Very easy to understand in class  and explains things very well if you ask questions. Tests aren't too hard, just pace yourself. Homework assignments are very long, however and are sometimes very hard too.
No Comments
likes to make up shorthand on the board that varies and makes notes are to understand

Tests are uneccessarily hard, but if you have taken calc already, you will get an A because of the rest of the class does poorly. Final grade cutoffs were            A 74.32 B 62.95 C 52.95 D 41.25

As a person, he's great - has a sense of humor in a cute/lame way that is funny. But 122 tests were ridiculous... TA was unhelpful. Also had him for the 4 Pillars of Geometry Seminar class- much more personal in that one for the obvious reason that it was smaller.

This class was HARD.  Expect a lot of homework, which is graded strictly.  The tests are also insane.  Took up too much time for 10 unit class.  Recitations are useless, TAs are forbidden from talking about homework problems.  That being said, he was a coherent lecturer and a fair grader (although tests were too hard)
The homeworks were not relevant to the classwork. I'm sure he taught matrix well but he did not do a great job with differential equations.
Great professor.  Very nice and helpful.  Pacing was just right.  Homework due every Friday.  Tests were fair.  Fun class.  :)

Extremely nice guy.  He was quite enthusiastic about the subject matter and was always willing to help out when he could.  The class took up a little bit more time than it should have, though, being a 3 unity course.
Is a fun teacher. Knows his material.
Stuck too closely to the book at first, but got better as the semester went on.  Very excited about the topic and always willing to talk about it with students.

He likes to tell bad jokes... then explain why theyre "funny", which is the humorous part.  Easy class though, takes polls in class of who is sleeping sometimes. Which is a break from the otherwise somewhat repetative material, that is somewaht interesting.
Teaches right from the book and his tests were not well done and he was not very helpful

Well, yes... it's boring.  Matrix seems like doing the same thing all year, just calling it different things.  And Handron was rather monotonous about it.  Each test has 4 problems, 3 easy and 1 hard proof.  So you'll understand the stuff but have to work a bit for an A.  Nice guy though.
This class was very easy. Handron talks like lumberg from the movie office space. " Yeaaa, well.." If you study for each test and turn in homework you'll be fine. No need for notes.

DiffEq (stands for Difficult Equations) is going to be hard no matter who does the lecture.  Handron's lectures were clear in class but proved suprisingly non-adhesive when it came time to do the problem sets.  Class hampered by sullen grad student TAs.
No Comments
No Comments

Nice professor. I think his first test is really difficult but the next two seem to be better. Lots of credit given on tests and homework for getting close to the right answer. Provides a really good structure for the class and the notes guide you well. Gotta do most of your learning outside the class but thats cause the class is only 50 min.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Really nice professor and not bad at teaching the material at all, but the tests are unusually hard. I understood the material quite well, but the tests ask very hard questions and even with the review it felt like you couldn't really prepare for them in completion. It is not an intro chem course. Very heavy on quantum mechanics in unit on.

I love Prof Vuocolo!! He is so funny and says the most interesting things sometimes. Exams are not bad as long as you go through the practice problems and recitation content. There is a lot of material so be sure to keep up with readings and assignments.

Nice person, but overcomplicates topics in lecture. If you are taking this as an intro to chemistry class think again.. It is useful to have background knowledge from high school. You can do well and not come to lecture because he talks a lot and more than half is unnecessary. HW is fair and boosts grade + Exams are more difficult but doable.

He is great. Tests and homeworks tend to be straightforward, and he is INCREDIBLY helpful in office hours - take advantage of it! He used an experimental grading system this semester that was very nice (more forgiving than point grades), and hopefully that continues. There is a participation portion for lectures, though, so be sure to go.

King he's so funny and deserves the world I've never seen anyone look so tired and sound so vocal at the same time just knowing that I get to see my king lenny vuocolo for chem lab later in the day makes me so happy hes got this little lab coat that he trots around the room in hes not taken seriously but hes fr so caring and nice
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Vuocolo is nice and engaging, and the OLI/textbook provide great practice problems. He has a nice sense of humor.
He is caring and kind. Really great content even for non-majors.
This man is crazy hard. I took this course twice and still did bad. The material makes no sense. beware

The class is doable for those with prior exposure, but would be difficult for those without. Do exam reviews & do/understand every. assignment. Study & complete assignments in advance. If you need help, go to your TA or Dr. V, and they'll be happy to help. He seemed a bit preachy to students. Too many moving parts in the course overall.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Good lecturer and carefully goes through his notes in class. This class is very time consuming (10hrs/week). Watch out for tricky questions on quizzes/tests. Psets are hard-ish and often include unfamiliar questions. Online software is expensive ($40-60+) and only slightly useful. Always do the exam review! Even a chem background can't help much.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I've never been more confused about concepts I already understand. Lectures take way too long to explain things in the most confusing way possible. Not good if you don't have a strong background in chem.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Lenny honestly tries to help every student as much as he can. His lectures are fast but the notes are clear if you go over them afterwards. His office hours are usually very helpful and he's pretty easy to talk to. Sometimes he can over explain things, but overall he is very thorough and puts in work to help your understanding.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: I didn't actually do that bad in Dr.V's class, but I know from talking to people that if you weren't already pretty good at chemistry, you definetly will take a beating as all of the topics are brutal, particularly if you haven't taken a good amount of chem before. Would steer away unless very confident with chem, even then proceed with caution.

It is stated that the class is designed for people with no chem background, but if you dont have any you will likely be floundering. Vuocolo explains everything Im the most unnecessarily complicated way (ie taking an entire lecture to explain a concept I can show you in 3 min, only I will make sense) Grade relies heavily on tests. Must read book.

The lecture could use a lot of improvement, but his office hours are helpful. The class moves insanely fast, so I'd recommend coming in with chemistry experience if you want to get a good grade. At times there is too much work assigned all at once. The assessments are extremely hard for what is put forth by the professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: His lectures aren't too helpful in my opinion and doesn't explain concepts too well. The first unit is very unnecessarily quantum heavy. He makes problem sets and other assessments pretty hard, but I will say that he is pretty accessible outside of class and was, from what I've heard, pretty helpful office hours.
The first unit is just quantum physics

Although he gives a lot of details in lectures, he likes to trick you when it comes to quizzes and tests. You have to be very careful because of those tricks he throws in, and I always found that recitations were more helpful than the actual lectures. He does give an ok amount of extra credit, but I didn't like how he looked down at his students.
Good professor overall. There are quizzes almost every week and a lot of opportunity for extra credit. The lectures are kind of lacking; he gives a packet of notes and goes through it.
Worst professor I have ever had at CMU. You cannot avoid Lenny, but atleast try to take Chem 1 over the summer.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. V made the lectures and materials easy to understand and provided feedback for every questions you asked. He also gave extra points if you did the reading and the corresponding sampling problems. Overall he was a good professor.

His tests (and graders) are super tough and cover things that are not in lecture.  Attendance is supposedly mandatory (you get extra credit for doing in class exercises).  Problem sets take a while and are graded for credit (sometimes the grades don't even make sense) so expect to have no idea what grade you're actually getting

Dr. V's a really nice guy. A lot of people think he's mean because of his hard tests but he does care a lot for his students. He gives so much extra credit, and is so willing to help out his students especially during office hours. Ace problem sets by going to office hours and tutoring, do all the extra credit, do the review problems--get an A!

The professor's teaching strategy is to give out packets of his notes and go through them in class. While many find this useful, he leaves out information from the textbook that he expects you to know. And even if you do read the textbook, you will always find topics that were never covered in lectures or in the textbook on the exams.

His course structure is superb. He makes you work for it, but you'll learn the material (which is conceptually hard) very well because of the sapling extra credit, weekly quiz, well-structured recitation combination. A a very enthusiastic lecturer, though meanders a bit. And is incredibly helpful if you're willing to see him. P.S. He doesn't age.

Dr.V is a tough teacher, but he genuinely cares about his students. His tests can be confusing but you get used to it. Go to his office hours, and take advantage of the MANY extra credit opportunities he provides (15 points).

Lenny is a great professor, by far my favorite of my first year. He is very personable and gives very thorough explanations. He expects a lot from his students, but I learned so much despite the fact it was an intro to chem course and I had already taken chem classes in high school. Lenny's strongest attribute is he really cares about students.

He doesn't care to help. I had never taken chemistry and had a TA who could not explain things. I'm happy I passed, and as a first year theres no way Im dropping my dream of being a doctor due to someone's inability to teach.

Quirky talkaive professor who makes his tests ridiculously hard. Epects you to keep up with a lot of work that doesnt exactly help on tests because he includes random questions that werent covered in lecture or on assignments
His class is a joke. He skips material then tests you on it. He doesn't regrade even though it's in the syllabus and is never available for office hours.

Very rude, nasty, disrepectful person. Will talk down to you, like you a child, and doesnt treat you like your an adult. Thinks he knows it all, and is always right. Your grade with him as a professor will suffer, even if you spend 40+ hours studying a week! Don't take his class.

Took Chem I with him, and as a second year engineering major, expected it to be a breeze.  Let me assure you, he doesn't make it easy.  It is MANDATORY that you do the readings, pay attention in class, take good notes if you want to do well in class.  The most challenging final I've ever taken in my life and I studied for weeks in advance.

Lenny taught Chem 1 for the first time this year, and everyone died as a result. I know of so many people who are dropping their dreams of being a doctor because of his class. He does not explain things well at all and expects everyone to be some of type of chemistry genius. He finds his quizzes and exams somewhere in hell.

Vuocolo is amazing!! He's hilarious during lecture and office hours. He tends to talk a lot, but after awhile you become genuinely interested in what he is saying. And if you really like him, you can see him in the gym at midnight every night lol.
He talks *so much*. Often to himself. Often to a student-victim who can't escape. He's nice, though (albeit a little unclear).
He basically talks to himself during lectures.  He's so unhelpful and his final was hell. He uses the same tests and homeworks every year.

Took Chem II with him. He essentially expected everyone in the class was a chem major (I needed to take three science classes to fulfill a requirement, and I picked this as one of them). It was pretty challenging as a non-major, and he didn't really do much to help.
Doesn't teach so much as say 'here is your assignment. Figure it out yourself' for chemistry prof. com. class. Professor is friendly, but also passive-aggressive so watch out!
He is a really nice person and is essentially a good professor. The class is really difficult so you do need to study a lot but if you put in the time then you can understand the material.
Keep up with practice problem sets and pay attention in class. Take good notes and go to his office hours and you'll be fine. Read before and/or after class too.
Good
Took Intro Chem Lab.  He explained everything well, and even gave extra credit for drawings in your lab notebook (of experimental setup, etc.)

Good and very friendly teacher, but a really boring class with moderately difficult quizzes/exams. Too much "busy work" as homework, and homework is due every class. Take a different science class to fill your requirements if you can.
live love russ
His personality is nice, and he's good to his students, but his way of explaining topics did not click for me at all. I learned more efficiently when I skipped class and read the textbook.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Walker is a great guy and pretty good professor. The class was pretty easy. Attendance in class Im not mandatory (nor in recitation) but it is helpful. Theres a free online book that you can use, but Walker discusses some specific exceptions in class so its good to go. All quizzes are also posted before being taken. Detailed test guides. Easy A
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: easy A class professor, up to 30 extra credit in final, surely pass, never push hard, period.

Russell Walker is a nice guy, really is. His quirky humor and silly phraseology keeps class interesting, Unfortunately, the course itself is very hard and he does a poor job of teaching the material. Study all you like, the tests could still throw a curveball that wasn't in any of the review. He makes all sorts of mistakes in lecture and grading.
He always posts practice exams and practice questions before a test. Doing them is really helpful.
He may not be the best in teaching... But definitely a nice professor!!! His classes are so much fun
Easy exams.

Listen, I probably could have put more work to get my grade up so I don't blame him for my grade. I blame Walker for his inconsistency in grading and for choosing TA's who are either rude or don't know how to teach. I'm not great at math and he made it 20x worse. He makes way too many mistakes and is rather unprofessional at times.

Dr. Walker is a nice likable guy, but is the walking embodiment of a stereotypical old out-of-it professor. His lectures consist of running through sample problems in a droning monotonous fashion. He seems disconnected from the students; being the only professors to give a 7:30am test, assign HW for carnival, and not mind a test having a 69 average
literally the worst teacher i've ever had
He couldn't even get a 100% on his exams! When the class average is a D, some things wrong.

In my entire 18 (almost 19) years on planet Earth, I have never had a professor quite as bad as Mr. Russel C. Walker. The homework? NOT BAD. The practice test? GREAT. The actual test? You might as well be a 14 year old boy looking at a playboy magazine: They're hard as hell. P.s Mr. Simione is the only reason why I stayed in the class, he's great.

Walker is a nice guy, but he's just not a good teacher. He makes a lot of little errors and the way he runs the course is somewhat disorganized. Couple that with the way he makes test questions contain uber-technicalities, and it really adds up to make the course much harder for the student than it has to be. Take Mackey if you can.

Funny guy, lackluster teacher. Knows his subject but not the best at imparting his knowledge; course requires a lot of individual effort from the student outside of class to understand the material. His tests are very difficult.

His lecture are lectures. He doesn't really teach you how to do math, her just more non the less, stands at the board and does math problems and expects you to learn. I have already taken Calculus, and his styling and ways of teaching things are poor!
pretty good prof. makes a number of basic errors, but his explanations are clear and helpful

It is really easy to not pay attention in his class for some reason, and it can be slow going at times. Walker is a pretty decent teacher, very clear voice and he wrote the textbook so he knows his stuff, but he makes frequent simple math errors and sometimes doesn't finish problems fully, which is annoying.
Enthusiastic and keeps the class involved. Great job of explaining concepts
His explanations are fairly clear and helpful. It's not easy to get an A even if you learned the stuff before.
He is hilarious because he's so old, but his class can be very difficult if you haven't taken calc before. Make sure study for the second exam; much harder than the first!! Be warned!!

Walker is awesome. Though lectures can get a bit boring, his humor helps a lot. He even throws chocolate to those who provide correct answers. Overall, pretty easy if you've taken calculus prior to this class. If not, just keep up with the readings/work and you'll be fine.

Russ Walkers class is amazing. Go to class, take notes and pay attention, study and you will do well. His review sheets and review sessions are awesome. Hes a smart smart guy and an amazing character. I literally go to class to see what WalkNasty is going to do next. If you do poorly in his class, you arent trying to arent good at math. Period.

I learned most of the material in high school, but this class still wasn't an easy A.  His lectures are not clear and time outside of class needs to be used to understand the lectures.  He spent too much time teaching things we didn't need to know.  Overall he's a really good, funny guy - throws chocolate at people who correctly answer questions.
He fell asleep on me during office hours. As I was asking a question. Explanations were convoluted and if you have not taken this material before, I would NOT recommend this professor.

Good professor. His summarizing sheets are really good. He gives you time to let the teaching sink in, and repeats the most important stuff until you get it. He may not be the most engaging teacher, but I recommend him anyways.

He really knows what he is doing. Sometimes it is difficult to keep awake but that's just because it is math. He teaches the material well but you need to follow what he is doing in the book and pay attention to details for those trick questions.
he is ungodly boring. Ben stein is more enthralling. He gives out a review sheet and problems that we should do and then makes the test 10X harder than any of the review problems.
Definitely had to read the textbook a lot to keep up with the class. He teaches well but fast and also his tests are a lot harder than what he teaches.
He's very interesting to watch during lectures. Tests are hard though.

Wow. Rusty Walker made my life a living hell. This guy can't teach to save his life. I've never been so lost in a class before. I can't believe people actually think this guy can teach. Maybe he's lost it over the last few years or something. Man, he sounds and looks like the boss from Office Space. This class was the worst. Zed Yilma saved me.
He is helpful but the tests are what gets ya!
Russ Walker doesn't choose numbers; they volunteer.

Professor Walker is a really good teacher. He makes the subject material aproachable and easy to understand. He doesn't try to intimidate or supprise you, he wants everyone to succeed. He also has a good sense of humor and really understands calculus. I did find the class easy, but only because I'd already taken calculus in hs.

He is a good lecturer, and knows his subject. However, there's just something about his voice that can put an entire lecture hall to sleep within minutes. If you're the kind to drink liters of coke throughout class to stay awake, I'd recommend him.
great teacher, great guy, definitely worth your time
No Comments
eh...he's pretty good at teaching the material, however lacks the energy and motive to keep the students awake in class!
cool guy; very quirky

His intuitive style has some potential. If only he would spend more time teaching students how easy his classes are and less time trying to intimidate them. With a special emphasis on TRYING, that is...
tough class if you've never had calc, he's suprisingly funny
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Tom is a good guy, but as a the co-professor for 240 he felt very lost in the material. He would look at the presentation and try to figure out what was going on during lecture. I feel like he could be a little more in sync with the class material. Went to his office hours like 3 times and was not very helpful.

Sullivan clearly cares about students. He goes slow in lectures which makes it so much better to understand than when Bill Nace lectures 240. I have had him for 18100 and 18290 too, he is a great professor.

Sullivan is an amazing professor. He clearly loves what he teaches and it makes learning all the more pleasurable. He teaches using concepts and practical application problems (best of both worlds). I would love to take more of his classes if only he taught more upper level courses.
Doesn't do much as co-instructor for this class. However, when he does lecture, the lectures are interesting and easy to understand. Explains concepts well.

This was the hardest class I have ever taken, but I also learned the most in this class then any other class I have ever taken. This is a very lecture heavy class, but Prof Sullivan is always willing to meet outside of lecture. You might get bored if long lectures are hard for you, but all in all I thought they were interesting. He's a good prof!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: By far the hardest course I've ever taken. I came in with no Physics II knowledge, so that was part of it. Another part was I slacked off badly. This course is SUPER tough, but Tom is a good professor who SERIOUSLY knows his stuff. Take initiative, do your work, get help from friends, and you should pass. If not a ECE major, take a different intro.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Took 18-100 over N16 semester. Crystal clear lecture and allowed me to understand everything from a conceptual level. Allowed me to extend upon my critical thinking skills, and be more interested in electrical engineing!
People fall asleep in the class
Not the best lecturer, and his style definitely won't suit everyone. However, he REALLY knows his stuff.

Took intro to ECE with Sullivan in Fall 14. Crystal clear lectures, though sometimes fast andor make you sleepy. Homework is sometimes hard but totally reasonable and offers great practice for exams. Expect long midterms, especially Exam1. His notes are amazing: read and memorize the notes and it's an easy A.

Make no mistake, 18-100 is a weeder course: *very* hard exams and if you're drowning no effort will be made to save you if you don't take initiative. Great professor if you get to know him though. (Protip: Don't understimate HW2).
Great professor, hard class.
He's okay. Classes are hard to follow.
His classes makes people fall asleep so quickly. Classes are not really interesting and exciting. His exams can be extremely hard, average score ~60%.
Go to the Supplemental Instruction, it was vital. Sullivan teaches the concepts, but doesnt go into to detail on how to solve the problems, go to SI again.

Knows his stuff, and moves really fast and goes pretty deep. The trick is to know when to pay attention, he shows you a lot of stuff that you don't need to know for the tests. He is generally a cool guy, though, but beware: He speaks with very unpredictable amplitude.
He's a good teach but the class is a bit too easy to fall asleep in. But if ur able to stay awak there's no reason why you won't get an A.

Extremely hard exams/Long assignments, make sure to attend every class, he is not kidding about it being a slippery slope. If you have a hard time following a concept in lecture and meet with him in his office he can explain everything crystal clear/is willing to demonstrate individual problems you are having issues with. Dislike new textbook.

18-100 was meant to be a hard class, to cut out all the students who are not supposed to be in the major, but are accepted cuz a lot of the other smart students choose to go to MIT instead. Professor's helpful if you go to his office hours. Exams are HARSH. It's one of those exams which you will be happy if you get over a 90.
Great prof, except the fact taht he makes extremely hard test! The professor is good, but the course is harsh.

Teaches the lecture for this course. Lectures were usually easy to follow. He occasionally said something extremely confusing that knocked me out for 15 minutes. He draws complicated diagrams, talks about them, and then changes little pieces, so you have to draw the whole thing again in your notes. Tests are extremely hard (weeder course).
No Comments
Overall he's a cool guy and enthusiastic about the subject. His lectures can get kind of confusing and hard to follow at times, but in general he does a good job of teaching.
The hottest professor ever. Good teaching and good style. I like when he touched his hair with his hand which was covered with chalk. Also very good help if you go to his office hour.
hes tough guy
