Tom's a great teacher.  He's really good about individual help.  If you have a problem, he will always help.
Just an awesome professor to have teaching you.
way to go Tom always-deano
Poor teacher who jumps around on the material. Makes excuses for students failing his class and an extremely harsh grader. Not a good class.
Very nice guy. Understands your concerns AND what he's doing, rare. The material is slightly difficult to grasp if you've never seen it before but there's help.
Unreasonable in terms of grading (doesn't even round, even if you're .9999 away from a cutoff), and a horrible teacher.  Fortunately, the course isn't hard.
cool
Engaging instructor, simplifies the material and you get a good understanding of it. Likes to give challenging tests, but you'll be pretty well prepared if he's teaching or TAing the class.
fun band, good performer
You get to see super-model Fabbrio teaching engeneering. His lectures are like rock concerts.
No Comments
Lectures taught well / exams are too hard / makes excuses for mistakes on exam
No Comments
Awsome class, awsome teacher, awsome guy
No Comments
No Comments
Sullivan's intro class is very well taught; material covered is fairly simple.

Lectures are kinda slow but are interesting. Lots of fun demos. Homework relies heavily on textbook problems (average difficulty). Tests are fair but slightly difficult. Makes you work hard for an A but doable.

My favorite professor here at CMU.  Yes, the class is really hard (Physics 1) but he is THE BEST guy to take it with.  He's super accessible and gets really excited when students come to office hours.  Go to office hours and get to know him - he's fantastic and will work with you until you understand it.  LOVE HIM!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: He's a really great professor who really enjoys what he teaches, and he loves explaining concepts even if they're not a part of the actual class. He references the textbook a lot, and if you're taking Physics for Future Presidents, you'll want to use the textbook to do well. Quizzes are sometimes difficult, but not if you pay attention in class..

Professor Vogel is hands down my favorite professor. Not only is he very clear and explains the concepts well, he is willing to sit down with you and go through everything! I always go to him (even though now i'm in physics 2) and ask him for help. He is more than willing!  I love him. He is a great and caring professor and friend!
awesome teacher. one of the best i ever had. his tests are really not that hard. his quizzes are hard. GO TO CLASS. i didn't and i regret it so much
One of the best professors at CMU! He's friendly, and will always be ready to help any student!

Best professor ever.  He really cares about all of the students, and if you go see him in his office he will instigate conversations with you on a personal level. Incredibly nice and understanding, and incredibly accomplished.

Best physics professor a physics-phobic student could ask for! By the second week of class, my friends and I started to refer to him as our "german grandpa" He is super nice and makes it a point to get to know all of his students! Pro-tip: hes pretty generous at giving back points on exams if you go see him personally (office hours)
He's really good, helpful and extremely accomplished - he works on the LHC!
Take this class if you bad at Physics. It is very similar to high school physics.

Professor Vogel is my absolute favorite professor at CMU.  Amazing, perfect, wonderful personality (go to office hours just to talk!).  I absolutely love him :) Class not too difficult (I had trouble with final though)... good luck!
Very good at explaining, interesting, inspiring, funny, and just awesome in general.
Nice and helpful.
A wonderful Prof

Generally a very good teacher, interesting too.  The only thing that might take getting used to is "Vogel Math."  You cannot use calculators on exams so you sometimes you have to make 'approximations' during the exam.  Only in Vogel's class does 3*3 = 10 :-)
Just splendid and wonderful.  Very enthusiastic, willing to help, and provide further challenging material.
Pretty good teacher, but rather difficult.
Professor Vogel is one of the best teachers I've hd this year.  His clas is funny, interesting and his demos are fantastic.  Absolutely a brilliant man and a brilliant teacher.

Vogel is an amazing teacher. He is good at explaining difficult concepts and always adds humor to lectures which keeps you paying atention. He tries hard to make sure that everyone understands the material. True, the class moves at an exceptionally fast pace and the tests are impossible, but it is still an amazing class which I enjoyed immensely.
Prof. Vogel is the man.. his class experiments are awesome and he helps so that each student does well
No Comments
nirvana.physics.cmu.edu
He taught the class very well.  Vogel has a good sense of humor which helps to liven the class and keep students entertained.  I would recommend his class to anyone able to take it.
Best prof at CMU i've ever had.
Vogel is an amazing professor. He explains concepts very thoroughly in class, provides realistic examples, and is extremely caring about his students. I definately enjoyed taking the course with him.

I'm not a huge physics fan, but his class is ok.  Uses some humor in lecture, don't expect standup.  Assigns a lot of homework, which is checked and graded.  Tests are challenging, but not impossible.  Awkward to talk to outside of lecture, makes me a little uncomforable to ask questions.

What can I say -- he's a great teacher. Although he's starting to get older and slightly more forgetful, Vogel is a wonderful first-year instructor. His methods are always clear and easy to understand, he is open to questions at any point during a lecture, and manages to interject humor into even the most boring of topics.
his tests are really hard, but i don't think Physics 1 people have a choice w/ the teacher...
Vogel math is awesome. Class was wonderful my favorite physics class to date
ok
Vogel is Awesome!!!
i love him!

Vogel is a very unaccomodating teacher.  I once woke up the morning of the exam with the flu.  I couldn't even walk to the bathroom without throwing up.  He wouldn't let me take the exam the next day, after I had been to the doctor.
Made me consider switching my major until I realized engineering classes aren't nearly as good as his.
This dude meditates about the universe in his free time.
his tests are hard! look at old tests on his website
Dr. Vogel is a god.
Vogel is the man
great teacher, funny jokes, hard hard class
one of the best teachers to ever walk the face of the earth.
handwriting is horrible but his jokes are funny.  class is hard get tutoring

Had her for 21-259. The lectures were alright, you get the info you need, but its important to note that she does a lot of derivations so you will have to filter that out and just focus on the end results of the derivations. She is very knowledgeable, and with remote class the weekly in-class tests were a little tricky with the limited time.

She was fine until quarantine and suddenly she became the rudest, most unreasonable, annoying, paranoid person ever. She thinks all of her students are cheating and she punishes everyone by giving exams that are impossibly difficult with an inadequate time limit. The way she responds to emails show little to no respect to her students, she sucks.
One of the sweetest Professors out there, Hard to understand the lectures (i might be dumb) but it's possible if you grind for it. Do your hw.
Mihai is an angel

Go to lecture and just write down all the examples. The homework is more difficult than the content on the tests by a long shot, and the tests are very basic and stick to the material. If you understand the proofs in the class, you'll be fine on exams, but you should be able to manipulate the ideas you've been learning.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Her lectures are not at all good. She is very boring and reads off the slides a lot. Seems to not really understand the material fully herself, given how much she makes mistakes and doesn't catch them until a student tells her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Great at teaching and explains the concepts in a way that is easy to understand. Homeworks do take a long time to complete, but the exams are fair. She also cares about her students very much and is, in my opinion, one of the nicest and best professors I have had at CMU.

Her lectures consist of working out example problems to help you understand new concepts which I found really helpful. However, I wish she could have provided better lecture notes and up to speed feedback on homework assignments.
Took Calc 3D and really enjoyed her class. HW and exams all seemed very fair.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Boring - Not Interesting!

Had Prof. Mihai for Matrices. Her HW is pretty long and tedious at times, but her exams are very, very fair. If you review her in-class examples and do lots of practice problems, you should be fine for her exams and the final. She also posts tons of supplementary materials on Blackboard, which is nice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: I liked her teaching style with a lot of examples. Didn't have a problem with her.

She's super nice. Tests are very very fair / similar to HW. My TAs were excellent. She goes over what she did in class last time. Her notes are pretty clear, posts slides to blackboard. Very organized. Ppl don't like her because they zone out in class/don't pay attention. Focus ... and it's an easy A. :)

I took Calc in 3D (21-259) with Prof. Mihai, and I am taking Diff. Eq. (21-260) with her now. Both classes were pretty boring. You have to memorize a bunch, and the exams are much harder than the homework, but as long as you pay attention in lecture and utilize the textbook you'll be fine. Do a lot of practice problems to study for the exams.

You learn very little in lecture because it's described in a very complicated way. Probably 80% of what you learn will be on your own, from friends or from the TA. Not a fun course. Having to memorize formulas for integrating random shapes? You'll never use it again. You hit slack variables one class and it's the only thing you need to know really.
GREAT
She over complicated a lot of the concepts in lecture, my TA was my saving grace. Also, watch out because the practice exams are NOTHING like the actual exams

She's really a nice person. She laughs when she makes mistakes and corrects  them very easily. She knows her material, she really knows her material. BUT she teaches the class in the most complicated way possible. If she could learn how to provide a simple formula, instead of a multi-page hieroglyphic explanation, the class would have been easier.
I heard bad things about her prior to the course, but she was actually pretty good! Clear, straightforward, easy to follow. Also a really nice person, I think.
Even though i heard horror stories about her, i liked the way she taught and her exams weren't that difficult. It was actually one of my favorite classes.
goes fast in lecture
Took 21-256 with her. She's not the best Math. professor you'd find, but not the worst her. She is helpful, homework is just right and test usually covers materials taught in lectures.
She is nice, but just not good at lecturing.
She is a nice teacher and very lenient if one misses a midterm.  She is hard depending on math background whether you go to class.  The book is almost completely useless, so make sure to go to class.

If you are thinking about taking 21256 with her, her first few exams are easy but she makes the last exam and the final ridiculously hard. She also tends to give problems not really on what you learn but what you learned in previous calculus classes which makes exams hard. make sure you get 100's on hw.. the only life saver.

Everybody told me horror stories about mihai, and during the first couple weeks of class I kept waiting for my "oh my god" moment. It never came. She explains everything very well, and very logically. People that Can't follow her are invariably among the 80% of students that don't go to class or Talk with their friends the whole time
I like her. Maybe too much.
Speaks quietly and with unclear notes.  Confusing and boring.  Definitely knows the material, but isn't effective at communicating it to students.
Avoid at all costs!

She's a nice person, but average teacher. Nice and thorough during office hours though. Lectures were dry and material was covered way too quickly. Not the end of the world if you have to take a class with her, but she's not making it easier.
She is confusing. Does not communicate well. Run from this math teacher. I have heard that most classes she teaches are pretty bad. Wait for another professor for the class.
the test questions are similar to textbook and other practice questions, so they are not so bad.
awesome

expect to learn more applications in recitation, mostly concepts are covered in lecture, hw is usually harder than actual tested material, weekly quizzes in recitation, lectures are computer friendly, don't sleep- she'll throw chalk at you (although she is very nice)
Concepts with Mihai was easy, but the concepts themselves could have been explained better and in the end, you were ill-prepared to go on to real proof-based math courses.
No Comments
No Comments
Rough class if you struggle with math.  She's a fair teacher and not exceptionally difficult, but the material is very difficult to learn if you're not mathematically inclined.
The difficulty level was average—not too hard—but it could have been a bit more challenging.

If you're familiar with the material, I highly recommend him. Class will be a breeze. I didn't have to come to lectures, slides were fine for hw/exams. But, if you're new to this stuff, avoid. Literally, first lecture he wrote out a bogus proof, and he's terrible with students' questions. His and his TAs' math is lacking, bad proofs.

Professor Adamchik remains as the worst computer science professor I have taken thus far. His lecture style is erratic, he shoots down questions, and the sheer disconnect between lecture content and homework/test content in terms of difficulty is not only wildly discouraging, but also incredibly unfair. Do not take this professor.
Difficult to understand the accent initially but you get used to it. He  makes you think during his discussion lectures and explains the concepts very well.

for this online class, it didn't really feel that she cared. there was no online lecture.  just homework assignments, quizzes tests etc. tough material that she could have made easier by providing videotaped lecture.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: great

I took this class over the summer at CMU. His accent was a little difficult to understand at first, but he gave really good lectures and I definitely knew the material after I finished the course. In the end. I didn't get a good grade in the class, but, in retrospect, it was all due to the mistakes I made.
Adamchik is amazing

Great lecturer! Discusses good questions in class and is AMAZING during OH for clearing concepts. Would strongly recommend attending his OH if you don't understand something. DO NOT expect significant help in homework problems. Has a thick Russian accent so 10/10 would recommend sitting in front.

Once you can understand his accent (which took me about a week), he's easily one of the top 10 professors at CMU. I heard that 21127 is hard class, but not with Adamchik teaching.  You'll feel like you were born knowing the stuff he teaches by the time you're done with his class, because everything just makes such perfect sense when he explains it.

Really nice class - learnt a lot. Professor himself is decently tough, not an easy A, and has a bit of a Polish accent that can be sometimes hard to understand. If you sit near the front though, you should be fine, and should end up liking him. Has a sense of humor and is generally kind.
Took 15-121 and 15-211 with him. Data structures are way more up his alley than algorithms. Has a Russian accent but is totally understandable. Great sense of humor. Very friendly.
He is VERY bad at proofs and theory. He is totally AWESOME with applications and data structures. But seriously, he sucks at theory.
Knows what he's talking about.  Other posts are correct, he has a thick accent but is understandable

Thick Russian accent, but still comprehensible if you sit near the front. His explanations are sometimes shallow or hard to understand due to the accent, but that's also the nature of the course. Genuinely helpful when you need it.

He has a Russian accent, but speaks fluent English, and it's not hard to understand him. He's a pretty good lecturer but let the annoying TA kind of run the assignments. Posts lecture notes online and keeps up with posting grades.
Very friendly, laughs almost too much. Very entertaining and presents his examples well. No tolerance for fools, good for people who actually want to be there.
Totally awsome
No Comments
He is a really good teacher, also is really funny, laughs at his own jokes.

As others have said, his accent is think but I don't think it's incredibly hard to understand. If it's a big lecture hall, sit in front and he'll notice you. He usually engages only the first few rows as he teaches. Subject matter is very interesting; I feel like the people who will give him poor ratings don't care for the course much anyway.
His accent is hard to understand sometimes
Adamchik will work you, but he's a good man, and you'll know your stuff by the end of the term. It's critical to sit in the front and get to know him, though, if it's a large class.
Ok, so sometimes it is kinda hard to follow him (accent and all), but the man knows his stuff!
yeah, sure, he can't speak english. admit it though, you were entertained.
He rides spinners and does not stop

This class was HORRENDOUS. Unfortunately I had no choice of professor: Adamchik taught the CS section and that's the way it was. If you can possibly avoid it, don't take anything he teaches. It's not the difficulty: it's the muddled style of presenting and low intelligibility.
Gave good explainations of basic concepts
Hard to understand, too focused on GUIs
Very hard to understand, makes it tough to stay awake in lecture
A little hard to understand because of the russian accent, but mostly pretty good.

Pay attention and go to class, he's an amazingly brilliant guy.  If he sees you've been in class and knows you try hard, there's no way you can get a bad grade in this class.  Talk to him if you don't understand him, he's so nice!
Quite easy of a teacher. Not always clear on the programs, but great lecturer.
Passionate about subject. funny. i loved this guy!!!!  whoever gave him the bad rating sucks!
No Comments
probably the easiest 15-200 teacher
No Comments
No Comments

I do not understand how this woman has a PhD. It's been three years since I took this class and I still remember this class as the worst one I've ever taken. If you'd like to stay sane, stay out of this class. Fresh snow peas will haunt me to the grave.

NEVER TAKE THIS CLASS. Here are the main reasons why:
1) her lectures DO NOT help. They feel like random ramblings tbh. I feel more confused after than before.
2) the new grading system is SO STRICT. More than 1 question wrong on a pset and you're stuck at a B.
3) every assignment takes 4+ weeks to grade, even if there's no feedback left by TAs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I would avoid courses with professor Bjorndahl at all costs. The class is incredibly boring, explanations are confusing, and her teaching personality is more suited to primary school. Being a good professor is more than memorizing our names. I was told she's a spousal hire, CMU hired her because they wanted her husband to work here, and it shows.

I'm in ECE with a minor in biochem and this class alone has more work than any other class. I don't have time for this bs where she prances around the classroom gurgling vowels at us. The class is a gened. Act like it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: THIS CLASS THINKS ITS THE MAIN CHARACTER OR SOMETHING. we're not even halfway through the semester and i get nightmares from this class. i'd wish she'd stop trying to guess my name and JUST TEACH BETTER. DO NOT take this class unless you've already memorized the entire IPA. TORTURE TORTURE TORTURE
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Great professor. The lectures are interesting and there's lots of class discussion (but participation is optional). I felt reasonably well prepared for quizzes/exams/homeworks, and there's retake opportunities for everything. I saw a lot of negative reviews concerning grading, but I think the TAs have probably helped a lot in that regard.

I took this class two years ago and whenever someone asks me if they should take this class I list all the bad things about the class and the professor so fast to the point where I'm practically rapping. I'd rather my tuition go into maintaining the grass on campus than going to this hell of a professor.
Worst professor ever. I've never had a class haunt me so badly
Absolute horrible. Do not take. Super uninteresting and makes content absolute hell

Probably one of my favorite courses I took last semester, but definitely not the easiest. You will probably not like this class if you don't have any interest in linguistics. The homeworks require a decent amount of effort, but office hours are very helpful.

Lectures are confusing and tangent filled. She doesn't fully explain things, then expects students to do well on midterms, homeworks, and exams. If you like Linguistics, you will like this class. If not, you will absolutely hate it. She is an overall nice woman, but would not want to take another class with her.
I've hated this class with every ounce of my being. This professor made me feel such unhinged, unparalleled rage and it's a good thing I don't see her around campus or else I'll be jumping her.
I took this class last year and yesterday I accidentally caught a glimpse of an IPA chart and I swear I just felt three generations worth of trauma I've never cold sweated like that before

Everyone is giving her low ratings because the class was very difficult,especially for something taken as a gen ed. But the material was interesting, and you can tell she really wants people to learn. I guess the class serves as a weed out. Most people hate it, and the people who like it REALLY like it.
I would never take this class again even if someone offered to pay my entire tuition

F*cking hate this professor so damn much. My friends and I would joke that our self abortion note would be our gradescopes for this class pulled up on our laptop. Genuinely pity anyone taking this class with her right now, get out while you still can.

Took this during spring 2022 and now I finally have the guts to write a review. This class was GOD AWFUL. This had more work than all of my stem classes combined. Grading is very inconsistent; worked with a group of friends and yet sometimes I got 15 points lower than the people I worked with (or vise versa). Genuinely thought I was going to die
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Stupid, ridiculous class and professor. Most useless content ever. If you do take this class be prepared to put a tremendous amount of effort if you want to get an A. I literally get nightmares thinking about the IPA chart

Probably the most useless class and professor ever. Emailed her 5 times telling her that my grade on canvas is wrong due to an accepted regrade and responds back twenty min later saying that she will fix it only for it to be the same two weeks later (yes i have emailed her again during the two weeks she said she was going to fix it).

After finishing work from my technical classes and then remembering I had some NOL pset or wiki to do pretty much always brought me to tears because of how much I hate this class and it's work. I envy those who dropped within the first month.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: She grades assessments too harshly and doesn't tell us why she took off so many points. I can't believe I studied so hard for midterms only to never get above a 55%. I agree with the previous person who said this class is detrimentally ruining my quality of life. She just loves the idea of making our lives harder than they already are

Literally hate this class so much. It's actively and detrimentally ruining my quality of life and shouldn't even be this time consuming for a gen ed. Lectures are useless, she takes ages to grade problem sets, and the problem sets take up to 3 days to complete. Most useless class ever DO NOT TAKE IT!!
The amount of work I had to do for this class to maintain an A is actually baffling. Never take this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This is literally the worst class I have taken at CMU. There is simply zero structure to this course. If you happen to see this too late and are taking this class right now, do not go to lecture; I haven't and I score quite well on the tests by just cramming the night before. Also, do your wiki stuff.

All the material and her very often irrelevant lectures completely ruined my love of linguistics. 
She's a very nice person, but tries too often to act like our therapists, asking us what's stressing us out, and when we tell her that she gives us too much unnecessary work she does absolutely nothing about it.

Although Bjorndahl is a really sweet and caring person, I heavily disliked the structure of this class. OLIs, homeworks, long Psets, quizzes, canvas assessments, don't even get me started on the wikis... it was way, way too much work. Definitely don't take this class if you were looking for an easy A gened course.

She doesn't tell students that there is a quiz-- we had to find out from TAs and this was the night before one. She takes really long posting study information and when she does she forgets to post the answer key. She tries to be our therapist instead of doing the work she should be doing. There are also no concrete examples in her slides.

There are few long assignments for this course. Procrastination not recommended. The professor is nice and caring, but her lectures can get boring. She is open to help you with any questions you have. The class was interesting in the beginning, when we learned about IPA and transcription, but learning grammar rules was less engaging.
Never take this class.

This professor gives the most mundane work I've seen in my entire life. In an effort to "get to know" her students she cold calls them and spends her time memorizing students and calling on them when they clearly do not want to be part of the discussion. She claims that her problem sets gets easier as they go on but they get harder

Gives too much work and expects students to complete it all. Does not thoroughly review material and has unorganized slides. Never take her class unless you want to major in linguistics. Assigns work on things she hasn't taught, gives extensions then acts upset when students do not do well. Spends too much time talking about Canadian identity.

She gives too much work for such an obscene class, she grades too strictly and nitpicks every detail. More work is spent on this class than all my stem classes combined, and her problem sets do not get easier as she claims them to be. They take at least 6 hours to complete and are complex and time consuming. She also cannot teach in a clear manner.
Way to fast and very disorganzied slides. Talks about irrelevant things a lot and does not provide much explanation for the relevant material
Christina is probably my favorite professor I've had. Fantastic person, very down-to-earth. Will be understanding about extensions (within reason). Made me feel heard during discussions.
Cool professor. Adapted the course amazingly to remote learning. I was a pretty terrible student in this course I really wanted an easy gen-ed, and this was NOT it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Some questions in the midterm exam also appeared (albeit slightly modified) in the final. Btw she can literally remember everyone's name. It's like magic lol

Christina is great! Her lectures are comparatively interesting, yet nothing super mind blowing. She is funny and will oftentimes poke fun at herself. While lecture isn't always mandatory in NOL 80-180, I would definitely advise attending most (if not all) of them.

Christina is a fantastic professor who is extremely passionate about the course and her personality/attitude makes the course enjoyable. The class has required lecture attendance with daily 'clicker quizzes' that are pretty easy. The textbook is recommended but not necessarily needed to do well in the class if you pay attention during lecture.

I loved Professor Anderson's class. His lectures are captivating and were worth getting up for at 8am. He truly was passionate about his teaching, and I only wish I could have learned from my mistakes earlier on.

we love Dr Anderson! Good lectures (goes through many examples) and his office hours are really useful. Exams are fair and homework is more difficult but doable. Recitation attendance matters and homework is submitted by hand. He is a really great professor and passionate in lecture. He goes off textbook sometimes so lectures are helpful
We love Dr. Anderson
Super nice, and engaging as a lecturer. Not always the most fun labs, as they can sometimes get monotonous, but his lectures are incredible.

BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD. He literally made me consider switching my major to physics. His lectures feel like TED talks. He is so helpful and makes class so interesting. Kept me engaged at 8am which says A LOT!The class is also extremely organized with so much support. Even if you aren't in CIT like me, I would take this course over the other

literally the best professor. He is clearly passionate about physics and cares a great deal for his students, He teaches well while still being kind and understanding which is hard to find. 
Class is fine if you have taken any beginning physics class but you might struggle if you're coming in without any physics knowledge.

The only man that would make me excited for a 7AM online class is David Anderson. An excellent professor and human in general who kept lectures engaging, even for people who are allergic to physics like myself. Simultaneously understanding and helpful as well as stern, as he has high expectations for us. He was my first professor crush at CMU, haha

Attendance mandatory for recitation, not for lecture. Fantastic professor. Very excited and very clear. It is obvious that he enjoys teaching. Makes difficult concepts easy to understand. Will give incredibly easy quizzes each week - don't be fooled! Tests are 10x harder. Can be pretty funny. Go to lectures, ESPECIALLY if you don't read the book.

Very enthusiastic & entertaining lectures with clear explanations! Office hours are helpful and individualized - he walks you through problems and explains each step. Reading not needed but go to lectures. Whatever downsides this course has are easily outweighed. This class made my semester so much better, and that's definitely owed to Anderson.

Fantastic lecturer, spends time with you on anything and ensures you understand it thoroughly and beyond. Would generally describe him as rigorous, but never punitively so. The expectations for tests are high; the amount of physics covered is comprehensive. Very supportive in getting you there. Will always work with you. One of my favorite profs!

Took his Exp Phys and Intro Phys classes which were the BEST Physics classes of my life. Cares about his students, learning, and is just an awesome teacher. not taking this class is such a missed opportunity.

Fantastic professor. He explains things very clearly and really cares about students. Very humorous during lecture time. Easy to ask for extension of homework. Workload is manageable and predictable. I genuinely likes this course because of him.

Very passionate about physics and teaching, and his class is organized. The homework recitation problems are usually harder than the tests. Take advantage of his office hours, where he freely goes through any problem step by step and takes the time to make sure you understand. Overall a great fella, who is also surprisingly amazing at Mario Kart
Tests can be very time-crunched, around 9 pages to be done in 50 minutes. Quizzes are significantly easier than exams. Weekly homework and quizzes. All the practice given is useful for studying.

Think of what a kind version of Draco Malfoy would be like as a man in his mid fifties, then make him a college physics professor. Thats Dr. Anderson for ya. Just an absolute legend and hard not to like.

Prof. Anderson is so cool! He's the only one of my professors that doesn't make me fall asleep right away. You can tell he cares, and his explanations of difficult concepts make them seem super easy. Highly recommend.

Anderson reminds me of the Doctor from Doctor Who, but like, less pretentious. His lectures are super interesting (as much as 33141 can be interesting lol) because you can tell he's passionate about the subject, and he's really nice. The accent's also a plus!

Course was insanely easy online, just a TON of busywork (finding equations, filling in variables/values, solving algebra equations, etc. Went to lecture approximately 0 times, used the book for the quizzes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: The man's a legend. What can I say

David Anderson is a great teacher. He is passionate about his job and physics and loves his students. He is a very nice guy and I would like to have him again. His quizzes are fair and tests are also not bad. If you do your work and do not make silly mistakes it is not very hard to get an A. You just gotta be constant! Assignment every week!

An amazing professor. For the most part, his lectures are engaging even at 9:30 in the morning. Recitation attendance is required, but the recitation problems are very helpful for preparing for the midterms. One of the four midterms is dropped. There are weekly quizzes and the lowest is dropped. Homework should take about an hour. Would recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I cannot emphasize enough how much I love this man, he's one of the best professors. He's very helpful at office hours and genuinely cares for his students. Work hard and study, and you can get the A

Absolutely fantastic professor. His lectures were very engaging and exciting because he was always so passionate about the topic. Also, the class was super organized--we always knew when everything was due, and recitations were guided by papers with practice problems that he put together. It's difficult--but students have the resources to succeed.

His lectures are sometimes heavy, but he manages to keep students' attention with cool/funny demonstrations. HW is moderate and gives many practice problems for recitation. You need to work hard to get a good grade, but he also drops grades. Get ready for Friday quizzes. He explains hard concepts very well. Note: Writes his Qs backwards.
Professor Anderson is one of the best lecturers CMU has to offer. Despite the fact that the lectures were at 9:30, he finds a way to hold your attention. Get ready for those weekly quizzes.
He's super enthusiastic and pulls your interest to the lectures. Decently challenging material but definitely manageable

This class could have been great if I worked harder.  Do not slack off.  Read the material, do the work, and you'll do fine.  Lot of lectures, and they're fast, so rather than copying everything down make sure you understand the fundamentals and the concepts.  He focuses on the concepts more than the numbers anyways.  Get extra help if you need to.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: A good guy. He'll really help you out if you go to office hours. I like how he focuses on the concepts instead of the numbers. Gets you ready to derive it yourself when you forget.

Anderson is like the inspiring British father you wish you had at CMU.  GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS, lectures are good but no one is tryna get up at 9 am MWF so use his hours for extra help.  He gives quizzes on Fridays so be ready for that, but otherwise he is super fair and the way he approaches physics is very new and creative; not focused on numbers
Ayyy cool teacher. Tests are okay just study and attend recitation since its mandatory as is 5% of your grade. You can skip 1 or 2 and your good.
It's always exciting to be in his class
He is awesome

Experimental physics with him has been very well taught and fairly graded. The lab reports are very low key and can be finished within the class period, so there is no outside time commitment, plus it never took more than two hours

Great professor.  He's hilarious, easy, and helpful.  Just make sure to pay attention during lectures and write down everything he says.  He literally tells you exactly what to do during the lab and if you follow his instructions you'll be done early and get an easy A.
Experimental physics. EASY grading, lots of time to get all work done, and usually doesn't use the entire 3 hour block. Fine professor.

He's a really nice guy and actually does care a lot about his students, his lectures do help if you actually pay attention, but if not he posts tons of practice exams and those  help you a lot. Also, if you can pick Eric as your TA, he is by far the best TA i've ever had.

He is my favorite professor so far!! He is amazing, just make sure to visit his office! If you make an effort to see him he will give you the grade he feels you deserve based on commitment! I visit him every office hour! He is a really good professor. The class is still hard just make sure to see him and read the book for clarity. Pass the Mastery!
Not very good...lectures don't exactly help

Taking this class I feel like a dizzy blindfolded monkey throwing darts at a periodic table. but hitting the mark each time. I have no idea how I do it when I feel that Prof. Karol would be a great guy yo go bowling with, but not learn chemistry from.
I love Pauly. So hot.

Dr.Karol has a great setup for blackboard and if you're smart you'd use it. As for classes, it helps some people but not others. He teaches in a very modern way. I think people would understand more if they asked questions. He is very good in one on one so see him during office hours. Overall, not a bad professor.
Class was boring and not helpful. He does post lots of practice quizzes and tests on blackboard though.
A really clear teacher, I enjoyed Chem way more than I thought I would

Prof. Karol is a nice man but he's not a motivating teacher at all. Each class, half the students are asleep within 20 minutes. Lectures are fairly straightforward and easy to understand but they do not cover what's on the tests. You have to go to recitation if you want to understand the material. Otherwise just look at tests from previous years.
He is a great teacher. He often uses material from past tests and quizzes. He makes his expectations crystal clear. It is up to the student to put in the effort.
I hated his course and found it an absolutely demotivating waste of time and tuition money.  He is a great example of what I don't want to be when I am his age.

Heard this professor was easy but his curve is not too generous. Did not worry a lot but ended up getting a B because of a misleading curve he put up before the optional final. SI sessions were more helpful than class.

boring and pointless to go for class. reads off powerpoint presentations which have nothing to do with the text book or the exams. TA's confusing and homework out of the portion. Random pop-quizzes which aren't even important

Lectures have NOTHING to do with what is on the exam.  Homework comes out of nowhere.  Quizzes are crazy.  He's a great guy, but iffy prof.  He knows what he is talking about, but just reads off the powerpoint.
Teaches via powerpoint, incredibly boring and monotone, had TA's that couldn't speak English and lost exams.  AVOID.

He's an affable professor, but his lectures are confusing, boring and not very 'grounded'. He could do way more homework examples in lecture. You can pass and maybe get a B....he curves ok. His tests are hard. TAs save his class BIG TIME.
Hard to stay awake, lectures are not clear at all.  Try to avoid the class if possible, apparently honors chem is an easier class.
needs to rely on his powerpoint presentation less. gives pop quizzes in the first few minutes of class sometimes. not always clear.
Usually pretty boring.  Monotone voice, etc.  I hear he's pretty hard for intro chem but it was doable.  Tests are pretty hard though.
Great guy, cares a lot about his students.  Not the greatest teacher but definitely a great guy.  Take Chem I with him, but take Chem II with someone else.  Very smart, very likeable.

Prof. Karol is a great guy. His lectures move fast, and his tests are hard, but he is very open and willing to help, just go check out his office hours. Like stoichiometry? You need to pass a mastery exam in it, or you fail the class.
his tests are hard, but reasonable. his lectures are kind of boring, but sometimes helpful. he's an ok teacher, sometimes monotonous, but a very reasonable professor.
good prof, tricky tests, very monotone
Karol relies too heavily on computerized slideshows. Ineffective.
annoying and boring -- a fan of pop quizzes, a master of monotone
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Now, if we could only slow him down.... he'd make a great prof
No Comments
Let it be known - The class will be hard all year, but grade inflation is high.
Very helpful both in class and for career development
Amazing Professor

Prof. Hrusa is one of the best professors I have ever had! Not only does he teach things brilliantly, his class will help you grow your professional aspirations tremendously. Also, he is an extremely caring person, something that you may not find that easily!

Overall, great professor and person! Definitely recommend

Really nice guy. He's extremely passionate about math and puts in so much work for his students. Schedules office hours regularly, posts lecture notes, and loves working with students on open-ended homework. If you get the option, take his 3 unit mini 21-101 (discrete-time dynamical systems). Fairly easy but very interesting and rewarding.
You cant graduate from CMU without going through this man's class. Amazing.

He's the best professor out there. Incredibly dedicated to the course and hilarious. He can be intimidating sometimes but it's because he really cares about student learning and tries to make sure you don't consistently make the same errors. He provides the course text online for people so many people don't tend to come to the lecture.

Hands down the best professor I've had at CMU. Not only is he an amazing lecturer but he truly cares about students and would go far and beyond to help them. He is also extremely committed to his course, going out of his way to make extra office hours and sending us tons of emails regarding updates. CMU is truly lucky to have a professor like him.
LOVE this professor. Teach well, hold a lot of office hours, give great advice to students... He always tries his best to help students. I am taking classes just because he is teaching it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Undoubtedly the best instructor at this institution. His commitment to the course and to students is unparalleled.

Best professor I've ever had at CMU. He is a very reasonable person with respect to homework, exams and grades. He is very dedicated to his job, even holds office hour until 11pm when needed. He almost knows every student's name in his class and cares about students a lot.
Amazing teacher.

He was one of the best professors I had at CMU, really personable guy who cares a lot about the students. He even sent me an e-mail at the end of the semester congratulating me for getting an A in the class. Wish I had interacted with him more when I was there.
BEST PROFESSOR EVER. He knows every student's name even though it is a huge class with 150 students. He offers great help in academics outside of the class. EXTREMELY WONDERFUL PROFESSOR!

I had Professor Hrusa his first year at CMU, and felt he was engaging, funny, and a very good teacher. He genuinely cared about his students and had a way of reaching them. I would recommend him w/o reservation.

Best Math Teacher I've ever had, easily available to talk outside class. Even if the material is difficult, he'll find a way to teach it that makes it easy. Patient with answering questions, and a kind/understanding person in general.

I never would have realized that math finance was so interesting.  Very helpful both in and outside of class.  If it's hard, it's because you need to understand both the math and the finance; you can be a perfect mathematician, and if you don't get the "economic" interpretation, you can throw your math out the window.

Cares about his students and is an entertaining lecturer.  Amazing at teaching the material.  However, his class is difficult and he said "I would fail my own mother to protect the integrity of this university"

I am a recent graduate and found Hrusa to be the best professor I've had by leaps and bounds.  He is effective in delivering difficult material and is also accessible in aiding students and answering questions.  Phenomenal teacher that I highly recommend!

I've taken 6 courses with Prof. Hrusa and have had the privilege to TA for him once.  I find him to be one of the most dedicated, fair, and clear teachers that I've seen in undergraduate and graduate school.
Prof Hrusa is a great math teacher. Best math prof I had at CMU. Very easy to understand, engaging, and interesting. I loved his class on engineering math, and would wholeheartedly recommend him!
Best math Prof by far I had at CMU
No Comments
Best prof I ever had, excellent teaching ability. Didn't think Calc in 3D would be so straightforward when taught correctly.
wonderful, wonderful, wonderful
Not only is he a great lecturer, but he will also go out of his way to help his students like none other! Stop me if you've hear this one before: this is the best math teacher I've ever had!
Really, excellently clear in lectures.
Explains things very well and is always available for extra help.
Hrusa is the best math teacher I've ever had.  He is very intellegent, and knows how to make calculus enjoyable with his subtle humor.  You'd be a fool to take calc in 3d from any other teacher.
Hrusa is the best math teacher ever. If you can, take a class with him; the class may suck but he makes it good.
No Comments
good guy

The TA I had was the hardest grader I've ever come across, particularly for participation. One time I participated 3 times in an hour long recitation and got a 91% that class for participation, which is ridiculous. Be ready to participate in recitation. Professor Law, however, is a great lecturer and teaches fun topics.

Professor Law is a super engaging lecturer and his lectures contain a ton of super interesting information. Depending on your TA, in my experience, the feedback wasn't that insightful. He won't check the readings as there aren't any reading checks but your big paper grades may suffer. The class is very doable and it isn't difficult.
Engaging, enthusiastic lectures. Best history professor I ever had.

Love Ricky Law, his lectures are funny and genuinely interesting. It is clear he is very passionate about what he teaches and he tries his best to make the content fun. I would take this class again to listen to his lectures. Great stuff.
So much reading. Insane amounts of reading. You'll want to off yourself from all the reading
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Great professor, lectures are required, lots of reading, but overall if you do the reading on time you should get an A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Took during the remote pandemic era so might be different for you, but Ricky was a very no-nonsense lecturer that kept on track of the material and was engaging to listen to. Much of the class experience however is up to the TA that you choose with some being lenient and understanding and some not. Participate in recitation & write good essays  A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Best history teacher I've had, really engaging lectures

He's super nice and really cares about the material. He's always helpful and makes class interesting, even though it's a subject I don't love. Recitation attendance is mandatory and lecture attendance is optional, but if you skip lectures you won't know what's going on. The assignments aren't too bad and my TA graded fairly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Dr. Law is an amazing professor. Extremely sweet and kind, but the best thing about him is his actual passion for what he teaches. His genuine love for history comes across in all his lectures, which makes even somewhat boring topics interesting.
Ricky is such a good professor he truly cares about the CMU community. Lectures were actually very interesting. They made sense through his essays. Only class I've taken at CMU that I've enjoyed.

I recommend taking Law's genocide and weapons of mass destruction course as it's very interesting and engaging. The only issue I have is that, given that classes are currently online, he only makes recordings available for 36 hours, so if you don't live in a time zone where you can attend synchronously WATCH THE RECORDINGS ASAP!!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He is, by far, the best professor I've had so far. He seems to know everything about everything he is teaching. Truly an awesome professor.
Professor Law is simply incredible. The lectures are extremely helpful, insightful, and entertaining.

Decent class, certainly very good lectures. Recitation is kind of miserable though and participation grades can be pretty annoying. If you hate writing try not to take this class even though it's fairly easy. Also if you had any history classes in high school, take a different class because you won't learn anything new from this one.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Amazing lectures--So many papers

comment: He gives great lectures. The class is very notes-heavy though, so be ready to write a lot if you don't want to miss anything.

He is really, really good. Gives inspiring perspectives to look at historical incidents. Very caring towards students. Gave a genuine speech on the meaning of the lecture at the end of the semester, and it was very touching. Lots of students came down to the front of the lecture hall to thank him at the last semester lecture. Strongly recommended.

His lectures are funny and interesting, but are useless. Your grade is heavily dependent on your TA. Assigns a decent/large amount of reading per week and papers are about once a month. Papers are weighted more towards the end of the semesters, which can be good/bad. Overall a good professor and really makes you think about history.

Dr Law delivers the best history lectures! You gotta experience them for yourself. Before attending this class, I was dreading about history and how history classes were usually conducted. These preconceived notions of mine were completely shattered and Dr Law demonstrated what all history lessons should have been.
Very interactive, fun, passionate instructor. The TA grades all papers and quizes. It won't be a hard A if you read the materials and take notes in class. Strongly recommend.

He loves history and it shows, very enthusiastic. You can't take notes on a device in his class. You're not required to attend lectures, you can miss a few and still pass with an A. I took the Film Class b/c genocide isn't my cup of tea. I recommend it if you like films, history, or Tom Cruise (you'll understand if you take it).
He is very general in teaching the intro global history class. Your grades depend on the TAs, who will grade all your papers.
Good class to take.

Really great lecturer. Makes history very engaging, and fun. There's a lot of reading he assigns, but you don't necessarily need to do all of it to get a good grade. Getting a good TA is important because they grade the essays.
Super engaging lecturer, made well-know history fun and interesting
NOT BAD RICKY
Tricky Ricky Wai-Kei Law makes this class ridiculous. He names it death and destruction but by the time I was half way through his class I was wishing for death and destruction on myself.
Super engaging lecturer, makes history really interesting :)

The worst professor i ever had. I never understood a word he said in class, and i used to sit in the front and take notes. I breezed through Econ so i have no idea why his class was so difficult. His exams were 20 pages long, i only did like 10 out of them in the final because i just gave up on life in that exam... his questions are weird and vague
Avoid at all costs.
AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
He is the Best !
wonderful teacher!!
Very hearty down to earth personality.  Has a good sense of humor.  Makes class interesting.
He can't teach!
i was scared of him for no particualr reason. His class was ridiculously hard but later he let us havean open book exam.Didn't make sense all the time.

He's fantastic, as a teacher and a guide. I graduated in 06 and continue to be inspired by him. Not only did I take 3 of his classes (Macro was not taught too well since he was sick at the time), but also TA'd for him twice. He's one of the reasons why I enjoyed academics at university.
excellent examples from life
econometrics and quan econ with him are horrible. he should be fired.
he rocks
This class was a walk in the park.
No Comments
Can Barely Breathe. Concerned about his health.

Difficult to understand, exams every 3 weeks, syllabus never matches what's really going on.  His head TAs do a better job than he does, and he really has no idea what's going on in his own course.  I love Ashish!

He grades pretty ok, half his class got an A. however, if you want the A, take lecture taught by his head TA Ashish he's much better teacher, on point, knows the exams. Even the recitations I learn more than in lecture.... other TAs are better.....
worst professor ever! He can't teach.
Don't like him

Take whichever lecture is being taught by the TA - they'll know the material better and make class way more interesting. Sileo convolutes the point, and since everything else in the course is run by TAs he doesn't always teach the right stuff for HW/exams
ashish is a better teacher

Horrible professor. Never there, the head TA teaches the class better than he does, and has mistakes on his ridiculously easy quizzes. If I could sum up this teacher in two words it would be an incompetent centaur.
spends the first 15-20 minutes of each lectures with complete BS - nothing to do with econ whatsoever. TAs contradict themselves and don't agree with the prof's answers
i swear with all the accidents he's having, he's gonna die before i graduate
Why is it that he is always sick and that Head TA teachesthe class way better than he does???

This is a bog standard meche and course. Very lecture heavy, and exams are most of your grade. But of the profs that use this format, Steif is the best. Lectures are as interesting as they can be, and you have years of past exams to study. Also, HW is effort based and gives answers, so you know you're on the right track, which I find very helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Neither stress nor statics are easy but Steif gives you more practice tests and resources to learn from than any other professor I've had. I liked his teaching style, though I've heard other people that really disliked him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: He's a super nice guy and the class is reasonable. He gives you all of the old exams which are extremely helpful. If you put in an average amount of work, you can pretty easily get and A or B.

He's not a forgiving or nice professor. His exams are rough and he will sometimes throw questions you have not seen before at you. He would prefer to go home and fail his students on something than wait 2 mins for them to arrive because they had a prior conflict.  His in class lectures are very average, he mostly read from his power points.

Class relies heavily on lectures and homework. the material is not always brilliantly presented in his lectures, but he provides years worth of practice materials, which are enormously helpful, even if lecture isn't always. Homework gives an excellent opportunity to familiarize yourself with the material.
Good Professor

Lectures were very useful and informative. The homework does a good job of preparing you for the tests. Tests had a tricky question here and there, but if you understand the material, you should have no problem getting an A.

If you mess up on one of the tests,  you're done. Grade are entirely dependent on tests(85) with homeworks sprinkled in there. Homework is effort based so not too bad. DO AS MANY PRACTICE TESTS AS YOU CAN and understand the underlying concepts which aren't too bad.

Lectures are boring and useless. Professor makes the subject extremely boring. 85% of grade based on 4 exams that are extremely hard and the professor is very unforgiving when it comes to grades. Hardly any resources for help. No quizzes or final exam, HWs count for 15% only. Basically: a poorly structured course with a bad professor.
Powerpoint Lectures posted afterwards
Very poor lectures. Unclear and otherwise not helpful whatsoever. Tests are extremely difficult and he refuses to adjust grades at all.

He's a good teacher when you go and approach him. His lectures are useless and his exams are hard. Do all the practice exams you can but expect it to still be different. They'll help but its no one exam is the same.
Really nice guy, in class, but really hard tests and homeworks. Work with others on the homework and make sure you do A BUNCH of practice tests. Lectures are pretty useless.
awsum.
Really good teacher...very very interactive...if you actually go talk to him in person, he makes concepts crystal clear! Loved his class...which I had attended more regularly
lectures are no use, exams are pretty hard
No Comments
I found Steif to be genuinely enthusiastic about his courses.  He was also approachable...Overall a good guy and good classes.
Good guy and professor, rather difficult class, I didn't particularly get much out of lectures (mostly books).
No Comments
lots of work, but his classes are enjoyable.  he's easy to listen to, and very friendly.
No Comments
He teaches Stress Analysis and Mechanics and Materials to Sophomores.  You learn to bendover...  This guy did engineering at Harvard and he thinks he is hard core.
He's a good professor, but he grades insanely hard. If you're a MechE you have to take him. Your entire grade are 4 exams, where homework is just minor extra credit.
Evil grading policy sends good students to early death and failure :(
Great class.  Set me up to understand a lot of my later courses.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: Tom Cortina masters the art of teaching the first class in such a tricky field as computer programming. Was really a pleasure to be in his class.
Cortina is such a great professor. He clearly cares about his students and is pretty well respected by most students. I would 100% take another one of his classes.
Tough class, but very well structured. The class can be boring at times, but Cortina is pretty good lecturer (if you can wake up for it).
Great lectures, difficult homework and tests
Gives very clear explanation, very funny guy - and after his class I understood that CS in my way to follow
Lectures are well-structured and well-paced. Really knows his stuff. Very clear during lecture. Funny guy, has great presence.
Very clear professor overall. Friendly in person, and exams are fair.
Friendly and knows his code.

Cortina is the man. Easily one of the best professors at CMU. Actually teaches concepts and applications, and does so very well. The class he teaches is very easy if you have already coded in your life, but if you are new to computer science, then Cortina is the guy for you. He will make you learn, and you will enjoy it.
awesome teacher, really cares, entertaining.  Great ability to explain complicated computer ideas to students like myself whom had no previous experience with programming
Great teacher really cares about students and a very entertaining lecturer

He is very funny and provides clear explanations of the concepts. The homeworks are very fun to do, but there is a lot with a written and programming hw every week. The exams are actually a bit difficult since there is so much you have to memorize about the history of computing
Awesome!!!
Hilarious and engaging. Often causes some confusion with his explanations, but a little thought and you get it right away. Takes an understandable pleasure in giving occasionally-hard work.

He's really a great guy. He handles the class like children far too often for him to hold my interest, but his class is very easy and you do learn some interesting things. He gives a quiz every week, but they are a joke so as long as you go you'll get an A. He makes it very easy to get good grades on everything. And he is always open to talk.
A great guy and a great lecturer. Principles of Computation is a unique take on the subject of Computer Science and is definitely worth taking.
I had him as a professor at Stony Brook Univ.  He was the best Lecturer I ever had, was so sad when he left.
No Comments
Very good teacher, although he does assign too much homework. Just go to class and an A is almost guaranteed, and you will learn a lot as well.

This teacher really teaches well. If you go lecture every time and you concentrate you will get A for sure. Test is not that hard. But too many written homework & programming homework (each week you get one written and one programming homework)
He is a good teacher, and explains things well.
go to him for help if you need it
Professor Cortina is a pretty good guy.  If you have to take 15-100, which a lot of people do, I'd recommend him.

I love him. Inspirational lectures that encourage everyone to participate, very kind and useful advice for your papers. Is willing to extend deadlines if you are truly stressed. Would love to take any history course with him again.

A gifted speaker, but if you disagree with any of his views you will have a tough time and be made a mild example of in his quips. Generally pretty smug about opening up CMU hermits to very surface level pop-culture history. If you know anything about the subjects he teaches, don't take the class--you'll only get a headache out of it.

Great lecturer. Requires no knowledge of rock and roll or american history prior to class. A lot of reading materials but worthy of reading. Sandage's really nice and interesting to talk to during office hours. Not an easy A but wouldn't be too hard if you write the essay carefully.
Great prof.

Great Professor and an awesome class. Scott cares about his students, knows his history, and keeps you entertained. The class really makes you think and is quite a bit a work, but it's definitely worth it. Although fairly harder than most other Freshman Seminars, this class is unquestionably a higher quality class, and you'll be glad you took it.

Scott is awesome. He's a smart guy and will make time for students he knows work hard. Make sure you actually do the readings, and you will do well on essays and exams. Go to office hours...the guy is very approachable one on one.

If anything, I now understand why Dylan and Hendrix get the love they do; more importantly, I've realized that there's more to American music than just the past fifty years.  Overall, an amazing journey into the culture and politics of American music.  Be warned:  Sandage's teaching has a bit of a political agenda; otherwise, great class.

FANTASTIC CLASS. The information he has sought out and compiled is absolutely mind-blowing--no one could have known there was this much rich history and cultural context to rock and roll. A bit corny at times, but it all adds up to the best class you will take. Such a nice, fun guy, yet with deepset morals.

Amazing lecturer. Exams are not based lectures but on reading, which is either very interesting or very boring. Reading questions are exam questions - take them seriously. Grading is picky and strict. Lectures are worth it.

Amazing lecturer.  Very charasmatic and gets the class very involved in discussions.  Is always very interested in student input and does his best to make sure that you take away from the course.  Try to take a course with him if at all possible.
Awesome class! Has a definite political slant/agenda to it, but still very interesting. He shows a lot of enthusiasm for what he teaches.  One of the most enjoyable classes at CMU.

Developement of American Culture was great, I really enjoyed the topic and his lectures.  I haven't heard the best things about Roots of Rock and Roll, but I guess that would be because people have such dissenting opinions about what good music really is.
truly inspirational, excellent professor, probably the best at cmu
Scott was the best history professor I've ever had.  His classes are very compelling and always interesting.

Charismatic teaching style that keeps you awake & interested.  Skillful lecturer, knows how to tell a good story.  Tends to bring his own political agenda into the classroom a little too often; definite bias to his subject matter.
Extremely poor professor and class.
Just a plain awful class and teacher.

Man, what a d-bag, this guy seems to be most clearly concerned with boosting his ego.  Seems to think he is hot ****, and seems to think he knows a lot about music, which would be fine, but he really doesnt. Not a hard class, but a big waste of time.
Pretends that he's subtle as he tells story after story of how there was never any freedom.  Glad to have been assigned Microserfs, though.
Brilliant lecturer. Very generous with his time. One of the best professors I've ever taken. Highly recommended. And he ain't bad looking either!
Development of American culture could be subtitled as  Why White Men are Evil , however it is a valuable course. This prof is passionate, albiet stern.
fantastic teaching style, and sometimes even brings his dog to class

no concern for individual student needs, course taught a highly biased view of history catering to students of non-history backgrounds who are easily influenced into his largely false demogogical beliefs
No Comments
Final is just a joke. He will try his best lower your grade.
Worst professor

I really want to like Prof. Nace because he is a great lecturer: I just think his policy on exams is very unfair. Every 240 exam for me has gone bad. Too long for the 1.33 hour block, too abstract, and you get only one practice exam ~2-3 days before so I feel pressured to cram instead of gradually adjust to the insane time crunch those exams are...
Worst professor ever.

Nace has decent lectures and I learned a lot during the course, though the class can be frustrating at many times (unforgiving course policies, awful points weighting on the homeworks, awful writeups to homeworks and labs, as well as awfully harsh/punishing grading).

Explains topics well during lecture and approachable. However, some of the labs/hw are unnecessarily tedious and time consuming. Also, they are harsh graders. One time I got all the answers to a HW correct and lost 10+ points because of "style". Beware of Labs and make sure you and your partner are actually collaborating.

I'd like to contrast people's ratings here. Nace is tough, but his exams are a good way of knowing if you actually understood what was happening. It is a great university way of teaching and he is always available if you are struggling and though his class is hard it is useful in the long term.

Not enough space to write everything; I will say that his exams are imo not great. I'm not particularly speaking about difficulty - finals had more than enough time - but some questions seemed off topic or unnecessarily specific to not-so-important parts of the course. Also midterm difficulty was more suited for a 2-3 hour exam than a 1hr20min one.

RUNNNNN from this class. He made me hate hardware engineering. He loves what he is teaching, but the lectures are mediocre at best. Lectures don't help you do well on the hw or exams. The lectures are pretty useless TA's help you learn so much. All he cares about is giving u a hard time on the exams. You can view the whole class as a trial by fire.
He is Riddler from Batman.
Not a clear course

Very tough professor and grader who genuinely loves what he teaches. You really earn every point you get in his class. While at times the amount of homework and length of labs may feel unnecessary, if you really pay attention and stick with it, you will finish his class with an incredible fundamental understanding of hardware engineering.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Really cares about his students, and is very clear when teaching. He makes tough quizzes, but you learn a lot.
This class is a mess. Seriously, homework and quizzes are a joke. NMSL
Really good at explaining stuff and very patient with students, especially at office hours.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Amazing lecturer. Lecture slides are posted online but worth coming to lecture to have them explained. Great guy
Professor Nace is a really good lecturer who is very knowledgable. While his class was a lot of work, it was very well organized and I learned a lot.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Absolutely ridiculous, he is unreasonable in assignments, exams, and projects. He  is not very clear on his requirements and grades harshly despite being unclear. This course relied heavily on trivia.  A complete waste of time. There are better courses to take in the same topic especially in the CS department. This is true of most ECE classes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is RUDE and not clear what he wants!!!

Don't be fooled by the clarity of the lectures, this professor is the definition of inconsistency. The homework assignments are REALLY long, the questions that he asks in the homework and during the examinations are ambiguous. He cares more about giving you a hard time, than helping  you understand the meaning of the material. I hated his class.

Lectures are clear.  I somehow get the feeling though that this person is interested more in his research than teaching. This makes sense given that cmu is a research university. This class was taught by TAs way more than it should have been. He did not communicate very well over email when I have needed help.  He seems nice/has a lot of potential.
Extremely Ambiguous.
Friendly professor. Teaches well.
Extremely heavy handed

Sherwood is a great lecturer, but she makes the Lab 1 environment incredibly stressful. She's very blunt and sometimes just mean, and due to Lab 1's already very heavy workload, her attitude sometimes makes the class even harder. That said, she's very smart and I've learned so much from her. It's a crazy grind of a class, but it's rewarding, too.
Do not like her, she singles random people out each class and comes at them to answer a question very 'passionately.'

BLATANT favorites. if you're not her favorite she will cut you off mid sentence and make you feel stupid for asking questions. she prides herself as “honest” and “real” but she's actually just mean and unwilling to do any degree of self reflection.

lectures for such a long time that we have no time to do our labs yet blames us for being behind schedule. instructions for assignments often contradict themselves. canvas page is disorganized. will shout out letter grades at students' answers to her questions (usually “C!” when she doesn't like your answer) entirely unwilling to listen to feedback

Super knowledgable professor, cares about her students. Don't get put off by her blunt attitude, she is a great person and professor and she really does care. She is blunt to help you and if you show up to class and participate you will learn a lot!!

She can come off as blunt but if you actually take the time to get to know her and speak to her she is very kind and incredibly intelligent. Her lectures are very engaging and she clearly has passion for chemistry and for her students. She is a tough professor and many people seem to not like this but it is all the marks of a good professor.

Ms. Sherwood is NOT respectful towards her student's time. Students are busy individuals too; I don't want to spend hours searching upon her disorganized canvas class set-up because she couldn't bother to make a reasonable interface for the students. In addition, she grades WAY too harshly, always giving the lowest end of the rubric when possible.

Professor Sherwood is by far, indubitably, the worst professor I have ever had. She is the most unreliable person I have ever met. She never answers her emails. She laughs at you for not knowing what to do, and she is completely unprofessional. DO NOT take a class with her ever!
She is not the most approachable and is not always receptive to feedback. However, she seems passionate about the material and is a relatively engaging lecturer, though intimidating at times.

she basically makes you feel dumb for asking questions in class and makes the learning environment very stressful if you do not understand the material. she often goes around and patrols the class looking for students who aren't paying 100% attention and will comment or call them out. this class is difficult enough without her belittling us

horrid organization made this class hell. TAs would give bad advice and then we'd be asked why we listened to them. Last minute assignments / feedback posted but yet very quick turnaround expected from us. unclear guidelines and incredibly inconsistent grading on major assignments. it completely depended which ta was assigned to grade you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Terrible communication, unnecessary aggressiveness, and unprofessional. I think she is probably very knowledgeable, but the way she taught/led this course was not enjoyable at all. Most of the time the students were just complaining about professors and the course.

I understand that shes a professor and shes worked hard for it, but every one of her students is working hard too. She belittles her students in a hostile manner, often yelling when unnecessary, honestly makes asking questions terrifying, were all learning at different paces. Ive never had a professor that makes me this uncomfortable.

Nice as a person but not great as a professor. She makes it obvious that she thinks you're dumb and will use any chance she has to tell you so. If she likes you then she's a lot more helpful. Very unorganized notes and lesson plans
terrible at explaining things, and overly demanding

You can tell she knows a lot about her subject, but not much about people. She makes asking questions terrifying, making fun of students for asking questions she thinks are "dumb questions". I have never had a bad professor, but this one clearly has issues. Her classroom environment is harsh, and she is just straight up mean. Avoid if possible.

She is a very good lecturer and explains topics in a way that makes them easy to understand. However, she was not very understanding with virtual and time difference troubles even when factors were out of my control. Many students were scared of asking questions due to her sometimes overly aggressive and rude responses.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Even though the class very intensive and requires a lot of time and attention, Sherwood is intelligent and an excellent teacher. She is also very considerate when we have midterms in other classes. A lot of people complain about her direct, brutal attitude. Tbh I prefer that as she ended up providing insightful, specific feedback on everything.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: She is clearly knowledgeable with what she teaches and an organized and clear lecturer. However, she is known to have a bad attitude with students. She is difficult to approach and often condescending if you try to ask her questions after class. Overall, she's a competent teacher but creates a hostile learning environment.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Oftentimes If you ask her a question that she thinks is dumb, she will mock you for it instead of just telling you the answer.

Belittles students for small mistakes. Rude and honestly just downright mean. Has told her classes that she knows people don't like her and justifies herself by saying that she's a powerful woman and that she won't yield to anyone.. but you can be a strong woman and still be gracious. Genuinely shocked at how high of a score she has here.
She cares a lot about her students and the material she is teaching. Definitely worthy of a lot of respect

Absolutely amazing teacher! She truly, honestly cares about her students, and she does everything in her power to make sure all of her students pass. She has actually answered emails at 2 am before and showed up to teach at 8:30 am the following day. One of the MOST demanding professors here at CMU, though. Definitely go to class if you want an A!

She is amazing! She may come off as mean, but it's mainly because she wants you to succeed. Don't take it so hard, she only cares and doesn't want to baby her. She is more than qualified for this course, but does it for her love to see students succeed. Listen to her advice and you will do well.
He was an amazing person, and an amazing professor :( ....

Amazing oustanding professor. He stayed with CMU's Qatar campus for nearly 2 years and became director of Academic Resource Center. 21-256, 21-257 and 99-252 Academic Counseling. Very helpful, friendly, love his jokes (derivative and tangents:) ), amazing professor and mentor. Amazing courses. Will be missed dearly by the CMUQ community.
RIP professor Winter. Truly one of the best professors and friends I have ever had. You will be missed and all of your students love you and will always remember you.
