RIP Prof. Dale ! He was a wonderful professor and taught me two Math courses which I can never forget in my life :( Students can simply attend classes just to enjoy his witty comments and comparisons in the process of learning. You will be missed badly in the CMU Qatar Campus.

The funniest professor I have ever encountered. It is not easy to get an A in his class, however if you take his class seriously you can earn it. Don't hesitate to go to his office and ask him any questions you have, he is very helpful. Try to enjoy his class as much as possible and don't think of it just as required course that you want to get don
The best professor I have ever been taught by. Although he does focus on the basics (which many people don't know!), yet he explains the ideas in a way that makes them hard to forget.

Dale Winter is a hilarious character. Hes a big guy with a huge beard and the remains of an Australian accent, and the things that came out of his mouth never failed to make me laugh and keep me entertained. He is very thorough and extremely helpful. His makeup exams are impossible so do well the first time around. Great guy!

If you take Concepts with Dale, know these: 1.) You will have to work VERY HARD to get an A. It took me nights of hard work to get an A in his class. 2.) If you wanna learn, take his class, if you want A, look elsewhere. 3.) His class is more fun than what you have heard. 4.) 21-127 with him will be different experience from 21-259/122 with him.

Too much focus on basic concepts and applications in lecture and not enough focus on the more analytical parts of calculus.  Tests are as hard as people say they are.  Problem by problem they take minimal creativity, but imagine doing 100 minutes of problems in 50 minutes time and you get the gist.

Professor Winter has been the most fun professor i have had, his classes are geared towards grasping your attention and making sure you are involved in learning math concepts. However his tests are the opposite of his classes. His exams have been the most unrewarding experience i have ever recieved for my hard work.
An awesome teacher. Tests are somewhat hard, but he gives you every chance to succeed.

This guy has to be the coolest dude in the world. Some of his jokes are legendary lol. Overall his class is pretty demanding. Try not to skip too many of his lectures. Recitations seemed a bit useless to me but lectures helped a LOT. Awesome teaching style though and he has beautiful writing/drawing skills.
his lectures are fun and very learning but tests are awefully hard
Dale is the man! Consider yourself lucky if you ever get him because there is hardly a teaching talent rival to his on this side of the milky way!
Great teaching style, but bullheaded. I will do my best to avoid his classes.
Lectures are super clear. Neatest handwriting I have ever seen in a teacher/professor. Second try on exams, no penalty. Super sweet.
best calculus teacher ever!!

He is a great professor, but his tests are very hard. You have to do extra work rather than just doing the homework and attending lecture to get an A or a B. However, he is the best calculus teacher i have ever had.
A really great professor!

122 is extremely difficult, especially @8:30 am, and the class is pretty boring too IMO.  Grading can be pretty harsh.  Don't expect an A or even a B unless you put in a very serious effort.  Don't be fooled by the exam retakes, they are often harder/different than the original exams.  Major props for putting all notes on the website though :)
Great prof!
By far the best math teacher I've ever had. Calculus can be confusing but I have never once been confused by his explanations. Plus, he's absolutely hysterical.
Hilarious

he's really bad at explaining topics and will leave you really confused. the lectures don't really make sense and it's a struggle to do any recitation or homeworks because literally nothing makes sense. frustrating class, not worth your time

If you're not interested in physics, Prof Garoff will be hard to learn from. He often jumps straight into topics in lecture, so reading the textbook ahead of time is crucial. He does not offer zoom classes, so if you miss a class you miss a lot. Exams are heavily based on lecture and is more conceptual, while homework is heavily based off the book.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Makes getting to class at 8am worth your time. Really good guy who teaches the material well, but you will have to work for it. He gives you every opportunity to succeed, including being very accessible outside of class should you need him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: As a person, he is very knowledgeable and extremely caring and sweet. His lectures are interesting in concept but were too early in the morning to attend. Also office hours were limited to the TAs . ATTEND COURSE CENTER!!! IT WILL SAVE YOUR GRADE

Professor Garoff is not great at explaining things. This will have little impact on your grades early in the semester, but will completely screw up your final. Half the test was on something neither Garoff nor the book explained . Only one person left early.  He was forced to give extra time since no one understood the material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Really bad at teaching what you need to learn, doesn't really explain anything just shows power points. If you also get a bad TA you're done for.

If you have the opportunity to take this class in the spring, do yourself the largest favor and do so. This professor and his class are horrible. He does not post grades online, he does not hold office hours, his class is taught using quizzes and poorly explained power points, and lectures are rushed and no examples of problems are ever given.
The class was not easy, but Dr. Garoff was very willing to explain things to try to help me understand what was going on.

Dr. Garoff may very well be a good physicist, but he is not a very good teacher. His explanations do not clear up misunderstandings, and often cause students to be even more confused. He often gives the impression that he doesn't really know what he's talking about but would rather make up an answer or obfuscate the issue than admit to not knowing.

Difficult class, requires a lot of effort. All classes are mandatory and constant test, quiz, hw, etc. Had a hw and reading due, online assignment, and quiz in class all on the same day. Not abnormal.

He is earnest in teaching, but earnesty is not equivalent to imparting actual physics knowledge. He has passion for physics, but his explanations are not very straightforward, and at times, confusing. I didn't have much of a physics foundation, so this class was hard. If you had a good physics teacher in high school, this class might be easier.

He means well, I think.....But he is probably much better suited doing research somewhere, not trying to teach freshman physics.  If you have credit, or can place out, DO IT.  He posts old exams online, but they don't reflect the actual exams.  His class is painfully boring, and unnecessarily difficult.  Maybe do something besides show powerpoints?

Hope that you have a good TA for Physics 1, since you will learn everything in recitation.  As for lectures, showing the solution to a problem on Powerpoint slides is not teaching physics.  Neither is vaguely explaining concepts without making the connection between the math and the physics.
MPL explanations were helpful.
This was a fairly difficult class, but it wasn't nearly as bad as Physics II with Swendsen.  I didn't mind it too much.
Tries very hard and is quite approachable, although the intensity with which he approaches the material  could be viewed as a negative quality if the student was not interested.
Reaallly hard class in general. He doesn't really explain well though. Good intentions, but hes sort of difficult to talk to. Kind of awkward in terms of communicating. Seems like a nice guy though.
Very difficult class. Garoff tries hard, but is not successful in explaining the material.
Teacher does not explain everything that well, however recitation is very useful.  Overall material  of the course is difficult, hence the teacher will get a bad rating in most cases.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Terrible class.  Not clear or understandable at all.  Pop quizzes constantly.  Not a good class.

Professor Rouse was a great teacher. He was very passionate about his course and you could really tell that he cared about what he was doing. He gave four pop quizzes and two long papers, but as long as you pay attention and start the papers early, you'll be good! He was my favorite professor thus far at Pitt. (By the way, he teaches at Pitt now)

He's an okay teacher. Lectures get boring. I probably slept in every single class after the first week. There's a midterm and final paper, both with vague & complicated instructions. I plan to get an A/B in the course, but it's waaay too much considering I learned little and it's an intro/gen ed. A lot of reading, too much writing. Overall boring.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: First of all, he teaches at Pitt now. He's smart and passionate, but his lectures become monotonous and repetitive. I was very interested in the beginning but found myself zoning out more and more towards the end of the semester. Class grade relies heavily on participation and papers & his paper prompts were somewhat vague

Not worth your time and does not count for any gen ed. Professor Rouse's lectures are very long and boring. He speaks very monotonously and tends to talk 5-10 minutes later than every lecture should end. Very hard to pay attention and very little discussion in this small class size. The majority of the class will be him going on and on.
This professor completely changed the way that I look at the world. If you actually give him a chance he will do the same for you.

The topics that Proff. covered were important for a complete view of how social structure and power works. He made it a point to be inclusive of histories that are too often ignored, and could also explain many trends in how certain cultures interact today.  All claims of bias that I've seen are in my opinion pure elitist ignorance.
Worst teacher I've ever had. Take the other lectures on history by other teachers.

Rouse is very far to the left. The class is called Globalization through History but it should be called Globalization and the Anti-capitalist movement. You spend most of your time studying emotional narratives about the plight of the working man being crushed under the boot of industrialism. I can't be motivated to regurgitate this material.

Its an eye opening class that I am really glad I took. Very different from the freshman lecture he teaches, as this class is a small discussion based class. Incorporates current events into the class as they are relevant.

Boring class. Prof said "it's ok to disagree with what I've said" when writing essays, but essays forced us to regurgitate his arguments or research our own opposition, or there was only one correct answer.

I really appreciated the subject of the course, having not been introduced to it before. Rouse's lectures are slightly wordy, but he knows what he's talking about. I do wish that he presented a less biased argument, but then, given the evidence, I can understand why he doesn't. I just think too many people write him off as a crackpot...

His lectures are like lucid dreams during which you realize words are coming out of Rouse's mouth but they somehow seem to disperse through the air before reaching your ears. They're like acid trips. The gestures he performs with his hands also help induce said dreamlike state. Capitalism Sucks 101. Hahahaha!

Grade depends on your TA, but most likely not difficult to get an A if you either go to lecture and take notes OR do the reading (trust me, both are not necessary). If you can pay attention and not slip into a coma, I suggest going to lecture; then you can use that to write papers (the TAs love to see you cite him as a source).

His political bias is pervasive even in the structure of the course; might as well be called "Capitalism is evil, as demonstrated by these instances in history". Possible to get an A just by listening in lecture without doing any readings (I did). Apparently TAs' grading was very subjective. Not very useful as far as a balanced viewpoint goes.

His lecture was completely irrelevant to your grade until the week before your papers are due. grade is entirely based on how your TA grades your papers and participation. His lectures are useless and droll.

Impassionaied about his subject, but it's still hard not to zone out in lecture. I agree that your grade is based entirely on your TA, and the TA's vary widely. I know one who basically summarized the lecture for his class; mine said nothing at all and we sat around listening to people shout at each other. Interesting... but not really helpful.
Not a fun class to be in. If he could give better essay questions, class could be a better. other than that, no complaints.
Very entertaining in lecture and a great guy to talk to and ask questions of. Unfortunately, lets his personal political bias leak into the course (and his TA selection).

Lectures were very boring. He could be a little more considerate of how he assigns essay questions since we would have to read ahead to actually have a decent amount of time to think about the questions.
Honestly, there's a reason the class is called communism 101. The new perspective on globalization was nice but papers are pretty much solely on books. Lectures are boring cuz they're redundant.

It's a fairly boring class, grade depends on TA and solely on the papers you write. There's a paper due every two weeks ranging from 2 pages to 6pages. Lecture is very boring (fell asleep everytime I went), but do go to recitations if you have a good TA and read the books!!! You'll learn hist from another perspective

Very boring, and you'll get no gain out of going to class nor recitation, although recitation attendance is mandatory and graded.  The entire class is graded based on essays written from his assigned readings, and if you do the readings, the class should be easy.

I took 15346 (not 213) and I thought it was really good. We covered so many comp arch concepts and I definitely learned a lot. I'm honestly shocked at the rating here since I really enjoyed his lectures. I still have the project from this class on my resume. I do think Professor Railing can be a little disorganized tho in terms of course logistics

His own words on piazza "I have contemplated adding a "your final grade cannot be more than X% different than your final exam", but there is no such rule in 15-213/-513." 

As a remainder, for summer 2024, final: 30%, lab: 50%, wa: 20%, in case he decides to make things more difficult for others.

Worst professor ever. He changes the schedule randomly to accommodate his vacations, provides poorly taught lectures, and lacks supervision of TAs. This results in materials created by TAs being filled with errors. The schedule was crazily unrealistic, with two labs due on the same day with no grace days, which is one day after the final.
Avoid at all means.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Railing is one of the nicest professors I've had. His lectures are very engaging and he puts a lot of effort to make difficult concepts simple to understand. I'm surprised by most of the ratings here and I believe that people are rating the difficulty of the class rather than how he is as a professor.
Don't take his class.
Literally the worst prof I've ever had. Not just bad lectures but also the rude attitude.

He's been grinding with HIS thoughts and ideas all the time while the course's assignments require something else. No help with the actual coursework or stuff, and I don't understand why he is the professor of this lesson.
It makes no sense for him to assign students do all the study without answering the questions. He is supposed to be the professor after all.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: extremely aloof in person as well as on piazza and gives off an aura of arrogance
Extremely impatient and rude to me. Could at least pretend to care about students but he didn't.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Worst professor I've ever seen. He is extremely smart but fails to deliver his knowledge to students. I'm an above-average student and still need to rewind his online teaching materials to find unstated assumptions. Worse than that, he likes using long and discontinuous sentences and is somehow rude to students.

Dude's whole personality is "weird flex but okay". Loves talking about how advanced he was at CS growing up, or the saxophone, or building legos. Knows a lot about CS but isn't the best at teaching. Really cold on piazza responses as well.
He is extremely rude, and disrespectful to students.

Professor Railing has helped me multiple times when I needed an extension due to a persistent medical issue. He has greatly helped me through the course and the course itself is super interesting if you want it to be. Pay attention in lecture and when doing the homework consult the slides. Overall great class so far and a professor who helps a lot.

I think Professor Railing is an extremely clear lecturer. I am taking 15-213 on Zoom and greatly appreciate his clarity and patience with delivering the material to people who've never seen it before.

Professor Railing is the meanest and most confusing professor/teacher I have ever had. He may be an expert on his subject, but he doesn't know how to deliver his knowledge to his students at all, making all his lectures trash. My and my classmates search for past 213 videos on youtube.
He shows little interest in students' learning and never answers questions. Think carefully before you take his 213.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He's the worst professor ever and doesn't care about students' learning and well-being at all. Super rude and mean to students too. Avoid him at all costs.

He is the worst professor I had. He's rude, doesn't care about the teaching crap he keeps talking about, and just wants you to get PONTS by suffering. Ask questions? No way he answers that. Don't fall for his soft voice, the guy is real trash. Like the kind, that doesn't even deserve to be near a school.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: A little rude at times.

Probably one of the people that have a lot of difference in what they say and what they do. Usually expects the students to be prepared when they take his course. If I knew everything, WTH would I take your course? Also, he will never help outside of class, because he expects you to know everything. If possible, avoid him.

The class itself isn't bad, but the professor makes it annoying. He also seems to hold little respect for the students he has, even blowing up on one over Piazza to accuse them of cheating, of all things. Kind of weird how much he promotes his Youtube channel. If you read the lecture notes on your own time, you'll learn the material.

Quizzes every week, wouldn't tell students what was on them although he said he would in the syllabus. Just overall not a very good lecturer, makes topics unclear and more confusing than they need to be. I'd recommend just sticking to the course textbook - it was how I taught myself the topics.

I appreciate Dr. K, he spent hours to make youtube videos for us to get supplementary instruction on topics introduced in lecture. However, I don't recommend lecture as I never got anything out of them. If you follow his study guide, you should be very well prepared for the exams! I got an A, but I studied his hour long videos religiously to get it
Neve taken again
Not a hard class, but the course is definitely annoying. He made it annoying.

He is a nice guy and knows clearly what he is teaching. The workload is below the average compared to other introductory-level math courses I've taken. The only thing I don't like is the mandatory recitations and quizzes. I'd rather have tests to be more weighted. Everything else is fine.
everyweek has quiz and enforce students to participate the lecture by unknown quiz

Funny guy. Not a tough class- never went to lecture but got an A (though I did take AP Calc in highschool). He grades fairly and consistently in my experience. Tests are exactly like the study guides and his youtube videos, so as long as you are comfortable with the study guides and practice problems you should be fine.

He does lots of example problems in class. Quiz questions are often more difficult than in class (the homework is a good gauge for difficulty). 
He also has videos covering the material; definitely watch them before tests.
Go to lectures.
It's a great class.
The learning resources provided by the professor are great. They help grasp difficult concepts beyond the classroom.

I took Dr. Katugampola's calculus course as a freshman and I'm very much satisfied with his teaching style. He expects his students to learn the subject and provides lots of opportunities for improvement. I'm not a strong man when it comes to math. However, getting a B at the end was a great achievement depending where I was before. Thanks, Dr. K.

Dr. K. was the best calculus teacher I ever had. While I knew some of the materials before I never learned it that well before. He is very passionate about his teaching and loves to explain if you want to. He has his own jokes. 16/64 = 1/4 is favorite. This is the kind of professor I would like to learn from as he knows what he is doing. Thank you.
This course is tough and get teady

Coming into this class with no calc background was rough. The quizzes were often very difficult -  sometimes the averages were 30-40%. He posts a lot of the practice questions/supplemental material on YouTube which is helpful but the videos are quite long and not the most efficient way to study. Lectures were useful.

There were a lot of tests and homework in this class. The tests were a lot more difficult than expected and the grading criteria were very strict for them. You could get the right answer on a test problem but get a 0 if you did not show enough work.

Dr. K is the best professor. I might switch my major to math thanks to Dr. K. I watch his YouTube videos daily, and everyone else should too. Make sure to subscribe and leave a like as well. While Dr. K's teaching methods may not align with conventional pedagogical approaches, his commitment to academic rigor is evident.

Worst professor Ive ever had. Used the threat of harder makeup exams and no makeup quizzes under any circumstances to force sick student to either take the exams sick, or have a failing grade. In class lectures are unhelpful, resumed to answer questions in class and instead told students two watch his YouTube videos,  overall awful teacher
He is the type of professor who doesnt understand that you are taking other classes and that calc is not the only thing you have to be worrying about.
He does not teach at all, and overcomplicates the most basic topics

He is not a good teacher, only reason I ended with an A is because I learnt it all in high school. He also makes us watch his youtube videos that are hard to understand. His quizzes are by far much harder than the material and on top of that some classes get the quiz answers while others do not.

Dr. K is probably the best professor I have had in my life. He really likes what he is doing and encourage others to do the same. Math was not my favorite subject, but after learning from him everything changes. I'm even considering switching majors and wanting to be a math major. I know it is tough, but I love to dive into it. Thanks, Professor K

I feel the last reviewers. His lectures are very dry, and he doesn't seem to be able to explain the material well. He uses a "textbook" that he wrote which is horrible. Mid-term and final exams are based on only one single chapter, so luck is a significant factor. I'd recommend 15-317 instead, which is its alternative for most purposes.

Trust me, avoid him at all costs. He will likely be the weirdest professor you ever have to deal with. His quote: "If you haven't looked at the assignment, you are doomed. (*chuckle*) yeah you are doomed." His exam: "Write up proof of a theorem which is three-page long." His exam feedback: "You don't know what you are talking about."

Hard to approach outside of class. His lectures are basically straight out of the textbook, which, by the way, he wrote and he forces you to buy (hw problems were assigned from book). Too many irrelevant tangents in class. Should've listened to the users below, avoid this teacher.

At first I thought he was a complete jerk, but after I talked with him I figured out he just doesn't know how to teach and is probably a little deficient in social skills. It really wouldn't be bad at all, if my grade weren't suffering for it.
schimmerling doest know how to teach and he has something stuck up his ass... he should stop teaching
Reading the book is more helpful

Yeah, so I dropped this course after others did.He is completely unintelligible and unclear when he teaches. He teaches in such a vague manner and says stuff like "you could try this..it's wrong, btw, but in a way its right.." and rambles, he's not organized. He likes guests at office hour, but I just can't understand him.
This guy is unintelligible.  I actually think I'm getting WORSE at calculus.  His tests are TERRIBLE.  Thank god for the TAs, or everyone would flunk.
apparently this is his first year teaching this class although he still blows.  im lucky i know calc and i just bombed the placement test because hes the worst prof ever.
I thank God each class for my laptop or I'd die.

I fall asleep every week in this class and end up learning more, in the recitation than during lecture. He starts every class with, "I am going to review what we did last time." You do the math, but that means you don't move forward, at all.

His class is a nightmare. Thankfully I already know all the calculus concepts we're going to cover: otherwise I would be screwed. It's not that the material itself is hard, but rather that he is completely unintelligible half the time during his lectures. He often makes mistakes during calculations, so more than once I've had to rewrite my notes...
What kind of calculus professor is so lazy that he doesn't use the chalkboard? Be serious, slides?! And I paid HOW MUCH for this?! No matter what he says he's not interested in teaching.
Do yourself a favor... Don't take Calculus in 3-D with him. Based on the FCEs, it seems like he's pretty good for Set Theorty, but who takes that?!

worst teacher ever. i had to teach myself everything, and even then i did horrible on his tests. his tests only cover like 2% of the material he expects us to know for the exam. also, he is really boring.

his test are so random, and no matter how hard you study you need luck to do well on his tests. he teaches by using transparencies, and his lectures are so boring. most of the class is asleep. he just rewrites the examples in the textbook for his lectures
This professor was the worst one I've had yet at Carnegie Mellon...I had to teach myself the material and the curriculum coverage was so much more than the exam coverage. Horrible professor.

The material isn't difficult; I knew it all and aced most of the exams.  At times he asks ridiculous questions, though, and is very unwilling to reward those who actually know the material.  Note: I knew the material b/c I read the book; he doesn't teach.
The most boring man ever to walk the earth.
No Comments
No Comments

His tests only focus on a randomly selected 5% of the material - it's so ridiculous.  Someone who knows virtually nothing on the chapter can walk out with an A while someone who has mastered most of the chapter gets a C.  You have to be lucky to do well.

Very good intro to calculus course. Should be super simple if you've had any calc background. Even if you haven't, prof Brandon is wonderful and begs the students to ask questions. She makes herself available if you need any help and is very thoughtful. If you get an A on all three exams you don't have to take the final, which is super nice.
Deb's class is amazing! I learned so much, and she is very understanding and helpful with all her students.  Take her if you can. Will not disappoint
Deb is the BEST professor i've had in college. She is ALWAYS willing to help and pushes you beyond what you think your ability is. She is also a fun and loving character!

I graduated a couple years ago, and it was thanks to professor brandon. I was a humanities major who HAD to take a calc class (as you can infer math is not my strongest subject) and she took the time to help me conquer calc. Many thanks to professor brandon for being so understanding and helpful.
Best professor I've ever had. Sometimes I would even go to her office hours just to talk, extremely cool person and really understanding of students.

One of my favorite professors. Goes to great lengths to make sure our enormous lecture does not have any questions about topics before moving on. She is always willing to answer questions a million ways until you understand. Brandon keeps Calculus light and occasionally fun--a great accomplishment. Go to lecture/recitation, ask questions, get an A.
I had her for Diff EQ in 2000 and at that time she didnt seem very interested in the class or the students very much at all.

Best calc teacher I ever had.  Encyclopedic coverage of topics, but always willing to walk you through stuff.  Expects you to learn, and works to support that.  It's an easy class if you work hard, and a hard class if you treat it like it's easy.
She was a pretty good teacher.  A LOT of quizzes, too many in fact... exams were decent... very understandable and good at explaining things.

One of the best calc professors I've had. Excellent at lecturing, and would always be able to clear up any confusion you had on concepts. Had very realistic expectations of students, and was fun and energetic in class. Exams were fairly easy.
Very very hard, and goes blazingly fast during lecture...like 20 boards within an hour!
challenging class, but she is VERY good.
I got striaght 76%'s by no fault of hers. But I've heard that Matrix can be taught MUCH better.  REALLY friendly person!
she's the reason I just graduated with a math degree.  wonderful person.

Excellent professor. The course can be very hard, but the way she teaches it makes it much easier. Her notes are VERY helpful. This is definitely one of those few courses where you don't want to skip the lectures. Review sessions for exams are HELPFUL!
This teacher is mean, and nasty.  I didn't like her, and she sucked.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

I took the Grand Challenge Seminar with Professor Cox-Boyd she is a great professor. I learned a lot from her and she is so nice and funny. Her lectures were very engaging and interesting. The class itself is easy, write your essays, show up to class, do the group project, you will get an A. Will miss her so much and would love to have her again.

Kind of a bird course. Exam might contain weird stuff not really related to the course, e.g. the content of a movie, so be prepared. Otherwise quite an easy course, especially if you learnt AP psych before.
Class was fun!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: NO NEED TO GO TO CLASS. Read the textbook if you're an overachiever. OR just go to the review session day before an exam, and fill out the study guide (then study that). grading policies are DESIGNED to give you an A, so if you're not getting an A in this??? what are you doing??? worth going to class for quality bantz tho boyd is legit the best
If you know everything on the study guide you are guaranteed a high A on the test. The study guides with answers are available online and she reuses the study guides.
She was really into teaching the topic. I took her course more than ten years ago and I remember her enthusiasm, pretty fair
She's awesome! She's super funny and makes the class super interesting. Her Social Psychology class was by far my favorite class I've taken so far.

She is a great professor. She is energetic and uses many real life examples to help you understand the material. She makes the class very interesting. The tests are pretty fair but your grade heavily depends on the TAs.

Very interesting class. Few Papers and a little bit of homework. Easy to do well. Do study guide for test and you will do fine. Review sessions before test with TAs are great and make test easy/ Checks attendance by having people sign in (so if your running late a friend can do it for you). Shes not to helpful in office hours
Excellent professor. Class is really interesting with lots of personal examples. Easier if you have some background in psych. checks attendance, but only used if you're on the boarder of grades.
Best professor ever!
Very entertaining stories that she tells during lectures which relate to the topic at hand. Still remember the story of how she told us how she met her husband.
Very good lecturer, but goes off on tangents very often. Exams often do not reflect the class, and she has very poor organizations skills.

Lectures are interesting, but not necessarily clear in their relationship to the assigned material. Exams are straight forward, but require study of exam review sheets -- there may be material tested that is NOT in the textbook. TAs and organization needs work. Completely possible A if you do the work assigned and reach out for help.
teaching is good. Organization and TAs are poor.

TAs grade completely arbitrarily, no consistency in grading system. Professor chooses tricky questions for tests just to make them harder--can have complete understanding of material and still not get an A. Only talks about her personal experiences during lectures, making them pointless.
No Comments
No Comments
not a difficult prof, but you do learn something and she is helpful
don't bother going to class...it's straight from the books and her lecture outlines (verbatim) are online
No Comments

Prof. Ada is is awesome in providing inspiring lectures. He cares about individual students a lot (respond the majority of piazza/pandanote post, nice instructor OH). 

Many exam questions are slight modification from textbook practice and homework (so do go over all of them!). 

Overall one of the best CS profs I've had in my life.
THE best prof Ive had at CMU so far
Awesome
Best professor ever T T

There are definitely plenty of hype men for Professor Ada. He is very charismatic and caring especially in a school where most professors are dry as paper and only care about research. People are confusing his likability with his actual teaching skill. It was neither memorable nor beyond what other professors at CMU can provide.
Ada is fantastic. 15-251 is a difficult course without a doubt, but he motivates the learning extremely well.

Prof Ada is a real gem. I respect the effort he put into making 15-251 a great remote learning experience (buying recording equipment, implementing TA-student one-on-one mentorships, getting rid of the final, etc...). His lectures are also extremely well thought out.

Ada is really good professor and person. He's really invested in 251 and works his best to make it the best experience for the students. Even with the pandemic, he modified the class so that the students would benefit the most and more stress wasn't placed on them (changed the grading scheme, removed the final etc.). He's a real gem.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Anil was the best professor I have ever seen. He gave amazing, inspirational lectures. The course was extremely hard, as you need to understand the materials deeply to get good grades on the exams, but Anil was the major reason that I enjoyed this course so much. I would recommend this course to all CMU students interested in CS and math.
Great professor. His 251 is really worth taking

Best professor in my life ever, period. I would honestly say that Ada was born to teach 251. Absolutely amazing lecture, he knows what he's doing, genuinely cares about teaching and students learning. I would take 251 over and over again just because of him. I would go as far to say that his lectures are life-changing.
Simply amazing.
He's a really great lecturer.
Very good prof

Ada is the best professor ever. Amazing teacher, really knows his stuff and really knows how to teach. Any negative things you may have heard about the course have nothing to do with him (he only makes it better). It's hard - but super fun and rewarding. If you read the notes and prepare well you'll get an A.

Hes a hard-working professor! He's easily one of the best professors I've had. He transformed a really hard class where everyone gets a C and they just curve it into a hard class that you learn in and you work hard for that B. My personal opinion but I think hes really charming (heart eyes)
I really liked him. Very clear, good lecturer. His classes require some work, but are worth it.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: The course is mainly run by the CA's, but he's not a terrible teacher.  Very boring lectures, though.  If possible, take Kosbie, but Ada isn't the worst by any means.  Prepare to do tons of homework in the course (not just Ada's class), and your weekends are gone, but it's not that hard.  Time-intensive.  Put in the work, and you'll be fine.
Great teacher and an even cooler guy. Taught the class very well and made the effort to get to know students that attended office hours (at least from the times I went).
Amazing professor. Truly wants kids to learn, and will meet you more than halfway. If you put the effort in, you will succeed in this class.
Great lecturer
Hard on zoom but great teacher
I love this class
She was great. I took her class over zoom and it was great.

The material in this class is not useful at all. I worked in Finance Industry before and her material is not useful in industry at all. And the course is very poorly designed. Her slides have lots of grammar mistakes and it is very unorganized. Her teaching style is talking nonsense everyday. Please avoid taking her class if you can.
Her slides are the most useful thing in this class even it is poorly written. I suggest everyone just copy the cheat sheet during class and please don't listen to her nonsense.
Annoying. Poor slides.
She is talking nonsense in class. And constantly focus on if you are discussing with classmates or using cellphones.

Laughed when I saw how consistent the ratings were over such a long period of time. She is really not a good professor. All other reviews are accurate. In addition, she even makes really frequent grammatical mistakes in her assignments, making questions extremely ambiguous. Constantly harps on cell phone usage in class. Just... No.

This professor is absolutely a disgrace. She will fail you for tiny reasons, such as using phones and laptop during class. Meanwhile, her class is boring. She is talkative but nothing useful for true knowledge. If you can choose other session, dont pick her. Also, please rate hero zero in the final course evaluation so that she wont hurt others.

comment: boring class strange grading policy same materials and examples used in class for many years with no change to the material
