comment: Have to be on-time. Have quizzes in every class. Miss two classes, you fail. Bring calculators to exams, you fail.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: There are a lot of homework and it has nothing to do with the exam. The class is boring and requires too much.
Lectures are poorly designed, grading is arbitrary
Lectures are confusing and not organized, homework is disproportionate to what is taught in class

Seems like a pretty nice person. Completely unreasonable and a bad teacher though. She just rambles off numbers and leaves a ton of ambiguity speckled throughout her instructions. When asked to clarify, she acts annoyed. Might be fun for someone with an acct background though.
I like her class. She makes theories and concepts easier to understand. Some professors just do it the opposite way.

Her class is really interesting and she gives many examples to make concepts easier and simpler to understand. She always keeps students updated with the latest financial news. Her grading is strict, but in a way also fair. She is a professor of principle, not like those who give easy marks . You reap what you sow in her class.
She does not know anything about teaching. The university will be better if she leaves. She is not organized. She is childish. She gives assignments that are way beyond what she gives in class.

I learned a lot in this class even though I didn't think I would find this very interesting. I have taken other accounting classes and this was presented in a much more practical way.  The assignments were were interesting and she was very approachable especially during her office hours.

Pastor's asinine policy of -4 off the top of everything frustrates me to no end. She is a good professor, but grading in the class often seems completely arbitrary. Her class is usually not extremely engaging, but she does have some decent stories mixed in.  All in all, I have more beef with her stupid grading policy than Pastor herself.

Carol should really take a good look in the mirror and re-evaluate her teaching career. Carol does not care about the well-being of her students and quite honestly deserves to be in the deepest depths of hell for the way she has handled the Economics program at this prestigious university. She is a disgrace and leaves a stain on this institution.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Goldburg is the worst professor ever! SO rude and tries to threaten students with academic integrity. She infiltrates every econ class by adding herself to the Canvas courses and then contaminates the syllabus. STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
She is the absolute worst professor at Carnegie Mellon. She gets involved in econ classes just to ruin student's grades. She doesn't like college aged kids for some reason.
Shes quite possibly the worse professor at CMU. Utter dissapointment. Hasnt gotten better at all. She does not deserve a teaching position at this school.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: just noticed all the bad reviews and i agree completely and say that the professor quality for this professor is horrible from my experience
HORRIBLE!!!!! STAY AWAY SHE IS A TERRIBLE PROFESSOR SO BEWARE

So i actually transferred out of cmu, but i had Goldberg for intermediate micro my sophomore year. Although she didn't teach it, she is in charge of econ advising. My experience at cmu was positive except for her. she is the worst adviser out there and i wouldn't wish for even my enemy to have her for an adviser
This woman is awful. She's rude and will literally make you feel dumb on purpose. Extremely unfair grading.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Carol Goldburg is by far the worst professor at CMU. There is a reason that she has the lowest rating on here, and it's backed up by so many student testimonies. She cannot teach, makes INTRO LEVEL CLASSES difficult than it has to be, and does not care about her students. She doesn't have the decency to even show up to SCHEDULED office hours.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Cannot tell you how awful she is. Knows nothing about even basic economics. Answer keys were often wrong/not released before exams - useless for studying. Arrogant and blames her own incompetence on students. Loses homework assignments/forgets to grade but never tells you. I don't know how she is still here. Really deserves a 0 rating.

Could not care less about the students. Inconsistent. Told students not to worry about writing down the ressitation section then threatened to take off points because of it. Grades don't reflect understand. Will not give any grace. If there's a multi part question and you get one part wrong, everything after that will be counted wrong as well.
Hard grading for this most basic econ course! Not responding the emails! Horrible!
full of lies. she wrote that 73-100 is a curved class in the syllabus and no curve was implemented. how bad can she really get?

Carol Goldburg is quite possibly the worst professor you'll ever meet. The tests are only half-relevant to the subject, the course is very poorly run, and she doesn't respond to emails or even show up to her own office hours. The fact that she's still employed is a disgrace to Carnegie Mellon. Prepare for an extremely hard first midterm.
Giving her even 1.0 is being nice. She should not be a professor here, plain out terrible, disorganized, etc. It's funny how she got all four degrees of her's at CMU and yet she is so bad.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Worst professor ever! The seminar courses should have been an easy A since we don't have tests. But this professor make things incredibly difficult. She is so disorganized during class, may be due to the fact that she doesn't understand materials herself. I feel so unfair to receive a C, given that I showed up everytime and did all the homework
Very harsh grader, docks points for simple math that no one needs to use, except her. Does not know econ, and does not respond to emails. Horrible overall.
Horrible professor. Not willing to help students.
She didn't even know the material. She just shadowed other teachers and tried to BS the material, but she often didn't understand.

Took over for another professor while she had a baby.  No interest in helping students, poor lectures to the point that she did not even know her own lectures.  Tests were made to have less room after they had been extended by previous professor.  Professor caused the class to be more confusing that with the previous professor.

Was an easy course. Not too much work unless you procrastinate on the papers. Is generous with drops (one test and one paper is optional). While the course wasn't bad, the lectures itself were really boring and long. Also pop quizzes which aren't too bad (you'll recognize what kind of quiz questions he likes to ask after a while)
he's an awesome prof. also really caring and respond to email fast. has a good style of teaching! would totally recommend!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Uses the Textbook slides. I never read the textbook. I ended up getting an A. There are 2 required papers, and 1 optional paper that will replace the lowest paper. There are 3 required exams, and 1 optional exam that will replace the lowest exam. Hence why I got an A haha. But seriously a great professor, and you do an interesting research paper.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is an amazing professor and lecturer, TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM. The material is really interesting and he goes to great lengths to ensure his students succeed. This is by far one of my favorite classes. If you want to succeed, read the textbook! He is always available for help and emails back quickly, do not hesitate to reach out.
The class material is so insightful
Signed up for class because of him; will look to take more classes from him. Engaging and funny lecturer. Tests are far more challenging than you expect.
Fun class, tests are hard

OK class. The guy is hot, all the girls love him and his accent. Kind of an jerk if you need help though. He pretty much will tear down your pride if he feels like it. Seems like most of his other ratings were based on the way he looked....
I want him!!!
good teacher..love the accent.
awesome teacher. his child development class is very interesting. He is a very funny and entertaining guy. Take this class.
very cool guy-knowledgeable, funny and entertaining, his accent is an added bonus! :)
He changed my life after taking his child psy. class.  A true Dr. Phil with a dosage of "bling"!  A+ to you!
So smart, so cool, and that accent--like aural chocolate!
He's awesome
this guy knows what hes talkin about =)
No Comments
If you're taking child psych, take it from this guy.
No Comments
good
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Test heavy

comment: Just about the easiest math class ever. I would recommend going to class, but you can just as easily get notes from someone else. Don't buy the book - we did three problems out of it the whole semester. Honestly, if you don't get an A in this class, there's something wrong with you.
Stats is pretty simple to begin with, and Oded makes it even easier. Don't bother buying the textbook, he readily admits that he doesn't use it.
Very clear, very helpful!

Amazing teacher! You will learn everything you need to know...and nothing else. Odded cares a lot about students...when I took a makeup test, he sat down and went through the entire exam, telling me exactly which questions are hard and how to attack them. Also he is unintentionally funny sometimes, especially when he makes mistakes...
he loves to drink coffee

Great class...lectures are clear, to the point, you learn what you nee to learn for exam. His practice exams are excellent,..I was ready for the midterms. He has some handouts online, but he gives practice solutions in class. You must commit to go to class, but it is definitely worth it.
Awesome.  Oded is the man.
awesome!
No Comments
AWESOME!!!
He's a CokeHead!
Oded is the man. He will change your life in 36-201.
he's the man.. take notes
No Comments
No Comments
just seeing his handwriting on the board left over from other classes this semester puts me to sleep
No Comments
No Comments

His lecturing style almost makes the class intolerable  he uses the filler word "ah" (instead of um) on average at the rate of 6 times per minute.  You can hardly hear him, his slide shows cannot be used to study from, and he often goes on tangents during his lectures.
He talks in a monotonous manner. Lectures are very boring. you would need to rely on TAs.

You can either do the impossibly long reading assignments or go to his lectures, in which he will spend an hour and 30 minutes explaining absolutely nothing in a monotonous fashion. His lectures have not taught me anything and this class is 1000% memorization of material, again, that he hasn't even taught me yet. Please, don't take this class.
worst class i've had!!!! lectures are boring!!!!

Lectures are very boring and power points are useless with out printing them out and taking notes on them in class. Still, when you look back at your notes later they might not even make sense. I had to study for about 8 hours for each exam just to understand the concepts that Kotovsky did not explain to me throughout the semester.

The class is mandatory, but they start giving points for attendance. Overall, not a bad class just very hard to stay awake. Sit in the front! Also, keep up with readings if you want an A, but you can still get a B without reading. Really easy if you took AP Psych in high school. He does tend to talk about having sex with the family dog (very odd)!
Fairly monotonous voice, but his clear love for the material rubs off on students. Fully explains concepts and their implications, but this often makes him drag on about things.

He does tend to go on for a while, so skipping lecture isn't a big deal if you read the textbook. His notes can be confusing by themselves, but if you listen he explains. The thing is, he just knows *so much.* I also loved how into his subject he was. I respect him immensely, and learned a lot in his class.

Not a good lecturer, not engaging at all. He uses examples that don't make any sense and often times fail. He explains things for 20 minutes on end without actually giving you any helpful information. Also, his voice is so hard to hear but he makes you sit in the back if you want to take notes on your computer. And the TAs are just as unhelpful.

Lectures suck, they're SO BORING. You don't need to pay attention in them though, all the notes are online and tests are on stuff in the book. Study for the class and you'll be fine. Kotovsky will put you to sleep though.
How the hell do you study for this guy's class??!!
He was pretty interesting, but definitely had a tendency to hammer home a point for 20 minutes when he really only needed to mention it in passing.  I also wished he had picked better TAs.
his voice can make you fall asleep, but he's a good guy
One of the only lecture courses I've ever found interesting. I thought he was very entertaining. Definitely the best choice for intro to psych.

This guy ramblesa lot..  It's hard to tell when he's going on some random tangent and when he's saying something he thinks is important.  Never bothered going to class and just looked over his posted reviews before the tests and came out with a B.
One of the best classes I have taken. Interesting fun and not a hard grader. I think it was great!!!
Difficult class but very interesting
Extremely extremelt entertaining.  Like watching Dr. Phil.  This man is one great teacher. A+ for you Ken!

First 2/3 of the course was extremely boring. Fall asleep in his class everytime. By the time it starts to get interesting, the course was about to end. Overall, wasn't horrible yet wasn't wonderful either
Ended class one day talking about his Animal Crossing island. Calton was candid by default and academic/dry when necessary, rather than the other way around. Top notch guy.
He was a really fun professor. He had strong energy every class and wanted to make students excited about learning. His lectures were excellent and he knew how to connect with students well.

Calton was my freshman year 101 instructor, back while he was still a Grad Student. Im reviewing him years later because I think it speaks worlds of how amazing an instructor he is. He has even helped me go over papers for other classes. Truly a gem of an instructor that will change students lives for years to come. Take his class, be respectful.

His Writing About Public Problems mini was INCREDIBLE. He would start every class with memes and then dive into very specific personal feedback. He brought his dog in for the last class and told us stories about how he got her. He even went out of his way to change the structure of the grading in the class in order to raise everyone's grades. 10/10

Professor Calton was an amazing Writing about Data professor. Giving educational and engaging lectures as well as a homework that actually applies things we learned in class. His feedback was extremely helpful. This class was absolutely one of the highlights of my freshmen year and I would absolutely take more classes with Calton in the future!

Amazing professor. He is very engaging, and personable. This class was probably the most fun humanities class I have taken and material is presented in a way that makes attending class very enjoyable.

He is a really great professor, cares a lot about the work. He definitely gives you a ton of thoughtful feedback and chances to improve your grade/writing. He is 100% the most passionate teacher I've had at this school so far, and tries to make class fun and meaningful. Also you will become a better writer.
Low effort, but you still leave the class having learnt something.
Very considerate and helpful professor. Very focused on making sure students understand the main takeaways of the class.
He gave a lot of busy work, but few lectures.

He's an incredibly sweet and considering professor. Students at CMU can find themselves inundated with work and Professor Calton was extremely willing to work with students to help them stay sane and get quality work done on time or with an extension if necessary. He responded to emails almost immediately and his office was always open.

Dr. Calton makes every effort to engage with his students. He will be straight up with you about the requirements for the class and what his assignments require. He starts every lecture with memes and tries to keep the rest of it light.

Dr. Calton not only delivers engaging lectures, but also develops rapport & interest in his students' learning. Outside of class, it is easy to reach Dr Calton via email and he literally replies within minutes. At his office hours, Dr Calton guides students patiently and demonstrates a genuine desire to help, even skipping his lunch in the process.

I took Writing About Data with Dr. Calton. His class was the first English class that I truly enjoyed. His lectures are engaging and showed me why the writing tasks are applicable to my major. He is willing to bend over backwards to help you if you need help--whether it is through his office hours or through email. I definitely recommend his class!
cool cool person

Thanks to Professor Calton, this course, which I expected to be boring, was 100% worth it. Professor Calton took the time to ensure that he properly explained all of the important concepts he wanted us to learn and was very clear in what he expected of us. I feel a lot better about my writing now than I did before this class.
Starts class talking about memes, and tries to give everyone every opportunity to do well.
He is a really nice teacher who tries his best to make you a better writer.
cool professor, tough grader but helpful to students that seek extra help. good mix of lecture and activities.

great guy, fast-paced class if you're not ready for it. his lecture notes(doesn't tolerate skipping class w/o reason)and **practice exams** are super helpful. study for the midterms, he broadcasts whats on those. final exam is essentially made for geniuses, i dropped a letter grade after the final because it's impossible. he likes boba & dr pepper.
HE IS SO NICE!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Often makes sarcastic or rude comments when asked questions he thinks are beneath him, that I felt were wildly unhelpful and inappropriate. Clearly he is extremely smart and can be nice sometimes, but he will get very frustrated & raise his voice if you don't understand his way, and often refused to even try explaining things another way.
Dickhead
Hard tests, decent lecturer, but grading scale is completely unknown (he doesn't tell you how grades are calculated)
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: The lectures are better than average, but the course design is excellent. The course exceeds the sum of its content.
Good professor. I like his way of explaining things and presenting the material, very practical less formal perhaps but his methods just works.

Is clearly very smart but doesn't always try to explain things in ways everyone can understand. Makes occasional obnoxious comments. Goes very fast. Is very confusing. Office hours are important but if you don't think exactly the way he does, makes you feel dumb. Basically, the class is curved and most people struggle a lot.
Not a bad teacher, but condescending. If you don't have much of a physics background you'll have to work hard to keep up, but it's not impossible.
Incredibly smart and knows a lot about the subject but is extremely condescending and sarcastic. Makes you feel dumb whenever you ask a question

Definitely challenging even though Ive taken multiple physics classes before. Briere isnt openly arrogant, he just has a low tolerance for incompetence and tests you such that you cant rely on memorizing the same repeated setup of problem solving. You need to understand and apply the concepts. CMU also provides an overload of resources for help.
Lectures are clear and pretty well explained, but he thinks he's better than the rest of the world, his students especially.  One of the more condescending people I've encountered in my life.

VERY SMART GUY. There is no doubt that he is knowledgable on the subject of physics. But brains only completes half of the teaching equation. He is not affable nor personable and believes that he is too good to teach his students.
He knows his stuff, but he's a pathetic teacher.  His exams intend to hurt your grade.  Overall, he's just not helpful either.  In order to do well hope to get a good TA.
Very interesting man, definatly enjoy his class and his lectures are not boring

Had him for physics of musical sound.  Not a difficult class, but lectures were very clear.  Occasionally dry, but always made sense.  Generally personable and humorous as well, but I can see why some people might be put off by his style.

He's one of those professors that knows physics up and down but can't teach it in a way that others will understand. If you don't know much about physics in the first place you probably shouldn't take him, even if it's a 100 level class.To understand the material you pretty much have to live in his office.
Knows his stuff, but lectures are not interesting at all.  Many people seem to doze off.  Doesn't make much of an effort to keep students engaged.

Not a good professor, he lectures clearly and knows his stuff, but acts like physics is the easiest thing in the world and doesn't have ANY respect for students, which comes as a first for me, personally.

I took 33-106 with him over the summer. Great man that really cares about his students, if you ever need help he'll find a way to help you. The class was a lot of work but nothing impossible, he teaches the material well. If you care you're going to learn because he cares to teach the stuff.

He is one of the best teachers I've had. Incredibly enthusiastic and makes an effort to meet all students on a personal level and help them excel. Always available for help with physics or just plain advice. Just try to answer a question every now and then, and he'll love you. P.S. I took him summer class, which was smaller. Take it!

He was the worst professor I have ever had. If you can, do not take his class. He was not clear whenever he lectured and kept getting on tangents. The tests? Literally nothing you have ever seen before on homeworks or quizzes.  It was an "introduction class" that barely introduced physics to you. Just a bunch of derivations not even needed.
Energetic, sometimes hard to understand, very passionate. If I was majoring in physics (and didn't suck at it), I'd love to have him as an advisor.

Incredibly energetic and uses hilarious examples to illustrate physical points. Sometimes difficult to follow in lecture, but a great guy who is genuinely happy to teach. Material is hard, but worthwhile.
Very interesting professor. I'm not sure if he can actually teach since so many people failed or dropped out of the class but the lectures are interesting.

Dr. Ghosh is the only man I know who runs across the room with a meter stick when talking about vectors. It is just about impossible to fall asleep in his class, which says a lot about a physics professor. He is the undergrad physics advisor and one of CMU's best assets. Not many people care about students as much as he does. He is there to help.

He is so awesome. You couldn't fall asleep in his class if you tried. He is very friendly in person. He is an advisor to many, so he is busy. When he is not busy he is great to talk to. I wish he would teach all my classes.

Class is "easy", but he expects CRAZYINESS from you. Hes a nice and funny guy, and teaches you things in class, but they probably won't have anything to do with the class. Nice guy, difficult to explain things to.

He's definetly the most energetic professor I've ever had. Passionate about physics, and will get you passionate too (even if you hate the subject and are just taking the class for the lab credit). Good at explaining experiments and their background information, and has realistic expectations. Highly recommended.
I like his method of teaching (compared to the first professor). Also has a sense of humor and we laugh a lot in his class. The exams were a bit harder than the one the first professor gave.
Don't expect to learn anything in lectures.
The only class where you can take the derivative of an elephant I wanted to fail just to have him as a prof again
excellent prof, learned a lot
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
his name is spelled Kunal Ghosh
No Comments
I thought Pattis' class prepared me well for future classes but I didn't like Pattis.  He is very arrogant and not too helpful.

His lecture notes that he posts online suck, and are impossible to read. He's not a very good lecturer; he tends to ramble and say "kind of" way too much. He's a very nitpicky grader of quizzes and exams. His assignments range from insanely boring to interesting. Very helpful outside of class (ie office hours). I've heard he's one of the best 15-200 teachers, though.
Pretty good guy, very difficult.
Awesome.  He's a good teacher, and a very helpful advisor.  He's a geek and shows it (which is a positive thing...haha).  He's also got a sense of humor.
A very difficult class. Definately go to office hours with Pattis; surprisingly they're incredibly helpful. Make use of him one-on-one often and the homework goes much much easier.

pretty heard but will put in alot of effort to make sure his students understand the material. His assignments are very challenging but very rewarding. rather lenient with grading if you do the work. (make sure you do the work)

I liked this class- difficult (assignments and take-home quizzes took a lot of hours each week) but we learned a lot.  If you do the work well though, you'll understand it very well and probably get an A.  Also he's not too boring.

The class is hard. Only Carrol is a more difficult 15-100 prof. BUT you WILL ace the final and more than 50% of his class gets As. You don't have to go to class ( I never did) cause he has lecture notes online. You don't need a book =)
He tried to teach us Pattis++ (his own variant of C++) the same way as you would Cobol.

The course was way too hard for beginning Java programmers, especially since it's a required course for most of the school.  He is also difficult to approach and not that friendly.  I really did not enjoy this--take it with someone else if you possible.

Expects a lot; sometimes a challenging class in terms of learning the material and applying/extending it (esp. for rookie programmers). If it's just a requirement, take someone else. If you're moving on in CS, you get a solid understanding and foundation.

Gives students a very solid foundation in programming skills.  Lessons are very clear and notes are well organized and easily accessible.  Course might be a bit harder but benefits to those intending to pursue further CS courses are well worth the effort.
Expects too much out of intro programmers, take another section!
Teaching methods impossible to follow, way too hard for an introductary class
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Not very nice
A great prof!

Teaches mostly theory and doesn't go through helpful examples in class. Recitation is mandatory and you will NEED IT. Gives a horrendous amount of homework each week with only a few days to complete it. Doesn't use Canvas - instead, all homework must be turned in by hand. If you are not familiar with ECE, this class will be VERY difficult.

I think Prof Collins is great and kind of underrated. It's very clear how to do well in his class. Spend some time on his homeworks, which are worth a lot of the grade, and you will do just fine in the class. The tests were very doable and the recitation problems were super useful. The course policies could be more lenient though.
Good instructor with reasonable expectations and standards for the class, not the most understanding of students with accommodations.
Very nice and cares about students a lot, but lectures are hard to follow sometimes (quite theory-heavy) and homework/tests are difficult and time-consuming.

Goes off on tangents during lectures, and homework is generally unrelated to lectures. Doesn't teach how to solve problems or how to logic through one. Physics is an incredibly difficult class without a good instructor, and this class definitely demonstrated this. Grade boundaries had to be lowered by 15% just so the distribution could be "normal".
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The professor is personally lovely, caring, and knowledgeable, however, the grading is not transparent throughout the semester. In my case, I was given a B while my grade was higher than the threshold of A (It was finally resolved.) While I believe this is just a mistake, I had never experienced this at CMU and schools earlier.

While I don't mind that his mandatory lectures don't relate well to the material. Why he does not accept virtual submissions baffles me, especially when he has shown a clear track record of losing submissions. 
His lectures do not help, he overloads homework for what is quite frankly a meaningless subject for most engineering students.

I have no idea how professor Collins has such a high rating considering the torture he puts his students through even in physics 1. Man goes through a bunch of useless content (once he even talked about gradients for 20 minutes) and then assigns a massive load of homework every week. His exams don't even relate to the problems he gives for practice

Imagine the worst professor you've ever had x10. That's Professor Collins for you. His lectures are boring 50 minute sessions of him making cringy jokes at 8:00 am in the morning. I redid all the homework and recitation sheets before the exam only to find the exam to be filled with problems completely different from what was taught. F-

attendance quizzes at the end of every 8 am lecture. lecture content does not match the homework and there is not enough time to fully understand the content before he moves on to the next topic leaving you confused and lost.

Can make the lectures entertaining with jokes but the material is still very abstract, theoretical, and at times hard to follow. Lecture material is important for understanding course topics, but it is not very useful for homework problems and many test problems. Recitation is very helpful.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Weekly problem sets take a few hours, but are medium difficulty. His tests are similar to the problem sets. Do the homework and you're good. The lectures are enjoyable because of his funny/cringey jokes. He is very nice and caring. His office hours and course center are your best friends. Overall, great professor! I really enjoyed his class!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: A great teacher who's able to keep us awake with his humor even in early morning lectures

I would give 6 stars. Every lecture is got little spur of the moment quips, a joke about the feelings of the variables, a funny remark about his personal life or interests. He doesn't get off topic though. On the days when your eyelids are made of lead, that sort of witty humor keeps you awake I wish he knew how much each student loves this guy.
we love hael <3333

Professor Collins is a very helpful professor. If you ever have issues understanding concepts, he's very willing to teach you. However, homeworks are long and he has mandatory book quizzes.  Overall an amazing teacher - just make sure to do the readings.
Great personality, a really nice professor

I love him, my favorite professor. He explains concepts extremely clearly, and he loves questions, so if you are confused just ask him. He is very inviting, and makes the class interesting. His passion is very clear which makes the subject easier to learn. Also sometimes the grades are strange because of the TAs but other than that hes great.

Great Professor! Lectures are engaging, although fast-paced and he covers a lot of content in a short amount of time so come prepared to take notes! There were a lot of exams (like 5) and a final so every other week we would have a test. If taking cell biology/biochemistry/genetics in the future, highly recommend taking this class.

Minden is a really good prof. He knows a lot about his subject and makes lectures interesting with interactive examples and real world examples. If you don't read the book, you miss out on crucial information, because he doesn't mention everything in the book, and vice versa.

Professor Minden is an incredible professor. He truly cares about students and wants them to succeed. If students are confused, he takes time to answer their questions, and sometime he'll even redo a lecture to ensure students understand the content. His lectures are a bit difficult to follow, but office hours are very helpful.

Dr. Minden is the best. He really cares about his students. I was struggling with the course initially then he reached out and offered to tutor me every week. He also invited me to work at his research lab. take honors modern bio!!

Minden is a very nice, caring professor. The material for the class is very lecture heavy and dense, which could be a hit or miss for some people, but if you have any problems, he will be there for you. He's super accomodating and passionate about his field. If you can, please take honors bio so you can have him as your prof!

Professor Minden is one of the best professors I have ever had. He really cares for his students and wants you to learn the material. His classes are engaging and he teaches the material very well. Some of his tests are a little difficult, but if you put in the work you can get an A. Definitely would take his class again.
He was fantastic and always wanted to engage the class.

Such a great person. Honors Bio is absolutely worth it and made the following bio classes easier. His research is super cool and he is willing to answer any question. His lectures are easy to pay attention to, but make sure to take good notes, you'll need them. Test are not just information regurgitation, mainly application problems.

Professor Minden is a great lecturer and is always willing/eager to answer questions or further explain the material. He also worked with and knows many of the scientists whose findings are discussed so that makes it really interesting.

I highly recommend to take honors modern biology. Professor Minden gives amazing lectures and explains extremely complex topics in a way that makes them understandable without "watering them down." He has high expectations for students, in a good way. You'll be a better scientist and have a renewed passion for bio if you take this class.
The tests are something else. Good lectures though.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you're looking for an easy class this might not be it, but Minden is such a good teacher that you'll feel good just taking the class. He's open to questions, loves explaining things that are still unclear, and is just a good teacher overall. It's rare to come by teachers who are truly all about the learning, but Minden is.

If you have questions, ASK THEM. Recitation is rather useless; it's just another lecture without a  set goal of getting anything done. Minden is an awesome guy and a great lecturer, but prone to going off on tangents. Additionally, he knows the guy who wrote the textbook and he goes by it concretely. BEWARE: Hard tests, great class, awesome prof.

Very enthusiastic engaging lecturer, and a very nice guy to boot. TAKE MINDEN'S HONORS MODERN BIOLOGY AND NOT REGULAR MODERN BIOLOGY IF YOU REALLY LOVE BIOLOGY! It's far more interesting than regular modern biology (which is an AP Bio rehash). If not a true bio lover, be warned that the material is hard and the class full of pre-meds.  Great prof
Decent prof. His class can be difficult but he knows his subject well and is willing to help the students succeed. Recommended.
Took the Mod Bio Honors section. Very enthusiastic about his work and Biology as a whole. Kind of hard class, takes work and time. Overall a professor that knows what he's doing and cares about it.

All in All, he is a very fair professor. Pay very close attention in his lectures and take very good notes. Work together with your classmates. You must put in the time in order to get the grade. Review the material daily.He is very approachable and helpful

He is the worst Biology Professor I can ever wish for. Yes, he is nice, but his class is horrible!!!! He never stated things clearly, everything is not in order, and he always go off track on our materials.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He's the kindest human being in CMU! Blessed to have him as our advisor and teacher. His lectures are amazing and he makes sure everyone understands
Professor Brasier was one of my favorite instructors. Very lenient and cared about his students. I highly recommend taking any class with this professor.
Great professor, very responsive to communications and helpful with work throughout the semester. His lectures were great and the exams were easy if you went to lectures
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Brasier is amazing! definitely one of the best professors I had in all my time at CMU. He is caring and kind and provides all the resources you need in order to succeed in his class. I would highly recommend taking one of his courses if you get the chance!

I took Neurobiology of Disease with Dr. Brasier. He is an excellent professor. The textbook "Psychopharmacology" is not necessary at all, I took the class and learned 100% of the material from his lecture and my class notes. You definitely need to show up because a lot of participation points are awarded for the class. He really is a great man!

He really cares, and is the most available professor around. He wants you to learn and will go out of his way to do it. Sometimes lectures drag on. Tests are extremely fair, straight forward. Highly recommend.

DJ is a very nice person and his lectures are high-quality; his examples can get a little awkward though. He wants students to succeed. He will answer all questions, and he holds review sessions before every exam. He also offers a lot of practice material before each exam. One exam can be half-weighted and the tests are very fair. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: Dr. Brasier is a very good professor. He seems to really care for all of his students. Has great funny analogies. The only problem I have would be that he tends to ramble off quite a bit, so you don't end up covering a lot of material and have to read the textbook. But he does answer all questions and engages students well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. Brasier is one of the nicest people I have met. He is willing to meet outside of class and responds to emails quickly. The class is quite easy if you go to class. He mainly teaches verbally with little writing on the board so pay attention to what he says as that is mainly what he grades on. Definitely recommend taking this class i loved it!
He is the best professor I've every met.

An excellent professor- the course I took with him is probably my favorite course I've taken so far at CMU.  He's a skilled and accessible lecturer who really cares about student learning and success.  The course felt fairly easy, but I still learned a massive amount.  Strongly recommended.
Great lecturer! Much better than other bio professors. Very nice, helpful, kind, and supportive. Also very entertaining.
A really great teacher. Always willing to help his students out with going the extra mile. Totally amazing.

He really cares about students, and is very patient with students. For the final paper, professor spent lots of time reading through the academic papers that students chose and intended to analyze and write paper on.  Course lectures are clear and helpful. Beside the textbook, outside academic papers are often used in this course to help learning.

Wonderful teacher. Let the class decide what we wanted to focus on the most. Had very interesting guest speakers that either were doctors specific to the disease we were focusing on or suffered from a disease. Consisted mostly of exams and a final paper. Lots of group class work (as attendance quizzes). The exams were easy if you went to the review

Lots of really entertaining analogies - keeps people engaged fairly well. Sometimes can get a bit technical and sometimes has to think of best way to explain something, but is always willing to help out if you email him with questions. Posts presentations online. Clicker and warm-up questions required. Strict about technology.
A great professor who is very invested in teaching and will do anything to help students. Had a really fun final exam for the class and a lot of fun activities throughout.

I took two classes with Prof H, 272 last spring, and 443 this fall. I recognize that the class is hard, and it's a lot of material to learn, and I ended up getting a high 79% with a C. But I would still recommend him for any future students. He's a really genuine person and he really cares about his students. He will help you if you come to him.

To future students: go to office hours as early as possible, as you need to learn EVERYTHING on your own. Does not provide any material to study for the exams, so be prepared to get ~70 for your exams even if you reviewed everything you can think of. Homework are due every Sunday, all I can say is good luck and find a friend group to collaborate.

The problem with this teacher is that he uses a Mac computer and then only gives mac-based software to use in the class. It was never mentioned that it's practically required to have a Mac beforehand and I suffered miserably due to that. Also, the exams are incredibly hard without, and you are given absolutely no clue on what they will include.
barely provides any material, really hard to study for, except students to magically learn the content
mysterious homework and problematic lecture-hw-test relationship
Terrible professor, unclear criteria, unrealistic expectations, terrible lectures, unorganized curriculum, and tries to be rude/intimidating during lecture.

This guy seldom gives clear instructions in assessments that have a large weight in the final grade. Complex and obscure writeup with lots of typos, which is unfriendly for ESL students. Points deducted for not understanding poor writeup. Lecture pace too fast but HWs and exams even faster. Expects students to understand magically by themselves.

This class is super lecture-dependent. That being said, the homework makes a lot more sense if you've paid attention to the examples from class. He's extremely helpful in office hours if you have the time for it.

The first assign had a class average of 55%. That is when is knew this class would be bad. Indeed, I was correct. I think this class can be summarized in the following way: whatever grade you think you deserve, subtract 20 points (at least for anything that is graded manually). Terrible class.

In general this course is tough, however if you truly pay attention to his lectures, read the comments in his code, you will understand what he is talking about. In this class, paying attention to the Lecture matters just as much as attending it. Also, this guy LOVES Monty Python. 

In general, DO NOT start the work for this class last minute.
Horrible. Please avoid
Awful professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Worst professor I have ever had in my LIFE. Does not know how to teach lectures, and constantly makes uncomfortable jokes about students' names, it is ridiculous.  Does not actually teach you anything, he just expects you to understand and implement codes magically and finish assignments. Is not understanding towards students.

In retrospect, a lot of the stuff he taught was very useful. However, I believe the course could've been structured in a way better manner. His Canvas page is extremely disorganized with a lot of random information, which is similar to his lecture style, where he talks with no slides and walks through codes expecting you to remember every word.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He often criticizes other professors for their curriculum while not paying attention to his own. He also tends to berate students when they go and ask for help. It is almost impossible to reach out to him outside of class. From personal experience, he does not seem to care about the students' wellbeing.

The Prof tends not to teach the material correctly and is very unspecific as to how he wants certain assignments done. A lot of credit is taken off for this. He also has strict policies regarding help and makes it hard to receive help directly from him.

Professor unfairly cold calls on students and is decently rude/intimidating during class. His expectations for our assignments are also incredibly unfair and unclear at all, which results in all students getting terrible grades (for example, the average for phase 1 of our semester-long project was a 54%).
Putnam Seminar was a ton of fun because of Prof Loh. He is awesome. Very funny, caring guy, and clearly enthusiastic about the subject.
Perfect professor and perfect man. A humble genius with a true passion for math and teaching. Made difficult concepts more approachable for people like me who are allergic to math
best ever, the putnam god.

Professor Po-Shen Loh is such an engaging and caring professor. He makes you love maths. His online classes are very engaging, he does ask us the right questions to encourage us to reflect and engage with the content in the lectures. The homework can be hard and do take a lot of time to finish but they are worth it.

Professor Loh is one of the most engaging professors I have ever had. He explains everything with such a level of enthusiasm and joy that it is difficult not to be interested in his lectures. He goes over the content diligently and is very good at getting the students to be engaged/participate in his lectures. Would recommend anyone take his class.
the absolute best

Very passionate about math. Homework can pile up quickly if you don't do it, but it's very easy and not graded for accuracy as long as you show that you try. Go to extra sessions (Putnam problems 1-3) if you can, they will help you get better at math in the long run.
I LOVE HIM. THE BEST MATH PROF IN THE WORLD.

I have never had a professor that is more involving and entertaining, he's the best teacher I've ever had and also outside of class one of the most genuine and caring and really wants to help you. I really hope more professors could be like him.
a math god
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He will make math your favorite subject - I dare you to take his class and say you don't love math. Even the kids who got Cs in the course stood up and clapped for a couple of his lectures. He will blow your socks off. Plus, tests are pretty easy to do well on if you go to class (open-book and 60+ was an A for us) hws are hard but u learn .. A LOT
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Po-Shen is amazing. In 21295 he doesnt teach very much per say, but makes it very open discussion (hence the name putnam SEMINAR). He is very intelligent and respected by everyone.
Great Professor, amazing lectures.
very good at explaining things
Amazingly dedicated to students' learning. Does extremely good job of teaching via insight and intuition!
Very entertaining and animated.

Amazing professor! Perfect teaching skills! He asks appropriate questions to inspire every student and facilitate discussions. With such an amazing guide, everyone gains a lot even in this 3-unit mini-course!
Course in Qatar's CMU branch. A real gem.
Szudzik gives clear lectures. However, attending them is not at all necessary since the textbook has all the information too. Plus his final exam policy makes it really easy to do well in his class.

Honestly, Concepts would've been hell if I didn't have Szudzik.  Tests were pretty rough and the homework wasn't easy but his office hours were SUPER HELPFUL. Lectures were super clear; I was always able to follow along and think about the problems as he worked through them
Really nice guy, and he's a great lecturer. Homework is tough but doable, the midterms have been alright, but I hear that the final is harder than the overall course.
Professor Szudzik gives very clear lecture and explains things very well. Class is small and he always takes questions. Definitely recommended.
I took Multivariate with him, and i never understood calc better ! HE'S THE BEST ! Also, his final exam was the same as the review session he did for us, so if he does a review session, ATTEND IT!!

The content of the course wasn't an easy A. However, with Dr. Szudzik's teaching method, and helpfulness. The material was made easy to understand and comprehend. Beyond amazing teacher, would recommend anyone to take his course. I got an A.
Well spoken/Knows his stuff
No Comments

Well guys hes now a prof not just a ta...except he still explains stuff better than the ta :) he is an amazing teacher who makes math fun and tells us great stories in class A++++ plus the fact that hes good looking helps for the girls :D

I had statman for this class, and well, he wasn't all that great at teaching. Szudzik filled the void with clear explanations and enthuisiam. If you have concepts, switch to his recitation section if you can
I agree with everyone else.  Get into his section of concepts, if you can- he explains stuff better than the professors.

"Suds" is the coolest.  Who else mentions all kinds of advanced mathematics ("Principle of Transfinite Induction," anyone?) in his recitation?  He understands the material and how to teach it, and is very clear.  The world needs more teachers, at every level, of his kind.
Great Guy. I agree with the above: "BEST TA. EVER. PERIOD. "
BEST. TA. EVER.
loud, clear and interesting
ALTHOUGH  A GRAD STUDENT HIS TEAHCHING HIS OUT OF THIS WORLD
waste of time.

comment: Really ineffective at teaching and leading.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Because of Clayton, I decided not to be an artist.
Merril is a really unpleasant person to be around- he makes you feel horrible and does everything he can to diminish your self worth. Really damages his students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Merrell was incapable of creating a safe space for students to express themselves. Merrell was hostile to students who had differing opinions and was very aggressive when confronted about it. I felt scared and unsafe in the classroom.

Clayton was unable to clearly hold a conversation about art or discuss relevant work during class sessions. His grasp of the material is limited to basic color theory and it shows in his work. His teaching style borders on invasive, and I felt uncomfortable around him. Did not create a healthy classroom culture and seems incapable of leading.

Very nice professor, very understanding and super chill. However, Clayton doesn't give back grades until midterm or final so you have no idea what mark you are getting in the course. But all homework is manageable
very lovely, caring, and helpful. I wish he was a litter tougher in critiques.
Clayton is one of the greatest professors I have ever had. He is friendly, helpful,  and extremely knowledgable. To attend one of his lessons is a great honor and pleasure.

Merrell possesses talent, but refuses to pass on any knowledge of craftsmanship to his students. He is self obsessed, and he has capitalized on the fact that he can do one thing with immense skill and that is paintings of clouds. His work can captures gesture, but is not at all emotive. Students that take his advice tend to produce crap.
An awesome teacher. Involved with each student, a fair grader, and a talented artist.
I wouldn't be where I am today w/out Clayton. His willingness to help in and out of class is amazing. If you prove yourself to him he'll stop at nothing to help you out.
he's great.  mellow yet tough, helpful.
clayton is good for criticism

A bit too esoteric, most assignments were given with themese of destruction rather than creation...He does have a good knowledge of painting, but painting assignments didnt teach much about skill or technqiue, which yeilded a lot of bad work
Very hot teacher with very hot hands (just look at them!!) and soothing voice...okay, he teaches well too, ya know.

Assigned the same project several times: do a drawing, rip it up, glue it back together, and draw over it again.  This was of limited help in expanding students' skills and appeared to be his personal schtick.  He did not provide strong leadership or structure for the class.
No Comments
He is a very good lecturer. Very clear hand-writing and notes are good materials for review.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Schaeffer's lecture notes are really clear and super helpful. His lectures are very useful and the exam is not that hard.

Professor Schaeffer is really great. His lectures are really clear, well structured, covering both theoretical knowledge and easy-to-understand examples. He is almost always available in office to answer questions, and he really loves to help students. Definitely take a course with him!
Terrible grader. Deduct points off just because you don't write like the standard answer.

Amazing teacher. His lectures are boring, but he cracks some "old man" jokes every time I was about to fall asleep. Very clear and has a thorough understanding of the material. And I think the guy below me meant to post his post on another J. Scheffer in CMU.
I had this guy for three courses in the early '90s.  Good to see he's still teaching.  I remember him only because he was by far the best professor I had as an undergraduate.
best teacher!! Get him for calc in 3d

The best calc professor I've ever had. Not only is he excellent at explaining a very hard subject (calc in 3D), but he also has examples ready and shows how things are derived and used, rather than just presenting the formulae and expecting us to memorize them. Exams are easy compared to homework material.

The first calculus teacher that has actually taught me something...I was deathly afraid of this class before i took it...but it's actually very straightforward...schaeffer is so organized and on top of things that it makes you sick...but in a good way...

Schaeffer is, hands down, the BEST teacer in the entire department.  He explains everything clearly, then provides examples illustrating his points.  And somehow, he gets through all the material with plenty of time to spare.  If you take Calc in 3D, take it with Schaeffer.
Great Professor.  Explains everything really well.
i love him~~~~~~~~~~ his class is the only one i normally dont skip... ;)

Don't take Calc3D w/o a good reason, but if you do, take it with Schaeffer. Presents everything clearly, and understands that lots of examples are the best way to learn. Not much class interaction, but tests are fair given the difficulty of the material
Easy to follow, easy to understand.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Great class to take for a freshman writing course. I enjoyed the topics taught. Sometimes when I wouldn't know what to write about, she would provided valuable help to get me out of writer's block. Not my favorite class of all time but not difficult.

Hands-down my favorite teacher freshman year. Knowledgeable about the material and genuinely cares about her students outside of class. Might seem like a hard class for people who haven't done a lot of paper-writing before college, but being challenged is how you become a better writer!
Very tough grader. I hated this course. I would not recommend classes from her unless you're a super good writer. However, the professor is super nice and understanding, but she grades so hard.,
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Choose a different teacher
Interesting, fun, enthusiastic, and makes sure the class does not get boring - But class is DIFFICULT.  Be prepared to put a great deal of work into your assignments.
I liked her, and she is great!But it is hard to get good grades unless you put so much time for the class
She does not apologize for giving a tough course.  If you don't want to work take someone else's class.  But you will learn a lot in her class.
Writing for the Professions, real nice teacher, invited us over her house for a christmas party
bad class, bad teacher- no time for her students and not smart
hard class, but awesome lady
She's not that smart and tries to make easy things difficult. i am frustrated.
No Comments
The teacher is likebale but the class is unbelievably difficult and much of the class is lost.

She was very nice and understanding, but had a lot going on at home and with her kids, so she couldn't hand back assignments very often. She cared a lot about the students, and tried to make everyone feel involved.
bad teacher, doesnt know how to teach, only handed back one of the three essays by the end of the semester, thinks she's funny but she's not

awesome professor! best professor ever! she's very clear in explaining the papers, and she has mandatory individual meetings with her to discuss the paper, which is very helpful. she also is very funny and makes the class very enjoyable

He cares much more about his reputation than the well-being of the average student in his class. His lectures are less helpful and less engaging than reading the textbook. Class ramps up in difficulty over the course of the semester. Tests are more of a race to write things down than an evaluation of knowledge. Callous and loves trick questions.
Not great overall
Good thoughtful Professor. Though his lecture is not very clear, I like his personality. He makes me like matrix.
Spends every class going over proofs already in the book. His tests sometimes introduce concepts not previously covered.
Spends too much time going over proofs in class.
A terrible professor.

He asked if anyone has question in class, and I said I don't know how to do a hw problem.  His reply was "that's an statement, not a question" and then asked if anyone else has a question.  In his office hour, I asked 3 problems and the answer is always "it's straight foward, simple!  think about it yourself!"
good

My grandmother died on a Tuesday night.  He still made me take an exam the very next morning.  It's hard to concentrate on calculus with that going on.  I subsequently bombed the exam and thus failed the course.   Enough said.
If you EVER see this name and your not a grad Math major RUN AWAY!!!!!!
No Comments
Blah

He isn't a very good communicator, he chose to use a microphone in his lecture after a midterm faculty review. He knows all the material, its just hard to understand him some times, and he's kind of corny and goes off tangents. His TAs save his class.

Awesome professor. Makes the material very easy to understand. Homework once a week, understands the material and knows how to actually teach it. Wish I had him for every class I took.

251 diff. eq's are not easy and not made any easier by tolle. Im a chem. engineering major so this is the toughest math class i have to take at PSU he is very thorough but a little well very above my level when it comes to math im sure hes only 1 teachn 251 now sp.2011 so good luck its not easy as 123 ha
Well, he teaches, that's for sure. But as for the tests, sometimes they're a bit weird. As for the final, it was totally unexpected to solve for something that wasn't in the book.
Lectures are boring, textbook was horrible. Vastly overrated professor.

He's a little eccentric, but overall is a nice guy who is enthusiastic about the subject. He tries his best to explain concepts and cracks an occasional joke. However, the majority of his lectures are very boring and involve many long proofs and droning on and on.
Great beard.
Very boring class, he managed to put the whole lecture hall to sleep within the first 10 min

Great Prof.  occassionally a little dull, but cracks hilarious jokes when he thinks nobody is paying attention.  FUN FACT: Watch him squirm as he tries to get through an entire class period without a cigarette!

Hilarious, interesting, learned things I never thought possible. Will give everyone advice on rough drafts! If you make the changes he suggests on the drafts, you'll get an A in the class! He's great.
only if i could stay awake...then his lecture would be soooo helpful..i guess he tries hard to be funny...but too many cold jokes...
hmmm.  he seems like a pleasant person, and im sure hes a great guy.   but, his tests are sooooo unnecessarily hard.  TAKE SOMEONE ELSE FOR MATRIX. the other teachers are so much easier
he's my fave
Tolle is an awesome guy, but I stopped going to lectures because I couldn't stay awake.
yeah he's not the best prof but he knows his stuff... stay awake in class take notes and you'r golden... although for 121 the book will do well enough
worth staying awake
Any schoolchild should know  that Tolle looks out of aDead concert but is great
Just makes bad jokes and is a poor overall professor. Extremely unhelpful.

This class was okay, It had a good start but quickly became a hot mess. Dates on syllabus for exams and assignments were changed, assignments were rarely handed back in a timely manner, the TAs sometime didn't even know what was going on. To sum it up, the class is unorganized.
Hes fine and humorous in his way.

What is wrong with u guys? I felt like its a common sense course but eventually I turned out to be wrong. Sorry, its just a nonsense course. He needs to be more specific on why he wears the things he wears to class everyday.
great

SOOOOOOOOO EASY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! You don't even need to go to class most of the time to get an A. This will be the easiest class you will take at CMU trust me. I didn't like him as a person..... cracked too many boring jokes and he's pretty arrogant but, you'll get an A anyway so just take it and put up with his blahness

He is a great guy. Class is pretty easy as long as you do the work and do well on the two quizzes. Dont fall behind as there are only a couple graded assignments. Class is easy if you dont slack (I did). Also you dont have to go to class and the final is a joke
he is one of the best intro professors you will ever have, ever
Dr. Cofield is a great teacher, very engaging class, and quite easy.  Best teacher and class this semester, hands down.
I loved his class!  He tells the funniest stories that can actually apply to what we're learning.  He cancels class a lot, but that isn't always a bad thing, right?
One of the best classes available to take at Carnegie Mellon University, alright, ok?
He is awesome and the course is great. I just wish I could take it again!!!!
Nice guy, easy course, really fun.(can't remember the course numbers, but it is intro to business)
loves cole haans

excellent business course. *bling*
He is so sweet and really cares about his students. His lecture slides are nice and detailed which can be a bit much in lecture but is very helpful when studying.
The best 03-121 professor by far. Lectures are sometimes on mundane and boring topics but he does his best to explain in an interesting way. Super nice and considerate if you need help.

Biochem 1 was the easiest class I've taken at CMU. It wasn't super useful to me bc I put in no effort & wasn't interested in the content, but if you're actually a good student, it's a good class! Dr. Rule is a rare gem who genuinely cares a ton about his students :)  I felt bad obnoxious premeds still always bugged him abt grades, y'all gotta chill

this class and dr. rule were both quite lovely! he is a lovely teacher who really cares about his students, the only issue with this class was our TA graders graded quite low on the problem set, making the overall class average be well below an A. the lectures can be slightly boring but he tries his best to make it engaging and cover everything.

Professor Rule cares deeply about the success of his students. He very clearly lays out content that students must learn for an exam, and even gives study tips and hints on what to focus on. He provides expectations for every lecture that are helpful for test prep. Professor Rule provides many resources for students to succeed. Strongly recommend.
My favorite class this semester! Dr. Rule always made sure to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly and was always available outside of class to answer questions/go over confusing material.
An amazing teacher dedicated to his students. Make himself available to help out. Always willing to explain things a second time.
Such a nice and clear professor. Apparently does some amazing research too. He is extremely fair and will almost always work with you to help you. He even let me submit things late a bunch of times
Super nice, but class can be pretty dull. If you're confused though, he's patient and able to explain things clearly. Be sure to review the material, and you'll be fine for exams.
Good teacher, class sometimes boring.
EXCELLENT prof...really cares about his students, makes himself available and explains things clearly.  He's the best!

He is a hardworking professor.  But what makes him special is that he cares about his students.  I was struggling to find my passion one summer, and Dr. Rule gave me a very thoughtful advice that got me on track.
every nice and helpful
mr. antibody!
BEST professor!  Dedication to teaching shows.
Wonderful Biochemistry professor!
I value that Prof Alex is a part-timer who is a practicing professional. Since I am going into this field, his practicality was invaluable to me.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: A practicing professional, prof. Alex is a bright star among the chiefly bookish, impractical, uncaring CMU faculty. He demands accountability and challenges you, but helps and provides constructive feedback. He obviously cares. Not a slam dunk, but a very rewarding class.

A very personable and "lead-by-example" professor with great insights into the subject matter and a wealth of professional experience that he shares freely and willingly. A game changer for me - switching majors from CE to CM.

I have encountered no problem with this class. Alex is flexible if you communicate in advance. I was given a chance to turn some homework in late for a small penalty which is fair. He provides good feedback and is always in communication. I have learned tons of new useful material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I am a senior here & I have seen them all: good, bad, and ugly. Alex is one of the best IMO. For once he brings real world experience into the classroom. Secondly, he cares. Thirdly, the cry babies who whine about too much homework ought to be embarrased - this is CMU after all. The class was relevant and the class work was adequate. I loved it.
I am completely dissatisfied with this professor. He gave me a C. In our school, this is a no-no. I don't know what his problem is, but I suggest you don't take his classes in the future!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Alex is on of the best in this department, probably because he is a part-timer. I liked how he linked all his lessons to real projects, that was rad. What I didn't like is that he come down hard on slackers in this class. In my team, the two of us, out of 5, did all the work, but all 5 passed the class. Unfair!
This is a hard class. Lots of work. I learn a lot, but the amount of work is unreasonable. Heading for an A, but, all things considered, wouldn't take it again... Did I mention too much work?

I feel that I have made a solid choice innpicking this elective. Professor Alex is relatable, concise, and teaches from real world experience. One negative though: too much homework. Test are similar to it though, so it is not wasted.

I enjoyed his class. The information presented applied to real life and the professor teaches from real life experiences. He gave us a lot of freedom in choosing the class schedule which was good. Relevant test (they were hard). I would take a class from him again.

IMO, this professor is a good one. A h/w every other week, 2 or 3 quizzes, and 2 exams plus a term project. He is not good looking at all, but he clearly cares about students learning and grades. He is accessible by email at any time. Explains material real well. Overall, a solid choice if you want to gain knowledge and to learn.

He seems to be on top of his game. The class is not easy but very rewarding. He is answering emails within a couple of hours - unheard of at the CMU. His midterm exams are a murder. He does curve, so I got an A in the end, but several people quit mid-class. It was overall a good solid engineering class. I learned a ton, guest speakers rocked.

The barrage of homework, quiz, assignment, in-class team assignments and tests is relentless. Lectures are very engaging, all from real project experience, good examples, but he piles up many work on student. Very personable and cares about students. Curves grade, so I did fine.

The text is published on-line - SWEET! PLUSES: The professor is a practicing professional - A BIG PLUS. Some amazing high caliber guest lecturers. Relevant material. Approachable. MINUSES: He teaches for people with engineering and construction backgrounds. Assumes students know certain things. Heavy-load homework / tests. I learned a lot.

I have thoroughly enjoyed this class and professor A in its helm. He is a practicing PM at a Fed Govt shop, and it shows. He makes you work for your A but it is well worth it. The case studies are relevant and the term project was fun and fostered synergy in my group. Time well spent.

I feel that I have been inspired by this professor to switch majors; from civil engineering to engineering project management. It seems more fun and more rewarding. I kind of been burned over by the cut throat CMU Engineering approach, and this is the first professor who has acted like a human towards his students.

I took this course in the Spring of 2022 and I really enjoyed the class. The lectures were interesting and actually made the material fun to learn. As a BME student, I think it was really important to understand the innerworkings of a cell on a mechanical level.  Also only one exam! Overall the class was great and exceeded all expectations.

Prof. LeDuc was a great professor and going to class was an enjoyable experience, even with remote learning. I was definitely the most engaged in this class compared to other classes I took that fall. Would definitely recommend this class to anyone interested in these topics!

I took the class in fall 2020 and Phil made the class enjoyable even in a remote learning scenario. Phil clearly cares about and respects his students. This class on leadership and communication was fun and challenges you to leave your comfort zone. He values participation. If you engage in the dialogue you'll learn a lot and do well in the class.

I enjoyed taking Prof. LeDuc's Cellular Biomechanics class. He is a great person and makes the class fun. The assignments and exams were challenging, but interesting and helped me understand the course material better. When the classes had to be transitioned online due to the pandemic, he was very accommodating!

I thoroughly enjoyed Professor Leduc's class. Along with presentations, he had a lot of real life examples and situations to share that made the class unique and interesting. I particularly liked the sections that covered negotiation and conflict resolution, communication skills, organization and planning techniques.

Prof. LeDuc really cares about his students. He's very approachable and works in your favor. He wants everyone to succeed but if you don't put in the work, he'll call you out. He has so much knowledge about academia and industry which makes him a valuable prof and connection. Overall, great prof and would take again.

I highly recommend taking Leadership and Comm. with Dr. LeDuc. His experience in academia, start-ups, and consulting are invaluable for this class. He gives his students a glimpse of his life in these areas and not "text book" examples of leadership. Sandy, co teacher for the class, was extremely helpful in developing our communication skills .

With considerable experience in academia and industry, Prof. Leduc's class is amazing if you are getting job-ready. Amazing lectures with good feedback. Participation in class helps you. Mock interviews, guest lecturers with considerable experience. Also deals with conflict resolution as a class exercise. Really useful for life. Great class overall

Dr. LeDuc has been one of my favorite professors to date. Very kind and caring but also has an extensive knowledge of biomechanics. I always looked forward to going to his lectures, he was one of the few professors that could tell a story and not just read off of the slides. He engages the class with questions and expects you to participate.
Good guy but not a great lecturer. You will have to learn his class for yourself using the textbook.

Very nice professor and person, would recommend taking his fundamentals class. You have a semester long group project as part of the class that is fun but a decent amount of work. Lectures are not too good for learning, but the textbook is very good for the course and he is clear on what will be on the test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He's actually a pretty cool guy.  The material is hard and he doesn't explain it very well, but if you work with him directly he will help you.
Easy class, confusing teaching. Always questions about guest lectures and videos in midterms.

Lots of videos (generally pretty old) and guest lecturers (some interesting, some not so much). Doesn't fully cover material in class that is necessary for homework assignments and quizzes - so if you don't know it, go to recitation or read the textbook. Not that hard to pass - not very strict. Have to do CAE and mousetrap car (group) projects.

Rating system on the site asks interest level PRIOR to class, but during/after? I both got a B and went into ECE b/c he made me lose interest in MechE. Instead of teaching material, always had people coming to class to talk about different programs. Also a jerk - called me out during lec for asking about a non-existent final (registrar not syll).

I had LeDuc back in '03 right after he joined CMU. Despite being new to the program, his advanced mechanics class (cant remember the #) was fantastic. He brought us cookies every class, conveyed the material well, and made class fun. The class also involved a fun team project where I got to analyze the stresses on a human tibia...

Took Concepts and Graph Theory from him... If you've already had a normal class in or have some background in whatever Schaeffer is teaching, and want to gain a more formal, rigorous understanding of the material, his class is for you. Otherwise, wait for someone less pedantic.
He is the man. All you do is write one paper and his standards for writing quality are low. Pretty easy if you show up and listen.
Fun class, really easy. About a month of cool stories about math, and a single large paper about like any topic.

I love him, but he's a horrible teacher. Most all students aren't as smart as him, but he doesn't compensate. He likes abstraction too much to help most students. It's possible to get a good grade in his classes with little work if he trusts that you're bright, however that doesn't help learning either. But try to get him off-topic; he's hilarious.
I took this guy 30 years ago, and he could not teach then.  Seems some things never change. I am a college math professor in spite of the fact I got a "D" in his class my senior year.

Good luck. I came to every class, diligently took notes, read the book, tried the HW... and got nowhere. Dropped the class, took Matrix the next semester, and suddenly everything actually made sense. Maybe it's b/c I prefer numbers and closed solutions to random garbled letters, but maybe it's because no one understood what he was trying to teach.
He is the awesomest man alive. And his wife makes great breakfast.
No Comments

I thought I was the only one that was completely out there. He sounded so smart, looks like albert einstein, and most of the class appeared to follow him. It makes me feel so much better to know that i'm not alone. It was much easier to retake this one in the summertime. I feel bad for wasting my parents money.
By far the worst teacher I've ever had, and that's saying a lot considering this is CMU.  A classic example of a guy who has no business being in a classroom.

I was a sophomore in 1970 in a class with a bunch of grad students.  I don't know that anyone had any idea what was going on, but if you didn't drop the class you got an A.  It was pretty much way above anyone in the class at that time.
Very challenging, and his style is not for everyone. If you love math (and can learn from proofs), he's your guy.  If you need more structure, look elsewhere.
He didn't seem too bad...unfortuneately I have had worse teachers...
Horrible teacher.
Really looks like he enjoys teaching the class. I have no idea what's going on.
Garrett is the kindest person I know. He would help even with material outside of his class and outside of his OH. At times, he would also provide emotional support to get thru the grind.
best prof for concepts period.
great professor!

Great professor, really clear in lecture. Also he does a great job of providing additional help in office hours. Like I do not like math but loved this class so much. The class is easy to get an A in as long as you do the homeworks.

The best professor to take Concepts with. I had to retake the class for Concepts credit after failing 21-128 and my ride with 21-127 was really smooth with Ervin because he is the best at clarifying anything that's confusing and he won't stop until you get it.

Highly recommend Ervin for Concepts! He's an amazing lecturer, goes at a pretty good pace, and is a very kind person. It should be relatively easy to get an A in this class as long as you go to office hours for homeworks and do relatively well on assessments. I had an A up until the final which I didn't study for because of various other reasons.
