The best professor I have ever had. While you can find the specific examples he uses in class in the textbook he provides, the way he lectures is significantly more digestible than any textbook out there. Made 21127 probably the best introduction to discrete math anywhere on the planet.

I had Professor Garrett for both 21122 and 21127 . He introduces topics in math gently and takes the time needed to understand the material, instead of just rushing into difficult problems. I'm so glad I took him for concepts, and the subject itself is quite challenging, but he did an excellent job of teaching it. I would gladly have him again.

Difficult, but thats because the course material is difficult Ervin makes the material as easy and understandable as possible. I ended up with a B in his class, but could quite easily get an A if I went to class or watched the recordings. Office hours are very helpful, and reading the textbook before lecture is the best preparation, and helpful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lots of homework

comment: I had a fantastic experience with him for Concepts, and I really enjoyed learning from him. He's really good with lectures and the class is challenging but very fair. He was always willing to help out and teach when we asked, and he was pretty accommodating too, within reason. Very happy to have taken Concepts with him :)
Garrett Ervin is perfect
Garrett is super nice and accommodating for students. Genuinely to help everyone succeed instead of making us suffer for the sake of learning.

I had an extremely enjoyable time in his class. I also took 21122 with him. He explains content extremely clearly and thoroughly. He makes sure you understand everything both in lecture and office hours as he introduces content at an extremely reasonable pace. He is very approachable and open.

Garret is great! he's covering the materials at a pace that's easy to digest even for people who have no experience with mathematical proofs before. Perhaps the only concern for me is that maybe we're covering fewer materials than other lectures taught. If you are not a math geek, try to get in his class! If you are, you should take 128 instead :P

Math is not my best subject, but Ervin is a good professor. Lectures are standard, but he's good at explaining things if you ask questions. HW is 10ish problems a week due at the end of class. Weekly quizzes. Worksheets from recitation can be really hard. Exams aren't too bad. He's really nice. Gave a friend makeup exam without a note. Cool guy
He seldom smiles but he's super funny... I know it sounds contradictroy, but he's the kind of guy who can make everyone laugh. He is a really nice advisor!!

Jacobo is one of the most uninterested professors I have come across at CMU. He seems to know his content but is horrible at teaching. Never smiles, and does not accomodate students needs under even the worst circumstances. Save your time by looking at course website rather than attending lectures. They are useless.
Lectures are very unhelpful.
Explains everything well but sometimes answers questions in a rude way.
He was totally boring and useless as a professor.  Came off very mean to many of the students, especially if you didn't understand something.  Overall poor quality professor.
Excellent advisor, is genuinely concerned with the well-being of his students. His class was easy due to the content, but he was pretty good at explaining everything anyway. Awesome guy.
he's a good advisor.
This guy is the best ever... trust me HE IS THE BEST
Well, don't make a mistake, because he won't cut you any slack.
No Comments
nice guy
OMG! I learned nothing in this class, it sux0rz but I got an easy A.
got through the class with an A but the 5 hour final was killer.  Don't know if they still do that or not.
No Comments
No Comments

I thought people were exaggerating but this teacher really is the rudest and most unkind person I've ever met. She picks on students and is incredibly egotistical. Her lectures are entertaining when you aren't the butt of her mean jokes. All I've learned about screenwriting is that screenwriters can be bitter + cruel people. Take with someone else.

She could come off as cold and uncaring but she is genuinely a really great teacher who gives good feedback and cares about your ideas. She's not afraid to tell you when something won't work and is strict on certain things but if you abide by her rules she is truly an amazing professor.

I have approved health accommodations of flexible attendance due to various cancer testing and surgeries. Sharon absolutely did not care about these medical accommodations and insisted that attendance was still mandatory despite me being in and out of the hospital. The lack of respect and compassion she showed is truly outstanding. DO NOT TAKE!

Very unempathetic person and professor. You'd think after the negative feedback she's gotten over the long time  spent teaching at CMU that she would try to be better but nope. Class material is sometimes fun but the teaching and feedback is bad. Very unorganized. Also proudly displays the Zi*nist flag in her office right in your face. No decorum.

I dont know why all of the film professors at CMU are the worst but Sharon certainly takes the cake. She is incredibly condescending and expects students to read her mind. Assignments never have instructions until 24-48 til they are due, she gives horrible and honestly nasty feedback, and the syllabus is illegible do not take a class with her.

One of the worst professors I've had. Values her ego over her students and could care less about them. No set office hours, syllabus has no grading criteria, schedule, or policies pertaining to the class. Grades not uploaded online and bare minimum feedback on assignments. I want to ask these kinds of people why even chose to become a professor.S23

I don't understand the bad ratings. Sharon is one of my favorite professors, I took her intro to creative writing class and it's one of the best decisions I've made. She makes class engaging, her activities are fun. She cares greatly for her students and even gave us her phone number, telling us to call her if we're ever in need of help.
awesome teacher! took her for intro to creative writing and she taught me a lot while being very nice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I've had the displeasure of having Sharon 3 times. Disrespectful and unprofessional. Condescending and unkind to students. The guidelines for assignments are unclear (doesn't have a syllabus for papers), and feedback is both nasty and vague. Unable or unwilling to help students better their craft. No extra credit. Will fail you over one late paper.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Sharon. Sucks. This woman is the type of teacher that asks students an open ended question expecting one answer. If the student isn't able to read her mind, she has some back-handed comment that makes them feel stupid. This professor also believes that the world ends with her class. Miss the min two classes, and she will have a tantrum.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Tough, but fair. Good discussion of screenwriting craft. Relevant films shown and analyzed.
I will never take another class with this professor. She is condescending and unable to explain anything and once you don't understand she does not hesitate to make you feel dumb.

She sounds all fun and humorous until you write/do something that doesn't appeal to her. After one meeting with her she said things like, "You shouldn't be a creative writing major," "Your writing is sub-par for the class," "You should find another professor or drop the class." After hearing that she has done this very often, I dropped the class.

Sharon is an excellent professor, writer, and wonderful person. I took several classes with her and appreciate her sense of humor, honesty, and cut-to-the-chase attitude. If you are serious about becoming a better creative writer, you must take her classes.

Lots of fun, very enthusiastic about the material. If you're interested in the writing, she's very approachable and is willing to spend a lot of time helping you develop your ideas. Her outgoing personality made her one of my favorite CMU English Professors. However, she doesn't give out too many A's, but I wouldn't let that fact scare you away!

Jim Daniels, while he gets off topic occasionally, is contagiously passionate about the craft of poetry. And as a person with anxiety, he was very lenient with grading participation after one exchange with him on the subject.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: One of the few professors I've had that I can actually talk to for more than just office hour time.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Most of class is spent discussing what students thought of vague, literary short stories. Pretty much zero time is spent on the actual craft of fiction. The major grade is participation; talking about "how you feel" is the main grading metric. Only worth taking to get to the workshops after it.
thinks he's brilliant and gorgeous but really a solipsistic jerk
he's a good guy. teaches well, doesnt push too hard in any one direction - not sure though if thats good or bad...
No Comments
No Comments
Great class.  I did not find him to be stifling to creativity in the slightest.
No Comments

Really great approach to teaching and reading poetry; was extremely supportive of me when I was trying to figure out whether or not to go into writing.  Highly recommended if you want to work hard and take writing seriously!
conceited, arrogant bore. his poetry is stale bread and he thinks he's better than blake, but he sucks****. make him get a real job.

Lousy teacher. Too conceited to praise anyone's poetry but his own -- but only gives good grades to students who write HIS way. Forget about being creative or experimental if you want to pass. You even have to buy HIS book for the class.
Daniels is a fantastic poet, and his tradition of industrial Detroit really resonates with Pittsburgh readers. Just being around the guy is a pleasure.
He tends to go off-topic a bit much, and his introductory courses are boring and crappy, but his actual workshops are quite useful and he gives very good written critiques of poems.
No Comments

After taking two courses (251 and 455) with him, I kinda believe that he is one of the reasons why Algorithms and Theory is an unpopular scs concentration these years. Not only are his lectures confusing, but he also presents the material in an outdated manner which makes it very hard to appreciate the importance and value of the topics.

no. simply. no. lectures are just him reading from slides. he says everything is trivial, but it is not. homework is much harder than questions gone over in lectures or recitations, so I now live in OH. homework takes at least 15 hours on a really good week.
Doesn't explain well in lecture to build the foundation well enough for the homework questions that takes 20 hours plus each week
Exudes sheer awesomeness
Great and inspirational lecturer. Homework can be hard sometimes, but asking for clarification/hints helped a lot. Exam was not hard.
Super cool guy. You can tell that he REALLY knows what he's talking about, and he's helpful about it, too.
Fantastic class. Hard, but fun. Great homework assignments. Overlaps with 15-453. Suggest taking algebraic structures first. Sutner is very generous and approachable, also.
VERY interesting lecture style.  Provided much needed comic relief to straight man Danny Sleator
Klaus is the man.  He says great things, has a great attitude, and is a martial arts master.
He singlehandedly inspired me to go to graduate school. Absolutely the best professor I have ever seen! Caring, clear, logical, and extremely knowledgable.
Good
Extremely smart. Talks like Arnold Schwarzenegger. Not nearly as intimidating as he seems. Unfortunately, his abstract, fleeting lecturing style is difficult to learn from.
Extrememly smart. Extremely clear. Extrememly helpful. Most influential prof for me.
No Comments
Eats freshmen for breakfast.
Avoid taking. Rude and disrespectful to students.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: He doesn't teach as much as he just criticizes everything that you like.

I think Paolo is a great professor who gives good and honest feedback. He teaches many tools and programs that are intuitive and useful. It is also not difficult to get a good grade as long as you do the work. The projects and lectures all align and help you get used to the material and program quickly. A very funny and amazing professor!
Awesome professor, wish I had him sooner. Definitely keeping an eye out for the classes he teaches next semester!
Good Professor! 100% recommend the class!

Paolo is a real one. He gives good feedback and made learning 3D so easy. Honestly one of my fav professors. I can't wait to keep taking more classes with him next semester! Even the GCS recommends his classes. Funny man, and he is the only reason Ik Substance Painter.

Paolo is such an amazing and chill professor. I really like the vibe of the course and it's one of the very few art courses at CMU where the 3 hour doesn't feel like a drag. He doesn't overwhelm the course with full 3 hour lectures or critiques and understands that students also need to work on their own during class time.

I don't know why there are so many negative reviews against him. I liked him. He is sarcastic and honest. If he doesn't like something, he will say it. He even went out of his way to teach me a program for a personal project outside his normal class hours. Also, in my opinion. He didn't assign too much homework. Easy to get a good grade if you try
Pretty disengaged in teaching, mostly focused on being cynical and getting attention.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Like most CMU professors, isn't aware that what he is doing is a job. Irresponsible and negligent.
Totally checked out and disengaged. I felt nonexistent and like I had no value. Horrible unhelpful experience.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Unprepared for classes. Material is out of date. Constantly belittling students. Avoid.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Very non-existent as a teacher. Teaches via email and online links. Lots of bad experiences from others, too. Surprised he is in academia.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Difficult and constantly offensive. I felt like his behavior was inappropriate and his perspective was bitter. I spent three years studying with him and learned nothing. Ineffective at mentoring and teaching,
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I had Paolo for 2 semesters and I would love to take another class with him. He does a lot of mini projects and makes sure you understand the software he is teaching. He is brutally honest with his crits, but wont really mark you down a grade as long as you try your best (or close to your best.)
Amazingly inspirational and humble human being !!!!
Amazingly inspirational human being !

Unfortunately he doesn't teach this class anymore, but as the department head put it, it'd be a shame for any Chem student to go through CMU not having taken a course with him. I loved his humor and energy and for a topic that's known to be "extremely painful," he made it incredibly easy to understand, although some effort and time were required.

The best professor I've ever had. Makes everything seem simple; if you dont understand something GO TO OFFICE HOURS. THEY MAKE A WORLD OF A DIFFERENCE. He's very likable and funny and makes the content very interesting.

A very good teacher. His jokes are pretty painful, but he's good-humored and likes to engage with his students. If you go to class and pay attention, you'll do fine. The class is definitely difficult, largely just because of the subject matter, but he and the TA are very helpful.
Awesome professor, super funny and engaging. Really nice guy too! One of the best if not the best profs I've had at CMU
Armitage = Amazing  One of the most engaging professors I've had, and I learned more from his class that basically any others
He has great energy. It's incredible that he can make organic chemistry interesting at 8:30 on a Monday morning.
Great teacher
This is the most clear, organized, perfect and boring class you will ever be in. You will know exactly what to learn and how to learn it at all times - no thinking required.
i love him...amazing teacher..great person
No Comments
Great prof, explains things very well and is easily accessible.  He makes an effort and cares about his students.
Not the easiest classes, but if you can get him for a harder one, its definately made easier by him

He is very relaxed and chill if you like that. He explains concepts, but usually its very confusing and I have to use REALCHEM to actually learn the material. The grading is tough, but there are opportunities to get your grade up. Overall I like him, hes sort of just average. Class is easy.
Pretty decent professor. I didn't get much out of lectures but the class is structured so that many resources and practice problems are available.
Great professor that is always willing to give helpful knowledge to students during lectures. Supportive and would recognize all the work students achieved. Would definitely take again.

Prof. Yaron is a nice professor, but not the most engaging of lecturers. However, he provides so many resources  for the class if you don't get anything out of lectures and he is very accessible. Overall, super nice and patient person, but not always the most clear lecturer.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Dr Yaron is a nice guy. He's knowledgeable about chemistry, but he is a boring lecturer. His voice is quite monotone, and if you're not interested in the subject, it will be extremely hard to pay attention. However, it can be done.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Kinda boring but he knows his stuff. Very nice and answers questions well. Overall recommend. Tests are straight forward, no surprises.
Dr. Yaron can be a little dull in his lectures, but he is always more than willing to answer any question during lecture.

He is a professor that knows his topics extremely thoroughly. Explains most of the concepts pretty clearly. Homework and tests are veeeery reflective of the problems we do in class. Tests are EASY. He gives random chemistry facts related to real life situation which makes it really interesting. Seems to not like the New England Patriots.

Yaron's lectures are a little dry but he gets the point across pretty well. He gives notes sheets with basic info on them so the class is very organized. There is a lot of homework in this class, but it relates well to the concepts. There are 3 midterms worth 100 points each, and one of them can be completely dropped or you can drop half the final.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--Would take again

comment: Honestly, I never went to lecture and I'm sitting pretty with a high B. Yaron is extremely dry and not engaging, but don't expect the class to be a breeze if you don't put in the work. A good chemistry background and a good TA is necessary to understand the concepts taught because Yaron often has difficulty explaining basic concepts.

Professor Yaron is pretty clear cut. He explains the concepts well, and lets you know what he is looking for on the homework or on an exam. I think he is very clear and willing to help you if you ask for it. Great class! 10/10 would take again.. I hope I ace this class.

Sometimes he doesn't do the best job of explaining a new concept and has trouble rearticulating it when someone asks for clarification.  The homework assignments often have seemingly nothing to do with the textbook or lectures, and you have to specifically ask the TAs to learn how to do them.  Not an awful teacher, but not always the clearest.

Professor Yaron needs to be more confident! He understands the subject matter and why it matters well, but is too sheepish teaching it.   Also, doesn't do a great job integrating math into the content.
Lectures can be a bit dry, but it's a fairly straightforward class content-wise.

Paul "i hate my students" salvador. The worst professor I have ever had he does not care about his students and is out to get them. very hard to reach outside of class, you have to go through his assistant. does not work to help students.
Hard Class
He is the man!
The only professor who tries to keep you awake and engaged in his lecture.
he likes to play favorites. He can teach, but needs to calm down
he would be much better if he cared about his lectures

I heard many good things about him in Intro, but I was somewhat disappointed by his teaching in Defects. Maybe since it was his first time teaching the course the pace was too fast at first and the homeworks/exams were killer. By the end he got better and overall I'd say he's a good prof! Very funny
Salvador freaking rocked for intro materials, I can only hope he's half as good in Defects of Materials (27-202)
I took him for Intro to MSE and he's pretty fun. Can he teach? Not really. The book does a better job, but he makes class fun. Getting an A takes work, but not much after that.
Good Prof, interesting course.. and so cute. He reminds me of a wuzzle!
This professor made my lazy friend interested in engineering and fmaking it through college, HE IS THE MAN!
EASY!! just try not to fall asleep
Great professor, so funny. Learned a lot too.
I learned so much. Hes a CLASSS ACT!!
I never choose professor again
explains topics very well and love his enthusiasm, tests are never unreasonable
He is fine in general. Most of the time he just reads his notes. He makes some mistakes in lectures from time to time but he posts notes online. The homework is way too hard and time-consuming.

Pisztora is a decent professor, the course itself covers interesting material and it is taught well. The homeworks and tests are a mix of computation and proofs, and are pretty challenging but not too hard. As a teacher, he sometimes tends to ramble and loose track of what he is teaching, and his noted are sometimes difficult to understand.
Heavy accent... but good professor!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Pisztora is probably the best professor I have ever had. His lecture notes are beautifully clear and he provides concise and well formulated proofs for everything he shows you. He also has a great sense of humor. Homeworks are a challenge, but not unreasonable, and tests are easy if you do the homework well.
OMG This is crazy hard and the homework take forever.

I took Matrix Theory with Pisztora in Spring 2015. Lectures are kinda boring but really useful and clear. Some jokes are present in lecture. His notes are amazing. Expect hard and long homework. Midterms are easy if you could finish 10 problems in 50 minutes, usually 8 computational ones and 2 proofs (It's not hard to finish). Final is easy.
Professor Pisztora is a good mathematician who also teaches well
He uses his own handwritten lecture notes which are super clear. His lecture and homework are great to motivate students. Exams are easy!
Amazing

Took this course Fall 2012. He does read from his notes, but they are very thorough and comprehensive. Lectures are clear and amusing at times (he will crack some jokes if you're lucky). Overall very nice teacher and satisfied!

Literally one of the best people to grace the face of the earth. But seriously, he is one of the better math professors at Carnegie Mellon. He actually cares about his students and is willing to help anyone that asks for it.

Illegible handwriting, and everything except homework and tests is handwritten. Very boring lecturer with a strong (but understandable) accent, though occasionally funny if you pay close attention. Recommend any other equivalent probability class (36-225, 36-217, 15-359)

I didn't do well, but it was because I slacked, not because it was a bad professor/class.  Beuth is pretty good.  Lectures can get confusing, but the book explains it well.  It's just applied physics, so if you're not good at physics it might be a bit more difficult.  Tests/quizzes are on the homework.  Do your work, & you'll pass. Don't slack off.
Good instructor
Pretty easy course overall. Grading can be unnecessarily tough sometimes.

He is a funny guy, always bringing in personal anecdotes to lecture.  His class is a bit unclear; one day we are talking about stress/strain modulus, the next day he takes apart a car engine.  Grading is incredibly slow, and there are very few test/quiz opportunities (1 quiz and 1 test + final for the semester).  Tests straight from the homework.

He's an interesting lecturer and was very keen on bringing in hardware to examine (ex: engines, fridge, etc).  He is terribly inconsistent with his grading though. I worked with my roommate on everything and sometimes our grades differed by 40%... So not right.  Regardless he's an okay teacher.
Good teacher, makes the class interesting; however, he is unnecessarily difficult when grading homeworks/quizzes etc.

Very good in Fundamental aspects of solid mech. Also, many tricky aspects related to practical applications and real life approach method to the problem are key learning I received. However, sometimes the questions in assignments are not framed in a easy to understand manner. One has to interpret what is he expecting. Grading is OK.

Beuth is a really boring teacher, the concepts of his class are very simple and he makes them more complicated than they need to be. Despite the simplicity of the class he is a tough grader and takes off points for stupid things such as unit conversions. He also fails to specify what he would like to see on assignments and you get punished for it.
1/2 way through the course, it seems pretty easy to me (though some would disagree).  Most importantly, the material is all covered VERY clearly.  And I don't fall asleep.

Interesting beer and classic car anecdotes to illustrate MechE concepts.  Friendly and reasonable in person.  Fun mousetrap powered vehicle and wrench design projects.  Coursework not so bad if you have a good grasp of physics 1.
tough, but if you go to lectures and do your work, can get an A
No Comments
Highly regard class attendence, which sux
No Comments
Amazing teacher. Proactive and goes the extra step for his students and wants every to understand the basics of economics
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: His class was great!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Prof. Acquisti is one of those people, who make you feel a little bit smarter just by being in the same room as you. He makes Economics so much fun, and his lectures are very interesting. (I legit woke up on time and went happily for all his 9 am lectures - that should tell you something). His assignments really make you think critically. 10/10!
Brilliant Professor with stellar teaching skills. Highly knowledge and humble attitude. The aura of intelligence surrounds him.
One of the best professor's I've had. Great teaching style, keeps you engaged. His homeworks and tests make you think. Would definitely take another class with him.

He is an amazingly skilled professor. He brings life in a dry theoretical subject. It could have been a lot more challenging to understand the concepts of Econ if he would not have taught us.   Thanks.

Possibly the best professor I've been taught by. His classes are well structured, and the homework, while difficult, perfectly complements what he teaches. Also really helpful, prompt and a great person overall.
He is a great professor and an even better person
Great professor. Gives tough tests and quizzes. Don't expect high grades in his Econ course.
Great
Great professor. Very helpful.
he is great
Always assigns lots of readings, and quizzes and tests are challenging.  I learned a lot, though.
Fairly Good professor. He's a great guy, but his Econ class can get sort of boring. His quizzes are pretty difficult too.
Mans that guy bro trust. I talk to him every single day (through VR ofcourse)

Excellent books and lectures. RIP Randy, Thank you for sharing your journey with millions of others. You have shed the light on what matters in life. Thanks again and rest in peace. Regards from Canada

Randy Pausch has taught me more about life than any other professor. The last lecture and the time management videos are incredibly valuable. The wisdom he exudes will stay with me forever. Thank you, Randy!
I both read and watched the last lecture. It was amazing! He couldn't have delivered a better lecture.
I can't attest to how he taught classes; however, I did find his "Last Lecture" inspiring, and his Time Management lecture was very helpful.
I just watched the Youtube "Last Lecture" and was once again moved.  I am going home to hug my wife and kids.
Best prof ever, hands down.  He will be missed.
He was the best prof EVER!!

One of my favorite 3 classes while at UVA. I remember he would walk around the room during class rather than stand at the front.  And after one of our 5-minute (not 6) presentations, I'll never forget he told me "Nice use of humor" (which he pronounced "yoo-mer")
Randy really knows what he is tallking about in the realms of VR and interactivity.  He is actually very supportive once you get to know him better.  Well done, Pausch!
he doesn't know students
No Comments
Good, unless you cross him. Don't do that.
In your face but funny and smart

This professor was disorganized in lectures and distrusting of his students. This course was extremely difficult due to the poor quality of resources he provided, and I have taken calculus before. Exams were disproportionately difficult in comparison to lectures and homework, and he failed to provide adequate resources to prepare for his exams.

Dylan's friendly, but he's often late. He likes using the textbook and its fancy words, which can be annoying if you don't get the math terms. HWs are rly different from lectures, and since he doesn't create the questions, he has to solve them first before helping. Test averages are low, but he drops the lowest midterm & the other two are 25% each.

This was his first semester teaching, so he was still learning how to teach. The first exam was awful and was all trick questions, but the next two exams were fairly straightforward on what the material was vs what showed up on the exam. Overall, he had notes for each lecture but does not explain the topics extremely well.

New but getting better compared to start of class. Agree homework is hard but sometimes very similiar to the textbook example and sometimes not, it not impossible to solve. Exam questions are usually from lecture or homework but I do agree grading is not generous making averages super slow. He is a very nice guy and will be amazing prof in future.

I don't think he's bad as others say. He is definitely inexperienced, but I think he's improved a lot compared to the beginning of the semester. I understand why he makes certain decisions (like placing emphasis on theorems or choosing difficult homework problems), even if I may not like them.

i get what hes trying to execute in class but whatever he teaches in lecture never lines up with what the homework is, homework is 10x harder for the first few units and he isn't great at teaching.

update: failed the class so do what u want with this info, even the final wont save me
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dylan is a nice person but not a good professor. Homeworks are difficult and sometimes doesn't think about the difficulty when he assigns it. Exams always have typos. Grading is very strict and barely get any credit for wrong answers but correct work. I like how he drops lowest midterm but the averages are still low, also be ready to FAIL exams.

Lectures are from the textbook which makes it easy to follow but he makes the homeworks so so hard and the exams as well. When I ask a question he replies "just think about it." He also makes the rubric so poorly making it impossible to get partile credit. I studied 10+ hours for an exam and still got a 30% :( he is also ALWAYS late to class.
Very conceptual questions, very little emphasis on computing derivatives and integrals, more emphasis on reciting theorems.
humorous
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: The homework and the exams are nothing like what we learn in lecture or recitation. I understand during lectures he has a lot of material to get through but you will always walk out being so confused about a pretty simple topic. The tests make up so much of your grade and beware to fail them even if you study.
I walk out of lecture feeling amazing and then I look at the homework and it makes absolutely no sense

Although today is my first time having his class first time, I hate this professor. His voice was like a mosquito then made me confused about what he was saying. Also, the blackboard writing is too thin and messy to be difficult to recognize and then take notes. :(
Moves very fast. Did not respond to my emails. During lecture went on rants about unrelated topics

Very nice guy, probably the nicest professor I've had.  I took him at Pitt and took CS cause it's a good skill to have.  He moves VERY quickly and if not for seeking lots of help, I would've done poorly.  CS in general is based on you working REALLY REALLY hard to understand it (especially if you're a non-major like me)

I have never programmed before and find it very confusing, but there was so much help available in this class that i did very well. Hes a great teacher and I am sad that they are canceling this class. It was a lot of work, but they made it manageable. A+ professor

Jim is experienced and good at what he does. He makes the class interesting, and also REALLY easy if you care. It took me little effort to get an A in this class, and I had a good time when I went. He's a great computer scientist and really cares about the success of his students.
15100 is required for my major, and before being in Jim's class, I thought of it as a just get it done kind of thing....Now, I really do have a strong interest in CS and may minor in it!
No Comments
I probably wouldn't have survived freshman year without this guy and Stehlik.
Jim is the man. Right up there with Stehlik, seriously.  He also taught Fencing, which rocked.  One of my favorite people at CMU as a person and professor.

Jim is a really nice guy and a really helpful teacher.  When you don't understand something, he will be happy to explain it to you again and again until you understand.  His lectures can be alittle hard to follow.  I was sick with the flu and he let me reschedule the test until the next week.
HE IS THE BEST!!!! AND THE BEST MOOSE ;)
No Comments
an amazing teacher
this guy knows his #@$%...take his class
He is so nice and helped me a lot. Always ready to answer my questions and respond to emails really quickly.
15112 is a well run class, especially considering its size. I have learned a lot, and found I never got overwhelmed by homework if I started it early. He cares for the students a lot.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: The class was really good overall. As someone with close to no CS experience, it was a great class to learn the fundamentals of programming.

Good professor, good course.
- CMU CS Academy is used for all homework.
- There is a main site for the course. Easy to find syllabus, schedule, office hours, etc.
- MAJOR FLAW: There is a rather stupid policy that does not allow laptops during recitations.

Lectures are nice and easy to follow. Very knowledgeable and funny. His axolotl is awesome.
One of the best prof, very good lecture, a very nice guy

One of the kindest professors at CMU. Motivated me to keep going with the course even when I wanted to give up. Set up a new system to help struggling students, even came to me for input. Alerted authorities when a racist man verbally abused students leaving Mellon Inst. and showed his support for us directly. Always available for his students
Great professor, very well structured course

Overall a good professor. Based on the way 15-112 is structured, I'm not sure that lecture is even necessary. I got bored sometimes during lecture since he talks kind of slow but was definitely helpful and available outside of class
Used a new method of testing for students and the class was going fine till then. Struggled to submit the quiz and gives me a zero. So unnecessary and messed with my grade.
One of the best professors I've had in my entire life. Super kind, quite funny, and a fantastic teacher all around! I
Amazing caring professor, he's really sweet

You can still learn a bunch, even if you've seen it all before. But make sure you study anyways, or else this class will go from "easy A" to "easy aaaaaaa I got a C!" I went in super cocky because I knew python and had a bad time until I learned my lesson. The good news is Taylor is the nicest prof you'll have and super kind (and interesting too).

He. Is. So. Caring. What kind of professor meets with you on short notice on a weekend just because he doesnt want you to stress about his class? Professor Taylor, thats who. Hard class but 167282/10 would recommend. Puts so much effort into this course its incredible.
Taylor is a great CS professor! He shows photos of his axolotl in class and it's excellent:)

His lectures are really confusing. You can tell he's a nice person and cares about the material but I stopped attending lectures because they were basically useless. The textbook got me through the course.

As someone who only took MODERN BIO because it's mandatory in MCS, I hated every second. Professor Lanni is a kind soul but I learned nothing from his lectures and stopped going. Getting together a STUDY GROUP and a PEER TUTOR is the only thing that barely kept me afloat. I survived on the lecture notes and google. Good Luck.

He's pretty nice and definitely cares about the material, but the lectures can get convoluted and he goes off on tangents sometimes. Tests are most of your grade. The homeworks he gave us were easier than the tests which sometimes got really specific. He's a nice guy and a decent teacher.

(Taken with Lanni and Jarvik) Prof Lanni knows what he's talking about, but it can go too in-depth and convoluted. I recommend going to lecture and exam reviews. His exams are pretty application based which make them harder than typical biology exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He is really passionate about Biology and he knows what he's talking about but he goes off on a tangent almost the entire class. So basically I would say forget about going to lectures. His tests are pretty hard but besides exam there's barely any work.
He is an absolutely awful professor, terrible communicator. Avoid him if you can, although i've heard that all the bio professors are bad
I love him!!!  He is a great professor and I have learned a lot from him. I will remember Dr. Lanni forever.
Kinda just complicates things. just read the text book and don't bother with class.

He's very interesting in Biology, and teaches the class accordingly. If he mentions something, even in passing, he will probably talk about it for 15 minutes, even if it means coming back the next day to do so. He's a good professor though, and fair.

is a nice guy but does goes off on crazy tangents that will probably just confuse you and won't even be on the test. homeworks are really hard and tests are fairly easy, just read the book and your fine. curves are nice too
Goes off on crazy tangents...
No Comments
Honest work = Honest grade.

Tests are hard if you don't fully know the material, and easy if you do. Lenient grader; OH are helpful. Lectures were good enough that I, personally, never really needed the (online) textbook -- can't speak for others though ofc.

Lectures can be hard to follow, but as long as you go to good TA office hours you should make an easy B. Homework isn't too bad, one a week that is not hard to score high on if you go to office hours. Tests are incredibly fair, not made to trick you but rather to check you know the concepts. He is very nice and wants you to learn the material!
The hate for this guy some ppl have is way overblown. Not the greatest professor at CMU by any means but the exams and lectures were clear enough and there wasnt much to complain about.

So bad. I am a math major and lectures made absolutely no sense even to me (and to everyone else I spoke to). Lectures honestly made me feel dumb because I could never follow. The only positive thing is that the course isn't that hard and if you teach yourself some of it, it's not too hard to end with an A.

He taught pretty well and really cared about students.
Exams are hard but normalized in a fair way.

2 in class exams, weekly homeworks, very poor lectures. all lectures are problems straight from the book. unreasonable and not really adaptive to rescheduling exam times and grading

better off finding a substitute class
He's a really bad professor. He doesn't care about teaching you anything that doesn't come directly from the book. Do not take.

Not a great lecturer, and the content wasn't very clear. At some point I thought I didn't have the prerequisites but some students with less seemed to be doing fine. I think if you mostly self - study you should be fine. On a positive note, he has office hours and does seem to be trying his best.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Probably one of the worst lecturers I have ever seen in my entire life. He spends more time looking at his ipad and the ground than at the students even when talking but it's probably because he's literally reading out of the textbook... Don't take his class if you want to learn calculus properly.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Beware, taking a class taught by Andrew Newman entails you self studying this subject for the entire semester. Why? He literally reads off the textbook verbatim during class while talking to the floor. The exams are in no way related to the practice exams he gives out (why even?).
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Going/not going to lectures have the same effect - none. Newman's lectures consisted of him reading off the textbook literally word for word, copying textbook definitions onto the 'lecture notes,' and him awkwardly shuffling around while mumbling into the mic. Tests (hard) also did not reflect the difficulty of the content or practice tests (easy).

References the free textbook we used heavily. Not necessarily a bad thing. Lectures are fast paced, but his explanations are helpful to understanding the concepts. Provided past midterms/quizzes and suggested textbook questions for exam prep. Exams did not contain any surprises. Had to spend time out of class reviewing notes/textbook.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Andrew Newman reads off the textbook for his lectures and enjoys giving midterms that do not reflect the course material (in one instance, he made a problem not covered in class/hw worth 15% of the midterm). He provides little to no review material and thus it is very difficult to know what to study. It would be more effective to study on your own.
Nice Prof

18100 has been a hard class historically and I'm so glad the stars aligned that I took the class while he was teaching it. Lowkey lectures can be learnt on your own with the slides but I attended it for Jimmy's good vibes. A big softy who genuinely cares for the students + made the class a lot easier = definitely take it if he's teaching.

He's so nice!! He's always talking about how you need to truly learn how to think and not just memorize material, and I think he delivers on teaching his students how to be creative thinkers. When I got sick, he was super accommodating too.

Not the best lecturer. Has an accent and tend to lower his voice as he gets to the end of a sentence. HOWEVER, he genuinely cares about his students learning and will go to great length to explain things to you if you go to office hours. Overall very reasonable professor and a great man.

Jimmy is a god amongst men. He preaches the light of knowledge to those left in the darkness. Jimmy could create life with his sheer will if he so pleases.  Jimmy's existence has accelerated the advancement of society tenfold. If aliens came to Earth, they would bow to him in reverence. I am a changed man after taking his class.
Excellent lectures, but labs can be time-consuming or frustrating at times, but TAs offer lots of support.
Great professor and very knowledgeable. Talks about the relevance of material!
Jimmy is my boi

Teaches the recitation for this course. Extremely good at explaining concepts and problems. 10 minutes with him will give you complete understanding of the concepts from a particular problem. Good at pep talks. Tests are very hard. (It's a weeder course.)
Best Professor Ever!
great course and not so much homework
This is the real ultimate proffessor! If you haven't had his class, you better get a life.
worst professor ever, i couldn't understand a word he said
This professor refuses to offer feedback, instead urging students to purchase his book.

Favorite professor. Teaches a lot, and if you listen will help you become a better designer. Wants you to succeed, but you need to put in the work, because you are an adult, and he won't do it for you.

If you want to learn how to draw and you are disciplined and committed, this is the right class. Prof Baskinger is smart and will demand the best from you but isn't this what college should be all about?
Excellent teacher. Hard but fair and if you work hard you will learn a lot. Not for people who wnt to malinger or be coddled.

Mark has a great sense of humor, often cracking jokes during class. He is a very talented and skilled drawer and knows what he's talking about. Expect to draw incessantly in your sketchbook; Mark likes clean, complete, and well-crafted drawings (and lots of them). He is an excellent source for specific feedback if solicited.

Baskinger is the coolest teacher ever. He is a good balance of professional, personable, and humorous. His relation with Matt is charming and the duo often makes the class chuckle. Mark is very skilled and knows what he is talking. He wants you to succeed but you will have to want to work for it as well.

He's a great professor, He knows what he wants and wants you to get better really bad.  He is just too cool to admit how much he cares. As long as you give an honest effort, he will respect and help you immensely.
no comment
Pretty impressed with himself but after a semester it remains unclear why.
He's really hard at first and pretends to hate everything but he's a REALLY great teacher once you are able to talk to him about your work. Also very funny.
No Comments
No Comments

No one deserves the the cool sunglasses icon more.  The guy's awesome... but not easy.  He won't pretend to like anything you do.  And he may rip it off the wall and stomp on it.  But all in good design fun.  CUBES!
not easy class. Be careful of this course.
He is boring but very nice. His quizzes are based off of what he says during lectures, but his voice will put you to sleep.

Absolutely adorable. Kind of spaced out and unpredictable, but he is so sweet and means well. Go to class, lots of his test questions are about examples discussed in class that aren't in the book. Tests are open book, but study anyway.

Teacher is very clear on concepts, knows the material, and doesnt just teach from the powerpoint like many other professors.  Assignments are relevant and on track, and most of the time, interesting. The kind of teacher that you choose to learn from, not to get an easy A.  The quizzes and homework are hard. Take notes, powerpoint not enough.
While the TAs are crap, that is not his fault. He is very approachable after class and during lectures is very clear on his points and helpful to questions.
The way he lectures the class, I have absolutely no idea when to take notes. This contributed to me dropping his class after half a semester.
Worst lecturer ever.  The tests are really pointless and the undergrad TAs randomly deduct points.
This guy introduced his "Intro to Intel" class by talking about his cats for 20 minutes. It was really boring.
He tells you lectures are optional, TAs grade easily and tell you what to study, if you read the book that he wrote and posts online then you'll get an A
Such a nice man!! He is so cute and funny.
The NICEST, sweetest most helpful prof ever!  The Santa Clause of the psych department.

Class is a joke, frustrating only because such pointless material can actually be made somewhat difficult.  Writes (poorly) his own text, which is only available online.  Takes it personally that no one goes to his painfully boring lectures.
Rode to fame on H. Simon's coattails.  Meanspirited and insecure.

I took a Russian language class. It seems like he may be better for his history and film classes. I found that he can be judgmental which shouldn't be the case when someone is teaching a language. I wasnt a huge fan of his methods for language learning, which included memorizing long poems and reciting them every class. Tests/homework are easy tho.
BEST PROFESSOR EVER TAKE HIS CLASS WHILE YOU CAN BEFORE HE RETIRES!!! HE IS SO NICE AND THE BEST CLASS EVER!

Best Prof ever! Called us 'sweety' in class, but was always willing and able to help with difficulties in grammar, comprehension, vocab, etc. This course is sure A as long as you show up and do the small amount reading/writing assignments he asks for.
Awesome teacher, one of my favorite people at CMU. Really cares about his students.

Very friendly professor! ie- when student falls asleep he asks if they need coffee. Class trips to concerts and opera were fun, although in class all you do is watch movies and make presentations about books you do not have to read (just sparknote it).

He is an amazing professor. He really wants you to do well, and at the same time is very funny. He however changes the syllabus frequently and all this means is that you have to do a lot of last minute work. But, if you do the work, you will be rewarded with A's easily.
My favorite person at this school.  Just make your work "maximum beautiful"

Dr. Kats is a professor that cares a lot of about the students and wants them to learn by any means. This is why he takes his own time to create classes that go outside in Pittsburgh and finds actually informative and relative videos for us to enjoy. It was more fun than work for this class.
The best professor at CMU, by far, cares the most about his students, makes the effort
best/easiest prof at this school!  Coolest Guy ever. "is good"
teaches really interesting classes, on pretty unique subjects with a very broad topic range
easy
Intimidating at first, but really a good guy

Having had a mediocre writing program in my high school, I learned to write well in Professor Rectenwald's class. Every single paper I've written since then, I've incorporated what I learned from him.  The 76-101 Interp & Argument class was excellent -  fascinating readings and class discussions that sharpened our intellects.  Highly recommended!
Great course, great prof. Quite funny.
left-wing hack; other than that his class was very enjoyable

Does he view himself as some kind of tortured genius, or does he just come off that way? Either way, he's a very...interesting person. Defintiely worht taking a class from, if you can understand his sense of humor.
excellent. this class opened my eyes to history, culture, literature, england, science, and more
outstanding, knowledgeable, nice.
Taught Mechanical Engineering seminar classes, which was an absolute waste of my time. Why is he still teaching it? We did very close to nothing, learned very little.
excellent!
Extremely Intelligent
excellent class, interesting material, lots of reading but very informative.

A nice enough guy, get to know him.  But the subject he teaches- "Science Studies", or the sociology of science- is ridiculous and boring.  Lots of very difficult readings (most people don't read them anyway).  But it's interp, there's only 3 essays.
He provides arrogant/snide comments when grading papers and makes crude references in class - it's horrible. There are many 76-101 sections... pick another.

Maybe my biggest complaint about Howie is his absolute lack of flexibility, whether that's delivering 10 min screeds any time a student is late to lecture or completely refusing late work under essentially any circumstances. I missed 40% of a HW because I needed another 15 min to run the code on the hardware and that just wasn't an option.

Intro to Robo would be super cool if it was half the work. Labs are exhausting, but interesting and hands on, but also graded super unforgivingly: the difference between a 100 and a 35 is narrow. Lectures & HW are often only barely related to labs. This course could be 2-3 courses. Also, 'mid semester' grade was returned 2 weeks before end of term.

Awful organization! Weekly home works take up to 2 months to grade, regrade requests take up to a month to handle... The professor literally does nothing outside lecture. All gradings, labs, and even exam-writing are done by overworked and underpaid TAs. 
Lecture and course content wise it's actually pretty good.
Professor lectures about his research and gives homework about material uncovered in lectures. Course staff are really disorganized and confused.

Most of these reviews are old, or for when he taught intro to MechE, but I took his Intro to Robo class and had a great time. He is an engaging lecturer and very approachable. He has high expectations from his students, as all good professors should, and provides the proper resources for his students to succeed.

this professor does not seem to have any clear idea of what he is teaching. i dont think he is happy with his job, because he is depromoted or something. i mean, he is in robotics department, but hes teaching intro to mechE? what's up with that??? DO NOT TAKE THIS GUYS CLASS!!!!

I took his General Robotics class, and wow he is one arrogant guy (no wonder why he didn't get tenure from the MechE dept). I did learn quite a bit, did well in the class, but found it "strenuous"... Lectures are so-so, but kept interesting by his (good/bad) personality.

i thought he was funny at first but i soon realized that he's just an annoying person who can't really teach well.  u don't really have to go to class though, b/c his lectures are crap and the book is really helpful.  i imagine wickert is a better intro to mechE teacher
Not very forgiving or very helpful, don't sweat not taking notes, just read the book and go to recitation.  f you like robots though ths is your man.

He's a robotics freak, so that's all you'll ever hear about. Doesn't so much teach the material as copies Wickert's notes on it onto the board (luckily it's all easy, and the book is pretty good). Funny, but pretty arrogant and annoying at times.

I don't know what the guy who posted before me was smoking. Choset is very impolite and makes fun of students in class. He brags about his course, but it is definitely no big deal. His personality is just very arrogant and irritating. Fun class though.
This guy is awesome! This class is better than sex. (If you don't believe me, do a google search on  howie choset  sex god).
I found Professor Masters highly intelligent, very, very helpful, and a pleasure.Very good experience!

Hilary knows the craft very well and will be frank and honest with you about your writing ability.  Some people can't handle the criticism, but also some people shouldn't really be writing professionally and should find that out sooner than later. Unfortunately, he isn't always effective in communicating with students as to what he expects of them.
I enjoyed this class and his style of teaching.
No Comments

Honesty and serious effort, not sentimentality, are what matters in Hilary's courses.  These values derive from the respect that he demands that students give each other (and indeed that he fosters).  Not to seriously consider a writer's work and to offer genuine criticism would be belittlement.  Hilary is serious about the craft and shows it.
No Comments

If he doesn't like you, he will encourage the class to join him in mocking you.  He holds his students to his own standards of morality and taste.  He does not care about helping students find their own voice, but instead tries to mold them to his.
Hilary's fair but only if you show a serious commitment to the course and craft.  Otherwise, you might as well drop.
Hilary's the archetypal sage American writer.

Hilary is a fantastic raconteur and professor of writing.  At first, you might think he's a jerk in workshops, but that's because he's very serious about what he does and expects you to be too.  Expect no coddling, but he is generous with his time--just ask.  Very funny.
participate, don't make excuses, and work hard
He takes no crap, but genuinely cares about writing and his students. One of the good guys.

Absolutely unhelpful, and part of a group of teachers who do everything they can to hurt their students.  Does not teach art history, instead brings wine to class and wastes everyones time.  Do not take this $3,000 class with a teacher who does not teach at a school where art is considered a joke.

Contemporary issues forum= mandatory visiting artist lectures. She speaks like she's reading a boring and incoherent textbook. good class to nap in! Would not take a class of hers out of my own volition
boring. go to her class. you get a nice nap, and attendance credit.
Nothing in her class was connected and her lectures mostly consisted of her telling us about what she's achieved in life-very annoying.
totally confusing and ditzy. pretentious and unprofessional.

Ugh. Dropped it 3/4 of the way through even though my grades were good. Its TERRIBLE. She's extremely boring and her tests are only (extremely) hard because she is incapable of making any sense or even writing in gramatically-understandable sentences.
Elaine Baby, you are too fabulous for words. You put the "mod" in Postmodernism.
elaine is really nice and silly and her class is super easy.
Oh Elaine, Im sure you are still trying to figure out how to use a zip disc, too bad those are obsolete now!

If this hadn't been a required class for my major I would have dropped it on the first day. She reads slavishly from her notes in a very boring, monotonous way and provides superficial, repetitive commentary on her innumerable slides as she plows thru the material. Very uninspired, no classroom discussion. I also suspect she doesn't know her stuff.
No Comments
Elaine Baby, you're fabulous.

do not take organizational behavior with Fichman. His tests (multiple choice) are extremely vague as is his grading for homework. His lectures are helpful but slightly rude in his behavior to students. He means well but his personality is not suited for most. If you have the option, I strongly encourage you take 70-311 with different professor.
Rude. Very difficult tests. Lots and lots of reading and memorization.

He was fairly rude to several people who were trying their best to participate this semester. He says the tests aren't graded on keywords, but that's exactly how they're graded. It's good that he drop one test, because you'll study very differently after the first one.
inconsistent

I took Organizational Behavior with Professor Fichman. He is a great teacher, and seems to knows his subject material better than anyone else. I highly recommend him. However, just as a note of caution, one must be really careful while writing emails to him, as the replies are often harsh, and public rather than private.

Grading was tough, because it literally meant memorizing pages and pages worth of reading, IMO. The readings were long, and participation was graded harshly. Exams were based on 150 points. So a single mistake == minus 5 (deviation from what they expected(!)) for 3+ questions basically means B. Not satisfied with the outcome. Learnt lots though.

Not very good at giving feedback: the course content (for OB) seemed like common sense, but did not do well on exams or cases - and I don't know why. Very demanding of attendance and participation, cold calls for hard questions sometimes and looks for very specific answers. Has strong opinions, but you learn to just take them with a grain of salt.
Tries to press personal opinions on students.
Smart, fun class.  Difficult though.
No Comments
the guy's got his faults but all-in-all not a bad guy
No Comments
Worst teacher ever with horrible class structure
A prof that actually cares about his students! Gave us the skills to work on real-world problems. The Excel sessions rocked!
The best finance professor I have had at Pitt and one of the best profs ever. I learnt more finance in his class than my previous 4 finance classes combined.
Great professor. Very down-to-earth. Focuses on the basic, big ideas and makes sure you know them cold. Brought in great guest speakers.
Amazing prof and amazing class. Showed us how to analyze what's going on in the real world. Really cares for his students. The best elective class I've ever taken.
The best prof I have had this sem and a really nice and approachable person. The best quantitative course I have taken at the uni.
Really great prof. Very helpful and approachable. Arranged for several amazing guest speakers and even got a company to sponsor a project competition for us.

Very demanding prof. But, you learn a lot in his course. Like other posters said, don't screw around with him. He failed 10% of the class. Arranged for several excellent guest speakers. Very helpful -- gave lots of contacts for internships/jobs. If you take his courses, work hard, learn a lot and do well. Or, don't take a course with him at all.
Really tough but fair professor. Don't take his class if you are going to blow it off. He will fail you. He advised several students to drop the course. Those that did not, flunked out

Prof. very interested in the subject and a reasonable guy. Has very high expectations. His courses are hard, but you learn a lot from them. His courses are not for wimps or those with weak quantitative skills.

Incredibly knowledgeable professor. Course was very applied. Lots of cases/problems solved in Excel. Great prep for consulting interviews. Has lots of industry contacts. He's approachable and willing to help the top students land internships. He is tough but fair. Don't try to screw around with him.

This guy has THE most screwed up grading system EVER. He's a great guy on a personal level, but he's a horrible teacher. The whole course is set up for you to fail. You can spend days working on the homework and not get anything correct. In class, he does really simple examples, but the homework and tests are crazy-hard. Avoid at all costs!
notorious for pressuring students to drop out if their work doesn't match her style, often dismisses students' work as trash, and her project advice changes daily, leaving her expectations unclear

you will never understand what she is saying, she'll take you on a long journey that seems like you'll end up with helpful points by the end of it, but it always ends in nonsense. if your style or work doesn't align with your tastes, i wish you luck. extremely micro-aggressive as well.

Horrible. Don't take her class, take a semester abroad if you u can. Does not know how to give real feedback and has no real world experience. Her projects change every year and are a hit or miss. If you get a bad project then be prepared to lose your sanity and a lot of sleep. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS

Known to make students cry and encourage them to drop out of the program. If you are a gifted designer but aren't repackaging the kind of design she likes, you're in for a rough time. Openly prejudiced towards other disciplines and tracks.

Lives up to the The famous rumor she knocked over a freshmans project from the table to the ground. She left saying its probably better than it was before shes rude and cant tell the difference between asian girls nor does she try. I cant say she is not a good designer but def does not have the personality quality of a professor.

Be prepared to answer the question, "So how would you happen upon this?" or "Where does this product live?" literally every class. She will give feedback on your project to you one day, and say the exact opposite the next day.
Disrespectful, unkind, and unpleasant. Gives unconstructive criticism and meaningless feedback. Discourages passion for design.

she has her favorites, also won't give you feedback until the very end, when its just too late to do anything .... also a direct quote from freshman yr "make sure you drink lots of water", this was her only advice before the entire class pulled an all-nighter before the project deadline
she has a serious attitude problem, and needs to get a real design job before she continues forcing students to do pointless projects.

she means well, but she's really hard to understand, and is more interested in the experimental than the practical. she also has a hard time giving constraints to a project and sometimes they are unreasonable, for instance we were assigned a video project to be displayed in a gallery, but she get a gallery or see if we had access to video cams. :(

You better agree with her.  Not interested in the practical aspects of design, Kristin is more into the theoretical crap.  Not hard to understand - she went straight from university education to university faculty - never had a real-world job.
the semester was very structured but her focus was way out there and she seemed extremely interested in the meaning of projects. she is a 'driven' person and expects you to be too. creative.

Took it during the summer. Homework due every day except for exams but very lenient on due dates/extensions. Professor is friendly, but is against releasing solutions to exams and homework sets. Basically have to figure out your own mistakes and try to do better next time, which was frustrating for a subject like physics.
Amazing professor, he's been teaching for quite a while so he has a grasp on how to communicate the concepts effectively.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: He laughs a lot at his own jokes.
The class is sorta boring and you really need to pay attention to grasp whats going on. Tests are almost identical to practice but the final was pretty tough.

Lectures are entertaining, but you don't learn much. He's a nice, funny guy, and he's enthusiastic about the material he teaches, but you learn most of the material from reading the textbook and trying to do the homework. Exams are exactly like the practice exams.
Amazing teacher. Would 100% recommend him as a teacher and this class. Very into what he teaches which make the class fun.

Absolutely hated this class.  He is horribly inefficient and unorganized and he babbles to himself in lecture.  He has you complete these little quizzes in lecture to check attendance, but he barely covers half of the stuff on the page.  His antics in lecture aren't funny either; it is just plain annoying.
babbles to himself, lectures worse than useless
The class is hard and boring. He murmurs to himself and you cant hear what he's saying.

Very entertaining! Uses a fire extinguisher in class to demonstrate flux, totally awesome.  He's friendly, cool accent and tests are challenging but fair.  He also TA's for other classes, so is able to teach on a personal level too (in office hours).
This guy is funny! Go in to his office hours, he's very nice on the personal level, and is willing to do as much as he can to help
Hilarious. Kept class interesting. Tests weren't easy, but they weren't hard either. They were fair. If you study, do the homework, and go to class, you'll do fine.

Took the racism freshman seminar where the class was 'co-taught' by him, Richard Purcell, and Mariana Achugar. He has a very loud and dynamic personality, which I found a bit cringe as he'd take over (read: interrupt) the conversation from the two and talk for looong amounts of time. Class was pretty easy, most people didn't really participate.

Prof Slate is AMAZING! His classroom is a really friendly, respectful environment that is perfect for in depth discussions or debates. The class wasn't very difficult, but it definitely made me think, and I would recommend it for anyone to take. It is obvious when Prof Slate teaches that he loves what he does, and its infectious!

This is not a history class. It makes too many untested sociological/ political assumptions. I feel like it teaches you what you should think in this western mainstream political and historical rhetoric, so I am actually quite annoyed by that. However I would say the professor is nice.

Professor Slate is the best. He's the nicest guy ever, and he really makes an effort to get to know his students. His lectures are really interesting. Definitely take as many courses with him as you can.
Easygoing guy, very enthusiastic about his subject. His class can make you feel like you're in grade school again (he calls everyone "friends" and emphasizes partnering up) but overall a good prof.
Awesome teacher, he knows his stuff.
Awesome, awesome guy with an infectious passion for what he teaches. Even if you've disliked history before, he'll make you like it.
This prof is so good that at the end of every lecture, you just want to stand up and in your best Mortal Kombat voice yell "Slate Wins!......Flawless Victory."
Great professor who was clearly very passionate about his work. Very understanding and engaging.

The class was Civil Rights and World History. Professor Slate is a great guy and teacher. He is extremely helpful and his TA Kaaz is really helpful too. I recommend taking his class. As long as you put in effort,  you will pass with a good grade.
Amazing professor, very interested in the topic. Makes an effort to get to know his students, so take advantage of his office hours! Attendance is not taken, but you'll miss A LOT if you skip.
Hands down the best professor I've ever had, has become a role model of mine. Passionate and inspiring; he truly loves history and his students.

Dr. Rabin laid out his expectations very clearly at the beginning of the course. Come to lecture, do the problem sets, meet with TAs for homework and exam study, and you will be fine. Tests are open book and TAs basically tell you what's going to be on the test, and so will Dr. Rabin. People who don't follow his advice are the ones whining.

Why would someone like this want to be a teacher? He obviously hates people and is completely condescending. Try to avoid this guy, or hope that karma is coming for him soon. Worst prof I've ever had at CMU. You'll work really hard for a low grade and be completely demoralized in the process.

I can only guess he is a great researcher because he is a miserable human being who thinks he's a god and looks down on everyone. CMU needs to do something to get teachers like this out of the classroom and back into a lab somewhere. Teaching is obviously not the right job for him, he is truly mean, condescending and uncaring. Avoid at all costs.

Not at all understanding. Doesn't respect students, is extremely stuck up and not at all accommodating. Doesn't teach well and is not at all coherent when he speaks. I don't know why CMU still allows him to teach

Felt it wasn't taught in a conducive environment. The various aspects of the class were not tied together at all either. While labs were engaging, homework didn't seem to apply much. In addition, tests were not reflective of learnt material from HW or Labs. Also, grading rules were absurd, and it was possible to fail with B-D avg.
Genuinely a mean guy. I feel like he is in the wrong profession.

A very strict professor which made this one of the toughest classes for the major. However, he does pay attention to who is struggling in (or skipping) his classes; he helps those that seek him for additional help. You will have a tough time, but getting through will make toughen & ready you for the final year.

Seems intent on making class incredibly hard by not giving instructions until after the fact, where he then criticizes our mistakes. Has a drill sergeant mentality-hates anyone that is late or absent to class (has given punishments for this).Extremely intimidating guy. Basically makes the class a struggle-expect one or two all nighters a week.
He is just horrible. Unfair grader. He abhors unwelcoming language. Try to avoid his class in any means necessary. At least one all-nighter a week guranteed.
Fantastic professor, though also a fantastically hard grader. Worth the pain.
The class was just unfairly graded.  I must say I learned a lot, but one of my very few Cs at CMU.
Heat transfer, the most feared MechE class, and it wasn't fun. In retrospect he did teach well, but the class wasn't a walk in the park.

I had a very bad experience in Professor Telmer's class. He assumes that you already know finance lingo and appears that not really care about the success of his students. He is also a rude person in general. He yelled at me for not know the answer to one of his quiz questions. Did not enjoy this class at all.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Telmer's class is difficult and a lot of work. However, he and his TA's are always there go guide you with problem sets and studying for exams. A difficult class, especially if you fall behind, but if you can keep up it's fairly straightforward. Pop quizzes were only for attendance purposes- not actually graded.

There is a quiz every Sunday due at midnight, a few pop-quizzes and a few midterms. By no means is he an easy professor (I think the average for the first midterm was a 55), but there is a significant curve and if there is a weirdly worded question he may give the whole class credit. Ultimately, you do have to put time into his class.
Telmer's Financial Economics class was one of the best courses I took at Tepper.
avoid him at all costs

Really tough if you aren't interested in / understand Finance. He assumes you know the lingo / language of finance within the first week, so if you don't really get it, you'll be lost the whole time. He's also rather dull in lecture, easy to fall asleep or not pay attention if you're not interested. Really hard exams, too, but good curve.
Full of contradictions. He doesn't know what he is teaching at all.
Could not answer students' questions most of the time.  Did not prepare the class well.  He was easy on the grade though.

He should be better prepared for this class. It seems he does not care about teaching et all. Some students were better prepared to teach the class than he was. They should hire these students to teach instead of him.
No Comments
Very rude. He took more than three motnhs to post grades.
he was really mean to me I didn't like this class it was not fun and extremely hard. I would rather go 12 rounds with prime mike tyson then take this class again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Very knowledgeable and technical. He can give the lectures and OH with no mistake/pause without referring to any notes.

Quite a lot of time needed to be dedicated to excel in continuous time finance. However, Professor Iyer is decently rigorous with the notations and introduction of new ideas. The latex notes are very helpful when reviewing and preparing for exams. He and the TA are always available during office hours to answer questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: The continuous time part is just soooooo hard to understand. He always made typos which made the proof even more confusing and the handwriting is awful

21-370 is a discrete class. While I get the materials in the first 3/4 of the semester, I'm destroyed in the last 2-3 weeks when he RUSHED through materials in CONTINUOUS time (beyond 370). He seems to just wanna be done with the class than to let students LEARN about anything. Don't respond well to feedback. Require to code which is not a pre-req.

He is not always prepared for lectures and has very messy handwriting. Sometimes he tends to go all over the place without logistics and order. He's not good at asking for feedback and response to them. Maybe he has a higher expectation for us with good intentions. But I hope he can set a higher standard for himself in teaching FIRST.

Iyer's class is "unnecessarily hard", says a math genius here. Multiple phd students here also think his homework problems (freshmen level class) were made only to be hard but not at all practical or useful. The technicality of his courses takes away the fun of math, they are discouraging instead--difference between challenging and technical.
Awesome professor. Really great at lecturing and has an amazing sense of humor. Homeworks and exams were fairly challenging, but you learn so much from them. Would strongly recommend.

I was taking an honors class but even for that he tends it in a manner than makes it more difficult than usual. Despite making it one of the hardest classes I've taken, Iyer is fun and does a good job teaching.
Hardest professor ever but he's awesome. I got a C and I don't regret taking it at all.
Lots of work for a 9-unit class, but I most certainly learned linear algebra.  Topics at the end (eigenstuff --> spectral theorem) were a bit rushed, though.  Take if you're up for the challenge.
Great professor. Very inspiring. She really takes time to know her students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: This was a very useful class.  Prof Finger made it interesting and helped me when I needed guidance.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This is an amazing professor. I learned a lot in this class.  It was really interesting also.
This was an amazing class.  Prof Finger is an inspirational teacher.  Overall it was a great experience.
Best professor I have ever had. She genuinely cares about her students and will fight against the administration to make sure you have a great time inside and outside of her class.
rapid proto was a great class, pretty easy
Fantastic teacher.
No Comments
sfinger was always around to help, even at 2 AM.  she was a great advisor, even when she wasn't supposed to be advising you.  she went out of her way to make sure you know what was going on.
No Comments
