Very engaging teacher.  Friendly, concerned with every student's performance, and has great class projects and interesting homework.  Keeps late hours and is always available to give help on homework.  More like a student than any other professor I've had
This professor expects all students to self study from textbooks.

This class is HARD.  WE learn little in class - Most is out of class or in recitation.  More like an honors chem class then an intro - Often his problems require advanced knowledge in other areas (Physics 3?!)

expects students to learn everything outside of class, uses class for zany explosive demos that don't do much for learning.  Try getting another professor if you want to learn this stuff.  When I took it the final(s) was optional.  The final allows you to retake any of the unit quizzes if you did poorly.
Be ready to work on you're own, and accept that this will not be your standard chem class.

He honestly cares about teaching, and he's darn good at it. Although he has a little too much faith that people will research a topic he touched on with a demonstration on their on time, he's always willing to answer questions during office hours. And really, who can resist the combination of explosions and a Scottish/Australian? accent?
best teacher i ever had
very fun teacher....always doing demonstrations, but sometimes he doesnt really explan exactly what he is demonstrating! Need to do a lot of learning on your own, but at least you have fun in class.

I knew when I stepped into 09105 the first day and the class started with an explosion of a hydrogen filled balloon that this was one great teacher.  Thumbs up to his innovative and one-of-a-kind teaching, thumbs down to his clarity(not to do with the cool accent).
Absolutely an amazing and interesting teacher. He style of teaching is phenomenal with his hands on approach and demonstrations.
great accent, fun teacher, take any class you can get with him
One of the greatest teachers any university can have.

I took this just to fill a requirement and now I am considering majoring in neuroscience because of this class! I found it so interesting and looked forward to lectures. Professor Holt explains things so well and is funny which makes lectures interesting. There are no midterms or finals, just weekly quizzes and projects which was a plus!!!
Super easy course aaawesome professor 10/10
This was an interesting class.  I enjoyed hearing Dr. Holt's insights.
Dr. Holt is the best. I took BFOB with her and there was no exams, just weekly quizzes with two PowerPoints worth of material and 4 problem sets. Great class and I still talk to her even a year later
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Class is rather boring and the material isn't exactly the most interesting for students who have never really been interested in science. It's technically a psych course but the majority of the material is biology-based (hence it's name). Can be challenging if you don't attend lecture because material is usually based on add'l notes from lectures.
The class was fascinating, and she teaches it very well. There was a lot of reading, but it was mostly manageable. She's an excellent teacher in general.
Interesting class, fair grading system. She explained the material clearly and was always available for questions after class.
I am baffled that anyone would find this Professor physically attractive or interesting. I have found her to be abrasive and cold in and outside of class.
No Comments
No Comments
excellent teacher-very knowledgeable, and helpful

David comes off as a bit off-putting at first but overall is a really good person. When students started getting stressed, he relaxed his grading criteria and removed some projects. It is also standard in his class to be able to resubmit assignments for a higher grade. In 158, he also brought in a lot of guest speakers from the field.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Boevers is not warm or welcoming, nor would he claim to be. Often, he reacts to someone reaching out exactly as one would fear he would (with a rude, bothered attitude)
David is one of my absolute favorite professors. He has so much knowledge, and is willing to help, you just gotta listen.
Apart from his sometimes-monotone inflection, David is a great lecturer who is always willing give advice or help to those who ask. He presents his lectures in a clear, easy-to-follow manner.
Apart from his sometimes-monotone inflection, David is a great lecturer who is always willing give advice or help to those who ask. He presents his lectures in a clear, easy-to-follow manner.
David is an amazing teacher. He has a wealth of professional knowledge to share.  If you really want to know, ask. He is more than willing to help but one must be willing to listen.

David taught me more than any other teacher at CMU. Those who think he isn't fair probably weren't playing fair to begin with. He is more than leaniant, and is a wealth of knowledge for those smart enough to pay atention.
Anybody who thinks David Boevers is unfair had better wake up and smell the coffee before they get into the real world. It's college. It's supposed to be hard.

David Boevers constantly berates anyone within hearing distance.  It is the practice of the program to give critical feedback, however this man takes it to a mean and vindictive end.    His attitude is incredibly inappropriate in our pre-professional training program.

This ass is the reason that I am no longer in this school. I did all the work for his class but it was not "up to professional standards". **** that! His monotone voice put me to sleep all the time. i felt he played favorites. . . .and obviously I wasn't one.
A fair teacher who is willing to be flexible for students who have earned it.

I took 15-123 (Effective Programming in C and Unix) with Professor Hoffman in 2010, and I must say that I consider him a truly great teaching professor. The students with an opposite opinion about this man are either completely disinterested in learning technical skills directly applicable to the industry, or just despise programming altogether.

This was a fairly easy introduction to Java from a pretty cool professor. He has a lot of industry experience and often tells interesting stories.  No mandatory attendance for class or recitation and a cool guy...take a class with him.

forgot it was a java class sometimes and would start teaching C, which was kinda humorous. pretty funny guy, mostly nice, although can be rather blunt when you meet with him. pretty decent professor overall, which i guess says something since i hate computer science

He is an outstanding professor.  He really took the time to explain a lot about how Java works under the hood and provide details far beyond syntax.  He used great relevant examples and good analogies to explain everything.  His class was also well organized with a lot of interesting programs to learn how to write Java code.  Take professor Hoffman
He gives a lot of extra credit. The homework and exams are pretty easy if you pay attention.
Hoffman is awesome.  He has some great stories and is just an all around good guy.

Good guy, funny, helpful w/little things that might prop up. 15-113 is pretty basic stuff, but C can get a little tricky for those without a CS background. Posts all the notes online, assignments are basic (and are basic variations of the same thing each semester). Final exam is cake, midterm somewhat harder. 1/2 pay attention, do the HW, get an A.
I was well prepared for the class in general; he's hilarious.  I don't even like computer science!
Not particularly well prepared for classes and doesn't make them particularly interesting (I've had him twice now).
well..i didnt fall asleep in this class..so i guess it was ok..but he gives the hardest midterm ever...but after mine he said it is too hard so he gives easier ones now supposedly
amazing

Mark is both enthusiastic about design and an exceptionally talented artist and designer in his own right. You will not regret taking a class with him, he knows what he is talking about, and will give you any assistance you need (you just have to be assertive, and ask for help). A top-notch professor keeping the CMU Design department afloat!
Great teacher. I had him in team with Baskinger for Design Drawing I and they were the perfect team. Mentzer is so helpful when you're stuck and he'll help you refine your ideas really well.

Mentzer knows his stuff, and he'll tell you if your drawings are crap. The difference is that he believes in your potential and will inspire you to become both a better designer and a better person. He tends to talk for a long time, but his stories are always interesting. Sometimes it's hard to keep his focus. But overall, I really liked him.
This man is both insane and a genious.  He's the most enthusiastic teacher I've ever had.
fabulous prof
Awesome, awesome, awesome. Everything a professor should be. Passionate, helpful, nurturing, encouraging... passionate. One of the best mentors I ever had the privilege of knowing.
Ditto to what people have said: a really nice guy, a helpful teacher, but dang disorganized.
He was the nicest prof in the design dept.

Mark cares about his students. He can be frustrating at times as he is not as focused as students would expect. He loves design, color, and drawing and this passion shows. To students who might rate this prof poorly for disorganized classes, remember he i
inspiring teacher
Really knows how to draw and help people understand drawing better!

Professor Barr taught the best class I have had on professional communication thus far. He does a great job of getting students to understand how people communicate by employing real-life examples.  He also is committed to students outside the classroom  making professional introductions that further career aspirations. All round great guy!

It was a great pleasure taking the Strategic Writing class with Ed. I sincerely loved his way of teaching which emphasized more on simpler ways of effective communicating. To sum it up, the best class to refine your professional knowledge.

Probably the best class I've ever had on communication. Ed is a real master. He got everyone engaged as I've never seen before in my life. Everyone was happy and participative in the class. Hopefully, his course will become a core course for everyone at CMU. I would recommend his services to anyone who really cares about good communication!

His class is very practical and helpful for me.  I had many wrong understandings of professional writing before and I had been using them in writing all the time before. He corrected many of my wrong concepts although the class is only 6 weeks long.

Ed Barr is such a great professor. I used his tips from class to solve a delicate sponsorship issue with one simple and direct email. I would have missed out on the scholarship if it weren't for his class. His tips works like magic!!
This guy is a back-stabbing SOB.He cannot be trusted. His persona belies the evil within.
Excellent course
Ed is truely sensational
Great fellow, a lot to learn from Ed.
HIGHLY recommended.  This class was fun and educational.  Plus, he will be a reference for you after school.

Prof. Barr is one of the best Professors I've ever had. I came into the class thinking I wouldn't really learn much, but afterwards, I'm so glad I took it. He does a great job of giving students "real-world"-type writing assignments. He is a fascinating guy, with a great insight into life - it'd be worth going to class just to listen to him speak.
A really, really excellent teacher - one of my best at CMU. If you work with him and take all the opportunities for extra work that he gives, you'll certainly do wonderfully.

Burak is a great professor. Lectures are clear and he gives plenty of practice for exam. He also teaches you to use Matlab for more than plotting, and it's the first core course that does so. However, he could do better at providing outside help, as office hours are very limited.
Dr. Oz is a great teacher and his lectures are very useful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: pretty great teacher!
He is such a good teacher! Super cool and funny
Dr. O is super nice and he taught DSC really well. Most of the class got A's
Not clear
can't teach
No Comments
A very irresponsible person
Taught the ME controls class well, especially considering it was his first class. Pretty cool guy, easy to understand and follow. Not an easy class by any means, but not too difficult either.
This was a great course. I learned a lot
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: good prof. would take again

I hate to rate every thing as excellent because it appears like I just picked the highest marks but this is exactly how I feel, there isn't anything that I would change. The class is truly excellent and I learned a lot.

Overall, I enjoyed the class and will definitely go deeper into programming. The TA was really nice as well. I liked how Professor Guna incorporated class participation; that was a clever way to keep people engaged.
Worst teacher in the world. No one attend class

I was very happy to be able to be taught by Professor G. He has a great teaching style that makes class discussion both informative and fun. I look forward to learning more from him if I am admitted here.
i like his lectures

The absolute worst professor. If you have him, drop the class immediately. Unfortunately, this guy does not know how to teach a class. Very disorganized, lectures are unreasonably useless and inconsistent.
Avoid this professor at all costs. Although he seems to try his hardest, he is utterly inept at explaining concepts which renders his lectures useless. Thank god for the pdfs from last year's course.
You have to learn how to teach
good class

Very bad professor. Course is practically taught by the TAs. He was advised by the TAs that the final was too long and too hard yet he gave it anyways. Did not offer any regrade request on the final. Does not respond to his email. I highly advise you take 150 in the spring.

* lectures and lecture notes are basically useless, and make you want to sleep.
* never interact with his student, dude doesn't even have an account on piazza & instructor OH.
* impossible final, with no curve and no regrade option.

I got an A solely because I learned functional programming before, avoid taking 150 with him if you can.

He is definitely very knowledgeable about the topic, but he is definitely not good at explaining it. Notes and lectures were not helpful, he teaches with the assumption you are already good at CS(even though it is intro level). The most I learned was from recitation and office hours which was led by TAs only. Overall not a pleasant experience.

Really unpleasent experience. He teaches in the Falls, do not take his course and prefer the very good spring time 15-150 professors. Lectures ended up being entirely worthless and hw often was not well related. You are entirely reliant on the TAs
Terrible professor that writes awful exams. His lectures and lecture notes are borderline useless.

The TAs are incredible and will carry you through the class. As for Brookes, he's quite a snooze of a professor. In a class of 150 students, lecture attendence was high at first, and dropped to about 30 people(including TAs) because just about every student saw that his lectures are worthless. Horrible lecture notes, doesn't respond to emails.
Very funny professor but can not teach. What he teach has nothing to do with the homework, and you will always find yourself wondering when was this taught.
Good class. The tests are really tough and long - be prepared.

Not a bad professor. Cares a lot about the course and sometimes makes it very challenging. Lectures are boring but he puts up slides so you don't really need to go. Each hw takes about 8 hrs to complete. Challenging midterm, okay final - do past midterms and KNOW foldl and foldr. Enjoyable course if taken seriously.
He has very loud music/videos in his lecture slides

Did a good job of presenting otherwise dull and drab material - lecture slides are well designed and cover the necessary topics, and there's always music and funny pictures to amuse you (if you stay awake). Impossible midterm (avg 39), but class is curved. TAs have more effect on your 212 experience, since they write/grade the labs (rather poorly).

Prof. Washburn is adorable, kind, and genuinely cares about his students a lot. He's not an incredible lecturer, but he's very nice and the class is fair. Orgo 1 was an easy class if you put in the work to do all of the practice problems (as the exams were replicates of the practice problems and problem sets). Study hard and you will be fine!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: The class was scheduled to be 2 hours long, but about half the time we ended early. Lectures were very dense and sometimes hard to follow. Reading the textbook helped a lot. The problem sets were not too bad. Getting an A was not too bad because an A is 85%.

Washburn is a nice guy, and he is trying very hard. But there are definitely ways he can be more effective at teaching. First off, he doesn't follow the textbook, which is frustrating. I almost always have to read the book since I come out of his lectures more confused than before. READ the book, DO the homework, ASK questions, you will survive...

Read read read read read read your textbook. It's not assigned, but read. Went from a D- in this class (lol) to a highhhh B due to my sacred textbook and matching the materials in textbook to what was taught in lecture. Not an easy class but it is definitely do-able. Don't freak out when lectures sound like foreign language to you, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He's an adorable, quirky guy. You can despise him at times just because of the nature of the difficulty of the material and how lectures can go way over your head in terms of understanding, but reach out to him about anything, and he's always ready to get to know you better and help you out.

Currently in his Honors Chemistry course; Washburn is a great guy, a tad absent minded at times, but a really good person to know in the department. He is always engaging and knows his stuff. My TA for the class was super awesome as well and I really felt like I learned so much in such a short time. Definitely not the easiest class though!!
Had a great TA, also has easy access to notes, since he posts them on BlackBoard every day. He's pretty easy, for the most part and likes to go off on tangents. But great guy!

He's a very good professor and extremely helpful. The problem sets are easy if the right person grades them. The tests are difficult, so studying is a must. Make flash cards early in the class, they are so helpful. Also, use the book it's amazing! Oh, and check out his nice butt lol.

Lecture is extremely tied to the textbook. I would have been better off if I figured this out sooner! Problem sets are fairly easy, but tests are extremely hard in comparison. Washburn knows what he is talking about, but I feel he gets a carried away with seemingly superfluous material.
Great teacher overall. Tests are a bit hard; problem sets are easier. As long as you go to class often and take notes, the textbook can be used just for reference and review.
No Comments
Great Professor for MI2. He's a great teacher and treats his students very well. He was the best professor I had freshman year.

Don't listen to these other raters; they basically took freshman physics with Swendsen and are sad because they didn't do well. The thing with Swendsen is he expects you to know physics. Know the material and you'll do fine. Try to cut corners by not coming to class or doing the HW and he'll bend you (and your grade) over.

A really good professor, very helpful. I started not doing well in the class for some reason, despite being a physics major. He was helpful in showing me my mistakes and misunderstandings. My grades improved gradually, with full credit on the final. He was happy to my class grade as my final grade.

Can't believe this guy has anything but a frown face. This was the worst professor I've ever experienced...refused to do anything but read from incomprehensible powerpoint slides and assign problem sets no one understood, then blamed the class for performing very poorly as a whole on the exam. When most of the class can't score above 50%, it's YOU!

Seemed to teach pretty fast (and the book didn't make things any easier).  Didn't seem to helpful to students who were getting behind.  This class took my budding spark of interest in physics and destroyed it.
Good researcher with excellent teaching skils. Can get bogged down with administration.

A pretty good teacher - the problem with CMU physics lies more with the book, which is the biggest piece of trash I've ever seen (my TA told me in private that even HE can't understand it). Still, his tests are extremely difficult, and he didn't curve for my class (the average on the final was around 90/200).
Class is really hard, teaches directly from power point, which is good and bad.  Mostly bad.
He is very clear and easy to understand.  He makes the book seem much better, which is otherwise horrible.  He is also really friendly and helpful outside of the classroom.
doesnt know how to teach, isnt much help outside of class, and makes the tests extremely hard and confusing. avoid at all costs

The fact that he uses Powerpoint for lecture helps - we just have to print it out and not much to copy in class. The textbook is confusing and hard to understand - but the professor explains it well so it's easier for us.
The Final comprehensive exam is tough and needs a lot of attention. Even though the hours/week is less you need to put in a lot of time to understand and learn the subject
Best Professor!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Worst professor had in CMU
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Brilliant professor. The lectures are delivered to pin-point precision. While, he is extremely strict about certain things (No acceptance of homework if late by 1 minute), he is extremely approachable and cares about students' learning.
Best prof ever! Disciplined and great teacher.
Best professor ever
Prof talks very clearly and he is very supportive.
His lectures are well organized and clearly delivered.
excellent prof
He's extremely good at explaining concepts.
A very good teacher
The professor was good and I enjoyed the class!
Best prof in the HCII. Knowledgable and inspiring.

This course has changed the way I SEE the world, in every aspect of my life. The things I learned about design and typography, about visual and verbal communication, will affect my career and my personal life forever. Karen comes across as very kind and nurturing, but she is a fierce and brilliant scholar who expects the same from her students.

I have taken 3 classes taught by Karen Kornblum Berntsen, simply to get as much wisdom and insight from her as possible. She is the best teacher I've ever had in any subject. Karen has the ability to pull the curtain back and bring her students directly in contact with their most intelligent and creative selves.
Best professor I've had at CMU, across all departments.

Karen is an amazing professor! Sometimes her head can be way up in the clouds, but she has a heart of gold and really cares about student learning. I am so happy that I had the chance to learn from her, such an amazing class and a really good experience.

Karen is a brilliant scholar and teacher. She has the ability to impart knowledge so as to light a fire in her students. I learned more in the classes Karen taught than I did in all my other CMU classes combined.
Best professor I've ever had, in any subject. She has honestly changed my life.

Prof. Berntsen puts the 'human' in human-computer interaction. She an extremely approachable and empathetic person, and has a very professional eye for design. The feedback she gives can be unorthodox, often using metaphors to illuminate her points - this kind of analogical thinking is exactly what HCI students need to balance more 'techy' profs.

Very nice and caring person. Passionate about her work.  However, super head in the clouds with a bleeding heart.  Need somewhere to go for thanksgiving? She's there. Need a concise, consistent explanation of what she expects from the assignment ? Not so much.

Not very good at giving feedback, and often focuses on minor details vs. the big picture.  You'll spend a lot of time of a project and be super proud of it, and have the entire thing discounted because a shade of purple is slightly off, or she doesn't like the text of a sub-headline.  Prone to hyperbole.

She is absolutely the best professor, and her Italian class is my best class. She makes you actually interested in taking Italian, and she makes an effort to know you personally, and the class is very interesting. As a student, you would feel that she actually care about you and your progress. Yes, you will get homework, but makes you want to do it
My favorite professor at CMU.  Professor Vairo really cares about you as a person and a student.  I would love to have her for all of my classes.
Best Professor at CMU hands down

Professor Vairo is the only person person that you should take italian with.  The class is so amazing as all of a sudden you know the language as she can really teach.  Class is very interactive and never boring.  She is so smart.  Really helps you also - just the best at CMU.  I wish that I had her for all of my classes

The best and such a fun class.  You think that you are in Italy.  You really learn a ton and she wants you to learn.  She is a real college Professor and she knows her stuff.  So helpful also.  She should teach all of the classes
Absolutely the best at CMU. She truly cares and makes it fun to learn.
The worst teacher ever.
Italian is fun with Prof. Vairo!
She is so amazing! she really helps you a lot and wants to make sure you understand the language.
such a fun class!  looking forward to elem. italian II next semester!!

Fantastic performer and teacher, but an even better person. She has one of the biggest and brightest hearts of anyone I've ever met, and it shines through in everything she does, and in her two great kids! I will forever be grateful to have her in my life!
Wonderful teacher... Wonderful person!
Great teacher.  Great person.

She is wonderful and very knowledgeable.  I have really enjoyed our lessons.  She knows TONS of music and gets totally excited when she teaches stuff she thinks is good, which seems to be just about anything.  Couldn't say enough great things.
Betsy is a wonderful teacher with a vast amount of knowledge.  Top teacher in the ex-tention division for sure. My voice has improved more with her than any teacher I have every studied with.

She is an amazing teacher.  I have learned so much from Betsy.  She has knowledge that I can't find in other voice teachers like...how to sing pop without hurting your vocal chords.  How to sing jazz, opera, musical theater.  She has worked in every genre and seems to know how to do it all!
Really great voice,very dedicated teacher, and a wonderful person
Betsy is a wonderful teacher.  Pretty face too!!
No Comments
Betsy is a fantastic teacher!!  Great voice, and beautiful person!
Extremely unprecise

Could tell that he really cared about the students. I learned a lot throughout the course. Don't understand some bad reviews on here, but my experiences were very positive. Would recommend this class and this professor.

Dr. Virtue meanders about introductory concepts, runs out of lecture time, and then rushes through the rest of the material, which is the actually important part. He seems to not organize his slides ahead of time and ends up rearranging them on the fly. His assignments are visibly rushed and grading often depends on minor details or technicalities.
he is a nice person, but the class is structured poorly

Extremely poor teacher, slides are extremely dense, shows up ill-prepared  to class sometimes. Tests are an absolute blood bath since he will take a minor detail from lecture and create a whole problem about it. Grading policy is not fair since everything is graded harshly and some questions are all or nothing.
He sometimes wrongly accuses people of cheating based on weird reasons. Although he did not make a report, the experience is still traumatizing.
He doesn't care about his students and is extremely disrespectful. All he did was try to catch people cheating, traumatize them (even if they didn't do anything wrong), and make examples out of them.

He is using a course from Berkley that is alright. However, the way he teaches is really poor. What got me to write this is a week ago I had a meeting asking for help with concepts after the midterm and he seemed to frame it as me being dumb for not understanding rather than his explanation being at fault. I feel basic respect is not reciprocated.
A very caring person. The slides were very well prepared and the lectures were quite straight-forward. I learned a lot in the class and made me want to pursue AI down the road.
Easily the best professor I have had at CMU. It is obvious that there is thought put into every component of the course

I wrote the last comment and I'd like to revise it but I can't figure out how. I was very stressed out during that semester so I wasn't my best acadmic self. and I think it might have been his first semester teaching this course. I am retaking it this semester and I still find part of the course material confusing with another professor.

He is a nice person and seems very available to students. However he glosses over more difficult concept (sort of goes around the concept itself and speeds up?) as if he himself doesnt understand them, and I find it hard to concentrate in his lectures. Theres also this participation poll so you have to sit in class so I ended up hating it.

Concepts can be a fast moving course and the problem sets really challenge you to your limits. Clive is a very entertaining and intelligence professor who's always open to help, so make sure you take advantage of the course resources and budget your time wisely.

Be prepared to learn beyond just memorization and repeated steps to solve certain types of problems - this course pushes you to truly abstract the concepts you learn. That being said, Clive was an incredible professor whose lectures were funny and thorough. Resources are available to you and Clive is a super smart guy who is always willing to help.
Professor Newstead is a legend. He gives nice course materials and well-organized notes. Tests are fair. Learned a lot in his class. Probably one of the best math classes I have ever taken.

Clive is a fantastic professor. His lectures are amazing. His midterms are fair, but the final was brutal. The problem sets weren't trivial, but the support was great and they were certainly doable. I personally found the textbook to be of very little use, as it often has the same conceptual holes as the lectures and not enough worked examples.
Great professor, very engaging and explains lectures well. Homeworks are not the easiest but lots of accessible office hours and support.

Clive is an amazing prof !!! I thought was going to fail, I got a mid semester grade of C- and almost dropped. I asked Clive to go through my midterms and homework with me and he gave me really useful advice. Finished with an A. It wasn't easy at. all. but in the end I'm proud of my achievement and couldn't have done it without Clive's help.

Clive is a god tier professor who loves math and wants his students to love math too. He gives clear and funny lectures and sets clear expectations for exams. The class was way harder than I expected a calc class to be but I learned a ton and it was my favorite class this semester. Take Clive if you can but be prepared to work for your grade.
Excellent lectures, easy to follow and interesting. Grading was also very fair, tests were in the exact same style as practice tests. Great overall, highly recommend
clive = goat

I really struggled in this class and even though my grade will probably be a C, it would have been an R without Professor Clive's help and I learned a LOT.he really cares but damn if this course is hard

The pace was really fast like we covered all of linear algebra and 3d calc in a single semester but professor Newstead made everything clear and interesting. Exams were difficult and but grading was fair. You could tell he cares about students and wanted us to do well. I didn't like the MATLAB as much but it was useful I guess.

Excellent Prof. Probably the best math teacher I have ever had. The class is extremely difficult, but Prof. Newstead tries to help every student succeed in his class. Make sure to attend lecture and OH. He offers drops on assignments and exams. The problem sheets are extremely difficult, so make sure to find friends to work with. Highly recommend!
this man is retired but he was the worst person i have ever had this misfortune of meeting
A kind man with a lot of wisdom to share. Teaches as much about life as about poetry.
The smartest man I know!
Talks a lot, but is pretty awesome.
No Comments
Took his intro class. Awesome.
Hardcore.

very smart, occasionally cranky but always affectionate. if his comments seem cryptic, it means he respects you. it means he wants you to figure it out on your own but is still willing to give you a hint. i took three levels of workshop with him, and was sad there weren't more to take.
AWESOME.
One of the best teachers you can have if you come to class all the time.
This man is a genius.  I mean, he kep his job this long!  (I mean in this so not liberal school)
Dee is tough and chooses favorites, but if you work hard (and I mean HARD), her class will be worth every minute. P.S. Don't ever miss class or come in late. She will behead you.

HANDS DOWN ONE OF THE BEST PROFESSORS I HAVE EVER HAD AND AN AMAZING PERSON. she had an incredible impact on me the one summer i spent learning from her. she is the reason i chose to pursue architecture.  knows how to put fun in the studio and connect with the students. i wish that she could remain a mentor in my life forever!!!
Dee was a hard teacher but she also had a presence that compelled you to create better architecture

Singlehandedly may ruin the Carnegie Mellon School of Architecture.  Exremely rash in her decision making; terrible as a coordinator and being in charge of the new admissions process, she is trying to completely shift the student populus and focus of the school towards a design school and away from the strengths that Carnegie Mellon posseses.
The woman was harsh but very fair. Although sometimes she may make you feel bad about your work if you put a lot of time in it, she was honest and I respected her for that.

All negative comments here are from the first years(class of 2010), who people are perfectly justified in not liking, as you never showed anyone you deserved any respect, and even did the best you could to earn disrespect. It's understandable that Dee hasn't been as great as in the past, cause you guys have disrespected and stolen from dee. go dee!

Dee is one of the best professors I have had in college.  Architecture is a tough field, and criticism should not be taken personally.  She has a great sense of humor, and cares deeply about her students.  Her criticism is very constructive and helpful.  She is also able to crack jokes, and help lighten up what can be a very stressful environment.
Dee Briggs is not a nice person. And by that, I mean that she's bitter and, on occasion, downright cruel. She can't handle anyone who questions her authority.
some people are just really not suited to interaction with the public Dee Briggs is one of them
No Comments

Lab I is just hard in general. Pay attention during the lectures, will probably save you time in the lab. The lab reports are graded by a grad student (?) and took a super long time but as long you follow rubric it'll be fine. The midterm and final are incredibly long and time consuming and make up 25% of the total grade.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Tests are tough

comment: She is such an amazing person! She is extremely helpful and really nice. The tests are extremely hard so beware. The lab reports take forever to do (over 12 hours for a good grade). The class has a lot of work and time, but overall it's a good class.

Karen plays favorites, no doubt. While she's a really nice person and she cares for her students, her strong biases towards one student over another is extremely frustrating. Get on her good side, and you'll be fine.
Shes really nice. Shes also really helpful, but you SHOULD go and talk to her like everyday (and get free candy from her). Shes funny if you like chem jokes :).
Fantastic - not only is Karen Stump's door always open for her students, she is quite possibly one of the genuinely nicest people I have ever met.

Mrs. Stump Rocks, I love the barrels of snacks she kept on her desk as well as curve.  Its fun when everyone passes.  I never saw her much in the lab, but she made it exceptionally clear who was to blame for the spurious results in my lab report.  Darn grad students; not doing their job correctly.
needs to drink less caffeine before lab.  she is too hyper.
lots of help if you go to her, just a hard class to begin with
Lois on 'The Family Guy'
No Comments

I'm disappointed with this class-it is not of the same academic caliber I expect of a CMU course.Unclear deadlines and expectations(final paper duedate was announced 4 days before it was due),classmates were very confused about writing prompts,and blatant favoritism.

Class is straightforward: daily readings, discussion, etc. Her grading criteria is a bit vague but everyone ends up getting the grade they expect to get. Bernstein is the most relatable English faculty here, and her class is the only one I looked forward to this semester. She's amazing and so is the class.
Doesn't make a lot of sense. Teaches Film, but never saw Star Wars.
Extremely helpful and encouraging. Choice of reading material is sometimes iffy, but always prevalent to the topics being discussed. If you want to do well, go to her office hours.
Very had to follow.

i didn't finish taking the class but she appears to be one of those no BS professors (read: dont expect an A with a half-hearted effort) who can really inspire you and stir up your interest in the subject.
Excellent teacher.  Most lucid of the bunch, by a very wide margin.
No Comments
Let's talk about faith.  Let's talk about you and meeeeeee
She was an awesome creative writing professor. Take her class!

Everyone has to take first year writing. Not everyone is lucky enough to take it with Prof Evans. I don't care how much more “useful” you think the other topics will be - you're wrong. Believe me. 10/10

Taking this professor's class has been one of the best parts of my CMU experience. Her empathy shines through her teaching, and it is genuinely harder to fail than to pass (with flying colors). All you need to do is try. I would 100,000% recommend taking her classes, especially Writing About Literature, Art, and Culture.
The class was a breeze thanks to this professor.
Professor Evans is the BEST. She is so kind and understanding and the class itself is very enjoyable.
Icon. Would listen to her talk about literally anything.
Love Prof Evans. Super flexible and understanding.
Favorite class first year. 10/10
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Super low key class. There is a bit of reading and writing, but it is broken into many weeks and doable. She clearly cares about the content too.

Easy A, smart professor, and interesting content. Of the writing minis I took, Prof Evans was the best. She cared about the students and made sure no one fell behind. The class was at 9 am, but I never missed a class because I wanted to hear what she was going to say and knew she would value my opinion.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof Evans is the most caring person I have met at CMU. When I came down with COVID, she checked in with me after each missed lecture and provided extra feedback on rough drafts. Her section focused on graphic literature (not superheros but memoir), and led me to read things I had never encountered before. Do yourself a favor and take her class!

She cares so much about her students and really wants you to improve. She makes you work for it, but her teaching methods are effective and she's extremely knowledgable. She pushes you to do better, but is still realistic. The course content is challenging in her advanced classes, but not too bad because she explains everything so clearly. Love her
Great teacher who really cares about the student's progress. Encouraging and extremely helpful. Recommended to both native and non native speakers. But please take this class seriously!

I disagree with some of the negative comments. She DOES NOT cater to native speakers, I think if you really want to learn you will be able to learn (as an ABC or not so native speaker). It's not her problem that native speakers choose that class, she doesn't have the power to kick them out. And it's not filled with AZN FRAT boys.
Awesome professor!

She is a very nice woman, but as a language teacher she is not very understanding nor accommodating. She caters to the students that came from China/Taiwan. Its almost as if she wants those students to learn their native language more than anyone else learning it.   Mostly filled with wannabe gangsta AZN frat boys, the kind CMU is infiltrated with.

This is not for those whose level is not that of a native speaker. If you are a native speaker take for an easy A, but anyone else avoid because as the other ratings say, she doesnt evaluate based on personal level. language and culture class on the other hand is very good, and taught in english. strict attendence. full of phony AZN free A students
No Comments
Expects a lot from the students and does not evaluate their personal level which is important in a language class. Take as last resort.

The class is full of native speakers and the teacher teaches the class according to their interest/boredom level. If you really want to LEARN chinese and not just an easy A then do not take this class. Seems to be designed for those who already know the language to begin with...
very good teacher. Very understanding towards the students

Probably the first genius level professor I've taken a class under. But be absolutely sure to go to his lectures consistently or you will fall behind fast, and it is very hard to get up to pace. Nevertheless, he is very approachable and kindhearted.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Cumming's lectures are clear and easy to follow, although I hope he could go a little faster. He is very articulate and explains subtle things well. He is very willing to help, offers hints/comments on proofs if you email him. Midterm and Final are take-home, and the problems are pretty standard. Definitely recommend.
At first you might think Prof Cummings is too theoretical, but when you start to keep up with the proofs, it makes Linear Algebra more understandable and interesting. Great professor.

His teaching style is very difficult to follow and often times his lectures had nothing to do with the problem sets assigned. Teaches in a very abstract way and hardly provides examples during his lecture.
He never provides context; rather, he teaches in the most abstract way possible; proofs can be symbolically slick and appealing, but few people seem to understand what is really going on
He is simply one of the best mathematics teacher in the world. A true mathematician, his class is so intriguing and proof so inspiring that you do not want to blink...

I am a recent graduate who had Discrete Mathematics with Cummings.  The grading was not clear, and at times his explanations were very unclear.  He was not accessible at all and never returned a single email.
Echoing the student who took Math Studies with Professor Cummings, his teaching of Commutative Algebra was just amazingly effective and thought-provoking.  Excellent.
No Comments

Professor Cummings is a wonderful teacher and is one  of the most approachable teachers in the math department.  He likes to do a lot of his lessons on the fly, but this is not a problem because he can prove almost anything off the top of his head.  He loves to help and is very easy going.
LOVE him!
amzing teacher and singer.  Really helpful with audition tips
excellent teacher.  REALLY knows vocal technique.
this guy really knows the voice and how to help you improve!!!!!
best voice teacher in the extension dept.
I found him to be hard to understand at times.
good teacher
great guy and wonderful teacher
excellent teacher
No Comments
He is an awesome professor. He has a very good heart. If you want to do well in his class, you need to put in the work.

I LOVE HIM. He is literally the best professor I've met at CMU. He is willing to work one-on-one with students and reclarify confusing terms. A student can talk to him about almost anything and he's willing to listen. Unlike Carol Goldburg, he knows what he does. 10/10 would take again! :)

Teaches down to the lowest common denominator, making lectures pretty boring.  Briefly covers some cool material on auctions, but mostly just standard econ stuff, presented in a rote manner.  An okay teacher, but he gets offended easily and isn't a particularly good lecturer.

He says that he curves the class, but the econ dept doesn't let him. Avg was an 80 meanign 50% of the class got below and 80 and 50% higher. After talking to my TA, only 10% got A's in the class. It's not an easy A class with him.
One of the best professors I've ever had. Gotta take more classes from him.
Very friendly and approachable. Always comes to class prepared; excellent teacher. Lecture notes are very helpful.
Very fair and actually cares about YOU learning.  Grades come second.  Great prof and would enjoy another class with him
Kesten is a great professor. Very knowledgeable,  understanding and helpful. Excellent handouts and hw assignments. Kesten rocks!

this guy is awful, ridiculous grader, horrible preparation..our practice final solutions were 70% WRONG and only corrected the day before and DAY OF?! the final..he was always out of the office and just plain terrible as an instructor, don't know how he won a teaching award??
Easy, don't go to class, just read lecture notes

Mary is honestly one of the best professors I have had/will ever have. She is such a great teacher, encouraging and invested in individual growth of each student. You will grow so much from her classes whether you are an art major or not. She is also an amazing and interested person. CMU(/the world) needs more professors like Mary!

I took Drawing 1 and two ADV Painting Studios with Mary. She is fantastic. She gives relevant, frequent assignments and critiques. Mary cares and becomes invested in your growth as artist, and because of this interest became my mentor over the past years. She grades very fairly, but when you receive an A you know you deserve it.

As far as drawing professors go, Mary is one of the best. Her outside HW is relevant to in class assignments and outside projects. She offers great instruction and tips for improvement. She keeps you busy throughout the semester but in the end it pays off when you can see how far you've come. Highly recommend her classes.

Great teacher, gets you out of your comfort zone. Gives great crits, and teaches! She also cares about her students, email her, talk to her any time recommended for majors and non-majors I had her for drawing, take anything with her it will help you.
Great experience, one of the best teachers I have ever had.
No Comments
No Comments
Excellent teacher who gives excellent recommendations ( I peeked, so sue me).

Excellent drawing teacher! Really teaches you how to look at what you're drawing and to focus on creating the structure of your forms. Homework assignments complement the classroom assignments nicely. HW load is sometimes heavy.  Had her for painting also but I preferred her drawing instruction. Only for her would I get up at 8 am.
Pretty good... Definitely BY FAR the best drawing teacher when you look at the other options.

Really cares about her students, but her lectures are really confusing and all over the place which makes the homework and exams difficult. She grades exams leniently though. Three midterms and the final is optional.
Deeply invested in her students. Her enthusiasm for the class and her students can be easily seen. It also helps that she's very funny.
Very nice teacher very caring.
sweet, personable, knowledgeable , intelligent, helpful, wants you to learn not turn you into a machine
Overall a pretty good professor!

Dahl was the worst professor I've ever had.  She was never willing to answer questions, didn't make herself very available, and overall was incredibly rude.  She treats students like they are beneath her and not worthy of her time.

Dahl was difficult, but fair. calss was interesting and she was funny. always extremely helpful and willing to answer questions. I had to work hard to earn my grade, but she definately wanted everyone to succeed.

Prof. Dahl was incredible!  Her class was very difficult and took the most time/effort during the semester by far, but I learned so much and have really come to love ChemE.  She's very funny and makes the material very approachable and understandable.  She's also very helpful and wants you to do well in her class.
Awesome teacher! She teaches you everything that you need to know about basic Chemical Engineering. IF you read the book before coming to class, you will be fine.
Students learn a lot from her class, but her class is quite hard.
Taking this class can be torture for students with no prior knowledge.

Professor Kelly is a fantastic lecturer, even if the class is a bit fast paced. She makes it clear that she values student feedback. Office hours is really usefultake full advantage of them! I like how she takes time during lectures to answer students' questions, but this does sometimes result in her not finishing her lectures.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: v good lectures, pace of the class is pretty fast if you don't have previous cs experience but still very doable. rivers is a great prof and is super helpful during office hours. quizzes are not too bad and hw takes some time but you learn a lot. if you have cs experience it'll be an easy A, if you don't you'll at least get a B if you do the hw.

Professor Rivers is an awesome professor and will go out of her way to help her students; her lectures were fun and engaging. Just like any other class, you need to put in the work and start assignments early.

Kelly Rivers is a good teacher for those that already know how to code, which goes against the class itself which should be an introductory class to coding. She goes too quickly during lectures, and accepts too many individual students' questions which cuts into valuable class time
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Her lectures are fairly simple to understand if you pay attention. She's really good at answering questions from students and also explains using examples that are easy to understand. Homework is on the harder/time-consuming side, so be sure to work with other students. Midterm averages are around 80%. Lenient on grading and an enthusiastic prof.

Professor Rivers is one of the most prepared and knowledgeable professors I've had! She is really helpful in lecture but you still need to work hard outside of lecture. Some homeworks can be really hard but the quizzes and midterms weren't all that bad.

Really amazing lecturer - if she's teaching go to 112 lecture! She is straight and to the point and makes examples very clear. The class is hard though (I'm a CS major so it wasn't as bad for me) because it's so fast paced but you do learn a lot. Lots of h.w that take a long time, though the h.w and midterms/quizzes load isn't dependent on her.
great teacher, learnt how to not be a terrible coder

Prof Rivers is an amazing lecturer; You will never be sleepy during her lectures. She ensures that her lectures are fun and interactive, and you could certainly feel the enthusiasm within her. However, sometimes she devotes slightly too much time for taking questions from students, which may result in the last part of lecture being too rushed.
Recommend everyone who do not have to take his course avoid taking his course.
Kai is an energetic teacher and always looking to have a discussion  about architecture or just whatever. He's a great guy and a committed pedagogue
Good job scaring away half of the class professor :)))))
He puts in the effort but he's still a pretty pointless presence.

kai is the best kept secret of second year and you should take all of his history classes. don't be fooled by the art-vs-kai attitude of the 2nd year. kai seems a lot more rigid compared to art but to understand where he's coming from you really need to take his history course.  definitely one of the best profs in cmu arch, worth your tuition.

Extremely well read and invested in giving students a strong foundation and understanding of the material being covered.  Always willing to offer extra help, even if inconvenient.  Basically, you get what you put in with Kai-you'll love him if you're a hard worker and will find him less appealing if you aren't.
Good course. Lots of great material.
Does a great job as coordinator considering all he has to deal with.
No Comments
Prof. Smith's class was great! She was always available to answer extra questions, and she made the subject matter really accessible. Take her class!

Worst class I have taken in my life. I enjoyed Harry Potter so I thought it would be easy but it's the only class I have gotten a B in at CMU. You have to read an exorbitant amount of boring articles. Please please please take the video games one or something unless you love reading articles about gender roles and class divisions among the wizards.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She's a lot of fun, a great teacher. Her classes are fun, but if you can't wake up in the morning don't take it. The class is easy if you know Harry Potter, but only if you know it. Don't be that idiot that knows nothing about Harry Potter and takes the class because they heard it was easy. They will struggle more than in any other interp class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Jamie is a great professor-- I had her for Gothic Literature, the advanced first year writing option. She's clear, engaging and fun in class lectures, but mostly supports great class discussion. Her feedback is useful and she grades fairly. She's very reasonable with extensions and due dates.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: If you struggle with waking up don't take this class, her sections are in the early morning. She only gives you four absences before she drops your grade. The class itself is ok. It ruined Harry Potter for me, and a lot of the articles are dense and kind of stupid. Easy to pass though.
Jaime is a lot of fun and super down to earth. Her Harry Potter section for Interpretation and Argument was easily one of my favorite classes. I looked forward to going to it all week.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Every day with Jamie is a good day.

Love her Harry Potter class! As a student who struggles with writing essays, her feedback was super helpful and she really helped me organize my ideas into a passable essay. Take her class whenever possible!
Her Harry Potter class is AWESOME!!! Great teacher, she is super smart and helpful. She is also really funny. Try and be good friends with her.
Really helpful and super nice. Great teacher overall.

Super interesting class, would recommend to everyone! Lectures are accessible, Vicki uses loads of real life examples to explain concepts. Midterms are 25 short answer questions so can be difficult if you don't study. However, it is easy to do well if you show up to lectures and study the lecture notes. Read the textbook for a little extra boost.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: Test questions are very very specific. Need to memorise exact wording and definitions of all concepts covered, and recite examples given in class.

Dr. Helgeson is amazing. Her Psychology of Gender course is the summation of all of her research; the textbook, written by her is such an easy read. The course relies on student interaction and personal experiences and it's the safest space I've ever had to explore my own thoughts in academia. Easily the best course I've ever taken at CMU.
Tests are hard.

Vicki is an awesome lecturer and provides excellent examples to illustrate class concepts, many from her personal experience. She's also my psychology major advisor, so that's an added bonus when help is needed; however, she has no concrete office hours and encourages students to meet with her whenever, for the student's flexibility.
Great professor, very knowledgeable and holds great discussions in class. Very clear about her expectations. Really really recommend Psych of Gender

Social Psych  Easy class.  Good lecture notes.  Gives good anecdotes.  Need to pay attention in class and give examples of the concepts we learn in class for the test.  Test is composed of many short answer questions.
No Comments
Very challenging, but incredibly knowledgable and interesting.
No Comments

Kody is a great lecturer but very overly enthusiastic to the point where hes annoying and obnoxious (in my opinion). A little smirky and not very considerate to students needs. Has a no laptops policy which is a bit annoying. Just obnoxious in many ways but youll definitely learn. If youre a low energy type of person I would avoid him.

Amazing professor. He teaches the concepts very well. The only thing I would say was frustrating is how he expects reflections to be done. Most people did bad on the first bit which he said was expected, however, the grades were kept which severely brings down your grade.

One of the best professors Ive ever had.I had taken it as a gen ed requirement but I ended up loving psychology. I was really struggling after the transition to online school, and he actually met with me to just encourage me and tell me that Im doing great. As long as you pay attention during lecture, theres not much work to do.

Kody's a fantastic professor. The material can be somewhat boring but his lectures are super interesting as he adds in pop-culture references and external media to make the class more accessible to those studying psych for the first time. The tests are straighforward but can be difficult; go to class, read the textbook, and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Very enthusiastic but the jokes are kinda cringe at times. Good lecturer and clearly explains the material. Lectures/recitations involve group discussion, which can get awkward. Not much work but each assignment is worth a lot, so watch out. Tests are hard if you don't remember the studies in depth (a lot). Generally easy class but don't slack off.

He was a really cool & engaging teacher, tried really hard to connect with us by bringing up modern references, which was cringe at times but overall a nice change from the stuffy old professors. Had cool slides and tried to make social psych interesting. Be prepared for a lot of textbook reading everyday, but he did curve the final!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's very energetic and caring. He's really cute. Taking his class right now and it's very interesting material!

comment: A fantastic lecturer. He really cares about his students and makes it very clear. Some of the subject mattery may be boring but his lectures make up for that. Very energetic and passionate about psychology. You'll have to read a little but as long as you go to class, you can scrape by without it.

comment: Kody's fantastic. Super understanding and very clear standards for his students. Highly recommend him for any class he teaches.

comment: He's a great professor
She seemed to be very interested in the course content and I found her to be very approachable. Class is not hard as long as you do the work for it, which admittedly there was quite a bit of.

comment: I literally want to throw up whenever I work on her assignments and midterms. Material gets retested and questions re-asked over and over again. Not much learnt from the course, very disappointed.

comment: Dr. Carver remains one of my favorite professors at CMU. She puts an extraordinary amount of thought into her teaching methods (makes sense, considering her field!) and makes a huge effort to get to know her students even in a big lecture course. If you have a chance to take one of her higher-level courses, I also highly recommend!

Dr. Carver is by far one of the sweetest and nicest professors at CMU. Her class is extremely manageable and the workload is light, provided you stay on top of your work. She gives so many opportunities for extra credit and her final is optional. Willing to work with students AND she's a very fair grader.

Professor teaches lectures very well in class.  Is very easy to understand.  I feel as if test and assignment questions focus too much on course framework, that it detracts from the learning in the course.  It feels unfocused.  She knows the subject material really well, though.
Taking this class takes up more of my time than all four of my other classes.
Child Development - best class ever
makes class mind-bendingly monotonous
She uses mostly slide shows to teach but what she adds to the class is also interesting. The papers she gives aren't very fun but that is not her fault, it's the classes general requirements.
Very friendly and helpful.
No magic 01
Rudich is awesome.  He is very smart.  Also, he sometimes does magic tricks for the class before he starts lecturing.
Absolutely no concern for his students.  I am in agreement with the "conceited" comment.  Thank God for amazing TAs.
Quite simply the best teacher I have ever had.
i LOVE the magic show...but that's about it
conceited. unjustifiably so.
fun guy, but hard as hell
THIS CLASS ROCKED!!!
awesome course. good problems

My truly inspiring professor Dave wrote that witty poem The Square Root of Three; but you still dare ask, how stunning this gentleman could really be?  Professor Feinberg is a caring, knowledgeable teacher with past experience in the software industry. I could not have asked for a better person to excite my interests in introduction to programming.
He wrote The Square Root of Three.  How much more awesomeness do you need?
Dave is just amazing and he is really cute in a nerdy way. He is the kind of guy you just want to go laser tagging with (?). Anyways he's awesome.
Kept the class very entertaining and very down to earth. The homeworks were challenging, but besides that the rest is pretty easy.
Best teacher to get for 15-110. Helps you through assignments by setting up the methods you need to write for you so you're not totally lost. kinda boring if you already have programming knowledge.
Dave is great.  Everyone in the class likes him.
Coolest Professor. He teaches you by having you program games and computer robots. Like for my last few HW assignments I programmed Tetris, King's Up, and that Snake game in JAVA :D

Fantastic professor; he was an AP Comp Sci teacher at a high school before, so he easily relates to students.  His lectures are always exciting, fun, and enjoyable.  I learned a lot of skills in that class.
15-111 I personally found the class too fast-paced for me and struggled on the assignments, but Feinberg is reasonable and fair, and a pretty cool guy.

I took Quantum Mechanics with her and the content itself tends to be very difficult, though for no fault of her own. Still, I enjoyed the class, even though it was difficult. She's not too bad of a teacher, but nothing outstanding.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Speaks quietly into the board and makes you fill out a sheet about crap she doesnt cover in the lecture while you are trying to take notes about the lecture.  Some demos were interesting, but she doesn't make the subject interesting at all.

Although it is hard to pay attention at 8:30am as other reviewers note, the prof makes the effort to know students names and is nice. The tests are hard/ish but do-able. If you're new to physics definitely copy down the problems she does and what is done in your recitation.
Tests questions are unclear, and attendance first thing in the morning is senseless.

Teacher is hard to pay attention to in class and doesn't present material well. Attendance is mandatory, but most students sleep or zone out. Lecture material will be on the test and isn't in the book so you have to fight to pay attention while she copies her notes onto the board. Tests are frustratingly poorly laid out and thus difficult.
Prof speaks with monotone voice and takes attendance like a middle school teacher. Prof demands that students come half an hour early to 8:00 am class so that she can make the test harder.

Her final was challenging, but the midterm exams were not that bad (except the one for thermo). Definitely do all the homework problems on your own, don't look at the solutions! Professor is challenging, but you learn a lot. :)
Shes...ridiculus

You must fill out a sheet every lecture- that's how professor keeps track of attendance. Although it is only 5% of your grade, don't take advantage. Final was ridiculously hard, dropped my average to a B when I had a low A before taking it. Class overall is fun; good professor! > 86.0% A  76.0-85.9% B  64.0-75.9% C  54.0-63.9% D  < 54.0% R

absolutely loved the way she used lectures to go over problems instead of introducing new content. she made a notoriously difficult class very doable. there were never really any curveballs on the exams. highly recommend!

"Flipped-class" model so you're expected to teach yourself the material and participate in solving example problems in class. She seems to know everyone's name, even if you barely speak to her, which I think shows her dedication to the class. Extremely generous grading and ample extra credit opportunities.

basically hard
in depth review hard
time consuming class
can't rest
help

Great professor, has a lot of content available online so if you miss a class you won't fall too behind, but the second half of the course is TOUGH. Go to class and study, don't put it off before the final. The homework tends to match up well with what's on the exams. No curve but she's really generous with drops (drops 2 exams and 3 homeworks)
Very nice teacher and person. Does make you work for it though, especially the second half of the semester.

Professor Silva is one of the most approachable and kind professor at CMU. It was really easy to ask for help with the course content and she tries her best to help the student. Thank you Professor Silva!

Organic Chemistry is arguably one of the hardest subjects in academia and Dr. Silva is an amazing professor to help students ease their way into this subject and drive them towards success all in one semester. Silva is an amazing lady and I thoroughly enjoyed getting to know her. Her exams are hard so be sure to study in advance, 2nd half is hard!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: So for Silva with OChem I, the first 5 -7 weeks will be pretty easy and you'll get in the habit of not worrying about the class very much. You can do the homework the night before. Then she crams mechanisms and reactions into the last half which works but if you don't step up your game, you won't be prepared.   She has great lecture notes online.

This class was a lot more work than the 6 units labeled on it, but it is a good experience. Silva's lectures can sometimes be hard to get through, but you have to pay attention at all times- her quizzes are based solely on lectures..

comment: really confused how could he wrote this book

comment: He is a prolific writer as can be noted by his amazing compendium of a textbook used all across the globe. rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Wrote the 15213 book, but fails to explain concepts in lecture.
He's a nice person but not really a good prof. Does't seem to care about students' learning. Boring lectures.
Nice guy but dry and uninvolved with his students.
The textbook for this class is very good (and was written by O'Halloran and Bryant).  Dave is a really nice guy

I really loved Professor Sleet's class! He took a lot of time explaining difficult topics and was always available to help even if it was not his office hours. I came into the course not knowing what to expect but ended up loving the course mainly because of Professor Sleets great teaching style!
Exams were very difficult, and this class was heavily test dependent. Had to take some substances that I was not proud of just to do well in this class. Would not recommend..
Real good lectures
Exams are extremely difficult, borderline impossible. He is so nice and such an incredible lecturer however. But his exams are unfair.

This is absolutely a professor that is one of his kind. Ridiculously unrelated and unhelpful lectures, more quizzes than hw, while the structure for grading is not systematically designed. The worst thing about this class is that it does not really teach anything useful about "macroeconomics", I for sure feel like I learned more in my AP econ class

Chris Sleet is an amazing professor, in terms of teaching abilities and clarifying questions. His tests however are EXTREMELY difficult, because they are designed in the British format. Getting an A is very hard.

This class was tough and Prof Sleet seems very strict at first. But if you go to lectures, review all of his notes, and make sure you understand the material, you'll be fine. If you need more help, he is more than willing to meet with students during office hours and at other times. He is very passionate about the subject, which can be refreshing.
Lectures unrelated to textbook, but he has a British accent!
Clear and commanding and he knows what he is doing.

Very personable, and with lots of sparkle in his personality. So lots of people like him. Unfortunately if he has political issues with your teacher he will treat you very badly. He can be very nasty.

As a psych major, I took choir out of love for choral music, not requirement. I learned more from Dr. Page than from any other professor at CMU. Underneath the barky exterior is not only a man who cares about quality but a teacher who pushes students to excel. What a tremendous influence he's had on so many. Thanks,Dr. Page for years of excellence.

Had Page for 4 yrs, never wanting to sing, but was req. class.  He tries to help all students, but ones who honestly try to improve themselves instead of just getting by, will reap the most rewards.  His bark is worse than his bite.  He had a bigger impact than any other prof., and it's been a while since I had his class.
To be honest, he terrifies me.  Don't take this class for an easy A, because you won't get it. Actually, even if you work hard, you probably won't get an A.  You will learn a lot in his choir though!

Dr. Page is a **** and an unethical teacher. He has inflicted vocal damage to students and not lived up to the ethics of teching vocal music. WARNING... this man will push you too far for the sake of his own... he has done it before and other vocal faculty have left because of his actions.

The most demanding professor I have ever studied under, but I have learned more from this man in 2 years than from any other professor in my life.  He demands your best and if you do not give it, you had better start packing your bags.  A truly magnificent musician, teacher, and colleague.

You'll love his Page-isms... he has these sayings that he'll just say with this self-satisfied look on his face. He expects you to definitely improve each semester which is really hard, especially for the majors, but he'll also teach you alot.
Page is the man!  You have to get used to his harshness, but he'll teach you a TON.
An excellent conductor and teacher, but once he thinks he knows what you can do, he never changes his opinion.  Better make a great first impression.

Although Dubrawski's stories are really entertaining, this whole class was very unorganized. I feel like i wasted 12 credits on this course. I suggest taking Practical Data Science instead. The first half was okay, but the entire second half of the semester was pointless. Also, even though he's funny, he is a little full of himself sometimes.
Brilliant professor! His assignments are very tough, but worth all the time and effort. I strongly recommend this course with Professor Artur.
Excellent course .Poorly taught .If not for homeworks the subject is useless. Homeworks make you learn
Best class I have taken at the Heinz college
He takes pride in being a tough teacher. Fun stories, but, for me, not a fun class.
The homework is ridiculously time consuming and the graders (TAs) are not lenient. The professor has a great personality, but his class is poorly structured in terms of promoting learning.
95-791 is the hardest course in CMU - M.I.S.M. but it is worth all the effort and pays off. Artur Dubrawski is a genius.
Prof. Dubrawski brings together his practical business experience and acute knowledge of the subject to make the class very interesting and useful.

Prof. Dubrawski's class is REALLY hard, but it's a lot of fun. He's a great teacher who really does a good job of conveying the subject matter to his students. I've rarely learned so much in class. He also throws in a bunch of little jokes here and there, but you only notice them if you pay close attention.  Great Professor!
GOOD
Not the best at communicating content, though a nice person. Tests are pretty simple, especially if you do the practice tests. Real test is on identical topics.
Awful

Not very clear or explaining. Especially for the intro class

he made it interesting

This dude looks like Arnold Schwarzenegger, and totally sounds like him too. It just makes the classes so much more fun
