Great professor! Very fun and enthusiastic. Plus, his awesome Austrian accent is entertaining.
It's great that he wrote the textbook for M&I, but about 20% of worked problems and examples are wrong.
felt like Mr. Rogers was my professor, super nice man and very invested in his students success

Professor Meyer is amazing! He has a nice sense of humor and is engaging to listen to. He is super easy to meet with outside of class and clearly puts a lot of effort into the Canvas page to support our learning.

I enjoyed Curtis Meyers class, although sometimes he could do a better job of explaining why we need to know things or being specific with his worked examples during class. Definitely don't be afraid to ask questions. Super understanding (let me take an online quiz after due date bc I forgot) & easy to schedule private meetings to review material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: Great Guy. Lectures are kinda dry but overall good. You don't really have to go to class since the textbook just has the exact same notes but more in depth, but he makes attendance a grade. The tests and homework are pretty chill once you get the hang of the types of problems. Final project was chill. Overall great

M&I is a great physics class. Nothing (other than some quantum and relativity stuff) stated without proof. Course project is optional and replaces one exam grade. Curtis wrote the textbook for the course and so it contains better versions of the lecture notes (more in-depth derivations, often). Homework is very helpful for learning the content.
Excellent teacher

fair tests, good teacher and I never felt overwhelmed by the course work. Can be dry at times during lectures but otherwise conducts informational, interactive lectures. A great teacher to have if your interested in physics.
Meyer is the man.  He's an awesome teacher.  Very fair, excellent fashion sense.  I know of no one who dislikes this man.

One of the best professors I encountered in my time at Heinz. He is smart and funny, and despite being a little repetitive, he is patient with students when they make mistakes. My presentation skills improved tremendously in just 8 weeks in his class.

Professor Labash was arrogant and repetitive. I would not classify myself as a great speaker, but he was always rude and made me more embarrassed than I was before. I would have appreciated private feedback, but he called out flaws in front of the whole class. Would not recommend (although I think it is a required course and he is the sole prof).

I remember he yelled at me once when I asked him a question. We were talking about how to speak in an interview and he gave me feedback on something I do unconsciously that sends a bad message. So I was brave enough to ask what do you think I should do, and he yelled at me in front of the whole class "DONT DO IT" and everyone laughed too

For smne who teaches communication this guy is repetitive to a fault and boring. Likes to think there isn't anything he doesn't know about body language and presenting. Will tell u the story of a car dealer who tried to mimic his body language and how he called him out.  Bugs you with his political leanings. I'm a liberal, but don't care if u are!

He loves to talk about how smart he is and namedrop.  He's basically that guy at the party that loves himself and thinks everyone else wants to hear him talk about how smart he is.  For someone who teaches a communications course, he is surprisingly insufferable.

Prof. Labash's industry expertise is indispensable.  Taking any of his courses will make you a better communicator, a better listener and, as such, a better leader.  I highly recommend any course with Prof. Labash.
He is not clear
Great teacher, made class interesting and was very knowledgeable.
Very bad experience. He made easy things complicated. Grading   was awful with no explanations given later.
First time coming to the U, I thought the class was a basic introduction. Everything I expected from an average class. Good teacher though.

his class is a joke. After a semester of class with 50 students he has to see every other day still possibly only knows half of our names. He is vague about project goals, his feed back is terrible, unhelpful and generic, he has bad communication skills, and he lacks technical skill.
Amazing! Is willing to stay after class and use office hours to help.
He's great! I would take his class again.
he's okay
Beats around the bush answering questions and needs better feedback.  Generally provides feedback late or in a confusing way.
Yay Eric
great guy, but maybe was still getting the hang of teaching.
Eric's a really great teacher. He's willing to help students outside of class.
Disrespectful toward students. She shoves her own views down students' throats and does not show respect for differences in ideas, cultures, and values.

I met Suzie and it was like being hit by a bus. The psychological violence is real. I left interactions with her feeling frazzled and attacked. It is genuinely scary to have someone like this around you. This type of abuse should not be tolerated.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She only favors a couple students she likes and is very aggressive to everyone else. She is very much open about her anger issues, but she does not try to fix it and takes it out on students. She is the rudest professor i've ever met by far.
Avoid this class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: One of the most life changing experiences was taking a class with Susie. Her constant anger and outrageously inappropriate behavior is openly accepted at CMU, a abusive, hostile demeanor encouraged by her admin. Susie showed me that people are rewarded for being cruel and manipulative, and that pursuing art is not worth dealing people like her.

She gets a lot of her own problems involved in class and makes the class atmosphere extremely depressing. Also very critical and opinionated, so a lot of the work feels like it's geared towards pleasing her taste rather than expressing your vision. She's a knowledgeable professor, just like many other.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Mean and angry all the time, she made me and other students cry.  I learned editing alright and using cameras but I also hate myself because of how mean she was.

Susie values hard work, so don't take her classes if you're coasting. In my experience, she bonded more obviously with certain students and picked on the weakest link in the class, so don't be that person. If you need help with software, hardware, editing, or finding artists whose work may be of interest to you, she is a wealth of information.

Suzie is definitely tough and she might throw some devastating blows to your ego, but she knows her material. If you work hard (especially outside of class), not only will you learn a damn lot, but she might even like you. And trust me, she is a great professor to have on your side.
he is just awesome! CMU MSE would be the best one in the world if we had a number of Profs like sridhar! he is just GREAT!!!
Good teacher. Makes stuff pretty clear.
Prof. Seetharaman is a very good teacher who is very practical in how he teaches and makes his homework assignments and exams.  He is also quite willing to help whenever you ask.
Great teacher, very helpful and eager to answer any questions
HE is the man!
No Comments
Although Transport is required for the MSE curriculum, Seetharaman does a pretty good job of helping you understand the material and boosting your grade if you need it.
No Comments
MSE professor.  Sridhar's the best.
Hilarouos, witty, challenged the students to be smart
disrespectful to students in constant typos on assignments, lecture slides, and tests
bad attitude, little respect to students, unclear assignment requirements, slow response
He's great
Not very patient. Homework requirement not clear.
great
Best teacher for a programming language I have ever had
No Comments

Not a bad professor or class, but not GREAT either. I didn't think it was terribly interesting, but Professor Roehrig is very enthusiastic. The homework was not THAT difficult, but it took a bit of time. The quizzes were fairly easy. Final exam not bad either. Get the book - his slides are sort of helpful, but the book is where it's at.

This guy assigns an insane amount of homework, is completely inflexible about just about everything, grades on attendance no matter whether you have a valid reason to not be there or not (does not give free misses) and is overall a bad teacher. He also assigns hw randomly without telling people and does not give extensions.

The review below is baffling considering that his biggest complaint and weakness was his inability to change. We literally had the university people come in to give him criticism, which he then ignored and made excuses and not change anything. The way the review is worded similar to how prof sullivan speaks, just my observation.

Prof. Sullivan's class isn't fun, but I learned a lot. It's a lot of dry material shoved into a semester. However, the worst reviews on this site are a poor representation of him and his course. In truth, he cares about his students and is liked by those who work for him, he listens and improves the course, and teaches the material thoroughly.

This class taught me a lot about instrumentation. The tests were reasonable. Only thing that really hurt was not easing up on HW after direct feedback. He did seem a bit apathetic at times, but gave ample opportunities for extra credit and expressed a willingness to change the course after hearing blind feedback from the class.

I actually got depression from going to his class. He's so rude to his students and can't teach at all. Only cares about himself and confronts students if they correct his mistakes. The worst professor I have ever had, BY FAR! I'm not surprised his ratings are so low.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT--So many papers

comment: He does not care about his students at all. He only cares about him being and never admits his mistakes when students point it out. His tests are not even what we learned about. aroudn 30% of the test is about random proteins and environmental stuff that is about his own research not even related to the curriculum. He should be fired immediately.

He's so bad that there are memes made about him on facebook pages. Everyone in this class, and I mean everyone, complained about him. He said he didn't know what changed this semester when students complained about workload. This was the semester when the corona virus forced us to go online. Does this guy care about his students at all??

Lecture style is not for everyone (dense slide shows + printed skeleton notes), but class is well-organized, and little outside of the information given in class is needed. Homework is busywork to a large extent, and deadlines are sometimes unreasonable. Sometimes confuses students more when answering their questions.

Absolutely horrendous. There's a reason he has one of the lowest ratings on FCE amongst all professors at CMU. Even our advisor complains about him and criticizes him. He attacks students if they try to correct him in class. Eberly center came in to give him feedback, but he made excuses and did not chagne anything. DEFINITELY do not take his class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Grading was very harsh. Lectures did not well prepare people for weekly quizzes so the class average was quite low. She is very mean towards students by saying that she wasted a good 15 mins of her time trying to recognize my handwriting. (I have never got any points off/received any complaints from any class because of my handwriting before.)
Professor Simmons is very friendly and inspiring. Her teaching pace might be a little too slow, though.

I'm interested in learning another language so I thought NATURE OF LANGUAGE would be a good course to take (& get gen ed requirements filled) Overall I enjoyed the class but Dr. Simons can be confusing and present her lectures in a condeluded way. Easy readings. Recommend going to Office hours (both for Prof and TAs) because they're SUPER helpful.

Mandy is awesome! She is such a caring and kind professor. I didn't do well on my first paper for 80-484, and we made an appointment to go over everything I missed in my paper in great detail. I took her 80-180 last spring and have now taken her 80-484. I always love Mandy's classes.

I had difficulties while in her class, and she was so understanding and helpful in meeting my needs. She was accessible outside of class for feedback and to go over material. Professor Simons also gave me by far the best writing feedback Ive ever received from an educator. Knows her field in incredible depth and cares enough to share it with you

Daily quizzes have stuff on them she never spoke about. Very ambiguous, sometimes the quiz answers are different than the reading they're supposed to be based on. Mandatory attendance for somewhat boring lectures. Can't use tech

She is very very kind. She gives very interesting lectures, and really pays attention to class feedback. I am really enjoying her class and highly recommend. the discussions make me feel very close to my other classmates, and the learning environment is wonderful.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Her lectures and the readings are very engaging. You will learn a lot by showing up to class.

Great teacher; very enthusiastic about and interested in linguistics. She was the advisor for the major, but it changes every so often. She's clear in her explanations. Nature of Language with her is relatively simple if you get the concepts, and homework is once every 2-3 weeks. Not many exams. As a Linguistics major, I like her.

The lecturers are not responsible. The lab materials are of poor quality and poorly designed. It is hard to read the instructions and know what they expect of us. The starter code is written poorly with a bunch of errors and malfunctions.

To be honest, it was hard. Since it's hard, the professor is really important but he would not actually teach you real stuff and he was really code blooded to treat his students. I feel bad for his children. Good luck for you (whoever is reading and wishing to take the class... don't if you have a choice)

This guys is a joke. His lecture is boring and useless, even this class is called distributed system, he did not teach a single thing about distributed system. Please avoid this guy if you can. His lectures are boring and his homework/project has nothing related to his lecture and you have to learn on Google. Such a bad professor !
I literally want to die because of him. He is awful even though you look at him and feel he would be a nice teacher. He isn't. tough, hard and you just don't understand the materials.
Awful, they don't even allow students to submit lab earlier???? I mean is this still a teacher??? Making fun of their students? If you enjoy these, take with him.
The exam is insane. 60 minutes 40 question and you cannot go back. The thing that you thought you learn will never be tested..

You would never learn because it's so hard to learn. He simply assumes that we know some basics, but we don't. The quiz is random and it's not even fair for students to have different types of quiz problems which some covers the lab and some covers the project. Technically, you couldn't learn because there is so much left to learn.

Professor Mertz is really nice and is a great teacher. My problem was that I firmly believe I did not need the course. There was an exam before the course started and if you get 70/100 or above then you are exempted. I scored 67. I know its below, but its not that much below. I just didn't want to be in that class because I know that I dont need it

Distributed Systems is an excellent course combinedly taken by Prof. Merts and Prof. McCarthy. The classes are a lot of fun and the concepts are clearly understood with the super fun and challenging projects that we are given.
Best professor ever had.
Ridiculous workload

Good professor and a great person with concerns about students who work sincerely. The course is very heavy- challenging HWs, project and quizzes that eat up the whole weekend. However if you put in adequate work, the outcomes are worth it.

I have never seen a professor care so much about ensuring the students learn. He explains concepts very well and is very patient. Understands the difficulties faced by students and is very approachable.

Confusing slides. Usually, 30 slides to explain one super easy concept, including super complex or advanced unnecessary calculus/optimization/Machine Learning/Linear Algebra knowledge. Yes. As a student who has taken all the referred math/machine learning courses, I can understand, struggle. But not all students can.

Incredible man and genuinely nice person. Cares deeply for his students - advocates for them and spends a lot of time writing recommendations, connecting his students with both academia and industry, and revising his course content. IDL isn't easy (ton of work) but it's really enough to become an ML engineer. Got my job because of Bhiksha.

Bhiksha is a truly awesome professor who delivers engaging lectures and wants you to learn. Weekly quizzes and biweekly projects are a lot of work and ate up most of my weekends. But the course is worth it. You can get a taste of the material by watching recordings on Youtube and checking the assignments.
Brilliant class!

Bhiksha is very responsible as he is very patient in explaining things and holding extra office hours, or even classes, for students who don't understand his lecture. However, sometimes you lose the track of his talking in class. When you understand the materials and look back, you will get his talking and say "Ah! That's what he tried to explain."
Very helpful.
Utterly useless class and waste of resources.

Ignore the positive reviews below that are for a different Johnson in Math. Andrew basically just takes up space here at the College of Fine Arts, but isn't really an artist or a teacher. Classes are dysfunctional and there's no mentoring or guidance. Probably better off taking similar courses in School of Design instead of CFA.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Inspirational.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He is easily the most inspiring, well read, and enthusiastic art teachers I have ever had. Out of the box with a super duper loose curriculum. Any day he can just decide "its too stale in here, we're gonna go outside and draw weird things. One thing, dont ask him for clarification on his thought process, artistically he moves a mile a minute.
Best prof I have ever had, a little disorganized but incredibly intelligent and knowledgeable about art. Took me in directions I never expected but I never felt pressured. The GA was also fantastic.

Often loses temper on students and gets too close, acts as if he knows what is best for them without actually thinking about other people's taste.  I wanted to learn photoshop and it was the main topic, but the course lost focus and everyone just did random projects.
Definitely a great teacher to take if you want a bit of a challenge. I wish I listened more to what he had to say-he pushed me hard and I fought when I should've listened!

Class: Concepts 1(disregard if you got him for drawing) If you want an easy class, dont take Johnson, if you want to push the boundaries of what you thought you could do,take Johnson's. He's crazy, disjointed, we don't follow a lesson plan we learn alot and think even more. He will help if you ask. I recommend him for anyone thinking art

If you expect boring, traditional classes where the professor tells you exactly what to do - dont take him!  if you want to learn things in a different way and make self discoveries, he is the professor for you.
nasty, negative -- helpful if you let him be, though. he's tough, so you gotta be tough too.

Professor Dilsun is a nice lady who seems to actually care about her students. I rarely went to lecture because of how amazing the course notes were, but every time I went she was able to explain things very clear and took time to answer the many questions I had during and after lecture.

Dilsun is very kind and always answers student questions without making them feel dumb. The assignments and midterms are the same as Iliano's so the class is still really tough, but Dilsun makes lectures a little better
She's very nice, trying to remember students' names, and very organized in her lecture. I enjoyed attending her lectures which made everything clear and easy to learn.
Cares so much, but is extremely boring in lecture(fall asleep snooze).

Great professor and lectures are very clear. The class itself is interesting, although the homeworks, particularly the writtens, are very mundane. But that's not so much a problem with Dilsun but rather with the class as a whole. Would recommend choosing this instructor if possible for the class.
Dilsun is a really kind professor and her lectures are very well-delivered.

Kaynar is such a wonderful professor. She truly cares about her students which is a rarity. Despite the class being incredibly difficult, Kaynar goes the extra mile to ensure all her students have the resources necessary to being successful
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Dilsun is one of the most caring professors at CMU. She prepares her lectures really well and ensures that everyone could fully understand her. So grateful to have her for 15122.

I really enjoyed this class. Prof Kaynar made this class worthwhile. She loves the material and makes every effort to help the students find a passion for it as well. She is the sweetest professor and always wants to answer questions.
Useless class. He dragged through droning derivations
Disrespectful of students; doesn't teach material well; consistently goes over time; avoid any class he teaches.

One word-incomprehensible, both on the board and verbally.  I asked him to resort to charades at one point.  Just memorize the book.  He is a good dude, but keep in mind that his curves are anti-curves.  I didn't get burned by this but friends did.
Very clear and patient and respectful to students. Spent a lot of time with me after class to help me understand certain concepts that weren't clear to me. Helped me a lot with the assignments.

He really had a passion for the subject matter, and worked very hard to show us the beauty of stat mech.  It was obvious if you ever went to talk to him in person that it was important to him that we understood the material.
Disrespectful of students.  Harsh curve for a required course.
No Comments
No Comments
Poor professor  teacher

The TAs deserve almost as much credit as Von Ahn, since they write all of the assignments, but 251 is an amazing class.  Von Ahn is a funny, informative, and brilliant lecturer, and the class goes through an enormous amount of information in a short time.  You will suffer, but you will love it.
Totally awesome class and awesome professor. I switched majors straight away.
His lectures are both very entertaining and informative. He has a lot to teach and is very interesting. This particular class has enough work to kill you.

I dropped 15-251 and switched majors entirely. While this is partly because Luis is VERY HARD, it is mostly because CS wasn't for me. Luis challenges students and comes off a bit harsh, but is a very entertaining lecturer and a fascinating individual.
No Comments

251 was HARD as hell, but Luis made it enjoyable, at least. He does lots of fun things to get students' attention, but honestly, I didn't care about this course at all and got tired of him near the end. Brilliant guy though.
Good teacher, gives clear explainations of the concepts and always has humorous material to keep everyone awake (the crush script, the marshmellow launcher etc...)

Brandon is hands-down one of the best professors I have come across at CMU. He is a superstar in the world of cybersecurity, yet he is so down-to-earth. He goes out of his way to help his students, and is always accessible and helpful. Genuinely passionate about teaching. 10/10 would definitely take another one of his courses in the future.

An amazing professor with great passion for teaching and answering questions from students. His enthusiasm made the class feel very enjoyable and at the same time interesting to learn more about network defenses (almost contagious)!

Brandon is enthusiastic, knowledgeable and most importantly friendly. He always showed willingness to support those who struggled with the material or the labs, he also sat beyond class time to offer help to students.
A really great professor who wants you to learn, and an even better person who wants you to succeed in your career as well

Brandon teaches using lectures, answers questions clearly, and makes himself available for any concerns or issues you have (especially lab issues!). He goes out of his way to make sure you're doing well and understanding the material. Also he's the sweetest and has great family and industry stories.

Brandon was absolutely one of the best professors I've ever had. He really roots for you to do well and is always so helpful and patient with any and all questions. I highly recommend taking his class.
I really enjoyed his hands-on teaching style. Brandon is also very attentive and would always be willing to help students who are lost in class.
A really
You get a lot out of the class if you pay attention and they work hard to make not only the professors but also the TA available and helpful.
Good teacher. Print off his online notes and his lectures become much easier to follow.
had him for 131 and 340.  I don't know why, but I just don't like him.  Not personable.
Not a whole lot of personality but still a good teacher. I thought the tests were hard but you were given ample time
Good Teacher, his explainations were clear and he was always well prepared for class.  BONUS: take his class and you may get to hear about "Schumacher's Cat" (used to illustrate Rutheford scattering)
You can easily get lost in his lectures, and he was no help at all when I had a conflict with his exam that was another academic class.
Schumacher sometimes loses me in lecture, but he is very helpful when asked for assistance and seems to have a genuine concern for his students.
Not the most exciting teacher, but very hepful when needed

Yao was better at teaching in Mandarin. Just kinda chatting about content was a good way to learn Chinese and a less good way to learn history. Her grading criteria were also clearer for both 82231 and 82232, whereas 82333 was more just 'did she vibe with your presentation'. I came in with a bunch of prior knowledge, so at least it was an easy A.

Not only an excellent professor, Yao Laoshi is also an incredibly kind person. Her course was extremely challenging and all classes are entirely in Chinese, but I learned a lot from her. She supported me through some difficult times and would worry about us if we were absent. She was so proud of me after our oral exam and gave me a hug!
She expects you to participate and practice speaking. There are weekly quizzes.
More than anything, she wants to see that you're interested in the class. Pay attention, ask questions and volunteer to read and you're guaranteed an A.

She is HOT! Very good looking woman! I couldnt concentrate. She is strict though, which makes her even hotter!!! The other students should be in an English class! NOT THEIR OWN LANGUAGE! Then again, if CMU had Korean, I'd take it for an EASY A toooooo. <><
No Comments

Yao is great,just do the work and show her you are learning something..you will get what u deserve..go to class though. the material isnt so easy coming from elementary.Many presentations, essays, strict attendence. And yes, too many losers looking for easy A. Losers who should be in an English class not their own language.but dept wont do anything
Great teacher and very understanding. Maybe it is the material or how the class is set up, but was not easy to learn in this class. too many losers looking for the easy A.
She's so sweet and the lectures are awesome

Fully lecture-based. There is no interaction with students, which may make the lecture very boring and difficult to concentrate on. There were only three exams and no other assignments, which I personally think is not encouraging the learning process at all.

It was unbelievable to see such a positive vibe in the classroom, thanks to her. You can clearly see her enthusiasm and excitement of all the material. She is so interested in everything and takes time to get to know you. Would 11/10 recommend.
She is very passionate with her lectures, that makes interesting and entertainment.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Really passionate, really engages you with each building

Diane Shaw inspired me continuously throughout my architectural education @ Carnegie Mellon. By far my favorite processor throughout my college experience. She has a way of making buildings come to life in a rich, passionate, funny way & challenged us to view architecture as a story. I took every class of hers that I could :)

Professor Shaw is an absolutely astounding professor, easily my favorite one from my six years at Carnegie Mellon.  I took every architecture class of hers that I could, and loved them all.  She makes it about more than just what's in the textbook: you learn about culture, the other arts, and history as well.  So much admiration for her!

Really funny, and really interested in what she teaches--and by virtue of that, makes it interesting to learn. Was only mildly curious about architectural history before I took the class, but the class turned out really interesting and even kind of fun. Don't miss a lecture if it can be helped.
Gives possibly too much feedback for the papers we have to write. She is quite caring, but you must participate in discussions in class in order to receive full credit.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: The other reviews of Professor Wright are correct, however I'd like to give her a little more credit. She is very curt and rude to students, especially if you are shy and don't like to speak up, but if you follow her directions to at T (which is incredibly easy, as she is incredibly clear about her expectations) you will most likely receive an A.
Just the worse
Constantly challenging the low bar of being a professor
Terrible professor, no point in taking the class. Simply wasting time for no reason and spending more time on it than my core classes.
Avoid at all costs
Bruh fr tho so bad
Absolute worst professor I've ever had, ever. Marks everything unreasonably, unreasonable feedback with no basis. Brags about her family all the time, has no intentions of actually helping students.
She is one of the worst teachers I've ever had. She's nice though...

Much of what we did was irrelevant, but some of the readings were interesting.  If only they had something to do with the essays we were suppose to write. TChang's alright, but get to know your TAs - they're the ones giving you grades and most are pretty helpful.  Class not as helpful as recitation.
do not take this course
I didn't mind her, until she spent a whole class period reading the syllabus to us in th e middle of the semester.  Useless!
Found interesting readings but had nothing interesting to say about them.
The course was interesting, a bit all over the place at times.  Professor Chang is knowledgeable and comes across as caring.
No Comments
Prof Chang is great.  She tries hard and has a lovely voice.  But ... I don't know why we have to take this course!
Teaching for the second half of the semester was very hard to follow. The exams do not reflect the teaching content or the knowledge, the curve is unreasonable which I think do not encourage learning
Nice guy. Useful OH. Lectures and homework are basic. Exam difficulty fluctuates a lot. Expect zero partial credit. Notes not recorded or posted anywhere. Would recommend another teacher for 21-228.
ok lectures, tests vary in difficulty, same for homeworks

lectures are confusing, pushes heavy usage on textbook and youtube lectures. features extremely tough tests and assignments with minimal grading leniency, making it hard to gauge standing. 
avoid at all costs
Does not teach the best

Writes lecture on board, but it's hard to follow. Relied on textbook and YouTube lectures (search for "cmu 21-228" on YT). Homeworks and tests are very hard and there is no partial credit. I had no idea if I was learning the right things or how well I was doing in the class. Expect pain and suffering

Confusing lectures, the textbook is clearer when explaining difficult concepts. Difficult exams and homework, very little partial credit given. Class is curved but prof is vague about specifics so hard to know where you stand.

Lectures are dry and dont help you understand the concepts. Homework and exams are also extremely difficult for no reason. Only good thing is that he curves, so as long as you can keep up with the content you can easily get a good grade.
Awful dont take him. Hopefully the curve is hefty because thats the only thing that can save me.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This professor is awful. Lectures are uninspiring, his slides are useless and exams/HW are unjustifiably hard. The material he tests on are much more difficult than what he discusses in class and even unrelated. He also explains things too quickly, then gets annoyed at students who ask clarifying questions. TLDR: DO NOT TAKE HIS COURSE.

His lectures are extremely difficult to understand and useless. He doesn't answer many questions from students, such as some math problems because "Calculus I is a prerequisite", even if the concepts aren't even covered in Calc 1. Oftentimes the homework is too difficult, and the tests are impossible to complete (avg score for midterm 1 was a 59).

comment: Clementi's lectures go fast and can be hard to understand, but it is reasonable given the amount of content he has to cover. The first week of lectures and homework are the hardestso don't be too afraid if the material seems overwhelming at first. Definitely a significant weekly time commitment and the tests are hard but everything is curved.

comment: Might be the worst professor at NYU. You dont know your grade until the last minute, the criteria is so unclear that you would just end up with an B. Absolutly no one listens to his class - I would rather sit and do nothign at Washington Square Park than do go to one of his lectures.

comment: Terrible professor, terrible lectures. Everybody falls asleep during his classes and his grades are also extremely subjective.
Very intelligent Italian professor.  No problem with accent.  Nice guy.  Very into his research and not as much into clear teaching.
Great professor! Definitely my favorite that semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--Hilarious

comment: Lots of reading (a reading journal entry or an argument outline sketch due every class) but very detailed, lots of interesting debatesdiscussion, and pretty thought-provoking. Pay attention in class! Work hard and do the readings and it will be rewarding.
Lectures are discussion format, so don't take the class if you're not ready to contribute at least a little. Great coverage of very interesting topics, and not a ton of work overall.

He knows his material, and is willing to teach it. His lectures often take discussion formats and he facilitates student discussion with him guiding it; if this appeal to you, the class itself will be enjoyable. However, grading is done by TA, while he is willing and accommodating to help students, the result is that he has little impact on grades.
Obvious that he has a passion for teaching and philosophy. Really wants students to learn and understand concepts. But too much work... TAs do pretty much all of the grading.

Terrible professor. Does not handle any aspect of grades nor does he care about any aspect of grades and delegates everything to TAs. Lectures are mildly interesting, but assigns an absurd amount of work.

Awesome class, as long as you put in the effort. Participate in discussions, and read all of the assignments closely and you will get a lot out of this class. I was not his biggest fan in the beginning, but looking back his class was one of the best experiences of freshman year. Nice guy too.

He's a pretty good professor in general. Knows his stuff and is somewhat interesting. He's not very helpful and directs you to the TAs and grading always depends on the TA. Depending on the TA you'll either get an easy A or you'll get a C.

Rebecca May's classes are the only ones that I cared for as an undergrad. I looked FORWARD to going to class in the morning. So interesting and intellectual. VERY helpful, definitely reach out for help. Just a great person. So much respect for her. You'll learn literature like never before!!
Becca's class is by far the only one i look forward to. So interesting, so intellectual, so fun....EPIC

I LOVE BECCA!!!!! She was THE most amazing prof I've ever had!  Taking her class made Alice in Wonderland my favorite book and the paper that I wrote her that class is my favorite that I have ever written.  Take her if you can- she's so nice and extremely enthusiastic about the material.
Becca kicks all kinds of ass!
Becca was my TA for Shakespeare and she was amazing!  She gave great comments and critiques on papers and was really easy to talk to.

This is the best class I am taking as a freshmen right now. She is very enthuastic and energetic, especially at 8:30 am! It's amazing that I can even learn something that early! She is also going to be teaching shakespeare.
Awesome course!  Take interp with Becca!
Interpretation and Argument is the best class with her! She is so much fun and I recommend to take her course! I took APEA with her and she is very kind and EXTREMELY helpful :)

One of the best professors I've had at CMU. She is also able to make statistics funny which is quite the feat. A very kind and caring professor as well. As with most CMU stats courses, the material is rather challenging so GO TO CLASS. and do the homework yourself. Wish I had followed my advice.

Rebecca Nugent has a lovely personality and makes the statistics class rather enjoyable. Some of the material is challenging, though she strives to give as much information as possible during the lectures, At some points, the pace is a bit quick and the homework can be difficult, but with the right level of effort, the class is easy to handle.
Hot professor  lectures are extremely fast paced, she'd go over a ton of materials but doesn't post lecture notes so if you don't pay attention to her lecture you'd be lost and suffer in statistics
Great prof, but extremely fast pace. (Covered 4 months worth of material in 7 weeks) Homeworks are quite hard.
Dr. Nugent is the best professor I have ever had in CMU. She is smart and knows what she is teaching really well. She will always make you laugh :)

Like a lot of professors, she's fairly nice and quite helpful.  However, she has exceptional teaching prowess, and is hilarious.  And she's super smart on statistical concepts, namely networks and the concepts of basic graph theory that she teaches in her Freshman Seminar in statistics.  Them guest lectures are usually pretty reliable as well.
She's awesome, so is Statistics:)
She's the coolest professor ever!

Loved Professor Chin for this class. His jokes were quite interesting and kept us entertained. The only assignments you submit are graded, most of which are at the end of the semester. Would take one of his classes again! Make sure to exactly follow instructions of assignments or you'll be graded down.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: He rambles on the entire lecture while expecting you to copy down the slide show behind him. usually doesn't even give time to copy down notes. He continuously goes off on random tangents, and honestly doesn't make clear what he is trying to teach.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: One of my few complaints about Professor Chin is that oftentimes, specific facts mentioned in the textbook only once are able to be tested. However, if you study the textbook and lecture slides well, you should be ok. Tough paper grader, so go to office hours. He offers up to 5 percentage points of extra credit though, which is kind of unheard of.

To be completely fair and honest, Professor Chin is a somewhat nice guy and all but he's an awful lecturer. He then expected you to know all this random stuff about political theory even though he didn't even teach it. The university should do everyone a favor and make Professor Chin just do research instead of teach because he is awful. 0/10!

if you want an A or B you probably should not take John Chin's classes. very very harsh grading. he is a nice guy until he grades your papers and quizzes. you can do all the readings thoroughly like i did and still end up with 60s and 70s for grades.

Chin is just a boring dude, cares more about his research than his students' success. Highly recommended to stay away from Chin if you want an A... he gives out C's to his students because he grades harshly.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Ok so I am only writing this because Professor Chin doesn't deserve a 1-star rating. He is definitely a hard professor and sometimes his quiz questions are a little unfair. But I think overall, he cares about the students and is easy to work with if you're having trouble.

His class is extremely hard to get a good grade in, I had a 4.0 GPA until I took his course in which I received a C. He grades essays unfairly, and his quizzes are specific and based off of sometimes over 100 pages of reading. He's also very inflexible to improvement, stay away from his class!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Has got to be the worst professor I've had ever. Just go back to business, please!!! For the sake of the next generation of computer scientists!!!!!!!
Personally he was passionate about the content and clear about what he expected. This class was the ultimate grade deflation course and was not graded on any sort of curve. Struggled throughout.
Struggled hard in this class. Professor had too high expectations

Smart guy but lacks the personal skills to teach students. Very condescending during lectures and was not the nicest person outside of class. Very unaccommodating if you need an extension for assignments. He grades the term paper harshly and gives no partial credit on exams. Overall, hilariously difficult class for a graduate level course.

Personally, getting an A in this class was practically impossible. However, at the end of they day the course was extremely rewarding and insightful. I learned so much in the class and prof R, is an incredibly passionate man about what he teaches. If you approach this class with the mindset to learn, Dr. R will be nice to you

His expectations of a quantum computing class is unreasonably high and tedious. Lectures didn't make much sense at times and he was generally disconnected from the class with the material. He scared me a lot too at office hours and was not the most approachable guy. He is very knowledgably about the material but I don't think he can teach it well

Warning, Quantum Computation is NOT an easy class and Prof Ramachandran is not an easy professor by all means. That being said, Prof Ramachandran is one of the most intelligent professors I've had at CMU and his class was eye-opening. His lectures were generally interesting and he provided a business viewpoint to each lecture, which is cool.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: My experience in Prof Ramachandran's Quantum Information class was truly awful. He was an extremely cocky, condescending man with a massive ego during lectures and office hours. He is a very smart man but cannot teach for his life.  Projects were also very difficult and graded based on his mood that time. Avoid!!!!
Truly an amazing teacher. He really knows what he is talking about and is very passionate. The class is test heavy but make sure you go to recitation and do your homework
best professor I've ever had.
PhD Microeconomics

Awesome Professor.  Funny.  Had him for the PHD Micro.  Class was very hard, but his teaching was excellent.  If you have to start the day with microeconomic theory, this is how you'd want to do it.  LOTS of homework.
This man is wicked smart. Makes econ fun and relevant. Proves you don't have to be an arrogant jerk to be a brilliant success. I hear the intermediate class is hard, the intro class was easy.
One of the best profs I've ever had.......
No Comments
Great examples.  Smartest member of the Clinton administration.
sucks
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Her homework write-up was so clear that I want all the instructions that I receive in my whole life to be like that. The workload is heavy but since the instructions and TAs are helpful it's a fruitful and satisfying process (if you start working early, otherwise it is hell). Her lecture is also one of the best at Heinz, clear and easy to follow.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: If you don't get a correct output of your code, you will almost get 0, no credits for the other parts of the code. TA will not spend time reading your code, if you don't get it right, then you die. Every week has a quiz and a time limit lab. No excuse for absence, if you miss any quiz or lab, you will have a 0, no makeup exam.
Worst professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Neelam is a great professor,one could actually build strong fundamentals in java using this course. She gives very interesting questions for lab and practice. Exams are a bit tough but can be easily solved if you do all the labs and practice problems. The only complaint I have is attendance. A very good course, I would highly recommend this.

The exams and labs are challenging with time limit but the contents are fair. If you understand the class materials very well, there will be no surprises on the exams or labs. Quizzes are given at the end of the class based on self-assessment and lectures. I highly recommend to take Neelam's class if you want to get a solid foundation in JAVA.

Just had the first test of the semester tonight. You have an hour to code a high level task. It was awful, you can't use anything to help (no googling!). The class is run opposite of how you'd want a programming class to run. You "learn" outside of class and she answers questions inside class about what you learned.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: 350 characters is too short to describe how bad Neelam is. She is the worst student anyone has had by far & looks to punish students. She may be smart in Java but is unable to communicate concepts, is very rude, refuses to explain things looks to fail students and gives 2 quizzes per class via labs and reading quizzes. Run away as fast as you can.
A great Professor. Highly recommended.
Great knowledge about international policies and politics.

Silvia is a phenomenal instructor - best I've had in this subject area. I considered myself a good writer prior to this class, but her assignments have led to visible improvement. I disagree with some of the other posts - she welcomes opposing views but has little tolerance for poor analysis. You need to properly support your arguments.

Silvia is an incredible professor. She practically knows everything, and she's incredibly sweet. There's a lot of reading but you never have to do it, since she comes to class with handouts on everything you need to know. But her course material is super interesting, as are the class discussions. Add anything to those and she'll be pleased.

Her lectures are boring, but her assignments are easy. She likes you to spit back her opinions verbatim. She is EXTREMELY stubborn and views herself as superior to students. A good grade is not worth the stress of her personality.
lots of reading. useless class that is part of required core courses.
a little boring, but its not too hard if you do the reading..the class discussions can be very interesting
clean delivery of material, interesting reading

His lectures and recitations are not that helpful for me to be honest. The workload for this class is rather light, all we need to do for every week are two readings with five questions each and one FRQ.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof Smith is a great guy! Each week is 2 readings, reading questions, and a short essay. Lectures are interesting and discussion-based.
A real gem at Carnegie Mellon University! You are lucky to have this man as your professor, he will make you see the world in new and exciting ways.

Like the others said, Prof Smith is really receptive to student feedback--which is great--but the first quarter of 80-100 was brutal. Long readings due Monday and Wednesday. The grading criteria isn't clear as well and the comments the TAs/Smith leaves are ambiguous. Lecture was essentially useless in my POV but others really enjoyed his lectures.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Incredible guy. Super interesting while lecturing or when talking with. Gives two questions on a reading as homework and then discusses them in class. Then the class breaks into small group discussions about the material. He'll change the course's format based on student input too. Contender for best prof at CMU.
Great professor! Incredibly smart, and will take students' concerns and opinions into consideration. Is approachable. Do the readings and homework and show up to class and you will get an A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Amazing! So genuinely nice and caring to his students, and he WANTS to give you an A so don't give him a reason not to? Just do the (short) readings and write (short) responses to 2 questions, 2x a week + show up to class and you'll get an A for sure. (You could probably do less and get an A, but why? It's easy and interesting, respect the guy)
I love this man. He is genuinely a wonderful Prof that just cares about having his students learn. The most intelligent person I've ever met.
Soooo easy. Practice exams were identical to real exams. Best and easiest course at CMU.
Professor Erol is an amazing person and teacher who cares about his students both in and out of the classroom. One of my favorite teachers ever--he made me so much more interested in Economics.
Reasonable and fair professor - not sure why people had negative things to say.
Amazing Professor!!! Highly recommend him.
Very very hard class. He is a nice guy but is unfair with his homeworks and tests. They often have nothing to do with lecture. Going to his lectures and especially office hours is extremely useless.
One of my favorite professors
He is a horrible professor. Doesn't teach anything and then tests you on random economic theories he came up with during his time at UPenn.

Amazing professor. Truly knows his stuff. You know this guy revolutionized parallelism and invented things like Scan / some of the best graph theory algorithms?(read his wiki) He's on point when he teaches. Plus, the class is an easy A. DO 75% of the Homeworks and get an 80% exam average (not hard to do) and BOOM you have an A while learning a lot!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The professor doesn't reply to emails nor does he hold office hours.
Guy really cares about teaching, and it shows. Would recommend 210 with him even for non-majors.
Very good!
Blelloch is simply just a god. He taught me how to do things that I previously thought were impossible. One of the best professors at CMU, certainly one of the best CS professors ever, period.
Slightly boring at times, but overall Guy was a really good teacher who clearly cares about the material.  Very challenging course, but I learned a lot.
Very dedicated teacher.  Passionate about the material and covers a lot of it in a high level of rigor.  Not an easy course, but one worth taking.
No Comments

I took both Development and Advanced Development with him. He's very clear on the concepts and delivers good lectures. He's also good at drawing lol I asked him a lot of questions and he was patient with me. Even if he couldn't answer some of the questions right away, he would check them after class and send us emails.

Ettensohn is an excellent teacher, he makes things very clear. You really have to go to class though or else you'll miss a lot. The exams are not difficult if you study the material and go to class, very fair.

Although the lectures aren't mandatory, missing one will have you far behind.  He is the perfect teacher for students just entering college! He breaks everything down so you understand it. His test can be difficult just make sure you study your notes and know them well.

Class consists of writing copious notes, both from the chalkboard and from PowerPoint slides, so I would recommend sitting in the front, taking great notes. He assigns readings, but make sure to get the big picture by matching the notes with the readings. Tests are not too hard; just make sure to study.

the lectures are pretty good. my notes for this class came out pretty well and easy to study from, and he draws plenty of pictures that are easy to follow. the tests are hard...need to know concepts pretty well. no recitation, but plenty of test help. GO TO SI
Tests are hard. Overall I did not find the lectures helpful.

Tests are hard; multiple choice questions often have 6 or 7 answers so study hard and do the readings! Quizzes aren't hard and they are useful for studing. In lecture he is pretty good, but sit at the front so you can hear him.

Clear, helpful teacher. Tests are challenging and grading is tough/inconsistent -- check you're exams! That said, I found him to be on of the best, most straight forward professors I've had in the sciences.

Extremely rude and has no respect for students. Terrible terrible person, if you expect to be treated as human, stay away from her at all costs because she will attach you for no reason and made you think you are stupid, incapable of doing anything, and a terrible student. Miserable to work with
Extremely rude and has no respect for students, whoever working with her must have a miserable life. Stay away at all costs.
Extremely extremely rude professor! Do not take her classes if you have other choices.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Good professor! Very clear with explaining concepts. Tests are not extremely difficult. Lecture slides are clear. Good place to learn intro to ML

Awful professor, she accuses students of cheating (I did not cheat and had to prove I didn't). She doesn't seem to know the material too well either, she seems like she's perplexed by what she teaches. Complete waste of time, a udemy/coursera class would have you in a much better place.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Leman is incredibly rude to her students, mocking their lack of knowledge on things that are not prerequisites for the class. She teaches at various speeds and can deep dive into a topic and explain with clarity, but mere seconds later realize her pace is unacceptable and she accelerates past the point of comprehension. I would recommend avoid.
Rude.  Hopefully she doesn't last long after she get's terrible teaching evals this semester
Exams are nothing like the homeworks or PowerPoint.   No guidance on what needs to be learned.

Dylan Quintana was a great professor for my linear algebra and vector calc combined class. While it was scary that exams were 80% of our grade, it all paid off in the end. This class will be rough at times, and you will feel challenged, but Dylan gives you all you need to succeed. If you go to lecture, and leverage his notes, you will succeed.

Hello world!!! I took 21-254 (linalg and vector calculus) with DYLAN QUINTANA, the man, the myth, the legend !!!!
He is a great professor and is very funny and approachable. One thing about this course is that you need to beware of MATLAB assignments, since MATLAB can be very tricky and you need to practice regularly. 

Great professor, very caring

While the homework and tests are difficult, Quintana gives you everything you need to accomplish it. His whole class setup is the most well-put together I have ever seen, and I am forever grateful for his guided notes. He truly cares about his students, and it's certainly worth it to attend every lecture.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: There is no denying 21127 is a hard class, but taking it with him makes it so much better.

Very well organized.  Class website made it easy to find any notes if you had to miss a lecture.  Lectures were also very methodical and easy to follow.  The homeworks were definitely the hardest part of the class, ranging from average difficulty to a handful of tough questions, but never excessively hard.  Overall excellent class, very well taught
Good professor course is tough though
really clear lecture and notes, very caring and reasonable (homework and exams) and gives good feedback :D

He is not the best at explaining concepts, although his note sheets are good. Unfortunately, it is clear that he does not really care about the success of anyone in his class, so much that multiple people this semester had to drop it, including myself, and generally shows disregard when shown class concern.

Amazing professor, definitely cares about his students. More than willing to help students after class if you don't understand anything from lecture. Exams are 80% of the grade which is somewhat unfortunate but the material is very learnable if you put in the time. Would 100% take another class with Prof. Campbell.
My favorite class this semester! Professor Campbell gave very engaging lectures, and the class content was very interesting

Campbell is a great professor who made me look forward to the class even when it was super challenging. Three midterms each making up 20% of your grade. The final is another 20%. The lectures are very dense. Grading on exams and homework is annoying because they are looking for specific wording and phrases. 10/10 would take again

Easily my favorite class this semester. Lectures are engaging and he tells funny stories. Homework is weekly, but I found it interesting and fairly easy to get done. Attendance isn't mandatory, but there are quizzes every Monday. Flashcards are helpful for the class. Definitely possible to get an A, just put in the effort.

Dr. Campbell is an amazing lecturer and is incredibly engaging. Easily one of my favorite professors in the entire university. Caters to each student in the course, across all colleges and majors. Starts everyone out on an even playing field and assumes no prior knowledge. Always curves grades and expects you to really put your best effort forward.
Campbell is the man. Tough class, great stories. Read the textbook, go to SI.

He literally puts stuff on the tests that was never talked about. Going to SI is a MUST or you wont pass. You can hope and pray he uses the same questions as past exams but if he doesn't, its really hard to interpret what hes asking in his questions. Tests are unfair. Oh yeah, and lectures suck, he never finishes a thought he just rambles on
Participation in class isn't required, nor is note taking, but without it, you will fail. Study a lot for this class!! He was enthusiastic and made it interesting.

His tests are graded leniently but my biggest complaint is the long and unnecessary homeworks. They are seriously annoying and take forever, including coding problems. Also the short tests are hard and stressful, and just not necessary, especially since they make tests/exams worth 85% of the final grade.
I actually really enjoyed his lectures, and I think he is super nice and patient in answering questions. He also sends cute emails.
He can be a boring professor 90% of the time, but if you just show up to class and at least try to pay attention the class isn't that hard, gives good test prep resources as well.

Great guy with good lectures. While he is a little plain on the outside if you put your effort into listening during lectures he makes them interesting and worthwhile to attend. I would say that negative reviews from other students could definitely be from students discouraged by difficulty of course if you don't put effort in.
Super boring professor. Does not explain things intuitively. Trying to avoid future classes with this professor.
unclear lectures and gives a midterm the same week as a quiz and homework due date.
Very thorough explanations to all kinds of problems
Homeworks are long, but tests are fairly straightforward as long as you do the practice. Freeman and his TA's are always willing to help. Attendance is extra credit

Jeff is AWESOME I would absolutely recommend taking a class with him. He's very engaging, knew everyone's names after the first week and called on most people every class. Super interesting and knowledgable guy!
You can tell he really cares about his students. I feel bad I kept falling asleep in class.

Jeff honestly cares about his students. The classes I've taken with him have been my favorite, despite it being nowhere affiliated with my major. His seminars are smaller so participation is essential to get the most out of the class but he makes you feel so comfortable that participation isn't a problem.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: awesome dude. super respectful of my mental health struggles and is overall a great professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: What an amazing professor! Jeff was kind and funny and as someone who didn't take Intro when entering the class, he was able to create an environment where I wasn't shy to share my opinions on the films we watched. I highly recommend taking his classes!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Probably the best professor I've had at CMU. Humorous, engaging, and approachable with just the right amount of intimidation. Would highly recommend taking a class with him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: No Comments
No Comments

Straightforward and socially awkward, which can come across as rude. Very nitpicky over student's writing, but lenient with grading. I've written several papers that she's torn to pieces in her comments but still got an 8/10 on. Don't you casual language, because she takes every word that you write very seriously and literally.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Has relatively balanced views on an inflammatory topic- the Middle East. That is really valuable.

Professor Eisenberg is a wonderful professor with a wealth of knowledge to share with her students.  She is certainly a tough grader, but not out of spite.  Prof. Eisenberg is particular, but polite; encouraging, but realistic.  I highly recommend this professor to my peers.
Very great teacher, communicates the material very well

Prof. Eisenberg is fantastic. I don't particularly care about the Arab-Israeli conflict but she makes it fun and interesting, but there is a lot of work that goes into taking her class so be prepared! If you want to learn, take this class if you're looking to get an easy A, take something else.
Demands high quality assignments - you can't just write bs down and get credit for it.  Encourages interesting discussions and debates and teaches the material masterfully.

I didn't like Prof. Eisenberg at first, she is very direct and often somewhat curt with students.  However, in the long run this is really a benifit to her as a professor as she provides very clear and percise feedback on papers and other class work.  I came to apprecitate her as a great professor!

Pat is a sweetheart, almost to a fault. If you blow off her class, she'll most likely still give you a good grade but the disappointment in her sweet eyes will guilt you forever. If you work hard, she'll give you more than you could ever ask for in support, guidance, and time.

Pat is awesome. She is truly helpful and the sweetest lady ever. She will not force you to work, creating a self driven environment. If you put effort into the class, she will give you back at least twice as much effort to help you in whatever you do.

Interesting way of teaching...could be nonchalant at times, crits don't really give benefit of the doubt to her students. Tells you to do a project a certain way, then criticizes it after doing it like she told you to. Strange.
The best teacher I had freshman yr. TALENTED, inspiring, interesting, and fun. She isnt a pushover, but she will trust you if you dont abuse it.
Patricia was truly a mentor. I highly recommend anyone with a true passion for art to take her classes.
Highly recommended
ok concept studio professor, good drawing professor(gives good crits/feedback).
i love him !

Brilliant, interesting professor. Some say lectures can be dull, but I find that his enthusiasm for Anthropology and the topics enliven the discussions significantly compared to other Anthro courses. Probably my favorite in the history department.
brilliant
discussion is relaxed, which works well for my style
he knows so much but his classes are so very dull.
Great professor.  Not the most assertive lecturer, but great non the less.
great professor, knows so much. good class.

Orkun is a very inspirational and passionate professor! I really learned a lot from him. He taught me the importance of solving problems independently and the pleasure of sharing knowledge with others. I found that many students in the lecture became more and more confident and found themselves interested in computer programming beacause of Orkun!

Professor Orkun explains the complicated knowledge clearly and thoroughly. And he always answers students question after class. His classes makes programming easy and fun. All in all, he is one of the best teacher Ive ever meet.

A decent teacher who really knows the content of the class. Will be accessible even not in working time. Also shows passion on teaching and answering questions. Your life will be much easier with him.

Professor Orkun is one of the best professor I've ever knew. His classes are very helpful. He introduced me the charm of programming, and always inspired and courage me to try something more challenging and exciting. Also, he is a very responsible professor. Every time I have questions, he is willing to offer help.

Prof. Orkun is expert in the field of Engineering. He loves to interact with students, care for their progress, and strongly encourages creative thoughts. Being humorous with a dedicated and rigorous teaching style, he'll always be friendly and inspiring enough to help you and motivate you! He will definitely make you love Engineering!
Extraordinary professor.
The greatest professor I have ever met

Such a funny professor hes always making jokes during lecture and seems so excited about what hes teaching. Very patient when answering questions and overall just a good dude. Kinda strict on grading but u get a dropped test

Professor Fernando is a great professor. Even though he makes Calculus I a really hard class, it is still an enjoyable class. He cares about his students and makes jokes in class to make them more entertaining. He is a great person and very accessible outside of class. Overall, hard class where you will learn a lot and have fun with his lectures!

Professor Fernando is an amazing lecturer. His jokes make people laugh! As long as you show up in class, finish your homework, and go to office hours if you don't understand something, you can get an A (He drops two lowest quizzes). He is patient to his students and approachable even not during office hours. Good at explaining!

I did pretty well in the class, but I know a lot of my peers were struggling. He went over the material pretty quickly but spent too much time going over all the minor proofs that we ended up being behind schedule for most of the semester. I think if he could be better if he spent more time actually focusing on the course material instead.

He's a cool guy but he made the class so unnecessarily hard. The grading is not forgiving at all either, even if it's obvious you understand the concepts but you make a small mistake you get a lot of points off. The grade I got was definitely not worth all the work I put in.

I expected calc 1 to be my easiest class of the semester, but I quickly realized that it would be much more difficult than I initially anticipated. Fernando has very fast paced lectures and likes to focus on the proofs behind each concept. His tests and quizzes are extremely difficult, and you really have to work for an A.

Easily the worst professor of this semester. He is a visiting professor from Northeastern university and he has turned a regular introductory class into an abnormally difficult class where you need to put in 2 hours/day studying in order to just pass the class. What he teaches in class and what we are assessed on in exams/quizzes are not the same.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She is incredibly caring and truly an awesome prof! Her attitude towards students is so refreshing and really conducive to understanding the material!

She's very nice and very smart, but a hard grader. Be sure to follow her report-writing instructions to the letter, no matter how trivial they may seem. Lecture can get pretty boring, but definitely take good notes! She covers everything you'll need to write your lab reports and get a good grade.

Whether or not you're really interested in the material, or even being in lab, she makes things understandable and somewhat interesting. Always really helpful when anyone had questions or wanted help with a lab report. I was sad to switch professors when I finally finished Lab II and III.

I think she is very clear on what she wants and she goes over exactly how she wants her lab reports set up. You can't make a lab II class much easier. She is also always available for help. She may sounds unsure of herself but I think that's just how she talks.
She is so confused all the time just on her own - she should not be allowed to teach! She goes back on her word and lies to professors. Don't go to her with a problem.
Shes easy/self-explanatory, but Lab2 means HELL, as spending 10-15 hours on lab reports. o.chem was EASY.
She explains things relatively well and there are no surprises in her class.  If you put the time into it, you'll do fine.
Howard is awesome.He knows everyone's name and really cares about his students. The best way to succeed in this class is to go to his office hours-he gives great help on hw.
Cares so much about students, is always willing to help, in any way that he can. Only wish he taught more classes.

Howard is a phenomenal teacher.  He cares deeply about his students (memorized all 100+ names in the first week!). He also is committed to teaching (he works hard to make the material accessible, and is constantly seeking to improve).  Great person. Great teacher.  I definitely recommend any class he's teaching.
Nice guy, very accessible. Cares about his students' progress.
He knows how to teach. Well-designed assignments, people come out the class happy and educated. Great guy in person too!
Great teacher. Always puts aside the time to meet with you and answer any questions.
very helpful guy-not a hard course and he's always available to answer questions
Awesome
He's OK - Book could be better
A great guy and he knows what he's talking about. That said, his lectures are completely useless and I learned everything I needed to know from the book and homeworks.
great prof

Lectures could be more engaging but he gets the point across ok.  HW not too difficult.  Mousetrap car project was awesome!  It felt like the most relevant thing to engineering we did all semester.  I love how some ECE's attached (auto-inflating balloons) to their car, but the car failed to complete most of the actual objectives.
No Comments
His wife bakes for the class

Very confusing class. Professor went over material too quickly in lectures and did not check for students' understanding in between. Lecture notes were not published and course material was hard to access online. Abysmal class averages on tests.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Overall a very confusing and disorganized class. HWs were very long (16 hrs on average) and Tests were also not reasonable. I felt like I learned nothing after every lecture. Youtube, TA's OH (not his tho, he was mad confusing), and the textbook carried me through this class. Very few other useful outside resources.
This yo-ho should not be teaching

Prof. Bukh was very passionate about the subject matter, and consistently asked if students understood what he was saying.  He was a bit idiosyncratic, if in an endearing way, and seemed to embody many of the most stereotypical traits of a professor -- somewhat disorganized, kindly, pedantic, and above all, intellectual.
The professor is an incredibly smart mathematician but he does not really know how to be a good lecturer. The notes is confusing, and the pace is too fast for someone who is not a genius.

Boris is extremely passionate about mathematics. He asks good questions on tests, and the bonus problems in his assignments are very interesting. His enthusiasm for math is evident; on occasion he hops with delight when he has shown us an interesting proof or result. He is clearly very knowledgable about linear algebra.
His intellectual arrogance can be matched by no other professor at CMU; he dismisses students' comments often. For somebody who is apparently sooooo smart, I wonder why his class is such a bore.

Took a summer course called Concept of Maths with Rami in the Summer of 2003 at Carnegie Mellon. 8 of us in the class. 6 of us were close friends from ECE. He suspected some of us cheated during our homework and vowed that if we got caught, he will make sure we get expelled. The threat stopped after all 6 of us scored above 90% in the mid term.
Really great prof! Even though his accent is hard to understand at first, it gets better. He really knows his stuff! Higher level classes taught by him are really worth taking.

Tells interesting stories/gives interesting applications/examples for many topics covered in class (Concepts of Math.) I found his accent very hard to understand, on top of that he would tend to stand in front of proofs while writing them (You could only see when he moved on to the next one) and his handwriting would sometimes be near unreadable.

I disagree with an earlier comment; I did not notice an accent, and his presentation was clear. He did tell a few stories but they were brief, relevant, and made the material more interesting. Professor Grossberg was helpful outside of class, too.
I found his accent very difficult to understand (especially at the beginning of the semester)and his lectures could get to be incoherent at times, as he would randomly start telling stories
Great prof.  I specifically looked for other classes he taught.
No Comments

The class is not super difficult, however he is not a great teacher. The review content for exams is not very helpful for the exams and we were tested on something he never taught us and is not mentioned in any slides or notes.
Really cool professor, not a lot of busy work, definitely would recommend.

There are so many things wrong with his teaching style. For one, he assumes everyone is on the same level with material. He'll gloss over concepts saying "we should know this already" and doesn't go over multi-step problems. Homework questions aren't related to in-class assignments. Don't bother asking him questions - he doesn't want to help.

He is not the best professor teaching-wise
Macroecon is not even a difficult subject, he is just not great at teaching in general (especially in preparation for quizzes and tests)

I don't know anyone who is not struggling in this class. It's difficult to receive a good grade in this class since you can't recover if you do poorly on 1 exam. I have a high A average on Homeworks and Quizzes, but I am struggling to get a B for this class. He does not give partial credit and will test concepts that he covered once in class.
The course content is fine as far as it goes but this dude is a clown lol. I would only recommend taking his class if you want an NFT shill teaching you about economics LMAO

Professor Zelin-Jones' class is amazing! He prepares the lectures very carefully and always provides wonderful lecture notes. His homework instructions are also super clear. You can always learn so much from his office hours, too! He is extremely nice and knowledgeable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment:
Professor Li's strengths lie in his honesty. I really enjoyed hearing his stories and
thoughts throughout the class, which also made his teaching more memorable. He did a good
job of engaging students and having us engage with each other. He is humorous and knowledgable
The professor really does care for student learning. Lectures were engaging and the professor made honest efforts to reach out and adjust the course according to student needs.
Professor Li is a very engaging lecturer and very knowledgeable as well. I really enjoyed his lectures and the homework was very manageable.

Out of all the teachers I have ever had, Li Laoshi is by far the most committed to his students! His teaching style is very organized. I could tell through his actions and persona that he genuinely wanted all of us to succeed. His feedback is always very clear, so I knew exactly what I have to change to improve.

His lecturing was surprisingly very entertaining. His humor is amazing and made everything fun to listen to. He was very knowledgeable, and made good use of the class time. He also seemed to relate to us and care about our experience. A+

Professor Li's teaching method was very effective. In general, he is also a very funny person,making any class that he teaches instantly more fun and engaging. He always prepares his lesson thoroughly before class, and everything is very organized.

The class was fantastic. Professor Li is the greatest strength of the class in being able to foster such a truly great learning environment.
