He picked great pieces of literature, journals, documentaries, and films to better understand the environmental crisis in China. As a senior, this has been one of my favorite classes.
Ryan has the magical power to explain hard concepts in a simple way.
O'Donnell is a fantastic lecturer. He will guide you to ask just the right questions.
Excellent lecturer. Do not miss his office hours. Very helpful and involved.
a
very good course
Amazing lecturer!!! Even though the homework is very hard, his lecture was the brighest part of my day. Run to his class :)
Very clear professor - excellent blog posts
Passionate about MatSci, helpful and always willing to explain subjects, very forgiving grading (lots of HW/test drops)

The hw is frustrating in Essentials because directions are not clear and he doesn't proofread his answers to the code. Usually it is pretty time-consuming. That being said, he was really helpful in the Mat Sci intro, and I've heard he's a good teacher in the course he teaches for juniors. He just doesn't like & isn't very good at teaching MATLAB.
Heard is probably the best prof I know and he was super helpful when I was having problems with my lab group.
Great professor and great lab teacher. Funny, clear with directions, and helpful. One of the best professors I've had
Easy class, impossibly boring lecturer, has a heightened sense of self, teaches problems. didn't learn anything. If you can do Physics 1, you will easily get an A in this class.
Interesting presentations, low workload, and generous grader. Cares a lot about the students' learning.
He is soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo nice!

Stephen Neely is an amazing professor, which is judged by how humorous he is. This class improved my view on rhythm, as I am more able to tell what rhythm I can hear from the literature, and how I can distinguish between binary and ternary signatures, and how I can come up with melodies. Dictations are very hard unless you prepare a lot for them.
Great professor. The dictations can be quite hard especially for some. Once you get around them, Eurhythmics is an amazing class!
amazing human.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Neeley is a very accomplished and amazing person--only 6 people in the country have his degree in Dalcroze Eurhythmics, so to learn Eurhythmics under him is rare. The class is difficult--much more than someone would think so--and you MUST if possible, attend class because you will miss out on a lot of info. Amazingly fun class though.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Eurhythmics is by far the most beneficial class I've ever taken, and I therefore took all 4 semesters even though I didn't have to.  It's made a huge impact on both my musicianship and day to day life. Stephen Neely is an incredible teacher and amazing person.
One of the most difficult but most engaging and useful classes in the Music Department.
Very fun and engaging class!

Really good lecturer and inspiring to have as a professor. I really enjoyed having Prof. Downs as a professor. However, the exams are pretty difficult, and if you do poorly or average, it can sentence your grade to being an overall B.

Fairly difficult lecture-based class, but she gives a TON of extra credit to offset that. If you do all the extra credit, you get 3 points added to your final grade (so an 87 becomes a 90). There are 4 exams and you can drop one grade entirely, if you have a good enough grade you can skip the final. Got an A without getting above an 85 on an exam.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: The exams are really hard, and the daily quizzes are almost impossible to get points which pulls down the grade a lot

I really love this class! If you understand the concepts in the lecture, you'll understand the exam question well and know what to answer. The exam content is all covered in the lecture and is of average difficulty. Also, Prof Downs is a really good lecturer, I enjoy every minute of her lecture!

lectures are really fun and interesting. It's a pleasure to listen to her lectures. HOWEVER, tests are incredibly hard. All tests are fill-in blanks or short answer, which makes it harder than ever. You'll have to figure out what to put in the blanks. Very confusing, super super hard.

The lectures are fun and informative, HOWEVER, the exams are awful. There are many midterms, and there are many questions based on readings that she never mentioned in class or in homework so students have no chance to practice those completely unexpected questions. Most questions from the exams are fill-in-blank questions that are super confusing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Worst gened course I've take at cmu. As a gened course, the exam is too hard. All we want is an easy A so stop being so demanding on the exam.

Lectures are really interesting but her tests are very unclear. They can be hard to study for and her test format takes awhile to get used to but the class is definitely manageable. A great class to take if you're wondering what decision science is about; you learn a lot of generally applicable information.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Teaches a great class (Reason, Passion, and Cognition) and her lectures are very interesting. Her readings are long and sometimes boring.  She gives some pop quizzes, but they're pretty easy. Her exams can get confusing sometimes... not extremely clear exactly what she's asking for. Overall though, a great class w/ interesting topics!

Melissa has awesome energy and will stretch your brain. Be sure to approach her in person if you have more to say  add  ask, because she's an encyclopedia and she values student participation. Really supportive, and she cares about familiarizing herself with her students.

I have this problem where I sleep uncontrollably during lecture classes, but Melissa EFFORTLESSLY kept me engaged. I don't know how she has so much energy, but it makes you mad excited about contemporary art. Excellent organization. A gem of a professor.
Best teacher ever.
Take the class no matter what it is, it will be fun. You cant understand Melissa unless you are in her presence.
Melissa Rocks!
Take her class!
No Comments

Professor Kennedy is an incredible character. He has a magnificent sense of humor and a vast amount of wisdom pertaining to literature. He is the perfect professor for anyone who wants to learn how to read a book, for anyone who wants to be entertained, and for anyone who wants to get an A for having good discussion and talking about what you want.

He knows a lot about the other profs in the English department.  He's very good at literary criticism and the analysis of early 1900s lit. Best of all, hes funny, and makes the class laugh at least once or twice per class.
Very cool prof. His classes were very fun.
Took about three classes with him.  Always good for a B.  He picks great reading material.
Interesting to listen to.  But he's serious.  More interesting to hear the stories about him (from other professors).
A hard grader, however is great to listen to and has interesting atheist views.
Intentionally had the class held in BH-235B because Michael Douglas was there.
Great professor. Very purposeful and detailed lecture. Homework is reasonable and well graded. Straightforward and clear explanations to questions.
Great professor with passion for this subject. Exams and assignments are challenging but very purposeful and are extremely helpful.
Classes are boring, but lectures make sense and go along with book. Tests are easy if you pay attention
Very good at teaching graduate classes. Very approachable, and knowledgeable on the subject matter. Highly recommend as an advisor for graduate work.
No Comments
No Comments
Higgs is fairly confusing sometimes, he tends to repeat himself, and calls on the same 4 people every class. He likes football players, easy tests tho.
Really solid teacher. Would definitely recommend him as a teacher. Not the easiest Interp section, but it's worth it because you will learn a lot.
Great teacher. Class is fun and makes you think. I cannot recommend his class enough. You will have to work for a good grade, but it's worth it because you will learn a lot.
Awesome class. Far superior to other 76-101 sections. He's funny, too.
really cool, really awesome, just truly glorious.
Great Class.
Interesting course, tough but fair grader, cool style.  Encourages interesting discussions.
No Comments
Awesome class - He likes to let the students run the discussions and he always has insightful things to add. Fair grader and always willing to help.
Great choice of topic (transhumanism), great collection of readings from multiple perspectives, and a very helpful professor. It was time-consuming though.
Great Professor!!! Organizes really really interesting class discussions and his comments are always really inspiring and deep!!! Loved the class!!!
He is very helpful and approachable. He is not an easy grader, but is a fair grader.
As a professor, he's very determined to help students learn and understand the concepts. He's a a tough and reasonable grader. He's very easy to learn from and very down to earth.

Gentry is an engaging professor that does well with generating an interest in what may otherwise be a bland subject. What I like most about him is that he's down to earth and not full of BS like a lot of professors are these days. He teaches practical concepts that can be applied in your daily life instead of snobbish and meaningless ideas/skills.
Really  chill guy.....an easy A.

Everyone else seems to like him, but I don't see the appeal. He didn't return ANY of our papers w/ feedback/ grades until the final grades had already been posted. Literally no feedback until the it was too late to matter. Not to mention his lectures were pretty dull.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: This class is so easy LOL. There is so much work though. He is also really passionate about the topics which he talks about, which makes it less boring than a usual English class.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's passionate.

Tim Dawson was an excellent interp professor. He has a real passion for the topics he teaches in class. Some of the assignments were tedious and quite dumb. Tim also has quite a bit of assignments, so watch out.

In class, Dawson does a really great job of analyzing opinionated pieces of writing without taking a side himself. As far as writing goes, Dawson will not hesitate to point out flaws, but he offers constructive feedback that helps you write a better paper.

Dawson is very interested in the subject he teaches and is very intelligent. He asks interesting questions.  He requires lots of work, but work you do actually helps later with huge assignments.  Sometimes he can be a little misleading, but if you ask questions, he answers them!

He's an English teacher, so you'd expect him to be very clear, concise, and perspicacious, all of which are true. His instructions in class may be a bit unorthodox at times, but his knowledge of the world, clarity, and eclectic style make his class quite enjoyable.
Incredibly kind and approachable professor, willing to work with students as he wants to see them succeed

Genuinely loves materials science, his lectures are fun and engaging and he often gets excited when talking about topics he particularly likes which made the class extra fun.
He's super accommodating and friendly, always happy to explain a concept after class, and really cares about his students learning the material. Great professor :)

super passionate about MSE and cares more about the students learning than grades (meaning homework and test are relatively easy). recitations were optional and labs were super helpful in learning the content
He such a great guy. He really loves what he does and he genuinely cares about his students. He also answers emails super fast.

Sokalski is phenomenal professor who is passionate about helping you learn. He's very flexible with being able to teach you in a different way/with different examples if that's what you need to learn. The material can be intimidating at first, but never be afraid to ask questions and you'll get the hang of it in time for the midterm and final
Sokalski is engaging and is invested in student success. The lectures tend to get long, but the office hours are amazing.

Prof Sokalski really cares about your success and gives great lectures (with notes that he also posts online). The homework and exams are difficult, but the lab is pretty easy and his office hours are very helpful. Just a great guy all around.

He teaches cog psych as if it's a research methods class. Quizzes are difficult for no reason and homeworks are lengthy. Too much emphasis on reading research articles; he would be better off teaching a research methods class where that stuff is actually useful.

The weekly quizzes are pretty standard and are an easy 16/20 at minimum. The homeworks are pretty easy but lengthy As, and the exams are open note so you just have to understand what happened in class. He drops the lowest grade for the homework and the exam, and the lowest 3 quizzes. You can get by with just the slides and not going to class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Really good lecturer, makes it interesting and engaging. Weekly quizzes are annoying. Highly recommend this class.
He is one of my favorite professors, really funny, and is soooooooo helpful. If you're in the psych department you have to talk to him because he has a lot of great advice on how to navigate cmu
Great professor
No Comments
Fun, clear, and with a clear understanding of the material. Oh, and he is so sweet you just want to eat him.

Great class. She provides the reading material and instruction videos. There are 6 assignments and 7 quizzes. All assignments are doable and very helpful in better understanding the material. Would take again.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: One of the best classes I have ever taken at CMU. A wonderful professor who cares about her students.
Great
none except that's she's one of the most knowledgeable person on the subject.
A little bit unsure in the beginning about the relevancy of this course with public policy major but then she unfold the experience through the assignment. Best course that I've ever taken at CMU.
friendly knowledgeable and helpful
Good Teacher, Assignments are right on.
Good professor

He is a great professor. Very passionate about the subject, and will do anything to help his students succeed. He always was giving us contact information of various ChemE people who came in to speak to us about research and jobs in the field. Also, his office hours were extremely helpful, as the weekly homework could be extremely challenging.
good man
best professor
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Prof. Schneider is really really good. Warning: his intro to chemE class is hard. Yes. But if you go to his office hours he will do anything he can to help you. Take advantage of the TA office hours to make them help you understand and his office hours. This class requires alot of studying. It is a class where if you want to pass, its up to you, no

Very interesting teacher, and I like his teaching style. However, the class material itself is pretty dry and by the end of lecture I'm always half-asleep. Not because he's boring, but because I find material balances to be the most boring topic I've studied since Latin.
Great teacher
He's interested in his work but isn't exactly a good teacher. Presentation of materials is poor and he's unapproachable after class. Doesn't return emails either.
Stars Galaxies and the Universe is very interesting and entertaining.  Low stress, lots of extra credit, I have learned a lot about astrophysics/ cosmology, and he is genuinely interested.

Don't expect to get much out of lecture. Copies and pastes problem sets from other professors without even checking the dates on them, uses wikipedia as a textbook. Seemed unprepared for class most of the time, often late, didn't seem to take class very seriously.
Quite probably the single worst physics professor at CMU. Don't expect to learn much in lecture. Frequently cancels class or ends class early just because he doesn't care.

Seemed disinterested in teaching the lessons.  Never did examples (and often got lost in a problem when he attempted them).  Homework was confusing at times (first textbook was terrible).  Regular exams were pretty straight forward, final exam was pretty hard.

Lectures were pretty disorganised-they were moderately interesting, but i'd realize that I don't actually know anything well when I sat down to do the HW. I have a lot of complaints about both books, so if youre in Phys 3 go to the library pick ANY book off the phys shelf, and ii will be better than the textbook. And ask questions.

Doesn't teach much in lectures. Exams are not hard though. After teaching half a semester when the other professor takes over, said he's going to the South Pole to search for a site to install an astrophysics device of some sort. I think he was for real!
He is an amazing professor... you'd be lucky to have him.
Lectures are boring and less clear than the textbook.
Difficult class but was always willing to clarify. Helped a lot with my understanding of linguistics and was willing to talk during non office hours as well as office hours.

This class (80-180) was really interesting at first, but steadily became less so. He is a good teacher, a little soft spoken at times, but is passionate about the topic. Sometimes he assumes you know more than you do, so for someone like me with no linguistics experience, it was really confusing. But the homework and tests are reasonable/easy.

Phonetics and Phonology with him was a tiny bit hard to understand - but only because Nature of Language was a corequisite at the time, and he taught as if it was a prerequisite (I took both at the same time). He's very understanding when it comes to submitting assignments late. He knows what he's talking about.

Taking his Phonetics and Phonology class now, took The Nature of Language last semester. Werner is a very relaxed professor, always willing to accept late work with good reason, answer questions, or listen to your arguments. Sometimes lectures are a bit dull, but his classes are definitely passable.

His lectures can be hard to understand (read the textbook), but he is helpful, and aproachable. Tests and homework are doable. Lectures can be a little bit boring, but not overwhelmingly so. He is very excited about linguistics, and knows the material well. If you are interested in linguistics, defently take this course, you'll get a lot out of it.

Dr. Doonan is incredible and I am so thankful for the time I got to spend with her as a student. She was always available for extra help if needed and was so supportive - she truly wants to see her students succeed.

Both 343 and 344 are two of the best classes to take at CMU. They are well organized and designed by a team of dedicated instructors led by Dr. Doonan. Dr. Doonan and her team are a force of nature -- making sure every day is full of intense experiments and students walk out with full understanding of all the core molecular bio knowledge.

Wow, the last comment left on this page was meant for Lynley Doonan, I am a little tired if you can't tell. But this Dr. Doonan was a great advisor and is 100% the reason I was able to graduate early and deserves a shoutout too so thank you to the other Dr. Doonan, haha

This class was hard but Dr. Doonan cares so much about her students and it really shows. I really respect Dr. Doonan a lot and would be a much worse scientist if not for this class. Never had a Professor care this much or work this hard to make sure students learned something. I would 100% recommend, great lectures too

She is amazing! She truly cares about her students and their success. She creates such a fun environment in lab and bakes cake and brownies all the time. Her grading criteria is very clear. If you follow her directions and do the extra credit, you should do well. She is always available for help (emails back quickly) and deserves a lot of respect.

Dr. Doonan cares deeply for her students. She's insane, but wants her students to succeed. She doesn't really show this until you get to know her though. Her lab reports are hell. But I will admit that I learned a lot. The grading is very inconsistent.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This class is a lot of work but Dr. Doonan is supportive and works with you. She forces you to think very critically and will not think highly of you if you aren't putting in the effort.

Curriculum is incredibly overstuffed. Recitations are mandatory, but lectures aren't. Very knowledgeable, but often assumes that you immediately understand hard concepts. Available through Piazza, but can be vague - his OH is much better. Last project instructions were too confusing and was assigned extremely close to finals. Generally a nice guy.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Nice genial guy, entertaining lecturer. Doesn't teach reasoning for some fundamental knowledge->hard to learn new concepts. An equation used on a test wasn't really explained--we only learned it from the answer key. hw is a huge effort each week & instructions unclear. No extension for sickness, only drop lowest hw grade; detriment if sick >1 time

Last project so unpolished he rewrote a page of it the week before finals, project itself due 3 days before final. Answers q/a confusingly. Rarely communicates with TAs and overwhelms workshop staff. Little respect for our time. Hw requires extra research. Curriculum itself very unpolished. Only top 25% car times can get full points in project 2.

Nice guy, good professor. Goes pretty fast and under the impression people have prior knowledge, but if you do practice material you will do well on the tests. Group projects are not bad if you have a good group.
He teaches like we have all been Mechanical Engineers for 20 years like him. As the year progressed, it became easier to learn and understand how he teaches, but there is definitely a learning curve.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Teaches like you already know the content, doesn't do a good job of explaining fundamentals. Makes assumptions that the entire class already knows content without reviewing it. Gives almost no guidance for projects. Homework questions are often unclear. Quizzes are worth the same amount a midterm would in a different class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Generally very nice and approachable. However, he struggles to teach people with base knowledge, typically saying "in order to do X you need to do Y," while we don't even know how to do Y. In lectures he just copies his notes without explaining the concepts behind everything. The quizzes (aka tests) are also confusing, even with practice problems.
the quizzes and exams are very hard and there is a lot to remember and a lot of concepts you have to understand
Pay attention in lecture and study decently for quizzes (they can be hard). Pretty interesting guy
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Great teacher- funny, passionate, willing to work with you to explain concepts. However, his exams and quizzes are very difficult.
great
Had him for BSE and Bus Law - great prof, I enjoyed going to lecture, he told great stories. There was no homework, but quizzes and exams were hard (big curve though). Overall learned a lot.
Great professor.  Very passionate about law, tells useful/funny stories, huge curve, no homework, just exams and quizzes.
law class - no hw, projects, or exams, huge curve. tells interesting stories

I really did not understand this class. There was absolutely no grading criteria and on top of that, she grades very harshly. She had no rubric on the assignments she grades and does not give good feedback on how you got the grade she gave you. There are no practice exams and barely any homework so studying for this class is impossible.
Unclear grading standards. Clearly had favorites. Wouldn't recommend.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: concise and full of information. Not a class for slackers. Found this class totally absorbing, and went to all the lectures which were not confusing if you'd done any preparation.
Unclear standards. No practice tests. Confusing lectures. If you can, don't take a class with her.
Very very intelligent professor, but is a harsh grader. Knows her stuff so you can't bs your way through anything.

By "Skip Class? You Won't Pass" I don't mean you will miss so much material that you wouldn't be able to learn it on your own. What I mean, is that she takes personal offence to students who do not attend classes. Between her pejorative comments to and about students and her discomfiting teaching style, I would highly advise avoiding this course.

This class absolutely sucked. There were no practice exams, the material was convoluted and poorly taught. The discussion always digresses and you never know what to study for the exams. Wikipedia is the only chance of acing any tests.
Deadly boring and helpless.

I loved Dr. Lynch, and I was shocked when I saw she had such a low rating! She's hilarious in a really subtle way, and I enjoyed her class (France During WWII) a lot. The exams and papers were difficult; she's a tough grader. But she is also always willing to talk about any assignment.
absolutely terrible

Obviously you must be of higher intellect to appreciate this professor. While difficult and not necessarily endowed with the most diplomatic of social skills, she is brilliant and keeps the academic bar raised high. You can only benefit from her tutelage.
clearly bi-polar, offering perfectly normal and perfectly beastly days; avoid if possible
No Comments
Boring...*really* boring...
awesome and chill guy. class was boring but easy, and I can see the value of it in other classes
Professor Routledge was an amazing teacher. He used a lot of real-world examples within his lectures which was nice.
The class is way too easy, honestly at times felt pretty unnecessary. Routledge is fun tho, so that made up for it.
Very easy professor for Business Science. Rarely ever needed to pay attention to lectures, and still did well for the class.

No one ever knew what he was really teaching but just make sure you know probability. The home works are somewhat random while the quizzes are not the difficult if you do the practice ones. The final exam was definitely harder than all the other tests. All tests are online and attendance may be taken through Menti.

This is a freshman business requirement. My section was large so I never connect with him. He seemed nice. The exam was challenging for me. The class is basically an overview of everything you will learn in Tepper.
most people didn't go to lecture and it was chill

Professor Routledge's Business Science class was incredible. Every lecture covered real world scenarios. He is an extremely well respected professor at the Tepper School of Business and he normally teaches Finance grad students but I'm SO HAPPY that he chose to teach this undergrad freshman class. He was so much fun and an easy A.
The worst professor at CMU
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Groeger is clever and engaging. Presents a refreshingly frank perspective of the field of economics in the context of academia and the future of science.

Professor Greoger is a hard professor (its a hard course). He is very funny though and keeps you awake in his 1h20mins lectures. Attending his lectures aren't mandatory, but you should definitely go because he creates the tests and his teaching foreshadows what will be on the test. His office hours are also very helpful
Very nice professor who knows his stuff and keeps things interesting!

Took him for Microecon. and although he tries really hard to be clear, for some reason you can never quite grasp what he is trying to say and eventually start dozing off. The material is relatively easy but he makes it much more complicated. Tests are impossible.
Super helpful office hours. Really cool guy in general. Random pop quizzes in lecture; they are not mandatory, but attending definitely helps.
Extremely rude and self centered, would seem offended if asked a question, seemed very entitled.

What a disappointment to be around faculty like this. Impossible to follow, rambling and incoherent style. Not sure if this was a class or just someone taking up time. I spent 4k to take a class with Kim and learned nothing.

She is very reminiscent of an aunt who doesn't really 100% know what your homework will be at any time but she is a nice person and as long as you showed up and work in your sketchbook (at least for foundations: drawing) you should have an A+

A decent teacher, but very disorganized and classes were mostly improvised. She often didn't give out important class-related information on time, and the grades she put in for my projects differed greatly from what she told me about them in class. Most of my work was digital, so she didn't fully understand the medium either.
Classes were improvised and there was no real structure.
She took alot of time to help me personally. The class was tough, but she was alot of fun. I'd take another class with her!
Prof Soluri was kind and understanding. His lectures were really interesting too!
He's the best prof I've had at CMU so nice
John Soluri is a great guy and a good professor; if you put the work into the classes (and it's not a whole lot, usually about 50-100 pages/week) and participate in class, you'll get an A for sure.

Really cool professor. I will admit, his voice is a little difficult to remain focused on during lecture and he occasionally moves very fast, but his courses are interesting and he is always willing to put notes on blackboard or explain concepts further.
A pretty monotonous voice, it becomes pretty easy to fall asleep in class

Bravo Professor Soluri for actually making an introductory class interesting. For once, we learned about something other than the Crusades; the quizzes, papers and exam were all really straightforward.

Glad I took the course while she only taught the labs, though seemed to me her TAs were doing most of the work. Doesn't understand very simple questions and doesn't even try, would rather give false instructions. Despite being incapable she is quite arrogant and loves telling people what to do. I feel bad for the kids who have to take her lectures.

Very cold, blunt, passive-aggressive and unqualified professor at all! There are never clear directions!!! What a shame on Carnegie Mellon's engineering. I am a prospective engineer in Meche with a bright dream and never expect anybody as incompetent as DIANA would teach 24-101! the tuition is already high emough and she is making it harder! shame!

Haidar made 24101 easier and you can tell that she cares for the students. However, overall the class felt like a worser version of my physics classes back in high school. The FIXATION with unit conversion made me want to gouge my eyes out and you will lose points over the dumbest things in homework/exams. Labs are the only plus for this class.
Useless lectures and terrible TAs

The course was state-of-the-art nonsense. So boring, so underprepared, and so random. Why would I spend time on Excel plotting and email writing in 24101?? Why??

And, the homework and quizzes of this course are so weird. Can't think of a better word to describe their quality except for LOW.

Never would I expect that 60k a year would give me this. There are never clear instructions. The TAs and the professor never seem to be on the same page. The professor can't seem to provide correct answer keys (her errors always get pointed out by students). She says that 4 midterm like quizzes respect students more than regular exams. Do NOT take.

It's a rare talent to explain a thing I fully understand in such a way that I leave confused on the subject. Her examples were long, convoluted, and often incorrect. Also, she gave us broken starter code and then offered no help with the highly technical errors (there was no CS req for the class). PS don't buy the textbook - you won't use it

TAKE THE CLASS, YOU WON'T  BE DISAPPOINTED!!!!! She is one of the most inspirational women I've met in my entire life. I feel truly blessed to have gotten the chance to have her as a prof. Take the class. Do it.
Great professor

I was in Prof Behrmann's freshman seminar class for HSS students. She's knowledgeable, enthusiastic, helpful, and most importantly, highly inspirational because of lots of sharing of her personal experiences in the academic field. Lots of writing for the class, but was manageable. Even though psych isn't really my thing, I totally enjoyed the class
I want to be her.  Seriously, though, she's incredibly knowledgeable about her subject.  The class goes off on some tangents, but it's all in the name of learning and trying new approaches.
The professor knows what she's doing. Lectures are helpful so don't skip thinking you can just look at the power points.
No Comments

Terrible lecturer - he talks to himself and can't really explain anything in his own words. His midterms were fairly easy, but his final was extremely hard. TA was also not super helpful and since it was my first time with proofs, that made this even worse. Never again.

He is a good mathematician but not a good professor. He is bad at communication in general. Don't take his class if you consider that class as an important class to your studies(such as real analysis!). But if you are very good at self studying you might want to try his class.

In past years this class was considered a joke; however, I feel the material difficulty really comes down to the professor and Ballew was simply not the best prof for the class. His exams were insanely hard, which was a sharp contrast to the easy homework and recitation activities. Had to drop the class due to failing, despite lots of work put in.

Ballew is helpful if you ask him for help, but his lectures are not helpful at all. In the lecture it looks like he keeps talking to himself... Also, he doesn't give right answers to homework assignment.

Ballew gave all the resources we needed and technically did his part as a professor, but exams were really hard to finish, problem sets were also really long, and lectures were not clear and concise. It is possible to do well in this class and help is there if you need it but you really have to work for it.

Ballew isn't exactly the best lecturer, but if you ask for help, he explains things very well.  Expect to do proofs as the basis for your grade - you'll learn the applications if you can figure out proofs first.
The greatest acting teacher I can imagine. Absolutely study with her if you get the opportunity- she will change your life!

Very disorganized. Contradicts themselves, but does not acknowledge it. Harder on you as a person, than as a student. Repetitive & not very good at re-phrasing concepts. Created a space that was often emotionally & mentally unsafe. Yet loving, passionate, dedicated, & always puts in the effort to understand.

The best and probably most invaluable class I've taken at the School of Drama. It's hard to appreciate it fully when you're in it, but do your best to soak up every moment you'll never know the class's worth till you've said goodbye to Barbara!
Know more about theatre and acting than anyone at CMU
like fine wine
One of the finest acting teachers in the country.
The man is a genuine genius--one of the professors you just have to take if you want to be exposed to the best a brain can ever offer.
Arrogant know it all.
This guy is hilarious and I loved going to class
Knows more about philosophy in his pinkie finger that the dumb people in his class who call him a simpleton.
Arrogant bumbling simpleton. Easy A, though.
Masterly, charming, old guy.

While an awful lecturer, that wasn't my biggest problem with the class, he was so awful, condescending, and disrespectful to students that it discouraged me from taking further CS courses just to avoid people like him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Best mentor and teacher ever!
Extremely kind and caring. TAs are the crux of the course. Very sweet and fun to talk to. Very helpful also.

One of the best people ever! I like his teaching style & his lectures are at a slower pace, which I prefer. If u have problems, going for OH will save you so much time because he helps you understand the material by going through it step by step. He also gives great advice outside of class and is highly respected by both faculty and students.

He's an amazing professor, great lecturer, and a good person to boot. Taking 15-100 (now 15-110) with him made me love CS. His courses are hard, but you learn a lot. Wouldn't recommend for people not interested in CS, though.
Amazing guy. He pretty much owns CS Undergrad Program. On the final review day, we spent 2 minutes going over the material and instead asked us how our semesters are going! Also a great advisor.
Do not take this class unless you want a brunch of homework and projects.
Lots of homework. She has very high expectations for everyone
This professor only cares about what's inside her head and will keep asking us questions until she get the answer she wants. She even taught us that "DO NOT WRITE YOUR NAMES WHEN YOU WRITE AN EMAIL".

Absolutely not worth your effort. Absolutely useless class. She will nit pick and find what she thinks is the right way to do stuff. If you put in a lot of effort into something, surprise surprise everyone will get the same 80% grade. Absolute sh!t show of a class. If you can't avoid, take this class as a joke and do not put in any effort.
EVERYONE HAS TO TAKE HER BORING CLASS. Taking her course and you will receive the "surprising" tasks and feedbacks she gives you. Never chooses her other classes AGAIN.

Julia does not have the student's best interest in mind. She does her best to make the student's life miserable. I will strongly advise students to take other sections instead to make your lives easier. Julia also likes to hand out academic integrity accusations like they are free flyers on the streets. Stay away at all cost!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Amazing prof and is able to really explain things really well. The course is reallly realllllllly fast paced and hard to keep up but as long as you go to class, pay attention, and do the homeworks, should be a solid A. Best professor and definitely the most fair I have ever had.
Really cool teacher. Knows his stuff and is very willing to help if you need anything. Is not the easiest grader, but he is very fair.
He is not easy, but a really good prof.
Made Intro class fun with cool experiments and grade curve
As a Mechanical engineer taking this class, I had NO idea what was going on.
He is so nice and will always take the time to help his students. He really showed a lot of interest in making sure you understand the material.
Very nice guy but he just grades so harshly and doesn't seem to want to ever help
He will make you feel dumb! exams are extremely difficult and he does not do a good job at explaining everything!!!! stay away...
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: He comes off as a nice guy but its completely fake. He wont respond to emails and when he does. He just sends generic emails that are clearly copy pasted to reply. Please do everyone a favor and give him the 1s on FCEs that he deserves.
His exams are very difficult. Don't let him trick you into thinking his class is fair, it's not.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Easy class, nice guy. Really cares about teaching students finance. Pay attention in class and you will get an A for sure.

Professor Xu was always nice and was willing to answer any questions, even if it meant for her to check for answers outside of class. The tests and midterms often skewed in difficulty, some were a cakewalk, others were pretty hard. The end of the course starts was cramped in, so make sure to self study if necessary for the final exam.
Such an inspirational math professor. She will explain many abstract concepts in an understandable way. You will learn a lot from her teaching.

Great professor, one of my favorites. She's super nice and very accommodating. Lectures are very good, she's quite thorough and makes sure everything is understood. A good amount of homework - it was enough to learn/practice but not too time consuming. You can tell she really cares about her students.
Super patient. Very accessible (emails/OH).

Nice professor who has very helpful office hours. The homework can be somewhat time-consuming. Her lectures can be difficult to follow (very fast, and she also has a strong accent), resulting in a lot of extra textbook reading.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: She really cares about her students and is happy to help. She overcomplicates concepts in lectures. In examples, she skips a lot of steps which makes them hard to follow.
Extremely difficult but enlightening. One of those classes where you don't realize how much you've learned until later.
Creepiest person in the world. You will be spit upon if you sit in the front row.
This professor is not a very good one, avoid him if you can

His lectures are not very relevent to the material that he tests or gives homeworks for.  Homeworks are excessively long, vague, and rely on material not covered in class.  In person, he's very nice and understanding about grading, though rather unhelpful. Try to avoid at all costs.
No Comments
No Comments
She is a really great teacher, and super nice. She was always willing to help and clarify things.
Unclear, unhelpful and uninspiring. I dreaded this class with her the most out of all the classes I took in college.
very helpful and willing to listen, but does not have a very clear grading scheme and gives vague feedback
She's so sweet and makes the class a true joy.
She obviously has a lot of knowledge, but that means nothing if she cannot illustrate her point or give clear instructions. A very frustrating teacher to have. Never understand what she wants.
No Comments

Adam's enthusiasm always got me excited to learn about cs theory, and you can generally tell he cares a lot and puts in the effort to make the class enjoyable. The class itself is extremely difficult and homework's are killer, but the tests are considerably easier. GO TO OFFICE HOURS, you will get answers to questions you didn't even have.

Destroyed my gpa. I did better in Chem 142 than CSE 311. HW is ridiculously hard, and they're graded harshly. He talks really fast and his explanations depend on you understanding what he just sped through 5 seconds ago, which isn't good because he's not very good at explaining. However, he is very dedicated and holds a lot of extra office hours.

You could really tell Adam puts a lot of time into the class and cares that the students understand the material. He's passionate about what he teaches, which made lectures entertaining but sometimes too fast for me. The class itself is hard, especially the homework,  but there is always available help if you are struggling.
Very helpful, way more office hours than anyone else
Probably the most caring teacher I've ever had. Really sets the tone for the rest of the CS curriculum.
Super super super helpful and cares a lot about his course and making sure students understand the admittedly difficult material.
writes for hours on this chalkboard, but this is very useful if you manage to follow her.
tough, tough, tough, but you learn a lot! :)
Just awful.  Notes were all over the place and were not useful when doing the homework.

Terrible teacher. Got smart with you if you tried to ask questions, didn't explain what variables in formulas meant, and was just downright disrespectful to students. I hope they never let her teach another class again.

Ass't professor. Lectures from prof's notes, seemingly without going over them before class. Drags out simple derivations over several days, putting us behind schedule. Seemingly unfamiliar with material (told us that the current between two bulbs in series is zero). Slavishly follows prof's (Swendsen, which see) absurd grading system.

An amazing professor! I had only mild interest in Irish history prior to the class, but it's now my favorite subject. A good slideshow. One class weekly devoted to class discussion. Opens class with fun roll calls so you get to know your classmates. And you can't beat his Irish accent.
He's a completely unfair grader.
Really great personality, interesting lectures, good use of media... I like the class format a lot and enjoy being there.
Awesome personality.  Will go the extra mile to help you.  SMART profesor.
Best professor that I had for histor here at CMU.  Very helpful and willing to go around your schedule to help you.  Great personality.  Nice person  Thanks so much Mr. McMahon

A super nice person.  Beyond excellent - great personality, caring and nice.  If all professors were as kind as he is - or was in my class - I would be a straight A student.  He makes class very interesting.   Thank you
A thoroughly and completely wasted opportunity her class was. She teaches from theory since she has no practical experience. She is nice but clearly shouldnt be teaching this class. What a waste.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Very smart professor, great lecturer too. Assignments were not bad unless you left them until the last minute.
Highly committed and passionate about teaching. Superb person to know.
shes an awesome professor I love her!
Very good at what she teaches.
Go to the TAs for help. This instructor is useless and can't explain things clearly. Her English is not so great either. Should update those slides!!!

He is knowledgeable about control, but his wording for explanation makes you understand harder than needed. His understanding of math in control is interesting. If you seek for his recommendation letter, he might not follow his promises.
He really cares his students.

He used too much bonus points in the homework, which turned out to be unfair. There is no proof in the lecture, you just learn the conclusions. He's class is more like a review, you can't learn anything practical.

His class seems to be under prepared and under developed. Not informative lectures, you can learn much better from YouTube. Extremely unclear project, and poorly documented code. Would give 0 if possible

It's a good review class if you already learned about the material. I thinks it's better to learn from the book rather than attending the class. The class is basically stack of factors without too much explanation. The amount of typos he has in the homework and lecture notes makes the class looks unprofessional.
I believe this is his first year teaching.
Great professor

I've taken 3 drawing classes from Cooper and saw tremendous improvement in not only mine, but everyone else's work. However great a professor he is, he is NOT an easy A at all. He's super critical of drawings and knows what he's talking about. Super talented.
He is probably one of the most interesting professors you will ever have. He tends to tell a lot of stories that seem pointless but they alway have a meaning...plus he is a great drawing teacher!
The best professor in architecture ever.

Doug Cooper is so pro. You'll learn a lot from him, as long as you're willing to work hard and improve yourself. You don't have to be a good drawer to do well in his class; he appreciates your effort, and always loves improvement. Don't fall too behind on portfolios, because they coincide with Studio deadlines all the time.
Best professor in Carnegie Mellon's school of architecture, hands down.
Such a harsh grader, never got an A on an assignment. The most boring lectures in my life. Just horrible!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Such a harsh grader. If you want a decent GPA you should stay away. She is very nice and caring but just grade unfairly.
Really good teacher.  Includes students, makes class interesting, knows history very well.  Have had some trouble getting in touch with her via email, but generally very good prof.
Really amazing professor: kind, helpful, and has interesting classes.

Amazing teacher who really cares about her students.  Decent amount of reading, but all of the grades in the course come from essays written at home about the texts, so if you keep up with the readings and put effort into the papers, it should be a fairly easy A.
Nice enough person, but the workload is crazy! 10 books and 7 papers plus a final exam. Plus, her lectures are boring. Bring something to read to keep you entertained.
Easy to get an A if you put in a little work, but not the most exciting lectures. He did record them, which is a positive, and the content was interesting, but he spoke quite slowly.

Great lecturer & an expert in the field of data science ethics! Recorded lectures & no readings. Beware: grade is dependent on 3 group projects. Requires a way of thinking that is not exactly phil or data science but more analytical/creative/conceptual- you'll need to synthesize the info not just memorize. Interesting and real world applicable!!

Class consisted of 6 short essays and 3 long essays. No final or midterms. Essays were graded by TAs and they were pretty lenient and graded kindly. Lecture attendance is not required. Discussion is mandatory. Readings are provided, but not mandatory for lecture or discussion. No complaints, the class was easy, and the professor was nice.
Really great lectures! Lots of writing assignments (and only writing assignments), but they weren't difficult or graded too difficult either.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Amazing lectures--So many papers

comment: Awesome lecturer and really passionate about the topics. Grades papers pretty hard but its well worth the effort
No Comments

Her lectures are the same thing every day. She forces the class to use "arugment diagrams". Class is poorly structured. We were forced into group projects that are worth 35% of our grade. The TAs don't even know what she's doing

She is not a good teacher at all. Her voice is shaky and she pauses a lot which makes it very hard to pay attention to. I had her for a freshmen seminar and she assigned seats and gave us senseless work to do. Class time was wasted doing remotely nothing, so we would spend hours at home reading long, boring articles.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She's a very nice lady, but the material is VERY dry. It gets better as the class goes. HW 3 times a week, but it is quick and easy. Grade is dependent on your TA. Class is very boring and consists of discussing the previous nights reading. If you put in some effort than it is not too hard to get an A as long as your TA is nice
Hard grader, but very helpful and a fun person.
Very hard grader on papers
No Comments
He'll make you work hard but in a good way. He's a great person and knows his stuff. One of my favorite classes and professors :) plus he plays music while we walk in :)
he's. amazing.
All around great teacher, recommend reading the text before each class. Has a good read on students. If you get a chance to take his class I would highly recommend it.

very helpful professor, knows exactly what hes talking about. the tests are HARD though; lots of material and really long. his class is geared towards bio majors and pre-meds so expect quite a bit of work. great professor though
corny jokes but overall knows what he's talking about. it was worth going to class most days.
No Comments

I think he is fair, and he tries hard to get the information out. He loves numbers (I guess that's why he's in this line of work) and has an excellent insight when it comes engineering issues. I understood he was a really successful businessman but gave it all up in favor of teaching.

Can't believe CMU does not fire this guy. He is unfair and rude with students. I've seen him pubicly humiliate one of his grad student then laugh about it when telling others about it. I also heard he does not read a word of what his grad students write. He jus piggy backs on the work of his colleagues. Unbelievable!
Thinks he is smarter than everyone else and loves to publicly humiliate others. This guy is not CMU-caliber. He just THINKS he is great.
He thinks class is a comedy show. Should be more serious in class and focus on teaching and not trying to be funny. This guys is a total fake!
No Comments
Amazing person, eager to help students.  Very engaging for a computer-oriented course.  Stayed very focused.  I love Lucio!

This was the first semester she taught this class so it was very unorganized and she expected us to do way too much work. I would have to do 3 different projects every single week and it was ridiculous. There are 2 5 page papers and 1 7 page paper on top of a final project at the end. This was more so a research class than a phil course.

worst class ever 3hrs class and iterally learn nothing.  The class is basically an internship, sometimes do 3 assignments in a week 4 exp i had to write a 5 page essay, do a group assignment and also some other research all due in less than a week. The class is really not worth it for an elective. Nice Professor but doesn't care about  student time

Binghamton - Class seems easier than it is when it comes to testsessays, but it's still not so bad overall. Just take your time on the essays, which she doesn't actually help much on. I wouldn't recommend this class if you wanted a more intellectually challenging class though

Prof Hassoun has changed my life. When I took her class this semester, I wasnt sure what i believed in, in any realm of ethics. But this class exposed me to so many different political issues and opinions, and opened my mind. This woman made me fall in love with philosophy! Also, your grade is based on two essays and a final, not hard at all.

Professor Hassoun is very nice and friendly. I love this class, and it made me fell in love with philosophy. One reading for every class (but this is philosophy, so it's fair, and I LOVE many of the readings.) She tries to make stuff clear in the lecture, but sometimes her ppt is confusing. My TA helped a lot. TAs do all of the grading. Love it.

Teaching at a public school, she knows students may be broke and responds by putting the reading material online for free access. She does great intro level things like fully go over how to write a philosophy paper. Lectures are a bit boring and at times unnecessary though, she pretty much just goes through the textbook. Great class for freshman.
Nice guy, terrible teacher. Most of the content covered in class came directly from wikipedia. However, as long as you are able to stay awake for his classes hos exams and tests are pretty easy.
He was very odd and didn't explain things well but gave you all the information you would need for the test. The tests weren't hard but you have NO TIME to do them.

Definitely one of the worst teachers I've ever had.  Lectures are completely incoherent and bizarre, this guy has to be on something.  And don't bother asking him for help with anything, he is utterly useless and extremely rude.

McElfresh left me completely unprepared for the 121 final, where other professors had prepared their students completely. If you take 15-121, do not take it with McElfresh. He is extremely impolite to students and doesn't really seem to care whether or not you're getting anything out of the course.
let's just say that i can't help to fall asleep in his classes. i hope he could explain the CS concepts clearer so that students like me can understand.
So-so techer, seems to dislike some students and be indifferent to the rest.
kent is my hero. ALl day, every day.

He was a great professor and super helpful. Everyone wanted his critiques. He would stay behind in studio often to help students, very invested in your work but will only reflect your amount of engagement so don't expect a lot if you don't do a lot as well.

Kent is super invested in his students and their design process. He gives great feedback and will stay long after hours to ensure he gives an in depth crit to everyone. He never gave up on anyone in the studio even when he was taken advantage of and disrespected. Best studio instructor that I have had.

Purely self-interested.  I found him to be closed-minded, uninformed, and unqualified to teach at this level.  This school should really not be hiring faculty who have no experience or credentials.  This guy is unable to be objective, doesn't really listen to students, and doesn't care about what he's doing here except to gain administrative favor.
is very interested in helping students with an interest in what they're doing.  has strong resources and tries to connect students with whatever their interests may be.

Prime example of one who teaches entirely to advance his own career - and to hear himself talk. NO interest in his students' educations.  No qualifications to be teaching at all. Tries to cover utter incompetence with aloof, dismissive attitude. Disorganized, chronically unprepared, overextended.

For my entire colleg experience, I have never met a professor as bad as Hendrich. He literally doesn't care if you are failing the class. When the class average is a D, he won't even address it. I went to his office hours and he made me wait 30min before answering my question. When I ask him questions, he expects me to know everything when I don't.
He is a very hard professor, especially for this course. He expects you to know things outside of the course to do well. It's supposed to be a math class, yet it's more quantum than anything.

Before I took this class, I didn't have much interest in thermodynamics. This professor is just awesome - he explains things amazingly well, and you can tell he has a genuine passion for the subject. He is very willing to help any student that has questions. Very hard material, but by exam time I felt like I had learned a ton. Keep it up Hendrich!

Hardcore-ness. Kind of ridiculous material and exams. He explains things reaaaallllyy well, but hes more of a concept guy, and the exams are all problems, so...make sure to go to rec and do LOTS of problems.

He is very inspirational - an extremely passionate teacher.  He can rotate a matrix like no one else, when he talked about tensors he almost saw my O-face.  Before I took this class, I thought ENDOR was where the Ewoks lived.  He has completely perturbed my world.

Prof. Hendrich was my favorite teacher, but he's is really hard.  Before I took his class I barely knew what an electrob was and now I've switched my major to Theology.  He's dreamy, he reminds me of an athletic Conan O'Brian, sans the attitude.  Overall, awesome teacher, Old Soul.  Rock on MPH.
If you play along while she pretends she's your age, you'll do okay. She just wants to be one of the cool kids.
She doesn't teach, she just expects you to know everything beforehand, and her critiques aren't helpful either

Spike understands and reads into things, she is very challenging and expects a lot of work. The student-professor dynamic was very positive. She encourages people to think outside the box; I did my best work and learned a lot this semester. Spike is the smartest and one of the most genuine and down to earth professors I have had.
Very knowledgeable on a very wide range of topics.
Spike is absolutely the worst professor in the school of architecture.
Wow - terrible.

Amazing professor. However, she gets really bothered if you laugh a lot during class, use technology at all or get even slightly off topic. She is super caring but sometimes she is too pushy with personal questions.
SO AWESOME. TAKE SOMETHING WITH HER!
AWESOME!
Very nice and helpful.  Made the class fun.  However, we did have a few big projects (such as a research paper/presentation) that I didn't feel like I was ready for at that level of Spanish.
No Comments
This was a fun class. Professor Tardio made sure we were involved.  I would take another class with her.
Don't go to lecture, you won't learn anything.
He's a knowledgeable person but his lectures are sometimes hard to follow.

Lectures are unnecessarily complicated and hard to follow. Tests are fair and homework solutions are provided. Excel and SI sessions are almost essential to understand what is happening in this class. Not much preparation for labs. Labs are long and equipment sometimes does not work. He's a nice person but he is terrible at teaching.
Less than 30% of the class attends lecture, and rightfully so
Very knowledgeable. Lectures are not really listener-oriented so are VERY hard to understand. Preview your material if you're learning with him.
If you are not ECE major, or you don't really care about ECE, his lecture would be even more confusing to you. I think you gotta be highly concentrated to follow his lecture.

Just lower your expectation for the class. Despite teaching at CMU for 10+ years, the class is still one of the least structured I have ever taken. Don't even bother trying to do well in this class. The grading scheme will make you get either B, B+ or A- no matter how hard you try. And of course you learn nothing LOL.
No structure. Lecture and homework have no correlation and quite boring. Fake smile and bad grades
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Expectations are vague. Course content is not very helpful or meaningful.

Sorry to say, but this course provides little if not none value to software engineers. The fact that this class is a requirement of the MSE program makes the program arguably a bad way to spend your money if you focus on learning. And yea he gives bad grades on really easy stuff

Not a very responsible professor and it seems like he doesn't respect students. The Master of Software Engineering program at CMU aims to focus on industry knowledge, but in this class you will learn nothing while getting bad grade. Definitely worth $5000 USD for the class, and it is a core class you can't drop it/switch out.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Communications professor that doesn't respond to emails. Do not respect students and he is really mean. Gives really rude comments on homework and do not care about students' success. Yes these are true and good luck if you take his class

Tremendous professor. If you want to learn French, take her courses. Super interesting work, and she cares about student input a lot. If there's something you want to learn about, suggest it. Could not ask for a better French professor.

Great Professor, really funny, treats her students like adults. Her grading method of cumulating points for assignments was interesting, and really took the stress off of having to do individual assignments. I'd like to see future language classes do the same. The topic we were learning wasn't very interesting, but I still learned a lot.

Such a great teacher, made Elementary French a fun class (but not a super easy pass). Was actually really interested in getting us to learn French, and was overall a great teacher with a fun personality. Heavy workload with a textbook, workbook, and classwork, so be prepared for that.
Bonnie is wonderful and engaging! She is also very personable and kind. Hers was my favorite class.

She makes learning French Culture at 9.30 am very engaging. She's over the top in a fun way, and she's very much an awesome professor but do not get into her bad books. That being said, just make sure you do her work and participate in class because attendance and participation make up a significant portion  of the grade. Highly recommended!
good teacher and real nice! Fun in class.

Class was a joke.  Dude showed random video clips from movies that were only very weakly connected to the lecture in order to win over the younger crowd.  I learned nothing other than that I don't want anything to do with this guy.

Professor more interested in making friends than making a meaningful lesson. Culbertson's course is essentially just him reciting stories and giving students gifts in an attempt win favor. All in all, the class gave me little help when I started my own company the following year. Go find another entrepreneurship class, you will be glad you did.
To be honest I found him biased towards some people. He talks about unrelated things. Will not take any of his classes again.
Great guy, hilarious, easy-going. Talk up and he'll love you.
He knows how to teach outside of classrooms and textbooks. Recommend taking follow-up courses after Intro, because he really drills on important skills you should have when starting up a venture.
Intro to Entrep. was the best course I've taken at CMU thanks to R.F.  Incredible professor, and a great guy who really cares about his students.
Confusing content.

One of the best professors I've ever had. A lot of the papers and projects are open-ended, she really wants to see how you think rather than how well you can follow an arbitrary prompt which I very much respect.

An incredible and engaging professor, she works with you to make sure you do well if you need help and helps you make up for any missed classes by attending other events. Most classes are discussion based so make sure to do the readings and attendance is a big part of your grade.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: One of the best professors I've ever taken hands down

Dr. Grama was a great professor. Her lectures are very discussion based, so be prepared to read outside of class and obtain required reading material on your own. She was extremely caring and understanding and is very knowledgeable about anthropology.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor Grama is extremely kind and very knowledgeable. She really warms up once you get to know her. She is really excited about the material for her courses, so she is very enthusiastic. Sometimes I left class a little more confused than I was when it started, but if you do the reading consistently and participate you'll be fine.

Class exactly as I expected it to be. If you are willing to put in the work you will receive an A. The work is not unbearable either. Very helpful professor when available. His office hours were a bit random but he fixed them by the end of the semester. Responsive with e-mails and is more than willing to help. Good dude.

The class was computer based and hard, but the guy would walk you through the proofs if you asked and was pretty good about answering emails/questions quickly. Don't remember any name dropping( like who do you drop in LOGIC everone is DEAD that matters!?)- but this course was ~NOT~ easy...

I don't know what the other reviewers were thinking.  This guy's a goof. He understands only basic stuff. Name drops alot and acts like he knows more than he does. His class is easy, so he gets good ratings from students required to take the course. He ce
he's a logical dude
cool dude

Definitely was my toughest class of the semester because of all the writing. He expects you to do your best, but if you do, he helps you all along the way and the good grade pays off. Grading is tough but he makes everything clear of how it is supposed to be. He kept class interesting always - its just up to you to put in the work to get the grades
Not a very helpful teacher. All he did was rant about what he thought was right. No leniency in grading. Believes A is exceptional, B is good, C is average, and D is below average...
Very good teacher. Cares very strongly about his work and is very committed.
No Comments
Very nice guy, interesting subject matter (digital rights/piracy).  Made the English requirement painless.
I think she's a great professor who truly cares about her students!
One of the worst professors at CMU. Incredibly disorganized, disrespectful, and overall incompetent. She does not know how to teach.

Very disorganized, and very very unclear about class / assignment expectations. Expects (and typically grades in accordance with) very specific things from assignments, but fails to communicate what these are
No Comments
she's a nice person, and available and helpful, but not good at putting her thoughts into words-very unclear and confusing, her grading scheme is a complete mystery!

Professor Lal has been by far my best professor at CMU. He is very charismatic and energetic when teaching the class. He provides very thorough feedback and truly cares about his students. He is very responsive to his email and always makes time for his students when they need help. Would definitely recommend classes he teaches.

Although some of the material was hard I always enjoyed going to lecture. He is a very caring professor, one time I submitted a big project late and he came up to me after class and asked if I needed any help and if everything was okay. Not just that but he is very charismatic. I really enjoyed having taken this core IS class with him.
He's really nice and understanding. He's not the most organized but he really takes time to help each student if they need help.

Professor is so nice and understanding. He takes time to know his students and is willing to meet with anyone for any reason at any time, even late at night and during the weekends if needed. He gives good feedback and is very clear about project criteria.

Difficult to understand him and syllabus structure is ambiguous. Feedback is subjective (to his experience). Dismisses an entire section of a submitted assignment if he deems the beginning unworthy of being read. Suggestions are often disregarded. Have to squeeze clear info about exams/homework out of him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He can come sometimes come off as rude, but I've found him to be a great resource in 18220, even though he is not officially the prof. He was always willing to sit down with students for 1on1s to go over specific questions and example problems, and I really appreciated that while I was in 220.
Not good at giving feedback

Worst amongst all professors at CMU. His idea of "teaching" is to just sit there and insult you without providing any useful information. A horrible professor and an even worse human being, I don't even know what he has to do with the courses. He just stops by the TA and Prof office hours and irritates the students. No help whatsoever.

Ok he's not really a prof for 18220, he used to teach 18220 but now just helps out with office hours and labs. The guy is great!!! He knows his stuff and he comes off as blunt but he just wants his students to really understand the material. He's also hilarious when there are just some random conversations.

This guy is super rude. We use piazza in the course and he is unhelpful and replies aggressively to questions/comments. Doesn't even teach the lecture, recitation, or lab so I'm not sure why he talks to us or what his connection to 220 even is.

Pretty decent lecturer though he sort of tends to spaz out on the board. However he is very willing to help. Mostly I find problem with the class structure. The full grade is based on about 4 different things. Merciless grading. Biweekly quizzes were terrible -- I didn't learn anything and only crammed page after page of computation.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: The course is inspirational, but lectures are pretty fast-paced, and biweekly quizzes can sometimes be overwhelming if you have other deadlines/midterms coming along. I ground through the course and somehow regretted it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Pretty good professor, makes you think very deeply about analysis. For this particular course, his syllabus diverged wildly from the course description, which was rather frustrating. I felt that I learned the content on his syllabus very well but that I missed out on what I expected to learn.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: His class is not easy. A lot new information comes in one lecture. Homework also requires deep thinking and reasoning. He sets high standard for this class and pushes the students to their limits. I learned good math in this class and spent a great time doing the biweekly homework.

He truly knows what he's talking about. His homeworks and exams are quite tough, but he teaches you to the point where the material gets very engaging. Really defines the true meaning of an honors level math class.
Cold calling and participation points? It's giving middle school...
Quizzes are really annoying
I hate it when he cold calls it's not cool at all

Tough class. Homeworks took really long and if you don't pay attention in class then you're kinda screwed. Exams claim to only take 24 hours but definitely not doable unless you spend the entire 24 hours working on it. Would not recommend this class with Trujillo

he's literally a professor and doesn't know the class material. the grad TA is teaching the whole course. gave 3 assignments before the exam and didn't even grade the third one before we had to take the test. course is disorganized, insists on making participation extra credit but forces students to participate by cold calling on them.
My favorite professor in 4 years at CMU! Clearly cares a lot about the material and her students. Can be tough but is never unfair.
Very difficult. Tough grader.
Substantial lectures, not overwhelming, nice person, cares about her student.
Wonderful. Gives interesting lectures, interesting reading, really talks to the students.
Great teacher. Lots of reading and discussion, but not much written work. She makes class fun and easily understandable.

THE BEST PROFESSOR!!!! 
Make me rotate and heart warm warm.
(it's actually 33104, but there's no option for 104)
Paulini is a really great guy, but he is harsh when it comes to giving assignments, pop quizzes, and exams. Extremely difficult class

He is a great person- warm, funny. But, this was the most stress-heavy class I have ever taken. Online quizzes Monday, Wednesday, Friday, 40 point pop quizzes that are impossible during class. He has 100 point exams that he himself say we deserve more time... but does not give us that extra time... impossible grader... basically my gpa is screwed

Overall, I like Paulini, but this class is very difficult for those who have no Physics background. He's also not very helpful in office hours, but he's a great lecturer. Be sure to do the readings and get a tutor early on.
Does a good job covering the material (works out derivations a bit further than the book).  Great job interjecting humor in the middle of fairly complex physics to keep student's attention.
Professor Niang is super dedicated to your learning. Amazing class and she gives you a lot of flexibility.

In the beginning, she decided to change the class timings to fit most students, but didn't bother asking if this class timing worked for everyone (it wasn't) 4 and I other students dropped because it overlapped with our other course. The course is not that difficult its just that Expect to do everything by yourself if you are taking it Online

This professor is the single worst professor I've ever had. Do not take any class of hers. She is highly conceited and uses it to justify the fact that she is simply unreachable outside of class "I'm too busy for you." She's graded 1/4 of our assignments in the past 4 months, giving no feedback. She clearly has favoritism in grading too. STAY AWAY

Incredible professor, her class was very interesting and she is hilarious. The class is never boring. She is very willing to help and cares about the students. There's a pretty fair amount of work, but she is super willing to help you out with problems. One of my favorite classes and professors so far

She's seriously amazing. Not particularly easy but she genuinely cares about her students. If you participate, do all the homework, and give effort you'll get at LEAST a B. She only gives quizzes and they're not too vital for your grade, there's always extra credit too. Her english isn't the best, but it's a French class...

everyone likes art when they first have him, just don't over expose yourself to him or let him have too much control over the curriculum. he doesn't actually know what he's talking about, and all of the "research" he's doing is mindlessly accepting whatever he reads, and making it law.  he doesn't actually understand much theory. super frustrating.

Well intentioned but holds strongly to personal opinions and approaches, which it sometimes seems he is trying to force students into pursuing.  Introduces some stimulating readings and discussions, but can be overwhelming to the point of stifling personal growth and development
The best ever...definitely impacted my life!
He is "Da Bomb".  Long Live "Da Art".
Art is the best teacher.

Very nice and a good teacher, but grading in the class was pretty unclear, so was the structure. Gave very little feedback, very rarely. If you're someone who needs to know what's going on throughout the semester, I wouldn't recommend her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very kind and helpful teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Awesome teacher to converse with. She's very helpful and understanding if something comes up. Sometimes she's not clear on what work you're supposed to do
Great teacher! Super helpful and a really nice and normal person. I actually couldn't wait for her classes.
Just a delightful person

This was a great class! He covered a lot of information, but made it interesting. A lot on the slides, but all interesting information. Weekly two page essays were the main portion of our grade. Also, he accepted papers slightly late and was good about checking his email.
great teacher, really funny, makes really boring stuff actually interesting.  And on top of that, totally hot!  I love history now...well at least one historian!
Hot ****
I found the class pretty easy (never got anything other than an A), but some people found him hard. Regardless his FCEs are awesome. Go check them.
Highly energetic, very dedicated
Great prof
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback
