comment: an absolute gem of a person, noticed we were all getting burnt out around midterms and pushed a couple of deadlines back to make it easier for us. super chill dude and a v easy grader -- most stuff is completion -- idk anyone that didn't end with an A
Literally fire, totally understanding and chill. Pretty easy grader, and at least in the class I took, most things are a completion grade. Also, he's like young and chill and relatable. Cool dude

Kind of a lot of work (more than I expected to spend on interp), but such an amazing professor. Super kind, super understanding, really works to help you be successful. Even though he gives a decent amount of work, Id still take him over other professors.

Cody is honestly a great professor. Because I took his course at the second half of the semester, many of us students were very demotivated and exhausted. Rather than continuing to assign a lot of work, Cody took the time to reduce the amount of assignments, shortened many class periods, and also was very open to extensions. Super caring professor!
Austin was an amazing lecturer and caring person! He made lectures really fun and also gave thoughtful life and career advice. Highly recommend taking 112 with him if you can.
Awesome professor!!!
Really great professor, truly cares about his students and faculty.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Awesome professor! Provides very helpful help for anything!
One of the most incredible professors that I have worked with. We could not have had a better learning experience as students.
Amazing professor!
Alan is genuinely the nicest professor you will ever meet! You'll love his class and teaching style.
He is awesome. I would absolutely take him again. I would highly recommend him.

I love professor Kohler. He deeply cares about all students and starts EVERY CLASS off with a question about our week or some game so that we can build connections. He makes sure we all know he is always a resource to us. His class was interesting. At times the assignments could be confusing but he was always there to help.

I truly believe he is one of the most passionate, kind, and caring professors at Carnegie Mellon University. He cares more about the students and how to help them then they do, and will be there every step of the way. I really believe that no matter the subject he can make it something fun, something that anyone would want to learn. :)
I found her class very difficult but very rewarding. If you really work hard and take the time to sit with her, you'll succeed. She's very sweet and an excellent listener.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Bluntly said, if you do not write in a specific style, you will be unfairly torn apart by her. She allows for no personal voice and makes backhanded comments in class. While she is incredibly intelligent, she comes across as harsh and clearly thinks there is one way to do things: her way.
Just perfect
No Comments
No Comments
Very good professor. She really cares. Probably the smartest person at CMU honestly.

For anyone interested in political science, this class couldn't get better. Skinner's lectures are fantastic and full of current applications, and the tests are fair (although they do cover a lot of content). She's extremely approachable and goes out of her way to engage her class.

Fantastic teacher who always keeps you interested and on your toes. Not afraid to put her students on the spot and makes everyone contribute during class. Have a quiz every class on a reading but its worth it for what I got out of the class

Not too hard a class; attendance doesn't seem to matter all that much. One or two readings a week. No real homework - just exams (5 total). Discussions of readings in class for the most part. A few extra credit assignments.

very nice person, and without a doubt one of the best professors and top researchers at carnegie mellon. difficult to get in contact with at times, but definitely worth taking the class. and good luck, her classes fill up real quick.

Terrible professor. Class is incredibly unorganized and is a bad lecturer. His inorganic chemistry was easy, but mainly because we did not learn anything. He makes offensive jokes in private to me, and laughs it off. Absolutely would not recommend.
It was a good class and not that hard if you paid attention and used your brain

Prof. Bernhard has a thick accent which makes it sometimes hard to understand; however, many find his humor to be dry (yet, I found it hilarious). While I was unable to keep Inorganic in my schedule for the full year, I enjoyed having Bernhard as prof. He gives open note/open book exams and final, so he really wants the students to do well.

Bernhard was an alright professor.  Notes seem to lack a bit of structure and organization.  He's got a dry sense of humor that's easy to miss if you're not paying attention.  Office hours at terrible time, but helpful if you actually go.

He is very smart, but does not know how to teach well. Attending lecture doesn't help; he just states facts seemingly at random, and does not provide notes. The textbook is really my teacher. The grading scheme is strange/unpredictable, but he does seem to give a large curve.
best professor ever.
Let's be honest here, there is only 1 metric that matter here. He's a solid 10/10.
He's a funny man. With a weird sense of humour sometimes, but not as weird as mine, so it's fine I guess.
All about discussion. His hair is wonderful.
Super cool. Extra hotness points.
The freshman seminar topic was interesting, and Dr. Devine definitely takes the time to get to know/help his students.
hes the man

I have him right now for business, society and ethics. Class material isn't always the most exciting, but that was to be expected and not the professor's fault due to the material of the course. Really enjoy the professor though. Always very funny and does a great job at keeping the class engaged. My most enjoyable course as of this semester.

He is literally the most amazing professor. Probably the best business ethics professor in the world. He cares about student and also cares about the subject he teaches. He poses questions for you to think which really helps you learn the subject. Almost always available in his office to answer questions.
What I learned in this class was actually much more useful than I had expected. He also cares about your learning. He apparently held office hours during spring break..
Amazing professor to sit down and have a conversation with about business ethics. He really cares about your learning.
He approaches Business Ethics with an interesting sense of humour. Pretty awesome, overall

She was by far the worst professor I had at CMU. She was late to class more often than not, shamed her students for not understanding her teaching, was generally defensive/mean/narcissistic. I don't think it's appropriate for her to be teaching. To be fair, it's been several years since I was in her class. Perhaps she has improved.
Not willing to listen, sometimes ignore students questions or their explanations for asking questions. Sometimes late to class, sometimes canceled class for no reason.

I found her to be extremely approachable and easy to go to for help. She cares very much about the progress of her students and is willing to spend as much time as necessary outside of class to help them. I found the switch to powerpoint to be particularly helpful in grasping the content and bigger picture ideas. I would definitely recommend her!

Terrible teaching ability. Very stubborn & refuses to admit when she's wrong. Used incorrect equations in class.  Doesn't listen to students & overall quite unprofessional. Was late to most classes & 15 minutes late on an exam day & then ran out of exams. Def would not recommend taking this class with her at all. Take a harder class w/ better prof.
extremely unwilling to answer questions. Not friendly with students
an insightful person and teacher. you will be happy to have learned from someone as talented as she.
meh
Charlee is really sweet, always open to new ideas and criticism. Her classes are what you make them - so they're great!
the class excitement level didn't always cut the mustard.
Loved her classes, she is super talented, and wish I could go back and have her again - great teacher!

He employs a very heavy course load, and it is definitely a lot. It is absolutely required to buy a textbook (you can't pirate it). During lectures he does not go over grammar or vocab rules, instead that is all usually outside of class as part of your homework.
Lots of work, lots of learning. My Spanish is better but it cost me great effort. Fun class, though.

VERY Demanding, unforgiving, and puts you on the spot.  Grading is harsh and the online work seems impossible.  He didn't help when I had a problem with my online work when I had over worked myself. Plays favorites, is very strict, and fails at making the class interesting or fun.
Demands a lot from you, but for good reason. Practice everyday and volunteer in class for best results--he'll also like you better for it.
No Comments

Zapanta is hilarious and a great guy. He responds quickly to emails. There are five labs and they are not too bad. Graded pretty nicely too. There is a poster presentation on a scientific paper at the end of the semester.
Love Dr. Zapanta. If you can, take his classes. Great mentor and instructor
Great Teacher and Mentor.
Best BME teacher ever. So into the subject and knows his stuff!
Dr. Zapanta is a great professor if you can get over the fact that he's a Penn State fan.
The lectures could benefit from better preparation, as some of the explanations of basic concepts were unclear and occasionally caused confusion.
One of the best professors I've had at CMU. Very enthusiastic and kind, and also makes lectures interesting!
Matt is definitely one of the best professors at CMU. Reached out to him when I struggled with serious anxiety and received a very kind response email.

Matt is a great communicator who is in control of the class. Always friendly and ready to explain concepts. I only took a bootcamp crash course into machine learning with him, but I'd be happy to take more classes

Matt was such a kind professor. He really cared about us learning. You could tell that he practiced his lectures, which were very interesting. The examples/ analogies that he used made complicated prediction techniques quite intuitive. The programming homeworks were challenging but very interesting and cool.

Great class, very interesting. Huge lecture hall, but can keep you paying attention. Good material and fun to learn. Boring book, but really was unnecessary Do the study guide and you'll ace the test. has review sessions before test where they go over everything. Very helpful.

A good guy, sometimes boring but that's because he takes the time to make everything extremely clear... when he's there. I understand that he has a 3-year-old at home, but I'm not paying to be taught by a TA. Still, I'd recommend his class.
No Comments
Made a lecture full of 200 people really interesting.
Really interesting.

Unlike some other professors I've had, he has real-world experiences in national level cyber incidents that allows him to better educate students. Some students may not like his delivery, but he provides valuable insight not found in a text book.

This guy needs an attitude adjustment. He is a legend in his own mind. He did not deliver a quality learning experience. Does this guy even have a degree? He tells jokes but is not funny. The lecture content is common knowledge. Do not waste your time on this useless class.

Marty's decades of experience at the heart of network security bring valuable insight to a course he has refined to perfection.  His interactive delivery style engages and encourages students to  apply and critique security policies in real world business environments.   He truly has the student's best interests at heart, but start homework early.

One of the best classes I've ever taken at Heinz.  It made me change my outlook on Internet Security, and he knows a ton and isn't afraid to share.  His skepticism and sarcasm makes the class entertaining, and if you like Info Sec at all, he's essential in helping you embrace your inner nerd.  Also easily available for help outside of class/e-mail.

One of the worst profs I've ever had. If you've never taken a sec. course before, it maybe wasn't too bad, but if you have experience with it, you see right through him. He's often wrong in what he says, and he tries to "show-off" by asking a question, then saying "no" to responders, and giving a response that's basically what the students said.
Good book, bad and boring lecture

He's very knowledgeable, but his teaching could be better. Lectures can seem a bit of a drag and during office hours, he sometimes answer with ''read the textbook''. The course material and labs are amazing though.

comment: He might look like a stuff old man when you first meet him, but he's actually incredibly knowledgeable and interesting, and just when you think you've had all the assembly you can take, he cracks a joke under his breath and suddenly it's all good again.
If you have the opportunity to take 213 with Bryant and O'Hallaron, I strongly recommend you do so.

very good professor. be healthy!
Easy A even if you only study old exams prior to the exam
Great class. Prof. Garrison is always willing to help.
great prof. nothing bad to say
Some of the most random stories you'll ever hear.  Watch out!  He's going to pass out!

He has a good rationale behind making the tests hard, and I don't think your final grade will be any worse than if it were any other professor. GO TO OFFICE HOURS.
god awful omg i've never hated a class more than his class he literally made it so much harder than it had to be, did not seem to care about student happiness at all and found our pain funny

comment: Made a hard class fun, in the end fair grading

comment: Mike's class was so so hard but he is incredibly helpful and I learned a lot of combi. I had to work a lot but I really enjoyed the course.
He is enthusiastic and cares a lot about his students. Very engaging and inspirational lectures. Midterms were easy.
He's a pretty good lecturer and knows the material fairly well.
Brilliant, caring professor. You can tell that he really knows the material. He seems to have a lot of fun teaching during lectures

Very engaging lectures though he does tend to go off on tangents. He has an enthusiasm for the subject and is very easy to talk to. Very nice and caring. His midterms are hard though, and the h.w's are written by TA's and tend to be very long. No practice midterm material. Lecture notes are thorough though very technical so difficult to understand.

comment: Professor Erdmann is a legend. Love that man.

comment: Professor Ada recommended this class. I was excited to learn about complexity theory and this class didn't disappoint. The material was great (though hard) but Kothari gave well-prepared lectures and had clear lecture notes. His office hours were particularly helpful. I recommend taking this class with Kothari if it's offered again.
Prof Kothari's lectures were really fun and engaging despite being about sometimes hard math.
If you are taking 455, you must take it with Prof. Kothari.
Teaching is not important for him, only himself, avoid by all means!
Amazing! Prof. Kothari made an online class feel more interesting than in-person classes. Would 100% take it again.

One of the best professors I've ever had! The class was very discussion-based, and I learned lots of important concepts. Heavy on case studies, but they made it much easier to learn the material. I would absolutely take another class he taught.
Absolutely fantastic
Best professor in Heinz

Lassman's cases cover a wide scope of management, leadership and ethics. Class discussion was by far the best out of any discussion based class I have experienced.  Favorite class: Bill Cowher-suprise speaker. Insight in Cowher's leadership style is invalualble. I'm fortunate and lucky to have had such a great experience.

Professor Lassman is awesome. His class is a lot of fun -- it's largely case discussion-based, and he is great at leading the discussion and providing valuable insight from his extensive experience. I am so glad I got to take this class with him - I learned a lot, and had a great time doing it!
Such an awesome and chill guy. I highly recommend taking 15-451 with him

An absolutely abysmal lecturer. No idea why he is still teaching, but you want to avoid this teacher at all costs. It would be one thing if it was just his lectures that were terrible, but he also designs bad questions and overall runs the course poorly. If you think a co-instructors will save things, think again.

Not an effective lecturer. When the other professor for the class is lecturing, often interrupts for the sake of arguing a minor mistake that the entire class has already caught and mentally rectified, understanding the intent. More of a hindrance to the class overall.

I immediately regretted showing up for class whenever this man was the one lecturing.  Brilliant at Chess and Splay Trees; total and utter failure at communicating ideas clearly and avoiding excessive detail

On the occasions you stay awake, you will be lost in a sea of hand-waving proofs, obtuse mathematical/CS concepts, and loosely scribbled info on the board. He's definitely brilliant, but his lecturing leaves much to be desired, especially for an undergrad level. Office hours occasionally helpful for understanding some theory though. Good at chess.

Lisa is an amazing professor and person. I took Body Politics with her and she made the course extremely interesting and makes it easy to succeed. She's so kind and caring and goes out of her way to accommodate students and tailors the course to the class' interests. Highly recommend taking a class with her!

Wonderful professor.  I wasn't extremely interested in the topic before I took the class but she made the material really interesting.  The class was well-organized and if you need help, she's very helpful.

Wonderful professor.  I wasn't that interested in the topic before I took the class but she really makes the material interesting.  The class is well-structured and she wants you to do well, so if you ask for help, she'll provide it.

She's great. Very clear about her expectations, and she's interesting. Attendance is absolutely mandatory (miss more than 2 classes and she'll bump you down a letter grade), but worth it. Lots of reading -- it's up to you as to whether you do it or not, but whatever you do, make sure you participate.
I loved her class! her essay is grading is kind of hard but she lovessss class participation! Be sure to read all the readings which there are ALOT of!

For your sanity, please do not take this prof. The homework is confusing, much of which isn't covered in class: the concepts are rushed, and her teaching style baffles even those trying to pay attention to her circular lectures. Her organizational method and pacing are abjectly terrible; get ready to self-learn all of ochem.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: She is the best professor ever. Super nice and her method of teaching changed via students' requests. Had such an amazing semester with her!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Exams are worth about 85% of your grade. Her dropping policy is a bit strange. You have your 3 midterms scores and your final exam score is double-counted. Of those 5 scores, the lowest is dropped. Her lectures are very fast and surface-level, so you may need the textbook for the things she skims over. Her online notes are a bit messy. Nice though!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: She is very caring and sweet. That's it, that is the extent of her positives. Here are the following negatives: She is very unorganized, unable to answer questions, not willing to regrade even if graded clearly wrong, and most importantly, cannot teach(she gives you facts and not reason). Absolutely atrocious.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She is so nice!
rating_tags: GROUP PROJECTS--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Respectfully, MS has no serious understanding of pedagogy. You will not learn a safe technique from her. She basically just chases after a "free sound" for 4 years; in practice, though, she creates an artificial, always open cord position and has you pass excess air. Sounds nice and big in short term, but leads to cord problems and early damage.

Respectfully, MS has no serious understanding of pedagogy. You will not learn a safe technique from her. She basically just chases after a "free sound" for 4 years; in practice, though, she teaches an artificial, always open cord position and has you pass excess air. Sounds nice and big in short term, but leads to cord problems and early damage.

Professor Spacagna is a wonderful and very knowledgeable teacher who cares deeply about her students. She goes above and beyond! She also has lots of on stage experience in the world of opera that makes her almost overqualified for her position. I would highly recommend studying with her, especially for those very serious about opera.

Maria cares deeply about her students and will jump through hoops to help them. She is tough and will let you know if you are making the same mistakes but she is also extremely understanding and will pick you up when you're down. If you're not getting a concept she'll find new ways to explain it until it makes sense, she's helped me grow immensely!

Prof Spacagna uses her opera career as grounds for authority at CMU. However she is late to lessons, has students decide their own exercises, but belittles those she feels take their lessons more seriously than she does. She has the least success in sending students to prestigious graduate programs compared to the other two fuller CMU studios.
Super laid back guy who talks slow and has a relatively boring class but its really easy with fair assignments and tests

Oppenheim is the least helpful professor, he doesn't do anything that requires him to do any extra work. Probably the worst professor I've ever had. And the slowest talker... but his class is easy though
Simply awesome!
Slow talker, great teacher.
A wonderfully weird professor but in a good way. Class average is like A-. He's awesome.
Very theoretical, but very rigorous
Very well structured and very helpful during the tutorials.

One of, if not, the most brilliant professors I've ever had at CMU. There was never a question he couldn't answer. For Continuous-Time Finance, the lectures are very theoretical but you don't necessarily have to understand of all of them to do well. HWs, exams, and grading are all very fair.
Brilliant professor, very rigorous instruction.
Great prof

He cares about his students getting the help they need and is very accessible by holding office hours immediately after class which were very helpful. VERY fair grader (next to no points off exams for small algebra mistakes). Easy to catch up in the class if you read the book. You will be prepared for the final taking his class.

Prof Wojtowytsch (at Pitt now) is ok. Clearly he's new to teaching and I think he knows that and tries to improve. Would teach concepts but not really how to apply them- need to go to recitation for that. Exams are ok, similar to the practices, and he seems to want to make them as fair as possible. Felt prepared enough for the department final.
He is in Texas A&M now. If you have to take his course, be ready to study by yourselves
Be ready to study by yourself
Boring and hard to understand. Most people don't even go. Nice guy, just hard to follow.

Unprofessional and disorganized professor. This person will assign work last minute while happily claiming you will not sleep till 2AM as result of this last minute assignment. Very poor course structure and awful lectures. The slides look like a 2 year old made them. Avoid this professor.
Best prof I had at Tepper.
Beware of the quality of the information presented. Questions are normally far below the expectation of masters students. Professionalism is questionable at times.

Terrible. Did not have correct facts in some cases. Did not give midterm grade. Most of final grade is huge group project. Will not re-grade individual questions on an exam, only the entire exam and "your grade may go down". Final exam is on last day of class.
Aven is great. Organizational Behavior, however, is pretty boring.
Great professor and great class. he mainly lectures about his work - he's done a lot of stuff across different fields.

Love this guy. Kind to everyone and offers extensions upon request. Definitely take his classes before he retires. Readings definitely help with tests and class participation but it isn't a big deal if you miss a reading. He also gives you the textbook so you don't have to buy it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He is a good professor. It was very interesting course. He seems to care about his students and was approachable.
Solid professor.  He definitely has a history with the material and makes it very relevant.

Told us day 1 that if we weren't going to do the readings, we should at least skim them--honest, but not encouraging to do the work. Much discussion, with a large component of grade being discretionary for participation and attendance.
He's hands down the best professor I've ever had. He's really genuine and he cares about his students! I love him!

He is the professor that will make you THINK! He is really good and if you practice enough you will get a good grade. He is enthusiastic. Attendance is mandatory and you shouldn't be late for his class. Prof Oliver is the BEST!
too damn hard

Very very unjust. Most importantly, the class room door is shut for students who happen to be even a millisecond(yes millisecond!) late + you lose 5% of your grade for being abscent(No excuses[fair/unfair] accepted).
Professor MacBeth is a great teacher who is really nice and helpful.

His classes are by-the-book, here are some slides go memorize them style. Pretty ordinary, average stuff, except it tends to be arbitrarily hard. Mark definitely won't help you out in a pinch, though. Reasoning with a brick wall would be easier.
Not afraid to speak poorly of people, especially biopsych majors or those not going on to graduate school.
Although he's an okay professor, and may sometimes be nice, he's a horrible person. Judgmental and pushy.

She's an ok professor. Sometimes concepts are hard to grasp, so she will sometimes review concepts during future classes, which is nice. She gets confused with her own examples that she provides in class, which is annoying.

I go to WUSTL and had Kang while she was a visiting Prof at my school. All in all, I'm very glad I took Microeconomics with her! She brings a witty sense of humor to class, thoroughly explains her reasoning for different kinds of problems, and writes exams so that you always feel prepared. Kang is super nice and I would recommend her to anyone!
Willing to help and her lectures were pretty understandable.

Very willing to help. Holds office hours at students' convenience. Problem sets are quite difficult and she encourages group work. Tests too are difficult. Be sure to make the best use of her and the TA's office hours .And don't forget the weekly online quizzes.
Susan is a very sweet and supportive.  She is one of the reasons I majored in Spanish!!!
Susan is one of the most loving professor I have ever had.  She is always enthusiastic, and constantly motivating.
No Comments
very strict, lots of work but a great professor
Was very good at the topic of forensics.  The co-teacher sucked, I forget his name.  If you have a chance to take a class with Tim you should.

He has in-depth knowledge in his area of expertise and also has appropriate knowledge in other information security domains as well. His answers are insightful and he makes sure any doubts are clarified. He is a laid back guy and teaching is not his day job so he's probably unlike any professor you know.
doesn't always have an answer, but will find it and report back later.  One good thing is that he really want technical things to be accurate
Fairly difficult coursework, but doable, and later seemed useful.  Has high expectations and makes bad assumptions about previous classes.  He was open to explaining things but you have to ask.

Roni is one of the best prof I have ever met. He explains things crystal clear and in a philosophical way (which makes me enjoy even more). I have concrete ML knowledge and thinking after his lectures. HWs are awesome too and documentations are well-written. The only thing is that tricky questions in exams have too many points assigned.

This professor has a great passion for the field. He is also a pioneer. And the Socratic way of teaching by asking questions is fantastic. Nevertheless, the material should be updated since NO SCHOOL now teaches concept space for one class. Also he could explain many, many well-developed ideas and equations in a much better way.
The class can move a little slowly but the lectures are always really understandable. There's a reason his section is always so packed!

One of the worst professors you can have at cmu. Spends 2 months on material the other section learned in 2 weeks. Uploads a sample midterm heavy on information theory then gives an exam without a single question on it. Makes students wait in line for 45 minutes to "sign up" before an exam. Spends most of his time trying to catch cheating students.

One word: Horrid. A teacher from the 70s, with zero grasp of how companies and world work today. If you want to listen to stories of what work for baby-boomers, treat yourself to his fantasies. If not - get an internship anywhere else and you'll learn more in 2 days there than in a semester with David.
Amazing Professor, his lectures are the best

Professor Krackhardt is an AMAZING lecturer. Every week he picks at least 1 group (usually 2) to present a case, but the cases are usually very interesting to read and straightforward. He teaches by putting his students in the position of managers and needing to make critical decisions. Very interesting topic taught by an amazing professor.

By far the best instructor I have had so far at CMU (and the class was outside my major).  I really enjoyed his teaching methods.  He engages the entire class in discussion, to the point where most want to contribute.  Structure of class very well planned out.
best teacher ever
Decent presenter. You can find that he likes to talk about himself and his work.
Nice class.
Okay lecturer. Well-prepared. Workload was not heavy. Not a lecturer who's receptive to feedback.
Really smart, a little intimidating. I had a hard time at first but this has been one of my most favorite classes. She's really great.
Super cool, had her for Medieval Lit. Brilliant teacher, very fair, very accomodating, I learned a lot.
Took the feminism seminar. Really cool and sweet professor, but a lot of reading long texts and writing papers, which I'm not into. But final project was fun.

comment: She's a darling. Really tries to make your life easier. Flexible about due dates if you talk to her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Not too great at clearing up concerns, gives very poorly worded assignments, and didn't teach a good chunk material before the exam which led to a lot of self teaching.

The class is quite essential and teaches many things that can be applied to many aspects of engineering. However, the professor is very difficult to deal with, and sometimes her lectures confuse me, even after I've done the reading. Make sure you are an obedient student and don't think outside the box when it comes to projects—she can't handle it.
I loved Professor Beckwith's class, as I felt respected and that she truly cared about my and my classmated education. It's a tough course, but she makes it much easier to bear.
Don't take this class.

Prof. Budnik is one of my favorite profs at CMU. He is a teaching professor and it shows, he is very good at breaking down concepts and making them understandable over the course of a single lecture. He 100% cares about his students, and goes the extra distance to help students with internship/job advice. Highly recommend.

Mark Budnik is the best professor that I have had here throughout my CMU career. He treats us as if we were his actually children. He makes complicated topics super simplified within a short span during lectures. Highly recommend taking this class if you love analog circuits. Labs are also super fun. The workload just about right.
Amazing prof who really cares about his students, favorite professor ive had even though i didn't enjoy the class material

Prof Budnik is an amazing guy. He really cares about his students and wants them to do great in his class. The class itself could do better but the professors offer a lot of resources to help the students succeed. Definitely one of the best professors in the department

This was easily my favorite class this semester, Oppenheimer made every lecture so fun and engaging! He truly cares about all of his students and is there to help anyone who needs it. If you haven't taken a psych class before, the exams may be challenging. But If you took AP psych or some psych course in hs, this class will be pretty easy.
His exams are too hard
very nice guy, not really college level class
Makes the already interesting class fun
Best psych professor ever. Loves his job, and does lots of dumb jokes and bad puns in class. All around a cool guy.

Objectively speaking, his lecture is terrible. He likes to ramble on different topics and goes on and on, on examples that makes his argument even more confusing. The quality of the content of the class is quite low, and I have the feeling that everyone is not bothering to pay attention in class just because of how bad it is.

Don't find his lecture very helpful. Sometimes he will even mock himself during class which I found funny. Makes me wonder how could someone who is clearly not knowledgable enough in the subject matter teach a class of 70+ students?

Poorly structured course. Homework does not seem to be well designed and structured. His lectures are basically reading off slides, and very wordy. Typos occur everywhere despite him teaching for years, and overall appears to be very unprofessional. Would not recommend.

Matt Bass is good at speaking with elevated authority, but in reality the content that he is speaking is very poor and does not have much meat. Sometimes I found myself able to summarize one hour of lecture in one sentence, and he can go on and on. It all boils down to it depends, and I dont find his lecture useful at all unfortunately.
Great prof
Bless this man

Such a good professor. Office hours are very helpful and he really cares about helping a student succeed in his class. The exams are difficult, but he gives out the layout of all of the reactions needed, so study and your set.
He is a really good professor. He's funny and cares about the students success. Plus, many of the students have crushes on him. Go to his office hours!
Awesome Professor, provides great feedback and cares about improving

She is so nice and caring. Really enjoys teaching. A very friendly and approachable person too outside of lecture. However the grading is difficult. She tries to reduce the average grade whenever she can. Beware.

Professor Burke highly values first impressions--both ways. She will put on a facade for the first week. Then, she will become herself--monotone and callous. She does not care if you are struggling with mental health. If you do not look interested and excited as well as speak in class often, your will grade suffer (a lot).
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Professor Burke is a nice, helpful teacher, but her class is full of group projects that require a ton of work. This class is not an easy A- it requires a ton of work (Although that work is easy).

Keating is a total boss, if you don't think so... then you are probably lame. He is single-handedly responsible for all the humor that resonates from the CS department in cmu. TLDR; the guy is hilarious and truly cares about his students

Spends the entire class rambling about random things unrelated to the subject.  Requires attendance for a 9:00 AM class that doesn't teach anything.  Horrible teacher, avoid unless you're in CS and have to take his course to graduate.

Keating is awesome, he takes a class that every CS major dreads and makes it interesting and worthwhile. The grading can seem a little harsh but eases up towards the end of the semester. Tech Comm is well organized, well run and not unreasonable amounts of work.

He taught Technical Communications for CS majors in Fall 07. Old but amazing teacher. Material can be the most boring thing in the world, but he cares a lot about students and provides really good feedback. Very tough grader though.
The best of the best!  We're lucky to have him!
Love him.
he's amazing!
I love this man sooo much and he was extremely helpful!!!!!

Horrendous lecture organization. Material taught was at the 5th grade level but averages on tests were still C's since they weren't representative of what was taught in class. I hated this course mainly because of her.

Solid teacher and course (Regression) - very easy material to learn if you do the homework and study. She was very nice and available for extra help (i.e. anonymous note card questions after class, office hours, and exam review sessions). Accent is hard to understand at first, but you get used to it.

Professor had no interest in helping students.  Continued to state that students were really stupid if they "super failed" by having a 0 on a rubric that was completely arbitrary and not shown prior to the first test. The rubric jumped from 5 to 4 to 0 with basically no partial credit.  Strong emphasis on vocab and unclear in requirements for tests

Teaches the material quite well, but often appears to advocate extreme ideas that make the class seem like propaganda. Tests and homework are difficult not for the content, but because it's extremely difficult to tell what exactly she wants written. Grades are based on a rubric placing significant emphasis on economic vocabulary.

He teaches the Haitian history freshman seminar. SOOOO nice. He is considerate and understanding. He is such a kind professor and during the class he also helps us to build connection between each other.

A very understanding professor. Made sure that students understood the material and what was expected of them in class. Focused less on the grammar and structure, leaving that responsibility to the students, and instead focused on giving the language a context in the French culture. Made sure every student felt understood, and had their needs met.

Professor West is amazing. He's by far one of the coolest professors in CMU who knows his stuff and is genuinely interested in what his students have to say or share. I find it rude that some say it's not a 'CMU standard' class. This guy just knows what it means to get to students to learn from interest instead of forced obligation.
His class is a waste of time, unless you're required to take it.  Just show up and you'll get an A.  Definitely not a CMU standard class.  Barely a high school standard class.

Very unprepared and disorganized. Missed lecture at least once a week. Seems as if she does not know the material well. She is very hard to follow in class and a horrible lecturer. It seems as if she tries to throw information at her students and hopes they pick it up.
Very nice, easy to talk to, but doesn't teach very well. Class was confusing.
Consistently late to class and unprepared. Doesn't teach material well. Posts homework and solutions very late and has major syntax errors that impede on your ability to learn.
No Comments
He's a good guy, good teacher, just make sure you do your work
learn a lot in a short amount of time but the readings are HEAVYYY

comment: Dr. Gray is very knowledgeable in his field. However, his course 80-100 is ridiculously time consuming for a gen-ed requirement, and on top of that, assignments are graded incredibly harshly. Knowing students who have taken the same course with other professors and had MUCH better experiences, I would not recommend Dr. Gray for 80-100.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Professor Gray was a good lecturer and generally pretty personable. The TA that graded my tests though was extremely arbitrary, and seemed to take off points very subjectively. Made it hard to respect the class, because he was the main grader and getting a good score meant spitting out what he was saying. Make sure your TA doesn't suck like mine.

Amazing lecturer, very funny. Lots of readings, but that's to be expected from a philosophy class. As long as you do them, if you're the type of person to get A's in English in the past, this class won't be any different. Easy A, IF you do the work (and pretty interesting for a gen Ed)

The sweetest professor ever. She really cares about her students and wants them all to do well. Class was genuinely pretty fun too. She is a very fair grader a long as you put in effort. Do your assignments and go to class and you will most likely walk out with the grade you want.
So sweet and understanding. An easy grader as long as you put in effort and genuinely makes an effort to get to know her student. Love her!

She is an easy grader and all you really need to do to get A's on assignments and papers is to turn something in with some semblance of effort. If you have experience with essay writing, you'll be fine. The first half of the semester is very structured, there is a lot of reading and small assignments.

comment: As long as you make effort when writing essays, you will get a good grade. Do the homeworks to receive credit. Participation in class is also encouraged.

comment: I took the Business Writing class which was insightful. The TAs as well as the professor both provide constructive feedback on the assignments which if followed can lead to good grades. The professor is cheerful and keeps the class interesting.

comment: She is a strict grader and you need to be on time for her class and not miss a single class since she will cut points for that.
This professor does NOT RESPECT students at all. She is easy to get mad at no reason. She teaches colleges students like a kindergartner.

The Professor is very bad at giving proper feedback. She does not seem interested in helping the student grow in the specific skill that the course is intended to help. As the whole course is subjective, it is very important to be in her good books. If she does not like you, then you will end up doing badly in her course.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Pretty nice guy, but lectures are a bit of a slog and are unengaging. Not very good at explaining concepts, but class is overall pretty easy, so I guess that makes up for it. Tests sometimes come with extra credit questions.

Lectures are almost entirely just writing down definitions. His homeworks and tests are extremely easy, and hes an overall funny and nice guy. Would only take his class if I knew the material beforehand (he is not very good at explaining). If I had him for anything else other than Calculus 1, this review would have been different.
Rocky start, but sailed the ship home. Good guy!

Professor Bourne has a great attitude and brings a lighthearted energy to class! His calculus class 21-120 can be hard to follow at times, it is lecture heavy with little engagement. It often feels he is moving too quickly, and the class has gotten collectively lost multiple times. Too which he responded with enthusiasm to help us.

Dr. Heise was an amazing teacher. I took her seminar in comp at Pitt and the class was sometimes boring (many easy/long readings) but overall great. It is a grade-less class, so assignments are marked for completion and you are given supportive feedback. 2 times a year you conference with her for an official grade. I could not recommend her more!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Dr. Heise is an excellent professor; I took her for Seminar in Composition at Pitt and she was great. She gives encouraging feedback and is super supportive. Also, she does not grade assignments, rather, she just gives you feedback and at the end of the semester, you fill out a self evaluation sheet where you determine the grade that you get.

Dr. Heise is super nice, she will help you out if you have any issues with deadlines or figuring out next steps on papers. Attendance is mandatory and there is a discussion board post and reading due every class but I never did the readings and was fine and the discussion posts are easy. Her lectures are fun and she's a great person and teacher.

Prof Heise is amazing!! You can tell she is passionate about what she does and cares about her students. Take her class if you have the chance, it's a great intro course especially if you haven't been very exposed to writing in the past. She is extremely accommodating and I would take another class of hers in a heartbeat.
Really awesome course. Great professor, very inspiring! Lectures were really fun.

Great lecturer and cool guy to talk to. Attend lecture and pay attention in every class if you want to do well in the course. A good psych background helps immensely, but Nick is more than willing to clear up any doubts during office hours. Relatively challenging but intriguing course.

Extremely passionate and interesting guy, has great lectures and comprehensive but fair examinations. This class is extremely challenging but you can get by with a strong Psych background, going to every class and taking notes, attending office hours and reading the textbook.
Read the book and go to lecture for an A.
Terrible teacher, incredibly dull, repetitive content, mandatory attendance.

comment: do NOT take 80-150 with him. his exams are hard as hell, and homework is hard as hell and boring.  Almost everyone gets a B or C in this class.

comment: this guy is boring as hell, he straight up talks to himself and rambles about the same stuff on and on and on, like dude stop LOL. he also gives quizzes every class to make u come to class, which is really savage. Explains concepts well and extremely thorough in class handouts. Handouts answer 90% of all questions you could possibly ask. Lab sessions are quick and informative. Extremely strict with attendance. comment: One of the best professors I've ever had.

A heartless man. Has no sympathy for students. Is not clear with grading expactations. He has no redeeming qualities as a person and even less as a professor. Does not strive to make his students succeed. He is a ridiculous grader. A psychopath and masochist in short.
By far the most awful teacher Ive ever had.
One of the worst professors I have ever had. His tone towards students is somewhat rude and he doesn't realize it so he continues. Get out of the business school and stick to computer science, Vipul!

comment: Material is super interesting. Pace was fine for the first half but increases quite a bit in the 2nd half.

comment: Crypto class by him was a lot of fun. The subject as a whole is tough but he does a good job in conveying the big ideas. One of my favorite classes.

comment: It almost feels like he goes out of his way to make his classes easier, but he doesn't explain things very well either and overall it's not a good time.

Not for me, hated econ. We didn't even learn micro economics, half the time we were learning macro! Plus there was a huge cheating scandal, and he didn't even curve the grades of the people who didn't cheat.
I took Mircoecon with him. It was hard. I struggled. Econ is not for me. But I did pass. I would not take again as this class was just hard for me.

I've never rated a professor before, but wanted to make sure everyone knows how great Professor Gasper is! He was super accommodating during the pandemic, and actually managed to make zoom lectures interesting.

Gasper is a great lecturer, and clearly has passion for what he does. Material was difficult for me because I haven't taken econ before. Recitation was also really helpful for me, but it depends on your TA. Didn't do too great on the last midterm, so my grade took a hit. But overall, great class!
supercalifragilisticexpiadocious!
This man is just as intelligent as he is good-looking! He just takes my heart away!
I really love this sweet enthusiastic young man who makes quantum mechanics so much fun.

He is the greatest human being I've ever met. He saves me from a subhuman savage who almost made me quit physics. Extremely gentle and sweet when interacting with students. Also instills students with the true love of theoretical physics.

Jim's teaching was so lackluster it caused students to permanently fail in their future careers. comment: Avoid classes by him. Should retire.
How depressing and disappointing. I changed my whole life to learn from people at a prestigious school and I end up watching YouTube tutorials.

As a technical major wanting to take an interesting course, I was disappointed not only by the lack of professionalism and subjective grading, but also by the standard of teaching.  Also more concerned with self-promotion than student learning.

Bret is the best professor I've ever had! So nice. He is very approachable when you need help because he is almost like a friend. Carnegie Mellon needs Bret back.

Bret Vukoder was my Expos 101 prof at Rutgers for the Fall 2019 semester. He was so helpful, funny, and inspired me to become a better writer! I thoroughly enjoyed attending his class and this is one of the situations where I truly believe that if it weren't for his enthusiasm during every lecture, I probably would've gotten a barely passing grade.

Honestly, professor Vukoder was one of the best professors/teachers I've had up till now. He taught my expository writing class at Rutgers and was such a down-to-earth, knowledgeable, and understanding person, scholar, and professor. I definitely recommend if you want a professor that understands and cares!
Bret really loves what he does and makes the topic very interesting and engaging for the class. I highly recommend it.
Widely credited with the erosion and suppression of the arts in both CMU and throughout greater Pittsburgh. As head of the school of art, he interfered with and obstructed students careers.
Stay away from John. He has a bad reputation for a long history of mistreating students.
What a dreadful nightmare to be around this person.

Carson used to be head of the school, so he is still faculty and teaching. I dont know what he was doing running the school, because he doesnt seem to know how to run a class. His lectures were vague and incoherent rambles with no clear meaning or value. I took this class because it seemed fun, but Carsons erratic behavior made it a mess. Avoid.
I took 76-390 Style for my major requirement and I loved it! Professor Oddo cares a lot about his students. He helps his students improve their style of writing in an effective way.
Very caring and helpful professor. Best I've ever worked with!
Professor Oddo is an embarrassment and anti-American to his core.

comment: Does a very good job of teaching essential writing tips & craft
So nice and understands that the language is difficult. Definitely going to take a class with him again.
I really enjoyed his class.  He loves teaching and he treats his students well.  Going to miss his class!
He would like it if everyone could learn Chinese and got an A. If you let him he will help you.
Liu is amazing as a teacher. he is patient and will take the time to help you learn the language. I love this class and hope to have him again next semester

He was a good lecturer, exams were more difficult, seemed to think students actually cared about course material but most were just their to get their gen ed credit so he would be frustrated at times.

comment: Really cool guy. Deserno tries hard to explain everything clearly. His problem sets are really inspirational. They're not easy but when you figure them out you do feel you learn a lot.

One of the best professors in the department in terms of teaching abilities. Explains everything clearly, keeps things interesting in classes yet always in context as well. Not always easy homework sets but they tend to give you an "AHA" moment once you figure out the problems.

Excellent professor. Very engaging and clearly interested in what he teaches. He is willing to explain concepts multiple ways to make sure everyone understands. Highly recommend his course Physics for Future Presidents.

Yes the lectures are three hours long, but he gives plenty of breaks.  Pay attention and have fun with writing and you'll do fine.  He goes over all the material in class, no absolute need to buy the book or read it.

I had him for the Beatles class in Spring of 2006, which was probably the most amazing class I've ever taken.  His lectures were incredibly informative and entertaining.  If you have a chance to take a class with him, do it!  Highly Recommended.
No Comments
No Comments

Definitely one of my favorite professors. Prof. Haworth's lectures are fun and inspirational. His assignments are fun, and his feedback on them is very helpful. He is not a tough grader and is always willing to help you learn more.

Lovvveddd Professor Haworth. In the writing class you can really incorporate any of your own personal interests for the big writing projects which is super nice. The class is super easy, enjoyable, and Professor Haworth is just generally a super interesting person who is clearly passionate about what he does. Definitely recommend taking this class.

Took a half semester freshman writing course on graphic literature with him. Interesting in lecture, an easy grader, open minded. Generally will let you get away with a lot as long as you have good intentions. Definitely a pretty good professor and an even better person. Thoroughly enjoyed my time with him. Would recommend.

The only negative comment I have is about the course. The section Prof. Haworth teaches was the only one available at my registration, so I was stuck in it - it also wasn't that interesting to me. Nothing against him as a teacher though. He made the class very interesting for everyone. Would take another class with him, but in a different topic.
This class is great!

Professor Compeau is an incredible professor, His lectures are really engaging and he clearly puts in a lot of work into his classes and really cares about his student. I highly recommend taking his classes even if you didn't like biology in high school.
worst unprofessional tutor i have ever seen

Took lot of effort to prepare lectures and notes. Amazing work in inspiring wonder in subject as well as creating a narrative connecting all topics. However, went in a little too much detail sometimes and sometimes didn't cover some topics very well.

Overall, Professor Jahel is a good professor. It might be a little difficult to follow his pace in lectures because he explains pretty fast and his handwriting is sometimes not very clear, but he is very friendly and approachable when you talk to him and ask him questions. He will also give us curves on exams and extensions on homework.

Prof. Jahel may be hard to follow in lectures because of his accent/handwriting, but he actually tries to explain as clearly as possible and genuinely cares about students' learning experiences. He also gives extensions and curves pretty leniently.
great professor!

Professor Jahel's lectures were slightly hard to follow, but since this review is being written during his first semester teaching, this isn't a valid criticism for the long term.

Homework load is light, but very open ended and sometimes confusing. I recommend reading the textbook (even though its not required) to fully understand key topics

Homeworks are intentionally hard to make you suffer, project is very confusing till the very end, exams are way harder than what the practice entails, sometimes even misleading from the practice. The students did give feedback on this mid semester but little to no change were given to the course
Difficult tests, tough homework grading, terrible project.
This professor tried her best to make this course hard. No lecture note, few feedback. Very unreasonable grading. exams are 10 times harder than practice test. Do not recommend

The most difficult math class I've ever had. No guidance, no help, and incredibly tough homework and midterms. There are no lecture notes, no feedback on assignments, and TAs are not given hw solutions. Midterms are 5x harder than practice midterms, and there's no guidance or direction for students

Engaging lectures, nice sense of humour, understanding of accommodations and one of my favourite professors thus far. Hefty amounts of homework with challenging coursework. Participation was mandatory and she would often pick in students to speak up, but it was understandable given the nature of the course.

Wu LaoShi is a great person and is truly willing to help any student in her class. Her humor is sometimes distracting and the classroom can get a little hectic, but it's overall very refreshing. Looking forward to taking more classes with her in the future. Tests and quizzes are ridiculously easy.

This was a fun break from my other classes, she is excited to be there every class unlike most of my other professors.  It's a good pace for an elective, not overwhelming but enough to feel like you're learning something and not doing busywork.  Take Chinese I before your last semester so you can still take Chinese II!
Funny teacher!

My man Raja. Words can't describe my appreciation of the GOAT of CMU's IS department. There might be one or two times where you disagree with his grading, but having taken 67-262 and 67-364 with Raja, I can certify that he truly cares about his students' success and a good course experience (unlike another professor for a sophomore-level IS class).
Absolute legend. Must take a course with Professor Raja.
Raja is a great person. Personally his lectures are longer than needed and he covers very little actual content each time, but he is very inspirational and funny and caring about his students.
This Professor is awesome! He was really open to the students letting us lead class lessons and discussions. Grading was easy and overall fun

If you're full of nonsense and are already an industry slave he'll call you on it. You always feel a little on trial which is fantastic for the CMU Design kids. He knows what matters, and seems to believe that how you design is how you are. That's his greatest strength and his greatest weakness. Follow his lead and stay openminded.

While Steve is widely respected among design students and faculty, the studio he leads for freshmen has little structure and supplies much frustration to its students. Steve conducts class with an easy-going, almost anarchical attitude, but students soon learn that his relaxed nature is a facade come grading - it is near impossible to earn an A.
Be curious. He doesn't tell you things, he sets you up to discover them.
He will expand your awareness every time you talk to him but he tends not to supply answers to questions.  Great class.
Very respectable teacher who is probably too nice. Taking this class with Professor Gregory was the best decision of my life.
Just go to lectures. He makes it fun.
Great professor who makes a challenging subject fun and interesting. His grading is tough but fair.

Required course in Fluid Mechanics.  Kelvin makes this dry (ahem) subject fun.  His grading is tough but fair.  He makes time for students and wants us to do well.  Don't skip lectures!  Some exam questions come directly from lectures.
He is the best professor you could get in any engineering course.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: One of the best professors at CMU. While he is quite knowledgeable what sets him apart is his genuine care for students. He is soooooo nice and patient. If you have an option try to take 18-100 with Zajdel.

It was a cool October afternoon. The students in Doherty Hall were rushing to their next class. I approached DH 2315 ready to learn about signals and systems, Tom's expertise. As the lecture begins, and Tom begins to speak he opens with an interesting phrase. "Guys" he said "I've been to a grad party". At that moment I knew that ECE was my calling.

He is a great professor! He is respectful, funny, explains well, and is very accessible. His lectures are full of useful information and they are inspirational. He talks about the relevance of the material given. Just a great human being that cares for the education of his students.

Dr. Hicks is a dedicated professor who cares deeply about his students. He's passionate, enthusiastic, and funny. While he faced challenges with the course material and time management, his effort and commitment to teaching are commendable. With refinement in grading and test design, he'll excel.

exams aren't really hard, they're all just from problems we practice in class or from the practice set he gives us. just focus on pop culture references or any mathematical symbols he uses in class and you're all set to get an A, maybe even A+

I genuinely looked forward to every class with Dr Hicks. His teaching style is not only engaging but fun and relatable. One of the highlights of his classes is the clever pop culture references that keep you attentive. He puts a lot of effort into making the lessons both informative and entertaining.

Dr. Hicks is an amazing professor who genuinely cares about his students' learning and well-being. He's patient, understanding, and encouraging. Math isn't my strength, but he spent hours helping me understand the material. He's devoted to your success and goes above and beyond.

Do plenty of practice problems to succeed on his exams!

Professor Hicks is very approachable after class. He helps me intuitively understand concepts and provides proofs or geometric explanations beyond the teaching material. He responds quickly to emails and adjusts exam review sessions and office hours to accommodate students' schedules. I enjoy the course with Professor Hicks
if you take his class, brush up on some sitcoms and good movies. Lookout for random movie quotes in the middle of his lectures as they make up some of the bonus questions on the test.
One of my favorite classes and professors. Assignments were difficult and you have to put in the work but I learned so much. Lectures were funny and engaging.
avoid him at all cost
Condescending, not respecting students, I have to force myself to go to his class every single time and I absolutely hate it

Sai Laoshi was a very insightful and engaging professor. Understanding enough to work with my accommodations while maintaining reasonable expectations and boundaries. Class was difficult and we would often be picked on randomly to speak, but not unusual for a language class. I learned a lot from him.
She was very helpful for Fluid Mechanics, especially in office hours.
exams are either really easy, or everyone fails. no curve

Enjoyed the course overall, however a few of the movies were a little dullunenjoyable (55 days in peking, gate of heavenly peace)

I thought the class discussions were very interesting and helpful. The readings were small enough to not be over-whelming, but still incredibly informative and framed discussions well. I love that I learned more about both China and film, both in an enjoyable manner.

She is such a hard ass when it comes to giving points. She's the government and your grades are tax money. No thats not right, at least there are tax returns. She does not give you a break.  A classic feminist chinese teacher that tries to make her class seem important by grading it as if it is a graduate course. My rec? Would not take.

Professor Gupta is an incredible teacher. His explanations are very, very clear, and his presentation is engaging and interesting. He also makes his students a priority. If there is a concept that wasn't quite clear from lecture he will type nice LaTeX notes to clarify, and is very approachable.  However, he is a VERY challenging professor.
No Comments

251 is one of the most evil CS classes ever (why is it even CS? It's mostly discrete math anyway). No magic tricks here, but he's pretty straightforward and easy to understand. Not very lenient with giving out points, and HW/tests are quite difficult. (Annotated) lecture slides are all posted anyway, so feel free to sleep and download them later.

Completely uninterested in the class.  Not sure why he was there.  The topics chosen seem interesting enough, but you must learn on them yourself.  I guess he is a new teacher, maybe he will be better later on.
not prepared usually, learns how to do things along with students

Responsibly  explain course materials.  A knowledgeable professor with solid math background.  He gives clear intuition. I would take him again.
Did require some understanding of  theorems and derivations,  but still focused on applications. He explained things clearly and was willing to help. Study carefully and then you will be fine.

everything is copied from textbook. no other materials. tough grading and focus on exams. In the exam, you are asked to memorize all the theorem and concepts without solving a real problems by applied maths.

I took matrices and linear transforms with professor Ginster. Having a textbook is optional but I chose to get one for myself since his lectures were too hard to follow. The homework is not hard and addresses topics discussed in class (get ready to do a lot of proofs). The midterms and final are proof and definition heavy. Overall a fun class. :)

comment: Lectures were clear, and questions were answered well.  Lectures are thorough enough that there is no need to buy the textbook. Homework prepares you very well for the tests.
Fair grader, very forgiving, easy to reach outside of class. The pace in class is fast but the tests aren't too difficult if you've done the homework.

Really great professor, with great lectures. His exams are a bit hard though, but people tend to do well on them if they pay attention and do well on homework. You get a piece of scratch paper for exams 8.5*11 so that is a HUGE help.
the teaching is average

Had Professor Greenhouse for 36-226. Very clear lectures. His exams are also very straightforward (they are very similar to the HW!) Overall a pretty solid professor and does a good job keeping the class entertaining.

comment: Most impressive. i will never forgotten her. Arguing and learning with her was more than a pleasure. She touched my soul. Olivier

brilliant, accessible, compassionate, all-around amazing.
Chris's class was my favorite class this past semester.
Very helpful teacher! Very kind and professional!
Good teacher. Very nice and willing to help.

It was really cool to have a real life meme teach a class about memes. As a memer himself, Professor Han goes to great depth and detail into the world of memes. This class was particularly difficult, since it took matters to the heart. But Professor Han put a  fresh spin to the class, and I really enjoyed his take on the course. Easiest A, plus you learn a lot

Took her Race, Gender, and Justice class. 2 readings per week, some were quite long. Occasional writing assignments but if you're good at essays and follow the directions you'll be fine. Dr.Wenner is an admirable professor. Very knowledgeable and more importantly, organized the structure of her classes really really well. comment: Dr. Wenner has been great! Currently taking a new course (Race, Gender, and Justice) by her, and its been fun. A bit of reading and the lectures are discussion based. Professor Bier was super kind and accommodating! I did not like the OLI, but the class as a whole was super fun!

comment: He is very hard-headed. Hard to work with; and packs his students with loads of work with assignments and writings while not being aware that the course only has 9 units. I do not recommend anyone taking this course if you want to continue liking the English language and Carnegie Mellon.

Professor Gillette gives pretty good feedback on your writing, especially if you go to office hours or request a personal meeting. Although I did learn a lot, I personally think he grades harshly on major assignments. Just get 100s on the minor assignments and I think it's a solid A.

Interp is supposed to be an easy A, but not with this professor. Overall, his grading criteria is really weird because you will get points off for random things on major assignments even if you follow all the steps. comment: Many positive things to say about this professor! Pretty kind and caring but very demanding when needed. They will not allow you slack off at all. This teacher works well with students who take initiative to solve their own problems. Since studying with this professor, my artistry has improved to what is pretty close to professional level.
Yes, other students need to know that he is uncaring and a bad instructor.

Great recruiter, not a good teacher. Stopped caring about me the moment I enrolled. Cannot convert what he is able to do himself into effective coaching for others. If you are seeking more than arrogance and the insipid platitude, "play louder, articulate harder", where your ability to develop as a musician and person is concerned, look elsewhere.
CG

Great lecturer, very knowledgable of the area. If you take his class you will learn a lot. That said, his grading criteria is absurd. Not very empathetic.
Great lectures
He did nothing while PhD student Dan Licata taught the class. Speaking of, Licata is one of the best and most engaging professors I've ever had!
Amazing.

Awful teacher. 
Does not teach material properly but the hw is extremely long and difficult. Avoid him

comment: He rambled for the entire class period. I would have taken the class and just read the textbook to learn the material, but he required attendance and didn't use a textbook. Painful.

comment: He's a good lecturer and responses on Piazza are relatively quick, however, he definitely has really high expectations and the homeworks are extremely difficult.

Cosma gives clear, well-paced lectures, and has a dark sense of humor. I get the sense sometimes that he'd like to tell more jokes, but he holds back so as to stay on topic. I learned a lot in this class. Statistical Computing (36-350) is most useful if you've done no or little programming, but I'd recommend it to anyone who needs to learn R.

Tilton is a great prof and made learning enjoyable. Lectures went by pretty fast. The homework can be difficult and sometimes long so going to office hours helped SO much. The two midterms and finals were open note/textbook. If you know how to do the homework and understand it, you'll be fine in the class.

Professor Tilton is one of my favorite Chem E professors at CMU. His grading structure is brutal, 90 percent of the grade over 3 tests and 10 percent hw with no drops, but the tests are relatively easy. The homework is some of the most difficult I've experienced, but his typed notes that he posts are incredible.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: The homeworks are very tedious/difficult so try to get your hands on the solutions to alleviate. The exams aren't easy per se, but basically no studying is required since they are open book/notes. The grading on the exams is also very generous, just write an energy balance and you get ten points!

be sure to attend the classes to avoid a failure. he is very strict about grades. also, be prepared for a low grade if that matters for u. the course content itself is wonderful, and he is obviously an expert in BE domain.

A pretty engaging professor (more than most people who've spent their life in economics). He's reduced the amount of reading for this year's class and the workload is manageable. He's extremely clear in his lectures, which makes the material easier to learn.

Clear and fairly engaging lecturer, but his own work appears in class a lot, so he can seem self-centered. The class' case studies also involved sexual questions to a potentially uncomfortable extent.
Condescending and ineffectual
clear lectures, reasonable problem sets. probably gets poor reviews because of the difficulty implicit in the material

Worst professor ever.  Couldn't explain his way out of a wet paper bag, if he were even willing to.  I've been booted out of his office with nothing more than a "look a little closer at the problem" more times than I can count.
Like him a lot, would recommend to anyone.

DeBoer is possibly the nicest professor in the world. His lectures are easy to follow. He prints out notes leaving certain words blank (to be filled in throughout the lecture)= good study guide and resource for homework. Homeworks take long, unexpectedly difficult Exam 3.

First semester professor at time of this writing.  Will ramble/mumble and completely ignore questions during lecture, often responding improperly ("what are p, c, and n?", "p is a variable, c is a constant, and n is an exponent").  Unfortunately, he's the only one who teaches MechE Thermo.  Easier to learn from book than from lectures.

This professor's classes are kind of hard, but they are soo worth it. I definitely couldn't skate, but I learned a lot. I have taken 2 classes from her. They weren't like other classes I've taken which was awesome.

I have never given a rating to a professor on this website, yet I felt compelled to this time. This professor was one of the worst I have ever encountered. If you are considering taking one of her classes, please reconsider!! It's not worth the inevitable frustration.
lots of reading, but pretty well worth it. very willing to work with students and help.
A world expert in what he teaches: makes you learn things you won't find on textbooks or the Internet. Makes you think during lectures. Heavy load (at least 18-756).
In and out, doesn't care.
Doesn't provide help AT ALL.
Great professor

Took 15122 with Simmons in Spring 2015. Lectures are somewhat boring but informative. The first half of the course was easy but once you dive into C you may expect heavy (programming) workload. Written homework is graded harshly. Midterms were not very hard but extremely long, especially the second one. Final was easier than the midterms.

Professor Simmons is my absolute favorite professor I've had at Carnegie Mellon so far. His lectures are fantastic, insightful, and engaging. As a person, I believe Professor Simmons to be one of the most genuinely compassionate, caring, and thoughtful people I've ever met. He makes me feel like I matter, and that's not nothing.

Professor Wynn is very knowledgeable and cares about his students becoming better writers and arguers. Fantastic course. I had some rough personal things come up mid-semester, and Wynn worked with me in an understanding and helpful way so that I didn't fall too far behind.

I had James for Rhetoric of Science, and I really loved the class.  James is rigorous, but it's meant to help you as a scholar.  One thing I loved about his class was the detailed feedback on papers and assignments--he graded to a rubric and made clear you understood the rubric.  Overall nice, funny guy, who sincerely wants to help students.
Kind, sweet, and amaznig looks - that's Dr. Wynn!  His classes are awesome, too!  Very hot and very helpful - take his class!!

He was such a nice and helpful guy.  Even though I took the class online, he always had online and real office hours.  His syllabus and class is very well organized, and he lets you know exactly what you need to do well in his class. It's crazy just how much time he spends trying to help his students with another full time job and family of 5
No Comments

He was a kind and caring teacher. He always tries to make the class interesting but the other students are all incompetent and lazy. He always has time to answer questions, but it would be nice if he could tone down the homework assignments (they are 10 pages long!).  And I would appreciate if he would speak louder, half the class couldn't hear him

Great class and professor. She makes the material interesting. Not too challenging. Readings are helpful, but you could skim if you needed too. She gives really friendly, detailed feedback on rough drafts so that you can do a quick revision. Understanding, always willing to grant an extension. I can't say enough good things about this professor.
Great professor.  Engaging and very helpful.
Taught me 76-101. Awesome professor! She makes having Interp at 8.30 am bearable. And she's always so nice and helpful.

Pay attention to lectures and homework, make sure to attend class as well as there's often supplemental tips that can really help with understanding the material, especially since there's no textbook.

comment: Good prof who teaches in a straightforward way. Attendance is 10% of the grade, and if you show up to class the exams are not difficult. The problems aren't tricky and as long as you know the concepts you'll do good on the exams. They give lots of partial credit and grade the exams pretty generously. A is achievable and the professor is very kind.
Attend classes and take advantage of the practice material within recitations!
Avoid if you can.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Professor Lessem was a great teacher! Her exams are easy as long as you take notes, do the homework, and do the practice exams. She's also very willing to help during office hours, if you ever have questions on any of the material.

Even though they take 4-5 weeks to grade one exam, there's a no late policy for the barrage of homeworks and quizzes they give. Seems like they're more than willing to give themselves accommodations but wont even extend a single deadline, even by a few hours, for you if you're swamped with work and sick.

While Professor Muller seems to know his stuff for econ. Unfortunately he should've been a researcher or public speaker instead of a professor. He doesn't provide feedback on presentations nor assignments and provides absolutely no clarification on the grade received. The slides used in the class are hilariously bad and are no even released ahead.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Great class.  Prof Muller is very energetic and engaged.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Just an unfair professor. He is just trying to get tenure but still has not. Clearly for a reason. Is an awful lecturer and his exams are IMPOSSIBLE. Should be banned from interacting with undergraduate students.
lectures are very hand wavy
