Professor Acar is an amazing lecturer and overall great at getting the content across. Diderot is a really easy platform that complements the course. The homeworks are difficult but you learn a lot by completing them.
He is tough.

rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Although the content of Dr. Purcell's class content was super fascinating and it was quite clear he is passionate about the course material, the overall expectations of the course were unclear. The final paper alone was worth 60% of the grade, which is enough to tempt even the most committed student to withdraw.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Richard is super nice and super into what he teaches about. Loves participation in class. He is somehow able to ramble on for an entire hour or more without interruption. Most of what he says isn't really important, so just put a little effort into the papers you turn in and you'll get an A. A pretty easy class to pass if you just show up and sit.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Tomprou is probably one of the best professors we have at Carnegie Mellon. She makes the classes extremely enjoyable for all of her students. She often starts/directs really interesting conversations between the students.
Amazing.
Such a good professor for Organizational Behavior. Best Tepper professor by far. She really goes out of her way to help support students.

While he seems to have his priorities elsewhere, Professor Chase is a captivating lecturer. His homeworks were a bit frustrating, but doable, and there were only 5 of them total. I would only wish that I had paid more attention, as I think I could have gotten an A.

His priorities are kinda elsewhere, but fortunately it translates into the class being relatively easy and chill. He posts everything in lecture before class, so you don't even have to show up. The problem sets can be confusing, but going to TA office hours helps. The tests are non-cumulative, memory-based, and based off only the lecture notes.

Professor Chase is an extremely smart person. If you read about his research and publication history you will be inspired by the work he has done. His teaching is quite the opposite. You have no idea what you are expected to know in the class. Never holds office hours. Takes forever to return grades or provide solutions to past assignments.

Weak class material given in a Zoom format that requires about 15 hours of non-interactive attention over a single weekend and grades harshly despite the obvious limitations of the format and cramming of lectures. You won't receive any grades or feedback until over half of your grade is already submitted, and the grading does not catch up later on.

Taking class with her was the worst choice I've ever made. Extremely harsh grading, extremely aggressive comments. The class I took with her was only a 3-unit writing/seminar class at CMU, and she gave me a C. I stayed up a whole night writing a 2000-word paper and received a 84/150. Avoid her at all cost. She's a nightmare.

Avoid Korryn's seminar at all costs. Although you may learn something about storyboarding and prototyping for a VR experience, you will regret taking her class all semester long. Extremely harsh grader, very passive-aggressive, and makes horrible jokes. Last person you'd want teaching your first-year seminar course.

Prof.Lew is a very kind person who is always willing to help students solve probelms. The course have weekly quizzes. This means you have to attend one of the recitations each week. The lecture slides are quite informative and helpful, so I mostly studied by myself in the library. Midterms and the final are not so hard.

Professor is a nice person, but is hard to understand. I never felt like I was really learning from the lectures because he is reading off of his slides. His slides are pretty informative but I would prefer not to always have to be self studying. The class midterms are not that difficult and are departmental, but the class averages are always low.

Professor Lew is a very sweet professor. He is always checking to see if anyone has questions during the lecture, and stays after for questions. His lectures aren't the most interesting though. He can speak kind of quietly and he just goes through his slideshows. If the lecture isn't helping you, you can always go to his office hours.
Doesn't interact with students at all.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Nice course and very clear guidance.
A great dude. He really inspires you to achieve your full potential.

I was privileged to take Professor Tonguz's class during my academic journey. I can confidently say that his impact on my growth as a student and researcher has been truly remarkable. Dr.Tonguz is approachable and patient. He deeply invested in my personal growth. I am proud to have been influenced by such an exceptional scholar.
great professor
Wildly disorganized. Periods of time when there's no homework and periods of time when there's three assignments at once. Course content is plagiarized. Professor unwilling to help students.
She seemed to be unprepared and winged it most of the course. Never posted up grades so you could see your progress, but the content was easy.
No Comments
Very interesting class, tons to read, and a lot of essays but worth it...she's real chill

DON'T take 10601 with Professor Kim. Extremely unclear lecturer. Lecture slides are  full of mistakes and confusing notations. Homework assignments were prepared by the TAs, who gave ambiguous explanations/questions and were slow to clarify. Final project was done in groups of two, and little guidance/clarification was given. Take the other section

Professor Kim is an absolutely terrible professor. She is very, very poor at explaining concepts; even those that are relatively simple. She also is very slow to respond to emails and Piazza posts, and her homeworks and exams were all riddled with careless mistakes (which again, she was very slow to correct on Piazza).
First time she taught this class. Super theoretical and unhelpful. Take the class in section A instead.
Really awesome teacher. Good lecturer, content is interesting, and all of the course expectations are very clear. Do the readings and take good notes, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: He's a really great professor. He makes you work hard but it's extremely fulfilling. He gives great feedback on papers and is very informed and enthusiastic about the subject matter. Definitely would recommend taking his class. It's a lot of work but definitely worth it.

Geoff is a fantastic professor. He really knows his stuff and is passionate about the material, which shows through in lecture. His classes are demanding in terms of the reading load, but he gives great feedback on assignments and exams. Definitely take his course - if you stick with it, you'll learn a lot.
Lectures are not helpful, so either you know how to study or you fail.
Got the idea, Got the flavor

Very easy grading, but doesn't like people not attending regularly. You are a failure if you get a C, consider that a fail with him. He's not really clear but the courses he teaches are easy and he makes them easier,  but you need to self-study, you can't rely much on lectures.

This professor consistently expects you to be able to incorporate nuanced information into your answers without her specifically asking for it. Very unclear 90% of the time, which is a shame because the material is interesting. Often gets frustrated/annoyed when students ask clarifying questions. Writes info on board, so ppts are very unhelpful.

Work itself isn't bad. email communication w/her is frustrating+unhelpful. She failed to clarify/write the expectations for the neurotransmitter project+took a month (since we already submitted work for project) for her to claim these expectations. Many ppl have insufficient time to redo work to meet the new expectations nearing finals season.

Her course was probably the most difficult one for this semester. She doesn't take attendance but there are group exercises after each lecture that are graded. Also her slides do not have any info, you need to go to actually get any notes. Tests were all take home but were so difficult. Wanted to go to oh before a test and she wasn't there
I really liked my class wit be Professor Apt. He is very engaging. The class helped me a lot.
A real astronaut! It was an amazing experience to take Professor Apt's class knowing he has flown on the space shuttle and been to space!!!
Professor Apt is an actual astronaut. I guess I am still a little kid at heart when it comes to meeting astronauts. His course is very interesting. He is easy to talk to.

Awesome professor with great lectures. Was a bit slow and theory-heavy in the beginning but the payoff is so worth it. Many cool applications: Computer graphics, curve fitting, Markov matrices, and more. The material is very cumulative; the material at the end of the course brings everything you learn together. Emphasis on proofs. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Very organized and informative lectures. The expectations for quizzes/tests are clear. Highly accessible and personable during office hours.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I took 21-241 with Offner and it was probably one of the most chill classes I've had at CMU. Lectures go over basically everything you need to know, and recitation and homework problems are instructive and reflect what he'll ask you on the test.
His office hours made me feel beyond dumb and the lectures go at a super-fast pace. Exams require a lot of memorization.

As long as you watch his lectures (or at least make sure you understand the lecture notes), 21-241 with him is pretty easy. His lectures are very thorough and laid out well. He is also open to questions during lecture/office hours. Overall, a very good class and professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: If I could live 100 lives, I would take a class with Prof. Talwalkar in every single one of them. I took the course because I wanted to learn about CS and AI, and I ended switching my major 3rd year because of how inspiring he was. To me, he is like a father figure. He built the man I am today and I aspire to be like him in the future.
Get ready to work hard! Professor Talwalkar pushes you to the limits but you will learn a ton. Inspired me to pursue a career in machine learning. You must take a class with him!

Really bad teaching. Just showing the math instead of teaching the people. Did a survey but never take the voice from the students who think the course has too much math rather than how to use big-data ideas. If you just want to know how the big data is used in the industry, stay away from him. You will get nothing from his lecture.
Prof Zhang is very patient and offers exta office hour upon need. Very nice experience.

Xu Zhang is the best professor you can possibly ask for. He is sooooo patient and good at explaining things you wish he taught all your classes. Also super caring and is always looking to give students some points back on homework or exams.

Professor Zhang is the best professor for 18220. He teaches very clearly and slowly. With him lectures are very understandable and homework is much more enjoyable to do. I really liked this class because of him, I hope he is given the chance to teach 18220 alone!

Took the quantum mechanics course offered by Noa this semester. Organized in a very unique way, which gives you a very concise idea about quantum mechanics and solid physics without going too deep into the details. Well-designed and carefully taught. If you are an MSE student without strong physics background, it is worth trying.
She was the worst teacher I have ever had. Very monotone, and did a very poor job explaining what she was teaching. If you can avoid her as a professor, I strongly encourage it."

Not the best lecturer. Very monotone, seems to just read off the slides most of the time. In fact I learned more from my TA during recitation than I did during lecture, and had to rely on those recitations for learning the material for homework and quizzes. Be prepared to become besties with your textbook for the semester.

Shes one of the most caring professors Ive ever had and checked up on me many times throughout the semester (I was struggling with my mental health). Very flexible with extensions as well. Overall she puts herself on an equal level with her students, unlike other professors that love the power trip. Very sweet and kind.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Do not take this class if you dont want a shot ton of work everyweek
rating_tags: So many papers--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Professor Burakowski is great! The lectures and the content are very interesting. Though there are two hw assignments a week, you can easily do them in 10 minutes. The exams consisted of short answers and a concept map which was not too bad, but they took a while. Fun and easy class!

Has high expectations (it was a first-year class for most of us), but she seemed to care a lot, maybe too much. It was fun, a lot of interaction with classmates, and not really that hard if you don't mind reading.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: The class was more work than expected for a writing class but you can get a lot out of it if you chose a research topic that you care about, the professor cared a lot about students improving, and the readings were a lot but mostly interesting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Don't take prof. Alexander's class if you want to spend more time on English than your in-major classes. She doesn't seem to understand that this class is a first year English class and grades the assignments as if we are all English majors... Spent more time on this class than on my math classes...

lovely person and a great teacher. i've had many harp teachers over the years including across different countries and she is by far the best. she challenges you for sure, but it really helps you grow and i've never voluntarily practiced so much in my life. she makes me love the harp.
By far, the best harp and theory teacher in the world!
Unbelievable teacher; really one of the most fine in the field.

Prof. Rollett is one of the greatest professors I have ever met and worked with. He has many deep and inspiring insight about additive manufacturing and general material science. Would love to take the course and work with him again!
Interesting course but overall not a great experience with Professor Rollett, especially when doing research with him.

Professor Rollett is a good lecturing professor but lacks many of the qualities necessary in a caring professor. He shows a lack of empathy towards his students in his lab group, classes, and even his TA. It seems that he does not actually care very much about his students although I think that he must to some degree. Cool class, pretty bad prof.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment:
12h+ per homework and only takes 30% of the score (6-8 homework),
In-class midterm takes 30% and finial 40%.
Lectures are basic, homework and exams are extremely difficult math.
Take 18698 if you are TRULY confident in math, consider take neural data analysis instead.
Byron is a good guy but he doesn't apply to ANY email.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I have never seen a professor prepare to teach a class less than Byron Yu. He believes that just because he understands what is going on that the rest of the class does as well. Be prepared to be dropped in the deep end and expected to swim. The class is poorly explained in the syllabus, and feedback is nearly non-existent.
Great in lecture, very helpful inside and outside of class. Very reasonable.

Lauren was a great professor! Very kind and caring. She values participation a lot, and she is great about providing feedback to everyone for all assignments. It's clear she genuinely wants you to succeed
Great class
It's not an easy class, but Lauren is awesome!
Great professor. He is very insightful.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He's a very cool guy and can be funny at times. It's hard to get below an A in his class. Grades leniently, cares about students, "open notes" exams, passionate. He even takes an effort to learn students' names. HW is 1-2 hrs, but it's not too bad. Lectures can get boring at times. I highly recommend taking his class.

I looked forward to attending Intro CivE class every week. The class itself isn't difficult. There are group projects throughout the semester which were very doable & enjoyable. Grading was fair. Homework & tests were easy if you understand the handouts. Definitely attend class. Costa is a total character & wants everyone to succeed.

Good professor with a fair course structure that makes an A pretty achievable. He explains things well in class (slides on Canvas too) and does practice problems on each topic. He explains the answers to the practice problems and answers all questions in class. Course is made up of 3 exams, weekly HWs (graded on completion), and a team-based essay.

His accent with the combination of his habit to look down and talk and stray off topic, sometimes made it hard to actually understand what he is saying in class. The midterms are kind of hard. Overall, he is a nice dude, but I pretty much had to learn everything on my own.
THICK Accent but he seems like a genuine guy. The class was pretty plain but that was most likely because there are not so many ways to teach a lower-level accounting class.
Good guy.
Extremely good lecturer.
He is a good teacher for this class.  you should take it with him
His dad is better.
One of the best professors I've encountered at CMU. She really cares about her students and wants you to learn as much as you can. She'll go out of her way to help you if you need it.

Wonderful professor. Definitely do not take her course lightly though--you will need to work hard. Extremely helpful and has a good sense of humor. She will push you to learn all you possibly can in a semester.
Wonderful teacher.  Very kind and knows her subject well.  She teaches extremely well and knows how to engage the students.  Heavy, heavy reading load.

Easy A. I already took AP Stats so this intro level course was easy, but it was definitely way easier than my AP class in high school. Tests are not tough, but you have to know the material to get it done in the time allotted. Homeworks are once a week and take anywhere from 2 to 4 hours. Overall not bad.

Professor Cai is a very thorough teacher. She expects attendance, but is willing to accommodate students who have to miss class because of illness or internships. If you do not understand the material, she is very willing to work with you in office hours or at other times. An easy class if you do the HW and take notes.
Dedicated and really willing to help.  Answers questions well.  Gives a lot of opportunities for bonus credit.
took the intro B&W with him.  Super awesome prof.  Funny, fun, and informative. He can go a bit slow some times, but its nice if you've never done any work in the photo lab.
Great prof!  Really allows you to explore photography with open eyes when your first getting into it.  Its a wonderful class wonderful experience.
No Comments

Dr. Donahue is as intelligent as he is funny and light-hearted. He goes off on tangents easily, but is well aware of this tendency and usually manages to incorporate a lot of interesting and relevant content into his side discussions. He knows his content extremely well and is a very highly respected member of his field. Plus, he has great hair.
I met Neil Donahue and  can't wait to tale his class! He is quick as a whip, kind as a doe and plus he has cool hair!

Hippie teacher who loves what he does. challenging subject (quantum mechanics etc.) with little natural intuition but you'll get through. fair grader and tries to accurately represent your work/effort.
She's not flexible about attendance. You need to show up to get the participation grade. She seems to prepare much for her lecture but the class is not very fun.

Grading in class is completely random. Gave her very clear on assignments because you know what you have to do, but the class teaches you nothing that you do not already know, yet you can get a C in common sense. If you do not agree with her entirely you will not do well in the class.

I give her Clarity of 5 because the material is revolves around "common sense" and it's very hard to screw up explaining that. She will also have a sudden fit in the middle of the class where she thinks everybody in class hates her. She also ignores your requests and questions, and insists you deal with it with your group members.

really great teacher, he's very interested in the content he is teaching and is legitimately interested in his students and their learning. He enjoys getting to know his students and values content and concepts of writing over grammar. I hope to take another class with him.
he's so enthusiastic it's amazing. and he's actually a good teacher who wants you to understand things! great!
He is a professor who is genuinely interested in the material he teaches.  His teaching style is refreshing.  He is genuinely interested in the performance of his students, and offers much guidance.

The largest difficulty with Touretzky's teaching may be that he assumes students will find computer science easy to understand, and does not go out of his way to clear up issues that people without any programming experience may have. Other than that, his lectures aren't bad, and the tests are relatively easy once you understand the basic concepts.
Very Bad.

Touretzky's assignments require knowledge not provided in class or easily accessible in provided resources. His exams do not reflect the material taught in class because he provides rigid constraints that were never a part of earlier examples, assignments, or practice problems. This class is designed to make students fail!!!

Prof. Best was accommodating and open to changing his course to suit students best and improve their learning. However, significant concepts are covered quickly, along with other content, in many slides. He is nice and listens to students, but he isn't the best lecturer or teacher figure. Most students who took Micro before skipped class. 3.5/5
I took his 73102 during fall. He is definitely one of the best professors. Strongly recommended.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: This was one of the best classes I have taken at CMU so far. I learned so much because the lectures were interesting and captivating. Also, the TA's were super kind and helpful.
His lectures are so nice to sit in because he sounds like a podcast

Don't take if you aren't interested in writing about art. I didn't realize what the class was when I signed up for it. Kinda boring, not that hard though. I didn't find her feedback on papers to be particularly insightful and sometimes it seems like she gets too caught up in political correctness/feminist views (I say this as a liberal).

This was my favorite class during my freshman fall. We got to write papers on cool things. I wrote an essay on the movie Edward Scissorhands. The professor is always available to help and super accommodating when students have outside commitments. She gives really good feedback on all assignments and wants students to do well.

really nice prof -- super understanding when it came to deadlines and fairly easy grader. made english interesting fs (final paper was on xmen) and def cares about her students -- willing to go over papers and give feedback when asked. go to office hours if you're struggling. easy easy A
AMAZING PROF
Sweet and Funny! Miss this sweet man so much after finishing this class.

Prof. Penco cares a tremendous amount about your learning and provides ample resources to succeed. He tries to make the class as least-stressful as possible, with open book and open note "midterms" (which are more accurately called quizzes). However, the final is extremely rigorous. You will learn a lot though! He's just a super nice person too.

Tests are harder than necessary and account for vast majority of the grade, but in class quizzes are quite easy. Beware homework is group based, so you can be adversely impacted if your homework group is bad.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The exams are really hard, and the daily quizzes are almost impossible to get points which pulls down the grade a lot

I took RPC with her and loved it. The lectures are fast-paced, so it could be stressful to follow and take notes as she lectured, but I would just look over the lecture slides afterward. I found the material very interesting. There are quizzes every class but half of them get dropped so it's just to motivate you to come to class.
Kyle better
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: If you want a pushover class that glosses over the proofs in a proof-based class, take this course with this professor. You won't be disappointed. It's like she's misread the demographic and the point of the class. She says we go slower to get a more conceptual understanding but we really just cover less content due to her inefficient style.

Pros: by far the easiest math class I've ever taken & prof is enthusiastic. Cons: She treats you like a middle schooler. Attendance is graded. I learned absolutely nothing & it was overall a huge waste of time. Watch a few 3blue1brown videos & save yourself the trouble.
Very cool class
Mild mannered and softspoken, but a pretty good teacher.  Assignments tend to be almost too easy, spelling out exactly what you need to do.
No Comments

Absolutely unfair in grading. Show no respect to students' work. The grading is hard and very subjective. Be prepared to see an absurdly low grade for your well-prepared presentation. Highly un-recommended.

Unclear grading scheme. Doesn't handle change well (especially due to COVID). Passed on the uncertainty over to students, hence they suffer. Unempathetic, pompous and undeserving. Needs more sensitivity towards student goals. He should be more caring towards individual needs and must show respect back to students in all forms of communication.

Great professor. Lots of dad jokes and very upbeat. I knew most of the material already from prior experience so it was really easy for me, but there are others who struggled (though they likely didn't show up to class, because tests are centered around what is discussed in class at length). Overall great intro business tech course. Good guy.
He is very understanding and is always willing to help. He keeps the class interesting.

He is such a funny guy, always telling jokes right in the middle of lecture.  It's a tough class but he tries to keep it interesting.  The good thing is he is always trying to help and is quite approachable.  It's not easy, but don't be afraid to ask him for help.  He is very understanding!
has a great accent, always willing to help, doesn't give bad grades unless you're a jerk
Great for Interp. Topic (pop culture and media) is interesting and easy to contribute/relate to. His readings are interesting, and he will help you if you are willing to put in effort.

Kurt was a great teacher. He truly cared about his subject and the students who attended class. He was very approachable and a fair grader. His readings are interesting and relevant to the subject. Definitely a must have prof.

Kurt is informative, and the assignments are all purposeful (although there are a lot of reading assignments). He's fair when he grades and reasonable with absences/tardies. Also, it helps that he's approachable and helpful. The topic (pop culture) is relevant and interesting enough to be engaged in class.
Just don't. Class is too chill so you don't learn anything
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Just don't. He should retire, just makes you write a whole bunch
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: head full on priceless music history knowledge, but tends to have meandering, tangential lectures that leave you asking what you learned that day (even if you learned quite a bit).

He says you didn't follow instructions on his assignments even when you follow them perfectly. He doesn't know much beyond the things he teaches in class - If you know some stuff beyond the readings he assigns, he will tell you you are wrong and to follow the readings. You really have to fight and argue your way through this class.

He is a very self-aware professor, eager to improve his teaching style to suit the students. He wants students to get something out of his class and if they put in the required effort they will. His classes will require thought and effort but he is willing to help and change his teaching to suit the students.
No Comments
Need to thoroughly read the readings to get good grades on the tests. One final paper (2 pages) required.
its a good class to fulfil a general education requirement. material is not difficult

Very passionate about material (graphic media management) and loves teaching it. However, lectures are lengthy and sometimes boring - also not mandatory for the final exam or term project. Goes really in-depth on course material, which is great if you are interested in it, otherwise it's dull. Covers a huge amount of history (beginning to future).
The best professsor I have ever met
Great Prof, fun class!

VERY difficult class, but the best security course I've taken. Adrian is freaking brilliant, and I *LOVED* his class. Learned more than any other class at CMU. You really need to pay close attention at all times in the class, to fully understand it. The "summaries" you have to do really suck but otherwise, this is a great professor and great class!
Straight up G.  Kept class interesting, despite his relatively low key teaching approach.  Awesome sense of humor.
No Comments
Brilliant teacher who really knows the realm of Social Psychology and Decision Sciences.  Regardless of my grade, I'd recommend his class to anyone.  He's also good looking and very funny.
Good class, good prof
Great professor. Expectations were high and he was always available for help. Didn't hurt that he's hot-love that German accent!
Terrible Professor. Poor speaker, pauses and repeats himself way too much and his info is copied right out of the book. Presents nothing new and class is both annoying and pointless.

Dr. T was a great teacher! Lectures were very informative and fun, and recitations helped with better understanding of the material. Only comment is that she didn't give out answers for homework (she wanted to reuse them), and the second midterm was very difficult for most of the class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Dr T derives a lot of pleasure from her lectures by showing off her Math skills, rather than focusing on teaching material in a manner that is easy to understand for her students. She does not actually curve scores for the Mid-Terms as well... she claims that she has 'curved' via her lenient marking and even so, the grades were terrible.

Dr T. is a really nice person but her lectures are not the easiest to follow. Besides the fact that lectures could be better, the main problem is that the solutions are NEVER given, even for the completed homework and revision papers (because she intends to reuse them for the future). This makes self study extremely difficult!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Funny, interesting lecturer. Lectures can get quite heavy (taking notes for the entire class). He knows what he's talking about but the material can be confusing. The homework is fair, typically has one/two more difficult problem. Exams are fair but make sure you actually understand the material. Pop quizzes are kind of annoying.

Quinn is amazing. He is a funny, eccentric guy and he knows his stuff. He gives some challenging homework problems but tests are straight-forward: if you study, you should get an A. A nice, helpful, funny, and overall awesome professor. If you want or need to take a physics course and he's teaching it, TAKE IT. You won't regret it.
His teaching is really unclear for Physics II. He rambles on and on without really teaching core concepts. Try to take Schumacher if you can if you need to take Physics II for engineers.

I was in his fluids class. He's a nice guy but the worst professor I have ever had. He just reads off of power point slides he printed out, doesn't go through the math written out on the board. He types out all of the math on the power point slides and talks about it. His power point slides are extremely unorganized also.

Had Domach for Spring Intro to Chem Engineering. Homework is challenging but minimal, tests are a bit harder. Goes through book examples on the board, to clarify if you don't understand the method. Likes to put in real-world applications, such as biotechnology and using distillation to make moonshine.

open book/open notes exams, 2 open laptop exams (geez), but he's not an exciting or great professor, uses same transparency, bad writing,..easy grader, I guess, but learn stuff..ehh...he gives no practice exams and he wrote our iffy text book.....
You wont basically learn anything in his class. He did not care about teaching.
Easy class. He wants everyone to get an A. Nice person but makes quite a lot of mistakes.
Mad chill. Probably my favorite professor in 4 years at this drab school.

Didn't grade anything, didn't give us any writing assignments in a WRITING CLASS. There was no syllabus + assignments were sent via email which was so hard to keep track of. He wouldn't show up sometimes which is just extremely disrespectful. Biggest waste of time.

Jason asks inappropriate questions about student's personal lives. He trauma dumps instead of teaching. We didn't get mid-semester grades. He's never given us feedback on our writing. We've never done a writing workshop in this class. He told us to disregard his syllabus. He has cancelled class over four times with little to no notice.

Not a super interesting person in my opinion. Class felt a bit dull at times and sometimes he did little to excite the class and get them to engage. Was comfortable sitting there and waiting for someone to raise their hand, so the same few people did. Thinks his jokes are really funny when they aren't. My class disliked most of the books assigned.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment:
Dr. Diabes is great, I highly recommend his class. Every other class session is an in-class negotiation where you can practice course concepts. The other sessions are lectures where concepts from the negotiations are reviewed. The class isn't too difficult with only a few major assignments.
Attendance is REALLY important on negotiation days.
Great Prof. very passionate and it shows. His assignments and lectures are fun and enthralling.
An absolutely wonderful professor... highly would recommend taking any course he teaches in the future!

Enjoyed 76106 with Dr. Williams. Course content was heavy but made the writing feel more meaningful. (Especially after coming from Writing with Data which was not at all informed by the realities of the world.) Would take another class with him in a heartbeat!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Can be a little intense at times, but super caring and willing to help you succeed. If you show up, do the work, and genuinely try you will get an A. Much more meaningful content than the data mini. Would recommend over the other minis

Very sympathetic towards students. If you let him know in advance that you need a deadline, he will give it no questions asked. He grades homework pretty leniently, but he can be a tough grader for midterm and final papers. He always seems to find something that you can improve on.
Love this man. Straight up god
One of the best professors I have had.  Easy to understand, good at explaining, extremely helpful, nice. Can be funny at times.
No Comments

TBH: Cuonzo is not your average math teacher; he's an extraordinary maestro in the world of matrix algebra. With an infectious passion for the subject and a knack for making complex concepts understandable, he stands as a beacon of inspiration and knowledge in the classroom. Rate: 11/10
Cuonzo really knows his stuff and is very caring; however, sometimes I get lost in his eyes because he is so attractive.
yikes
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: Very professional and very kind. Best professor in Tepper. If you wanna learn about accounting, Prof Liang has quite a lot of optional accounting exercises. He and his TAs are knowledgeable to answer your accounting questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: The BEST CMU professor ever. Such a nice person and truly cares about learning above everything. Gives feedback on homework and allows you to correct mistakes and turn it back in for full credit (although its not needed, he grades easy). Final is generally take home. Will offer extra credit if you ask. Even will take studenst to lunch on campus
A good professor with a fine knowledge of accounting.  Sometimes he let class discussion get in the way of what he wanted to accomplish, but overall no complaints.  Very little accent.

Richard is overall a very friendly and caring person. He makes every attempt to help each and every student feel safe and understand the course content. His homework is always very long and complicated but he is available outside of class to give you feedback and help if necessary.
He is a true gem! He is so accessible and really cares not just about his students' academic success but their personal lives as well.

Good ol' Richie is always a classic to have in drafting. He seems like a hardass at first but actually really cares about students work and well being, it just takes time to understand. 10/10 would hand draft again.
Great professor, made my experience as a first year!
Lots of problems to do ... she makes you work for it but ok if you stick with it
She is a nice person but not the best professor.

Dr. Ranade is a kind person, but that's about it. Assignments couldn't have been more confusing. She literally asked for our feedback, yet we still never got a single actual rubric. Every lecture is another roll of the dice—the last one was awful, but what if you're lucky this time? She didn't teach a thing, but I learned my lesson. Steer clear.

Dr. Ranade is a knowledgeable professor with a lot of experience in the workplace. She discusses relevant experiences in class that helped me understand the professional lives of technical writers. You have to be attentive in class to understand assignment expectations, else your grade will suffer. But you can always redo for a better grade.

Professor is a nice person but not a good teacher. The syllabus was riddled with errors and there were no rubrics for any assignments. I wanted to get more out of this class but the professor was very unorganized. It got a little better as the semester went on.  
Great person + terrible teacher = bad class.

This was required for me so if you can, avoid her class. She is nice, but it's not enough to make up for a lack of teaching skills.

If you wanted a rubric, good luck. There was never a rubric for any assignment, and she only started to give out requirements (verbally) by mid-semester.

If you want a worthwhile education at CMU, look elsewhere.
Best professor of the semester
Lectures are great, though a little fast paced sometimes
Wes is a nice instructor. I enjoyed his lectures although they were pretty hard and fast-paced.

Great professor. Sparked my interest in discrete math. I then took combinatorial games with Wes. His enthusiasm and interest for these topics would make anyone interested in the material. Brilliant lecturer. Fair homework assignments.

Really really nice lady. PhD student who sympathizes with students and often gives  extra time for assignments (sometimes unsolicited but if you ask her and are usually on time, she almost always grants an extension). Not easy grader but not overly tough if you follow her feedback. Witty and enjoyable personality.

As a first year writing teacher & current PhD student, Emily has a strong grasp on what students are going through. She is very engaging and personable. Also willing to spend time to work individually with each student to make sure they thrive. Easy class if you put in the effort. Her class deals with evaluating what "intelligence" really means.

Freshman seminar. Over 90% of classes followed format of collecting questions students had from previously assigned readings, then answering them. Very little off-book teaching. Awkward teaching style. I knew a lot about the subject but found myself in trouble due to unusual grading on tests.

Golman is a young professor - I think he is mainly at CMU for research - but he is good and passionate about what he teaches.  He is the department of social and decision sciences.  He hosted a bring your friends to class day and served coldstone ice cream! For not being very interested in game theory, he made the class enjoyable enough.
Really makes lectures entertaining
Generally disorganized
Basically just working here because otherwise where would he? CVS?
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Awesome professor. Class was super participation-based, so you have to go to every class. Lots of projects and a few group projects.

Overall she is a pretty good teacher. She guides the discussions pretty well and she picks a lot of different, interesting readings. She is really helpful (especially if you ask). I would recommend taking her class.

Enthusiastic and fun. Class was almost all discussion-based on very interesting topics. Prof. Lundgren let us go pretty much where we wanted with our discussions, but I still feel like I learned a lot about the topic. Essays were graded fairly lightly.
good professor that gives me study power

Will throw tons of work at you, rip up your work (if it's bad), make you cry for your mama and make you feel like you are the most incompetent being on Earth and that your existence is a waste of space (Final Reviews). However, you can learn a lot from him if you can follow his pace, and generally just do things on time. Punctuality is important.
I really loved his optimization class. One of my favorite classes so far at CMU. Unlike some of the other mathy business classes, Gutter's class was actually mathematically interesting.

Adam Gutter's so-called "Differential Equations" class was terrible. It was the worse class I have ever taken at CMU, and that's saying something, considering how bad some of our professors are. No textbook, typo-ridden lecture notes, and ridiculous tests. He must at least be a good chef, because this was the perfect recipe for disaster.
Its an exciting class and very lively. He lifts up the mood In the class. He has a good sense of humour
No Comments

He's alright. I had him for 21260 Differential equations and he was great and very open to helping in office hours. However in 21476, an upper level math class, the class was insanely rigorous with too much assumed knowledge and extremely dry lectures, while providing inadequate help.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Worst professor I've ever had. He didn't teach anything he expected us to know; his tests were vaguely worded and inconsistent with the homework and quizzes. He also failed to provide any review or study materials, simply uploading random tests he found on the internet. Additionally, he was condescending and didn't answer students' questions.

She is particular with her expectations when it comes to designing your own experiment. The course is a bit more work than you would expect it to be but she is a nice person and will try to help you if you meet with her.
This woman is the most rude person I have ever met. Good luck to whoever takes this class, it is an abomination
Her lecture is basically just reading slides while asking some weird uninspired questions.
Was quite boring.
Terrible teacher, do not recommend.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Very good, clear and helpful Indian professor.  No probleem with accent.  He made very difficult material easy to understand.
A challenge. It's really helpful, but defintely requires you to put time in. (This is a great thing, in my opinion.) Tries hard to communicate and is generally successful.
This is definitely one of the hardest interp. classes so don't take it if your looking for an easy A.
Such a good prof
I can't say enough good about Riccardo. So many great opportunities came from this class.

His approach was heavy on pretension but light on substance, giving the impression of rigor without delivering real educational value. The structure of the course often felt like a hollow approximation of what a college class should be, but without meaningful content to back it up.

I genuinely can't comprehend why he's put in charge of so many mandatory classes. 
I swear, this guy gets a power trip out of pulling the most obscure detail out of readings for final exams. Participation is mandatory but don't expect to engage in any meaningful dialect either. Feels like taking a high school class if the teacher had a massive ego.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Horrible professor who gives really rude comments on your papers, very little feedback, and his class is so boring. He will ask specific questions in class, but no way you will get it right and he gets annoyed afterward. Hardest grader I have ever had.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The film analysis is more "learn by doing", or more accurately "learn by watching him do" for large portions of class. This may work for many but if you are looking for a systemic approach you will be disappointed. He will ask very broad questions and expect a specific answer (and sometimes be annoyed by the class not guessing the answer).
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: He is a great man and is very accessible if any accommodations are needed. But he is not as good as a professor. He is difficult to understand and I often left lecture with more questions than I had going in. Grading is a bit confusing but he gives lots of partial credit, thankfully. If you're not a math person- good luck and get tutoring ASAP.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Such a great professor and a great course. The professor would post notes for every lecture, and prepare problem sets for us to practice. You can always review notes to catch up. Best math course taken so far
The other 2 reviews on here could not be more accurate. This was the only section of interp available and I regret not waiting til spring.

So much busywork it's ridiculous. He's such a stickler about everything despite the fact that he's horrible at using Canvas and makes unclear guidelines. He's a harsh grader and he'll take away points for really specific criticism, and if you ask him about it he'll give some super vague answer about what he's looking for.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: My experience with Professor Strickland was extremely disappointing. The homework was overwhelming and felt like busywork. Instructions were unclear, and clarification responses were often unhelpful or absent. Strickland was an excessively harsh grader, giving zero credit for completed homework and hypercritical feedback. AVOID THIS CLASS.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: she's a good professor took ENL 101 with her the class was easy and a lot of participation
Pretty easy class. She's not a hard grader and loves participation. Class is discussion-based and largely student-oriented, so do the readings or read the summaries.

English 104 @ A&M. Lucked out in getting him, gave me way higher essay scores than I deserved, allowed late work no matter what (i got 100 on a shoddy essay I submitted a month late). Just wants you to attend class and answer questions.

I took professor Wyatts critical writing class at Slippery Rock University. His lectures seemed like they didnt have direction but he always relates it to what we are doing. Only had to write 4 papers all semester, so all in all this class made me dislike writing a little less!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Easy class, great experience.
Such an adorable old man.
Very easy interp class. Our topic was Texting, Tweets and N00bs. She made it very relevant is GREAT on helping the class out with deadlines. Take her interp class!

Cool professor, very young and enthusiastic. Not as hard as other interp classes, but essays need to be written with effort to receive a good grade. Must go to class (like every interp class) and participation points given. Overall, one of my favorite professors.
Dr. Alfonso-Wells is awesome! She's a really nice professor who tries to make the material as engaging as possible.
Very outgoing, friendly, and funny.  Teaches a lot about Caribbean history, but mixes in personal anecdotes and videos to make the class always fun.

One of the best and most interesting professors I have taken at UT thus far. The class is definitely not difficult, as you learn enough in the lecture and slides to be able to do all the homeworks/quizzes/midterm. Chris is also very approachable in office hours and outside of class. He also teaches important life lessons every now and then! 10/10!
No Comments
Really energetic and willing to help.  If you engage with her, the class becomes much more beneficial to both the student and teacher.
She's funny and always willing to meet with her students.
A brilliant man who cares.
No Comments

Easy grade in his classes if you hand in everything on time and is on top of your work. Professor has clear grading rubric and templates. However, if you miss something, you usually can not resubmit or make up that mark. Attendance matters

Again, it's Japanese, and it's Intermediate Japanese I at that, so it's getting a bit hard. Native speaker (and it's the second year), so he talks mostly in Japanese, stopping to translate into English when we don't get it. Harder work, more work, etc. Get used to it.
Not recommended, unfair grading, not available for students
The class was really badly taught
Professor Day is an excellent and competent instructor. His course is reading heavy but his interest and enthusiasm is contagious. Stand-up guy with a great sense of humor.

Terrible teacher and harsh grader. If you have a choice don't take a class with him. The class is also super boring and a  ton of reading. There were 3-4 papers, a midterm, and a final. You have to pay attention in class and do all the readings since you have discussions. You also watch documentaries in class that put you to sleep.
Loves to take lectures on humorous side tangents, but they're usually interesting enough.  Hates chewing gum and incorrect pronunciation of words such as "orthogonal".  Very insightful.

I'm sure he's a great dude outside the classroom, but he's difficult to appreciate as a professor of art history. The class was boring, disorganized, and poorly conducted. Read the textbook if you want to learn the material.
Took for HUM 200 at IIT. Very nice, easy to talk to, learned something
Nice. Actually learned something.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Love him. Reads off slides but he acts funny, makes his lectures kinda funny too. Gives extra credit for lecture attendance, allows cheat sheet. Contrary to first impression he's actually quite accessible and willing to help if you care to ask. 4 is a fairer score but I give him a 5 because I think he's underrated.

He's fine. He mainly goes off of slides that are easily accessible on Canvas, which is nice. He also allows a cheat sheet for tests (mostly for formulas - he doesn't provide them). Homeworks can feel like a bit much at first, but he gives you plenty of time to complete them.

He's fine. Thermo is fine. To be fair, I took it late and felt babied as a junior in a sophomore fall course. There was a lot of hand holding for students taking their first real meche courses that I found insufferable, and compared to higher level courses, thermo was boring. I mostly got a C because I couldn't be bothered to turn in homeworks.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Intro Graph Theory at Georgia Tech. Forgot he was teaching an introductory undergraduate class. Tough homework assignments and tougher grader. Wasnt very accommodating during the pandemic. But he was a nice enough guy, but he could learn some more about how to be a professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Incredibly energetic and passionate about the class. Clearly cares about the material and that everyone is able to understand. The class I took, Set Theory, is naturally a very abstract topic, but he has a knack for conveying it in an intuitive and natural manner.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Very good professor in Tepper. Global business class is very structured. Lamont knows what he is doing.

Took the non-majors version of his class - You don't need to go to class other than the group project days, just read the textbook as 100% of the midterm material comes from there. He also lets you bring a cheat sheet for the midterms and you can fit everything you need on there. A pretty easy class but you need to put in a little effort.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment:
Took 21112 last spring... the class structure and grading are very clear. 
The grade is mainly just homework and there are no other projects or final exams. 
It is not hard to get an A for this class. However, the lectures are rather boring and he jumps around with different content.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: If math is magic, he is the wizard, the insights and different perspectives he offers in class literally blow your mind. When he does the same problem at different times, he uses totally different approaches, which makes you go wow I didn't know you could go this way! Every word coming out of his mouth is gold and magic, he amazes me every time!
Very nice guy, lectures are fast paced but he gives alternative proofs to textbook theorems which are very helpful. Responds to questions out of class quickly and gives HW hints. Difficult exams.
Tests are obscenely hard, lectures are boring and hard to pay attention in, just not engaging AT ALL
Nice professor. Very helpful course!

His course is just so flawed in every way. Lectures and lecture notes are rambly, disorganized, and full of typos. We wouldn't finishing covering all the material for each weekly homework until a few days before the due date. There were problems with academic integrity that went unaddressed for half the semester. Very unhelpful instructor.
Super sweet and supportive!
Amazing!

He is an extremely chill professor and cares more about teaching and talking about design than homework or grades, which is really nice. However, BE SURE TO GO TO LECTURE, as that is where the majority of your grade lies! Sometimes classes will have field trips to different companies in Pittsburgh, which is pretty cool.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Very passionate guy. Loves design. He understands the fact that most kids would rather be out of class so he keeps his lectures shorter. He's also nice & says "thanks everyone for your time tonight" after every class. For a lecture class, it's about as interesting as possible. The class is engaging because he's passionate in talking
He does not care about this course or the students at all
Unclear about grades
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The lectures were often scattered and material out of date. He was very self promoting. He seemed more interested in the students social lives than in teaching the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: The professor left CMU in 2021, but I was fortunate to take his class a couple of years ago and learn a lot from him. He helped me grow as a researcher and as a person, motivated me when I needed, and I can honestly say taking his class changed my life.
At first, his sarcasm may be off-putting but he means well and he is genuinely interested in helping you. Do the readings for the class and you should be fine.
He is really a very interesting professor. His humor and teaching technique kept me intrigued.
great teacher! very passionate about teaching!
great teacher

Quizzes everyday. His accent is terrible. Also, if you go to his office hours and ask questions, he doesn't actually listen to your question. He just says yes and then repeats what he said in the lecture, which isn't helpful at all for understand the material. Also, theres no textbook or anything, so you can't even study on your own..

This course was okay. Prof Yenmez was a decent professor. The micro material isn't too challenging. He really cares about the subject and that comes through in his teaching style. Seems pretty nice and approachable. Sometimes  a little unclear and his accent can be hard to decipher.
15-251 was my favorite course of all time! Professor Haeupler's enthusiasm and method of explaining things is really incredible. I hope I get another chance to take a course with him!
Solid lecturer. How excited Prof. Haeupler is about the topics he teaches is really adorable. Also I love/hate this class (hate it because it's too hard but love it because it's really interesting).

I took Biology in the summer for the general education requirement, she was really good at breaking things down and explaining it well. She also helped out a lot when we all messed up on the exam, and the final was very similar to previous tests so be sure to study those before the final !!
Shoba is a great teacher. Pay very close attention to her in class. She is also very fair and loves to help students. You'll be glad to have her.

Avoid this professor at all costs if you're on the SV side. Policies are abysmally unclear and communication is almost impossible. He somehow ignores every major content in your emails and picks out the most minute detail to discuss. Prefers saying "this is trivial" rather than explain concepts.

his teaching ability aside, his people skills are abhorrent. A technician was called in to help our class and he treated him like less than a person. the problem ended up being Gligor's own fault(the tech touched two buttons and it worked) and instead of thanking the tech, he insulted him. not a good man to learn from.

Material is largely impractical; readings are dense but actual knowledge derived from them is sparse and easily forgettable; lectures are self-indulgent. Get ready to stuff lots of esoteric philosophical jargon into your head that you'll be prepared to dump the moment the semester ends. Saving grace is that the few graded assignments are easy.
Teaches philosophy like teaching math. Not how philosophy works!

Professor Hahl was awesome. His lectures were not only interesting, but extremely insightful and made students think about the world in a slightly different way.  He assigned a few case briefings, and some were very intriguing.  He was always willing to help students, give feedback, and was open-minded about group ideas. Overall, great professor!

He's willing to work with you, and is knowledgable about the material and clear when teaching it. The exams are easy as long as you look at his slides, and he is very clear about his grading criteria for his essays and the group project.

He covered A LOT of material in class and made it REALLY interesting. There were random quizzes throughout the semester at the beginning. The class was open for discussion and usually got out early. Grading was slow, but pretty fair. The textbook is mostly only necessary if you don't pay attention in class.

Class disappointed although I suppose I learned a lot. Quinque is kind of annoying; he is always telling people to be quiet. It's more distracting than the people talking. Also, nothing is graded in a timely fashion. I am fully expecting an incomplete because the final can't be graded in time. Grades are frequently inaccurate.
Notable subject area expertise and industry insight.
Class is pointless.  His TA was awful.

Rakesh Thapar is one of the worst professors at CMU, Heinz. He never gives clear instructions. Assignments are confusing. And, even though he says attendance isn't required, if you do not attend, he will deduct points. Don't take this class

Do not take his class. He overcomplicates everything, provides too much information and confuses everyone. It's a project management class, which has nothing to do with IT. His assignments are not about project management, more financials. Take the regular project management class instead -- that one is more practical and on point than this class.

Contrary to the previous comment, I found Mr Marcellino's career history irrelevant to the content of the course.  He provided strong arguments on every side of every prompt, and was very helpful and accessible.  His bias was not apparent and he worked hard to maintain objectivity.

Marcellino teaches on democracy, and as a 15 year marine he definitely has strong opinions. He also has a serious attitude problem- He thinks it is fun to insult his students. I would never feel comfortable asking him for help. He also uses his own writing as examples for "how to write correctly" which I think is a bit unprofessional.
He's very unclear in his explanations. His office hours tend to be a bit choppy since he doesn't really answer broad questions. He gets too oriented on details and it makes it hard to learn from him
easy prof.
He is helpful if you go to office hours. He can sometimes stumble over words but overall can communicate organic chemistry in a simple way.
Class is not mandatory, but is helpful for learning the material.  No hmwks, so studying is up to you. Pretty boring, but it's hard to make organic chem 2 interesting.
nice guy.  knew his stuff.
legendary

Course content was boring to start, but it picked up and got super interesting toward the end. This was the MOST content I've ever received in a class. I learned so much, so fast. He's all over the place, but makes sure you know what your doing. He helped me from 9pm one night, for 2 hrs, because he thought my project was interesting. GREAT guy!

Loves what he does! Does WAY too much! Needs to focus more on the class structure- we spent so much time learning how to 3d model, wish we had more time on the equipment! Still, he'll get you excited because HE is excited to teach u!
I get FOMO just not going. Honestly great teacher and relevant lectures.

Literally the best English professor EVER! Very considerate of students and is very helpful. Classes are also extremely easy with minimal work. Kindest professor I've met. 10/10 would recommend taking him.

I concentrated almost entirely on getting a high grade in the class, but still struggled to get an A. I didn't realize before taking the class that almost more than half of the people in the class were PhD students, and the standard of assessment was completely based on the doctoral model of doing research
One of the best professors Ive had at CMU. Really good in class with sarcastic humor. tough but fair grading, people like to complain when they dont do well. You have to work for it.
OK Lecturer. Assessments in this class are horrible. Takes off points for irrelevant mistakes. The grade you get in this class does not reflect your understanding of the material.
She doesn't show up, she doesn't give her time to her students, but she really is a lovely woman.
She's clearly the most knowledgeable of all the MT teachers. If you're looking for the best private instructor, she's obviously the best choice.

Honestly I liked the way he taught. I felt bad when he asked questions in class and nobody answered him... But, he was very understanding everytime I emailed him. Also, the class itself is just time consuming. The homeworks are graded on completion, doing them helps a lot in exams. You'll do great as long as you dedicate time to the class.

He isn't good at explaining and he give us loads of homework that are graded for completion, making the 3 tests in that class extremely important to pass which doesn't give you an opportunity to do good

He explains concepts and proofs super clearly. Plus, he provides tons of sample practice problems before exams, which really helped me prepare. The homework is weekly and graded based on effort, so it's easy to get full credit as long as you try.
Chill Prof who curves generously and I actually learned stuff from his class, even though I already knew the Calc BC content. Better prof at CMU and super chill

Cares about your academic success, but, more importantly, about you. Understanding, reasonable, and fair professor whose class is primarily a ‘if you work extremely hard, you'll succeed' type of class. Go to lecture please—he spits insane knowledge.

Extremely caring professor, and cares more about learning than anything else. Generous with homework drops and curves, while making sure you learn the material. If you work hard, you'll succeed in his class. He gives you a deep appreciation for the topic at hand. Brought his dog to lecture :)
love his dog
Brought his dog to lecture. Great curves.

Dylan is a beacon of light in the School, offering the people skills many communication professors lack. You'll get out what you put into his projects, as he won't force a specific outcome. He's available outside class and goes above and beyond to support students, including helping with personal projects and guiding you through self doubt.
This professor is pretty chill but can be a bit unprofessional, often sharing super personal stuff about their life. Also, they seem kinda lax on the responsibility front.

really made me feel at home in the CEE department, and loved to talk about anything and everything with his students. one of the brightest minds i've ever met and a beloved teacher who is super generous (yet efficient) with his time
Some of the best teaching Ive had at CMU or anywhere. Jerry really changed my perspective on computing and data science. As he constantly says, if ya dont know the error, ya dont know nothin!

Midterms worth too much/don't represent the HMWKs. My 33 142 was dual-taught with HAMISH GORDON, who was the greater evil. In Singh's 1st month, he clearly did not give a damn about the students he taught. After Dr. Gordon's terrible month, we got Singh back. Singh POPPED OFF and started being useful. His office hours are amazing too, makes time.

The final grade is extremely dependent on your midterms. Problem sets in exams are drastically different from those on worksheets and homework sets. Midterms are time-crunched. Formula sheets only cover about 20% of useful formulas. If you stress a lot during exams or have a hard time taking them in general, good luck, you'll definitely need it.
Avoid!
Gives good critique and assigns interesting projects. I already knew Premiere but it seemed like he explained it well for those that had no experience.

One of my least inspiring instructors at Carnegie Mellon. He read PowerPoints verbatim the entire class. The material was interesting, but his lack of energy drained it. I reached out over email to express my enthusiasm for a project we were working on (building a 3D printer) and to no response, which was disappointing and unprofessional.
Terrible teacher. Boring, drab. Waste of a semester, but he was the only teacher for PUI.
Hi

Does a great job putting his own personal stances aside and objectively offering insight and advice - a good studio professor for those who are willing to put in extra work to help develop their own point of view.

Her class rocks! Very clear, organized, easy to follow & understand. I used to dread probability so much, after taking the course I could finally say I nailed probability (at least at the level of 36225).

Abby is a great teacher. Super laid back and really cares about you learning. She will actually get upset if students don't do well on quizzes/tests and curves when it is absolutely needed. She makes a few mistakes on the board here and there but overall she's fantastic.
Great class. You will get to learn a lot in CAD. There is an intermediate level of coding involved. Have fun!!
No Comments
If you are looking for someone to teach you to be hostile and angry, this is your man.
Trumpet Professor...Great!!

Class: Opera Since Wagner. Fallon is very big into teaching students about life skills in research, but he doesn't take the time to truly discuss each opera.  The quizzes are "did you read"-type.  The 10-page paper assignment is fair.  Do not expect any discussion or learning in class. But he does care for students, and is readily available.
Fantastic teacher. Very passionate about what he teaches, is well prepared and very available for office hours, very quick at answering emails.
Excellent professor and very friendly
Very intelligent and good Indian professor.  He knows his stuff and can teach very well; I doubt anyone out there knows as much as he does.  No problem with his accent or understanding his class.
Super amazing.  Discussion based but it's not too bad to skim the reading.  She's really just such a cool person!!!

Very fun teacher and likes discussion. Class usually consists of discussing the reading you did between then and the last class.  Expect to read a lot (6-7 books in the semester). Provides a lot of opportunity for bonus.
Jay is an extremely nice person and a very engaging lecturer. Made required history class fun. Really helpful and kind during office hours. Highly recommend for Global Histories
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Jay is arguably the best History professor I've ever had. Incredibly engaging and personable. Normally, 79-104 is a huge lecture, but this was a special section with only 30 people and it really made a difference. Definitely recommend his British History course or his Culture of London course.
Speaks very monotone during lectures, unclear, practice exams nothing like actual exams. Good luck.

Seems nice, but doesn't seem like a great teacher - sometimes difficult to hear (especially a problem in a big lecture hall, even with a mic) and doesn't explain things well. Read the textbookGoogle stufflook up videosgo to SI or you won't understand material. Posts presentations online. Clicker and warm-up questions required.

He's guaranteed to cram your head with knowledge, and you can tell he puts in a lot of work when making the homework assignments. As you go through then, the techniques used and results found ever so gingerly pushes you to the next question's answer. It's brilliant. He's brilliant.

Prof. Tice put in a lot of effort into teaching vector analysis. He comes in well prepared and explains concepts clearly, prepares thorough lecture notes, and crafts assignments that help us learn. He likes challenging students, and is happy to spend time with you after class (or on Piazza) if you want to discuss interesting tangents.
Fantastic instructor who made the class interesting and engaging.  Human Factors is the best class at CMU.
she's not knowledgeable about the material that she's teaching.Expects us to take her views at face value.

Ayanah's teaching methods are not right for everybody (she likes to lead critiques, which I personally am not a fan of). But all in all she's a great, enthusiastic professor. Don't take her occasional snark personally.
No Comments

Professor Sinopoli is a great professor. He's dedicated and he's receptive. Lectures are great because he takes positive and negative feedback (shoutout to his controls class WHUTTTT) and he will stay extra hours and hold extra office time just to help you  out if you're stuck.
Take his class, you won't regret it.

Professor does an excellent job of breaking down complex concepts. He is very approachable - come to his office hours. If you are still confused he will patiently explain the material in a way that makes sense to you. That being said, you have to come prepared and show you have attempted the work on your own.  One of the best professors at Heinz!
Most terrible professor I have ever met in my life! Try to avoid taking his class if you are not a brown nose!
One of the best teachers you'll ever have. She has a great way of inspiring you to be better and her classes are exciting and creative.

Very organized and clear in her presentation. She's extremely funny and down-to-earth, and always eager to get the students involved. Many extra credit opportunities, exams are very easy and readings are interesting. Mostly importantly, she's sexy as hell.
Really enjoyed the lectures. Pretty tough course, but I like a challenge. Nice to look at too.
Very informative lectures.

Yasuhara is very nice and lenient with late work. In class, we watch anime and discuss it. A paragraph discussion post is due the same day. There are two short essays which are like longer discussion posts and a final presentation and paper about an anime of your choice. Very fun and chill class
He's very nice but can be somewhat awkward. Class is fairly easy and he's lenient with mistakes. He is a native speaker and proficient in English. I recommend him.

Professional Julie is kind and can give feedback but I wouldn't completely suggest taking the course with her. She does give a large chunk of reading the first couple of weeks (30+ pages before each class).The work is not too bad but she does expect far too much for a first year writing class. Most classes are group based and participation required
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Mediocre but nice enough, does give a large chunk of reading the first couple of weeks. Majority of work and class spent in group work, somewhat easy grader. Don't expect to learn much but is friendly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Great prof, loved taking her class, 10/10 would like to have her as a prof again
Lectures do not help with quizzes and there needs to be more relevant practice.

For an intro to marketing class, it's hard and time-consuming. Assignments have little to do with class and you have to spend multiple hours outside of class. He's unreasonable with participation credit and doesn't care to hear what you have to say.
Very cool professor. Looked forward to attending his lectures always!
Class was really just a waste of time. Teacher does nothing.

Jon is a conceptual artist who uses the classroom as a place to make work, which mostly consists of randomly inviting strangers off the street into class to act as guest lecturers in his courses. He invites random people without any planning because his whole practice is spontaneous (I.e. he literally does not know what he is doing). It costs 15k.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Not really a teacher as much as just a person who likes attention. Often late and/or cancelled courses. We didnt use any textbooks or have any real course materials. The class was unbearably disorganized and Rubin clearly didnt care about teaching it. I have never been in such a confusing and content-less class. I have no idea what just happened.

Stated his own biased opinions, saying everything is a "scam" during lectures. Left no feedback for the final report. He states that he "tracks participation" (he doesn't know people's names and doesn't track attendance). So many people's grades went down a letter grade. I don't feel like I learned anything since he won't give feedback.

No immediate connection between lectures and homework. The rubric is always vague, yet the grading can go unpredictably strict. He released extremely tough gradings the last minute before the university deadline while emailing students several days beforehand about his inability to reply to any of the inquiries before the next semester.

I have no idea what to say about this man. He is just a talking textbook. I feel neither hatred nor appreciation for him, and I am sure he has the same to say about me. I will say, though, that the homework solutions are both messy and don't make sense, and his tests do not use practice problems from the homework or recitations.

Absolute worst physics prof ever. and I've taken college physics at other schools. and i'm a physics major, i like physics. I could explain the concepts better. he just spouts the textbook word for word and I haven't shown up to lecture because of it. also puts never-before-covered material on the tests. no recitation or HW problems were on there:(

You cannot go wrong with Tanquary! She has high expectations at times but is super approachable. I asked her for extensions on two or three different assignments and she was more than willing to give them to me.

I loved having Ms. Tanquary as my professor. As long as you pay attention in class and stay up to date with the work, you will do well and have a great time in this class. She is super chill. Her lessons consist of sometimes a short lecture and then a lot of group discussions and group work. She is always there to help you.

the professor made me love coming to the classes! It was unlike any other class I took in my 4 years, it was so interesting! I learned a lot form the professor and the classmates! I really loved the memes too, they were my favorite

All went great! I really liked the class, and got plenty of new things to my backpack of knowledge in terms of psychology and how it works. I think it will give me a great opportunity to manipulate in discussions and take upper side in other situations:)
He gives everyone in the class the same grade, regardless of your personal efforts.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things
