comment: Professor is very entertaining through his condescending humor; however, he plays favorites and there is no real syllabus or final.  The syllabus informs that he grades based upon how he feels about your talent and about your ability.

Most students failed or used a voucher for this lecture. The professor was incoherent and, despite his immense knowledge of mathematics, did not have any teaching ability. He assumes that the students should already know the material, mocking students if they don't know a concept: stroking his own ego by stating that he learned the material faster.

The instructor's explanations were unclear and assumed expert knowledge, and he made no effort to adapt to student needs. He displayed unprofessional behavior, including mocking students, expressing anger, and bragging about his skills. His illegible handwriting and frequent mistakes in examples further hindered learning. Avoid this professor!
Enjoyed the lectures!
Very helpful professor- always willing to look over your work if you have any questions. Exams are easy. Attendance mandatory.

In my years as a student, Professor Markowicz is without a doubt one of the worst teachers I have ever had. Not only was each lecture miserably boring and the material hopelessly dry, but Professor Markowicz is near impossible to work with. Don't expect to get anything from his classes, he is a perfect case study for uselessness.
No clear structure to lectures.  Often wrote notes on board on top of each other or in diagonals.  Very nervous when speaking. Very awkward to communicate with.
No Comments

The man derives equations which grow exponentially in size on the board very very fast. I swear he's gonna run out of greek letters soon, and his notation is VERY cumbersome. The TA's are more helpful BY FAR. I've taken up to calc 3, linear algebra, calc based physics, all with A's... but this? This is something else. The book is his, it's bad too.
Not very good prof., avoid if possible
good

Awesome professor. Very enthusiastic every day. He goes to great lengths to make sure even H&SS kids have understanding of practical physics. I'd highly recommend taking a class with him--particularly Physics for Future Presidents. Very easy and fun.

Teaches Physics for future presidents with another teacher. He's the better of the two and a cool guy. Very interesting class and recommended to those who do not need a real physics class as a requirement. VERY easy B and with some effort, an A is not too hard to get (only need an 85). Besides that, not much work and the class is interesting.

Professor Siegler's Educational Research class was one of the most well put together classes I've taken. He was a great discussion facilitator and had students lead discussions, making retaining information easier while allowing us students to showcase our knowledge from the readings and work together as a class to learn.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Unfortunately, Dr. Siegler is not a very interesting lecturer or person.  His arrogance is transparent and a real turn off to many students.   Dr. Siegler makes a fascinating topic into something rote, self-promoting and dull.  I got an "A" but it wasn't worth the boredom.

Josh was a great professor. Very caring about students, and interested in the subject. I really loved having a draft paper due before the final. You get to hear his thoughts, and take another meaningful look at your paper before submitting. You might worry about getting an A, but as long as you put in meaningful work, you shouldn't have a problem.
I had him for Interp and he put lots of care into each student, but in terms of grades, you may have to work harder for the A. Easy B for essays but hard A.

Among the most useful and best-taught courses i have ever had. Two years after i haven taken the class, i am still going back to his notes to look up material. Also, he is very friendly. Too bad he left CMU.
No Comments

Cares about students- after I did poorly on my first exam he helped me build my way back up again. He's super charismatic and I actually enjoyed his class a lot. Homework and exam heavy but doable if you keep up with textbook and lectures
He knows his stuff but he doesnt really jump in to help. you need to ask for it even if its just to say "what the heck is going on"

Mr. Reddig really cares for his students and wants the best for them. He loves Econ (and his cat) too much, but it makes the students more entertained in class! I would definitely take his course again. Overall great guy! :)
He was really helpful in his office hours. He would spend as much time as necessary during this time to help clarify the topics we would learn in class. He also is nice to look at during class ;)
Hes so great and respekxted
I love Lenny. He's an inspiration and a very loving individual.

Stuart is condescending and lacks both empathy and self awareness. For the final day of class, he stretched an hour long activity out to a 12 hour day, with no regard for international students who had to reschedule their >$1k flights. His interactions with students are built on an assumption of doubt in their skill and character.
Very condescending. Focuses too much on his own work, and doesn't teach how to apply future studies into design process. Treats class like they are all 5th graders. Lack of respect.
A master of the field--yet so young! How does he do it??
He's amazing!
Excellent prof
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: great Prof
Many professors in this university are described as "nice" and "caring", but this man is truly THE ONE.

He is probably the smartest person I have ever met and at the same time he is super nice and humble. He has an amazing ability to explain complicated algorithms and topics in a very simple way. Also he loves solving problems: for our final project we went to him a few times for advice and he just sat with us for hours trying to solve the problem.
Best professor so far

This guy is the goat. I took emerging markets with him on zoom because covid and usually I dont pay attention in class. This guy was very engaging and entertaining and made you want to participate in his class. Homeworks are a little bit tedious but he gives you the help you need. 10/10

He is super understanding and wants to help and support you even if you're doing really badly. I took a class with him a few years ago during a really hard time in my life and he did his best to work with me. He tries to set up the class with as much support as possible, both from him and also from classmates.

Professor Branson is an angel from heaven itself. He was an amazing lecturer and took the time to learn his student's names without even talking to them first. He also really listened to student feedback and incorporated it into his teaching. A real gem.
Professor Ytsma is great! She clearly explains the content. If you show up to lecture and do the homework, it is a relatively easy class!

Professor Ytsma is amazing, if you have the chance, take her class!! I took Intro to Accounting and you can tell she is extremely intelligent and knowledgeable - its no wonder she is on the world economic forum! She is always there to help, accommodate, and reteach if needed.

Professor does not understand fundamental concepts of the course, making it impossible for her to effectively teach. The structure of the course is ridiculous, with homework and projects due before the content is taught. Professor is basically unreachable outside of lecture, and displays an apparent lack of interest in the education of her students

Professor Wayne is a decent lecturer but sometimes gets confused with her notes which makes the material a little hard to follow. However, she is so great so I highly recommend taking her. Had a homework assignment every single week regardless of exams. The exams were the same difficulty as the homework
Unreasonable grading, heavy and meaningless workload, little knowledge.
This professor possesses questionable competency, little knowledge in subject matter, and offer a hellish amount of repetitive homework. In addition, it's a core course for data analytics program.

Professor Ryan is a great lecturer. Attendance is mandatory but going to class would be worth it regardless. The class is a lot of work and can be difficult if you don't have a good grasp of all the topics. She can also be a little blunt when it comes to answering questions, but she's generally pretty nice.

She is reachable outside of class time, the only thing is she can come off as rude sometimes or very cold/short. The lectures are really good, and the concepts are explained very clearly. The syllabus is extremely easy to navigate, and there are no surprises when it comes to her.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: not very meaningful class
Attendance matters
Interesting lectures
You can never imagine the grade until it comes out
The grading rubric is not clear. Grade received was far lower than expected.
Life changing experience!
Big Latino-phile with good sources and an interesting narrative. Tends to hark on anthropological details more often than not.

This class is good, but I'm thankful Prof Anderson isn't the only professor. She is very confusing and doesn't explain herself well. She is rather harsh and doesn't seem to care about the students. She is willing to answer questions.

She's OK. The only trouble I have with her is that she can seem a bit whimsical every now and then. Her class is not difficult and she structures the material based on a rubric she hands out at the beginning of the semester.
I heard he's in a really good band

Literally the worst professor I have ever had. Fanatical social justice warrior, accusatory, disrespectful, and harsh. She derails conversations to fit her agenda, rarely provides any constructive information, and has made students in class cry numerous times because she just keeps shouting completely inaccurate things at us during critiques.
Not clearly explanation
I was a little intimidated by oil painting at first, but she finds a great balance between teaching basic techniques and encouraging one's own personal style.
Does not explain concepts well! Lecture notes pdfs are useful (not written by him)

I had him for two semesters of German, and not only was he a delightful person and an excellent teacher, but he has since become a friend.  He is compassionate, kind, dedicated, and fair.  He is a good professor and a good man.

Was unable to give feedback / grades on assignments until last week of class - very frustrating. Course content / assignments changed and was confusing to plan ahead for. Focused a ton of course project (felt like >50% of time, yet it's only 30% of final grade). However she's very approachable and understanding, and responds to emails quickly.

He's clearly brilliant, and generally tries to be helpful and approachable, despite his busy schedule. However, he tends to be a bit disorganized and scatterbrained. Subject matter is interesting, especially given his expertise. Definitely one of the smartest profs the dept. has to offer, and seems like a nice person, too.  I would recommend him.

I studied with Mr. Forough at summit music Festival. Gave me a lot of great tips and insights to improve my playing and also said some encouraging things that really motivated me and improved my confidence.

Had Principles of Economics (73-100) with her. She's not a bad professor, but not exactly the best either. She explains concepts well, but doesn't usually answer students' questions accurately. But if you attend lectures and recitations, the class is not too bad.
Dr. Ruth was incredibly kind and worked really hard to make classes interesting.

As a person she's very nice and approachable, super eager to teach astronomy and help her students succeed and learn about the stars. As a teacher, she's not that good. Me and many other students learned most things from the textbook. An easy pass as long as you study a little and keep up with the video game and labs. Really lenient grader.

Professor Phillips makes a seemingly boring class very interesting and compelling. I spent hours on papers that he had roasted once or twice, but I almost didn't mind because it was an honor to be taught by him. He teaches in a way that forces you to be engaged and participate, which can be demanding, but he is fair and you will learn.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Not a real course, nothing useful to learn and no content.

Her lectures are pretty boring. Just rehashes what is in the textbook, so you can skip class if you read the textbook or look at the lecture slides she posts. Monday nights the reading quiz is due. On Friday night, the homework where you correct your mistakes (for full credit) on the quiz is due. Straightforward class. 3 midterms and a final.

She grades homework easily (basically for completion). She talks a lot in class and will call on people for discussion. You have 2 excused absences for any reason, and after that, you start getting penalized. There is quite a bit of reading, but not too much. She is overall a great person and easy prof
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof. Chen is one of the best professors I've had at CMU. I really appreciate her dedication towards teaching and efforts in helping the students. She is very approachable and very knowledgeable. She always wants to bring the best learning opportunity for us. The learning experience is very enjoyable and really helpful for my job interviews!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: McHenry is the worst prof I've ever had. He maintained a policy of not taking questions during class, went over time, flew through dense/abstract material, all compounded by a speech impediment. He'll casually fail you on an exam without solutions to study, won't discuss point allocation or express any interest in helping you learn the material...
He's a really understanding teacher and gives really generous curves to the exams. Quizzes are straightforward and simple.

I have taken a lot of CS courses at CMU. I can say full-heartedly that Nathan Beckmann is one of the best professors I have ever had. His lectures are god-tier, crystal clear, a lot of industry-related and research-related insights. he answers every single question during lecture, giving on-point answers with wisdom and insider perspective.
Really nice and really caring, I like her a lot. Participation is super important to her though, so no phones. And she will yell at you if you have one out.

Very nice guy, took his class on zoom during covid and it was pretty much no work. Homework was very short, only reading an article and writing a page about it, and the essays were fun on interesting topics.
Professor Block owns the school of drama. I love him. He is such a kind soul and a great teacher. He knows what he is talking about and won't let you down.
A lifechanging experience.

My favorite Professor this semester! Charismatic and enthusiastic every day. Nice chats and plenty of high-fives during classes. He's new, only started at CMU in the 2021-2022 academic year. He was head of the writing department in Arizona and has plenty of experience. Great guy, hope to see him get tenure soon at CMU!
Nice and approachable, Professor R-M is an excellent teacher and I thoroughly enjoyed his class despite being a stem major. Excellent class with an excellent teacher
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She is a wonderful professor who helped me greatly. Although I didn't do very well ( it was a hard class for me) she still understood that I was improving and would try to help my grade the best she could.

Method of teaching was bad, very little interaction with the students and he didn't engage me enough to want to do well in his class. It's a good thing it was easy to do well in his class.
Also, homework assignments were graded late so it was borderline impossible to get feedback or clarity on my mistakes.

She's okay. Her teaching style can be quite unclear at points. She also doesn't post lecture notes, so beware of that. Also, sometimes homework will unfortunately cover material that hasn't been covered yet in class, but you should be able to teach yourself through the textbook. Group projects are quite reasonable.

I found the classes very uninteresting, I did not enjoy doing the Final Project which I thought was impossibly hard to do after how 'motivating' her classes were. She's a nice teacher but not a good teacher i guess :/

Prof. Li was a lovely instructor! He made all of us feel comfortable speaking up in class and we could see his passion for the environmental humanities come through in his thoughtful preparation for class. In addition to teaching us the course material, he also was intentional about helping us write better and read with more efficiency. Amazing!

I met him as he taught 12-100 for the first time. Lectures may be dry but Dr. Harper is energetic, caring, and helpful in conversation. He ensures that everyone understands what he's teaching and geniunely wants to better his students. He improved the course itself by working w/other professors, and grad students talked about research every friday.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: A funny great person but a bad lecturer. Lectures did not prepare us for exams, people self-taught and would stop showing up to lectures because he goes on side tangents and doesn't teach. Lecture and lab felt like two separate classes. He would make himself accessible outside of class though and offer Zoom office hours even when he was home.

I think he used to do essays instead of tests, but now (Spring 2022) he does weekly quizzes based on the readings. Although there is a good bit of mandatory reading, the readings are interesting. He is a tough quiz grader, so give details and examples. He gives the questions to the quizzes the day before the quiz, so study your response very well.

This is only for CMU/WSP. He is very kind and you can tell he cares about every one of his students. Disclaimer: his emails can sound passive aggressive at times but I don't think he means it in that way. Make sure you check canvas announcements, as sometimes he uses that over email for important announcements. Not hard at all to get an A.
Great Professor
She is a tough grader and is not lenient at all, but she explains course material very well. This class (21102) has very interesting topics and I would recommend it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Homework questions are absurdly long and esoteric—you need to read his mind to get credit—coming from someone with 6 years of R and statistics experience. He's the type to tell you it was very clear if you say it was unclear. Gets upset when no questions are asked, then treats questions as dumb. Seems to be trying to prove himself since he's new.

Hands down one of the best teachers ever. Very knowledgeable, experienced yet humble. Very accommodating, uses all the right tools for teaching. Exams are structured well, with hints and no time pressure.

Lectures are fun, always interested in entertaining new ideas, methods and hypothetical questions. Amazing guy, feels like an elder brother!

Apparently a doctoral student. I took both Elementary Japanese I and II with him. The difficulty of the class mostly has to do with the level of work (there's homework every day there's class - 4 days a week). He is enthusiastic and tries to be helpful. (He's also a native speaker, which is good for learning, but can make understanding difficult).

I had him for my freshman seminar, Voting Theory (I still have no idea how I ended up in it). Attendance is not required, and there is literally no work at all besides the final paper. (Even then, I could have passed without handing it in, apparently. Weird.) He's very relaxed and friendly. I enjoyed the class.

Very knowledgeable regarding international relations (she was the former Assistant Secretary of State for African Affairs, after all - she has a wiki page). Explains things well. Attendance for Diplomacy and Statecraft is not mandatory as far as I can tell. There are quite a few readings for the class. It's worth taking as an Int'l Relations major.
Classes can be pretty tedious.  The essays are generally pretty easy, but her multiple-choice exams can be tough/confusing.  A lot of the teaching was confusing or felt unstructured.
Schult is a cool dude but a hard grader. his class overall is fun and he is fair.
THE worst. Completely useless. The department is getting better and he is the definition of dead wood. I hope he leaves. Full of himself, too! And he has no real professional cred.
The best course and prof at CMU. I had taken 15410. But 15418 is the class I enjoyed the most. Thanks Kayvon
French professor, a little trouble with accent.  He knew his material, but couldn't teach it.  Taught French/European statistics to American students.

She was teaching an experimental strategy course.  Very useful and interesting course where you play strategy games.  Her lecture style was a little boring, but the in class exercises were great and helpful.  No problem with her accent.

I would not recommend taking any course with Rich Caralli. He accepted another position and completely neglected his responsibilities as a CMU faculty member. He fell short of expectations expectations as a CMU professor and there really is no recourse or accountability for performance here so I see little chance for change.
Mediocre lecturer, with little interest in students' improvement and wellness
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Cares about everybody in the class on a personal level, which is ridiculously impressive, and will continue giving you advice after you complete her course.
Great class. Great friend
A little spacey, but very nice.  She takes her class very seriously.
He doesn't know the subject too well himeslf. It's a shame we had to be taught by him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Not an excellent lecturer but very responsible.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great class. I'm waiting for him to teach something else so I can spend and elective on it. Made really abstract ideas super easy to understand, and everything was always useful. He's really funny, really interesting personality. Plus he's nice to look at.
He's typical of the software eng. dept at CMU. I regret the day I signed up for this course.
Professor Owen was a kind and caring professor. Her lectures were insightful and we learnt a lot from her.
A very renowned theoretical computer scientist and while he makes his class difficult, he's very good at teaching and explaining the topics he covers.

He's a nice guy, but a terrible professor. He jumps all over the place, his slides are hard to read, and his exams are so poorly worded that you have guess what he's trying to ask you to do. He's also not very good at responding to emails, so good luck if you have any questions.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Haggag is great. As a professor, he is very kind, approachable and caring. The class was interesting as well. Would take him again if given the chance
He's a sweetheart. Really excited about the class and about the students. Has an odd interpretation of some of the literature we read, in my opinion.

Prof Adams is one of the best there is at CMU. A great professor and wonderful leader. He really made the material tangible. I needed some accommodation the semester I took Prof Adams' class and he was very understanding.
She made class very enjoyable. I felt as though I got something out of her class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: His lectures are literally his slides which is helpful. There is *so* much reading. When I took it, the quizzes and tests were virtual but he may have changed it. Very hard tests if you don't have resources in front of you during the test. Although the tests are mainly on the textbooks, there is just so much reading that it is difficult.

Very kind professor. He gives you a pdf to the textbook so no need to buy it. Offers some extensions. His classes are great econ classes for non-Econ majors and his lessons are very applicable to the modern day (not annoying theoretical stuff)

This is a seminar class, so he brings in a speaker every week and you write a (very) short paper about the topics. He has a very interesting career, he is a kind and caring person, and understands the college experience. For example, he removed the requirement to do a paper that was due right after carnival, so we didn't have to do it.

If u enjoy being given 5 days to read sometimes 400 pages of readings, this class is for u. But, if u are normal, I highly discourage this professor. It is almost like this class is made for a student only taking his class rather than a student with a full course load. If you are looking for an easier mini or chiller politics class, this is not it

This is not a hard class. A lot of MITS and grad students take it to throw in an easier but still relevant class into their course load. There are 3 exams, a paper, and a big group project. Classes are lectures with some guest speakers and she typically makes discussion groups for the assigned readings during class. Most people got an A.

There is a textbook but there is a free PDF online. There are a lot of things that she grades which is good since no single assignment can ruin your grade. It's a bearable class but she is tough particularly on the memos, so watch out for that. You can also get up to 2% of extra credit just for attending a lecture series and writing a summary.
I liked Chad. Told us in the beginning that as long as we completed all the assignments and put in the work, that we would get an A. His coursework is also very manageable

Professor Haan really cares about all of us and you can clearly see his passion for the subject. The simulations we did were extremely educational and fun, and the cases related well to the concepts he talked about. He tried to give us a lot of feedback and listened to us when we provided feedback. One of the best professors I have had at CMU.
best prof

Very nice and understanding. She does use textbook but if you pay attention to lecture you really don't need it. She doesn't post powerpoints and the entire class is looking at the pictures so I just would search the photographer and as she spoke found each photo and put in a Google doc. 2 essays (short) and two tests (memorize), one group project

It is my 3rd year at Boulder and Dr. Shanmugaraj is by far the best professor I have ever had. She is extremely passionate about her work and very educated. She gives clear and thoughtful feedback on our work and ensures all expectations for our assignments are clear. She deeply cares about her students, I HIGHLY recommend taking her class.

Focuses too much on class participation and pre-class readings. The course in general is not difficult but the additional aspects of the course make it difficult to score in the class. Class participation holds a good weightage in the final grades
An A should start at a 90
Very organized lectures and great subject matter!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Accessible outside class

comment: I enjoyed my semester with Parker, he is very passionate about the subject and is caring. Overall the work can be very heavy and complex but he does an amazing job breaking things down. His midterm and finals were one of my favorites as we had the opportunity to write about something we were interested in. 100% would recommend his course
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Great lecturer and extremely knowledgeable. Biology in general is heavy on memorizing facts. AP Biology experience will be slightly helpful but most of it was still new to me. Homework is not too bad. It calls for a textbook but you really don't need it. Anything you need to know is either in lecture notes or can be found on the internet.

Professor Alison is excellent, reasonable, and helpful. He also cares about the material and does a good job making sure we know why it is important. Would absolutely take another course taught by Professor Alison. He is regularly available outside of class to help clear up any issues in understanding.

worst professor in the world. She teaches the most pointless class.DON'T TAKE HER CLASS she doesn't believe in giving A's and honestly her class is the biggest bs class i have ever taken and i got a c in it... it does not make any sense.

Great professor. Very helpful when you have difficulties and also very knowledgeable. However, getting an A is impossible. If you do average you get a C. If you work really really hard you get a B. This is my only complaint. College students also need encouragement sometimes, y'know... Would be great if everyone is moved half a grade up.
He's attractive.
Homework, lectures, and exams are all straightforward. He and his TA's are always willing to help, and work with you if you need to move an exam for some reason.
Gentle and funny. Sometimes doesn't understand how native English speakers' brains work, but usually great :)

Becky is an awesome woman and just recently received her PhD from Carnegie Mellon. She's helped me through some rough patches this semester and I would definitely be interested in taking another class she teaches. Philosophy itself is rather challenging if you've never had exposure (mainly papers) but she makes it engaging and manageable.

Really cares about his students and will do anything to help you succeed. He also is a really fun guy to just talk to outside of class. After finishing 15-150 with him, I applied to the HCII and he wrote me a recommendation letter and sent it in without me even asking it of him.
amazing woman and great class that makes you think and work hard (:
Lacking basic computer skills, unclear as to deadlines and expectations and unwilling to evaluate arguments that disagree with her own. An utterly abysmal professor.

Very interested in class. However, assumes that you have a thorough background in Spanish grammar and grades essays and written assignments pretty hard. Also, assigns quite a bit of reading and checks that you did it.

This class is pretty easy and enjoyable. He gets the students involved, and consistently has us read aloud. It's very helpful for pronunciation and understanding, and I've definitely learned a lot more Chinese than I thought I would.

I was honestly taking her class to fulfill a gen-ed requirement, but found to my surprise that grammar is pretty interesting stuff, mostly I think because Ms. Commer did a really good job teaching it.  I learned a lot and got a decent grade without trying to hard.  Definitely worth taking.
Is really interesting. fun to listen to. very enthusiastic

I found her lectures to be very refreshing. She doesn't like to plug and chug, she's more into taking it slow and just writing out a complete set of notes. There is a very even rhythm to her sliding the chalk against the blackboard, and she is almost computer-like... but in a good way. recommend taking 210 with maggie
Awesome professor. Very knowledgable and fun to have.
Do not miss him if he is teaching 36225. Grading is very generous. Handwriting is a disaster.

Professor Hagan is my favorite professor at CMU. She puts in a lot of effort to experiment different ways that her classes are conducted to ensure that they appeal to her students and help with their learning. Additionally, she is the one of the most caring teachers you will ever have (she previously also won the best teaching award in CMU).

Art and Arduino was a great course! Sidney made the class very fun and interesting, and was always available to help students get parts and figure out how to program them to work. Very optimistic, and even defended my project to an extent when other students gave mostly negative feedback during critique.
Exams are easy, homework and attendance not required. Gives practice exam that prepares you quite well for actual exams. Do homeworks and the practice and you're set.

Great Guy. Has a solid understanding of the subject matter. Teaches really well. Easy on exams and grading. Makes great efforts to explain subject matters as clearly and enjoyable as possible and succeeds in doing so. You will definitely love his course.
I took my first business class with him and I had a great experience. He was very helpful all the time.
Be sure to read the textbook if you want to have a chance on the exams. Very difficult for a GE course.

She is a wonderful teacher; really knows her subject.  Her teaching is very clear and her class is well-structured.  Lots of reading and the essay prompts are really, really hard.  Since she knows her subject so well, there is no bs-ing the essays at ALL.

Great professor. Her lectures are clear and informative. Covers much of the same material as AP Physics C: Mechanics, but with more formality, although you will learn about basic quantum and thermal physics. Don't need to do anything super intense for your semester project to get an A. Programming assignments can be frustrating/unclear at times.
Dr. Parno is awesome. Her lectures are funny and engaging, and she is very accessible outside of the classroom. She is also very kind and willing to help. 10/10 professor.
Sometimes questions are ambiguous and hard to understand on problem sets and other assignments.
High expectations for student's effort; was always professional with me.
He is clearly very knowledgeable on the course material and has no problem answering questions. Overall an excellent instructor. Content can be a little bit deadpan at times.

What an amazing professor. I've never been so excited to attend and participate in class. Sunkee is always bringing in enthusiasm and energy to empathize with his students. He looks out for students' wellbeing and also knows when to be strict when students are not performing as they should. He deserves teacher of the year award!!

The class was not too hard, you're grade will be based heavily on the weekly discussion board and weekly reading journal you have to do. If you do well on those and pay attention to the concepts, you honestly should be fine. Also missing a lot of classes will have a huge impact on your grade and even being late so don't miss class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Do you want to take a class that has an FCE of 23 hrs/week but is only worth 12 units? No? Well tough luck; you need it for any Robotics Institute program. You spend as much time on lectures, homeworks, and exams as you would for any other class, and then you still have to do the group labs on top of it all.

50% of your grade is 6 quizzes and 50% is a final exam. What a lazy approach to teaching. Less for her to grade and higher risk for you. You have to prey that emailing her TA will get you a couple more points. Her modules can be hours of her talking but not getting to the point. She is a smart person but a terrible teacher.

The worst professor I have ever had in my education career. Her pedagogy is ineffective because it is not open to the student's approach to practice. The grading policy discourages the self-development of students. In particular, students should not make mistakes. Because if you make a mistake, most of your accumulated grade points will be lost.
His lecture is so heavy. He gave so few exercise examples in class. Most of the quizzes and exams are hard and really tricky.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Professor Lambright's teaching strategy is fabulous and unrivaled. She teaches by demonstrating concepts first: students are challenged to engage with readings and media using their own thinking. After they come to class, lecture serves to clarify and elaborate upon the subject at hand. Class discussion is lively and thought-provoking. Brilliant.
Terrible professor - absolutely terrible teaching style. Avoid if you can.

Lectures were unorganized and confusing and handwriting was difficult to read. Office hours were also unhelpful. Learned the same content later in a different class and was surprised at how much better I understood. Avoid at all costs
Incredibly nice. Would strongly recommend taking her class if you have interest in the machine learning and/or its applications to business.

Lectures are memorable. HWs were challenging, but doable. Exams were very difficult, but curves usually happen. Attend all TA office hours and you will do perfectly fine in the class. Prof Christin is very caring and friendly as well as very knowledgeable in this area. If you are a crypto/web3 enthusiast, I highly recommend taking this class!

Dr. McCartney is probably an expert in her field but she is an awful teacher. If you take her course prepare to essentially teach yourself. 

You'll be overwhelmed. The material covered in one semester in her class is what other universities cover in two.

Her classes are geared to only the most prepared students. If you're not, you're out of luck.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Great class! The reading can be a lot sometimes but just make sure to dedicate to it. All you have to do is read and participate in discussions to be successful in that class :). There are few writing assignments and no major papers. The literary trial assignment is basically writing a courtroom script, which was kinda tough at first but very fun.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Mitchell is "super groovy"
It was an easy A and a nice break from my other classes. She's really nice and approachable too.
Awesome prof! he is very helpful  in his office hours and very kind. Take very good notes in class and ask a ton of questions. he is a great teacher.

Intro to Japanese Language and Culture is a lot more work with Taguchi than with Litt. Assignments every few classes, a few essays throughout the semester, etc. Attendance is required. In general, if you can, take it with Litt.

Jason gives stellar feedback, and is truly able to offer guidance by seeing the big picture when working on a project.  He's a super busy professor though, which means his availability is sometimes limited making it tough to get feedback on course work. You definitely have to seek him out at times, but when you do, he's more than willing to help.

Nice professor, interesting projects, fair grading with useful comments, cool guest speakers.  Discusses interesting relevant subjects but doesn't incite much class discussion unfortunately :(  Cardboard bridge project was fun but pretty hard, tall+narrow+vertically oriented beams are key.
Robert provided the best educational experience ever. I now have a burgeoning interest in 9/11 studies.
Good

He is an amazing professor. Extremely well experienced and can name various references to your projects at the drop of a hat. He will be equally passionate about your project if you are. Show up, talk, and pay attention to his lectures. I have seen very few professors with dedication as much as him.
Super easy class and fun, as long as you don't worry about how you look and just let loose. Teacher is really chill and a nice person.

Lance is a phenomenal teacher, musician, comedian, and mentor. If you ever have the opportunity to take a class or lessons with him or even just meet with him, take it! He cares so much about his students and does a great job tailoring his teaching to each person, pushing you towards goals and helping you get there, whatever it takes. He's the best
Not very good at answering questions, doesn't provide any study material for tests, lectures are sometimes hard to follow

Flashcards are really helpful for exams. Homeworks are pretty rough, but the TAs at office hours are great. Dr. Abbott genuinely cares about her students, and overall is just great. She also makes it so the person who does the best on exams is able to get out of the final.

Dr. Jacobson is absolutely a gem of a professor. It was absolutely an honor to have taken a class with such a professor who cares about his students as much as he cares about teaching from his heart. He is always there for you, even on weekends, and always makes the class fun and interesting. Hands down one of the best professors out there.
Prof Q is an extremely kind professor. Her lectures are interesting and keep students engaged.
Professor Herckis is extremely kind and approachable to all students. She prepares her lectures really well.
Paul is an amazing professor. Gave really good insights and amazing feedback. He can be a little harsh at times but he really cares about student learning.

Geoff Kaufman is hands down, by far, the most amazing professor I've ever had. He is so accommodating, kind, and truly cares about his students. His lectures and slides are extremely informative and very relevant to the exams. Just do the work and you will be fine. I encourage everyone to take a class with Geoff!

Anne is an awesome lecturer. She answers any questions you have and is very respectful (she once stayed back after lecture for nearly 40 minutes answering questions and explaining advanced topics). While the course is very difficult, she does a phenomenal job of making the concepts easier to understand.
Enthralling

Her homework and tests were very well balanced and she was clear and concise during lecture. When she sees that the class is struggling with due dates she often accommodates. The final exam was tougher than the rest of her exams, but she gave a generous curve. I felt that she cared a lot about the course content and her students. Awesome prof!
Good professor.

Susan is very caring and clearly respects and cherishes her students. However, she is not the most organized or clear in describing her assignments and their criteria. Part of this is to force you to make creative decisions, but it is often quite frustrating.

Professor Jarbo's lectures are always very engaging and interesting. He is very fair and the class should be easy if you keep up with the readings and do your weekly reflections in a timely manner. Both him and Dr. Manke-Miller are super understanding and accessible, and their class is amazing. Hope to take another class with them sometime.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: I literally made an account to add a professor so I could review Bergbreiter. Part of it was that I loved DSC so very much because it let me sit squarely in-between MechE and ECE. Part of it was simply because Bergbreiter was a lovely lecturer to the point where I've googled what else she teaches. In summary, I would die for Bergbreiter's DSC.

She is one of the best professor I've had at Carnegie, she loves what she does and cares about the students she teaches. Is always willing to stay after and give any feedback if you ask for it, and overall a really kind hearted teacher.

Ali was unprofessional and uncaring in his teaching. He violated numerous university policies (Title IX) and was terminated from his position for his hostile and abusive treatment to his students. Incapable of teaching and only in it for the prestige.
Great professor!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: No Comments

SUCH AN AMAZING TEACHER. She's so sweet and nice, and although her workload is on the heavier side, she's a very very fair grader and one of the best teachers at CMU. More professors need to have her type of teaching style - highly HIGHLY recommend her. She's all around AMAZING.
You will learn about planes crashing pretty much every class in Human Factors.
horrible teacher, didn't help at all and wasn't able to understand him half the time. would never take a class by him again
Probably the easiest Chinese teacher, but she sometimes forgets to remind you about homework being due, so always check the sylabus.
Informed about the art world and is good at getting her students interested and involved as well. Awesome teacher
This guy is a walking encyclopedia. The best piano literature professor I ever had. Very demanding, though.

Mitchell is a really cool guy he  is chill but he is a really harsh grader unfortunately. He is really picky about word choice and works cited. He picks about your essays so its hard to get a good grade unless your writing is phenomenal. Must attend class and participate too, he is like so anal about contributing to class.

Ambrose is an incredible professor. If she's offering any courses, take one! She truly cares so much about her students. I feel like I have really gained a great deal of knowledge from her FS on Mexican Immigration. Awesome lady! She does admin, so doesn't always teach. When she does though, your class has her full attention.
She speaks very quickly and that's all she does .

Barnabas is a terrible teacher. He is completely disorganized, cannot communicate effectively, does not know how to speak publicly, is completely clueless about the course assignments (his office hours are worthless), and worst of all, he does not even care that he's an abysmal teacher! His the classic case of a prof. who only cares about research.
really understandable. really reasonable. sweet, genuine person.
Very good Indian marketing professor.  Very clear, no problem with accent.  Great examples of commercials.  Learned alot in his class.

Class is pretty laid back. If you go and pay attention its an easy A. Problem is no one goes. Friday rec. is completely worthless. Do good on all the HW and decent on the tests for an A-B. She writes all X's as N's which gets annoying, but she is a good teacher and easy to understand if you pay attention. Posts slides from class online
Very little homework. Class consisted of mostly discussion.
Stacie is really sweet, but she and her partner, Steve Stadelmeier, create quite a dichotomy.
Not particularly engaging in lecture, but wants you to succeed and highly encourages you to seek him out. will take as much time needed to make sure his students completely understand Chemistry!

Excellent professor! Course is taught for people with beginner level experience and towards the end if you study right you will become intermediate to advanced level in DS & Algorithms. Course is very useful even 10 years into your professional career. (Save notes) Must take this course, if you want to move/continue in Computer Science field.
Clearly there is a reason she is an assistant professor. Her lack of teaching skills are apparent. Follow the syllabus and you will pass.

I don't know if I've ever had such a dedicated instructor.  She put tremendous effort into the class, was extremely helpful and encouraging, and is highly intelligent.  I'd definitely take another class from her.

Questionable lecturer, but great at answering questions. She kinda just proves things on the board the whole hour. Half the class skips lecture, and it seems the people who skip and read the book do better in the class than those that go to lecture. Also, her exams are not that hard. They are tricky, but not difficult. The TA teaches everything.
Real nice guy that knows he's teaching an easy A class
Very nice, friendly teacher. Never talks down to students. Course material is simple to understand.
Good lecture. Can go a little slower.

Highly recommend this teacher. Steve made DigFab very interesting, and I learned a lot of new skills in Rhino, as well as CNC and Laser Cutter. Highly accessible outside of class, and is always trying to make sure students do well. Lectures could get a bit boring, but that's just how art lectures are.

Ninomiya-sensei was an amazing teacher! She made Japanese fun and easy to learn especially if you have not had any experience with it before. By the end of the semester, my class was able to fluently read hiragana, katakana, and some kanji, and comfortably have a conversation with a Japanese person. Highly recommend!

Horrible. He makes up his own library for his probability class and it is genuinely an awful, mind-numbing way to learn. It's convoluted, difficult to use, and seemed like it hardly related to concrete probability concepts. I got nothing of value out of his class, only lost time I will never get back.

Will is a great guy, super passionate about all things entrepreneurship. LOVES to tell stories, much chiller than probably any professor you've had at CMU. Group project oriented, for sure. Plays good cop, but is secretly bad cop if you ask him for brutal advice. Would recommend - Highly

Professor Gillette is very poor with communicating with his students and makes his assignments due midnight the day before class, which is inconvenient and harder for his students. Also, he adds large assignments out of nowhere that are worth as many points as small assignments.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Good

Super kind! She'll give you extensions if you ask nicely. Her notes are very neat, but the class tends to be a bit slow and boring. You do 4 labs in a group and do lab reports for each. Exams are open note, but can get tricky still. The MATLAB assignments are easy if you pay attention in recitation, but aren't impossible if you don't. Solid choice
Worst Professor Ever. Literally playing a guessing game for what she wants. Instructions were never clear.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: My least fond memories of CMU. Glad he's long gone.
Very mean, should be avoided.
Not too much work. Mainly a discussion based class with two papers and a final project. As long as you put in some effort and attend class, you will do well and most likely enjoy it.

Mrs. Gelman is the best Piano teacher in the world. Perfectionist  & thorough. May be demanding at times, but awesome! Not for light hobbyists though...if you take music seriously and want to become a concert pianist one day, Mrs. Gelman is the best.

Super engaging professor, and even though my class was her first-ever class she's taught, we all thought she had years of experience. Incredibly helpful and caring, and extensive OH/help sessions make the course amazing.
Very good professor
Tough class but really good lecturer. Very fair class.

Professor DeYoung was one of my favorite professors this past semester. He really knows his stuff and is always there to help if you're feeling overwhelmed. He's also super accommodating for letting students pursue their personal goals within the course. Take this class if you love animation or if you even just want to try it out.

It is not too hard to get an A in the class. Lectures felt really light and comprehensible. The first midterm was kinda difficult but each subsequent one got a lot easier. Her office hours are super helpful and she is really easy to reach.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: There was no textbook but we had a lot of discussions in class and I thought it was cool, he told us about all the things he does directly with BIA and it was cool. He's saved a kid with the stuff and he gets to travel the world.

Kristi is incredible! She fosters an amazing, inclusive, understanding environment for her students and is always available as a resource. She also made class very engaging when it could easily have been excruciatingly boring had she not cared as much as she did. I literally cannot say enough amazing things about Kristi Good!
Professor leung is amazing and I would have taken math 140 before this class with him if I knew how good he was.

Definitely go to her office hours. I did run out of time on exams a lot, and the course was so hard despite covering the material in hs a year prior. She usually spends lectures doing proofs and very simple practice problems that usually don't reflect what is on homeworks. Lecture is not necessary,  but reviewing lecture slides was helpful.
She hurt my feelings every lecture and was always talking in polish even though everyone complained that they didn't understand her

She is bad at explaining concepts in class and will deduct points for missing class. She does not have good reasoning regarding grading choices and has favouritism. You have to teach yourself the concepts which is not hard though because the content is pretty easy. Can get an A if you go to class and if she likes you

There are only 3 exams and participation that is graded. Participation matters a lot and you should at least some of the readings so that you can ask/answer questions. If youve ever taken a CMU history course, youd know they're surprisingly hard, and this class is no exception. He is very knowledgeable and a great lecturer and the content is great.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: This class is very slow-paced and is perfect for Japanese beginners. She is really nice and cares a lot about what you have learnt and if you actually know the content or not. The class is very interesting and fun, a strongly recommended class if you want to learn another language while having heavy workload in other courses.

Good: solid course. he was knowledgeable and good lecturer
Bad: he treats girls very differently. my friend saw him starting down someones shirt lol. he also yelled at someone during project office hours and I saw them crying afterward. also the class requires participation.

avoid interacting with him outside lecture and it'll be a great class

Amazing Guy, really. Although his grading is extremely tough, you will be forced to get used to it, and trust me - its a good thing. He is really funny as well and takes criticism with confidence when he speaks something wrong and incorrect. I would give him a solid 4.7/5. Take him if you can, it will help

My favorite class was when Dr. Daichendt regaled us with a story of him wrestling a trained Grizzly bear at a mall in Cincinnati. He rolled around on the ground and everything to reenact it. He is lore-heavy, but it only adds to his engaging lectures! Silver fox.

Dr. Daichendt has a 1,000 lb. brain! He explained things way over my head with ease—going as far as using Hebrew letters for variables in equations (he had already exhausted two other entire alphabets in one equation). He downloaded additional international keyboards just to be able to text equations to students unable to attend office hours!🌶️

I have the impression that I had to work so much more in his class than comparatively to other students in the same class with other professors. Not too bad though, it ended up giving me a way better understanding than I would otherwise, but I wish the markschemes weren't so punishing.
Does not answer questions, just reads off of lecture notes which were from the textbook.

Class was marked incredibly poorly, midterms would lose 50% of points on a question for a simple algebraic error. Markschemes were just garbage in general, and there was no curve on the class, with the exception of a 3% curve on the final. LMAO. For a trivial class, exams were too tough. Nice guy tho.
Not worth taking
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: This guy is so sweet and so helpful in my thermodynamics class. He is the definition of inspiration. I love how he breaks down complicated concepts into simpler ones with both lectures and in class problems. Always available to talk, very approachable, and genuinely wants you to succeed. I love him so much and thank you Prof. Shen! You're so geat!
Honestly, should take a public speaking class... Really hard to pay attention in lectures... I'm falling asleep rn zzzz...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Really nice professor who gave great feedback. She's very passionate about the subject and tries to make it interesting. Only complaints are that her grading standards are considerably higher than other 76101 instructors (not necessarily a bad thing) and she gives a lot of homework, although the assignments were typically short.
